ma3DWkuE4BttvftbHvvWbA.text: Few times I am surprised when it comes to brkfst. Eggs are eggs. This place really rocks. Stopped by on the way home to LA.   Best steak & Eggs for the hubby. Kids loved the pot of bread. I recommend the corned beef hash extra crispy. The french press coffee a plus!   Take the family. U won't be disappointed. Ask for Lisa. Just the sweetest waitress ever. The pjs are a cute touch.

OtveLg2LW6NbmYRrIwFiUg.text: Came for Fathers Day brunch and it was amazing!  The staff is so nice and hospitable. The portions are outrageous. The quality of the food is amazing. I had the Steak & Eggs with Chilaquiles and they were to die for! Anytime in Vegas this will be my new spot.

ZCj68JtFeh9OLCAOHe7kmg.text: Cute cute place. Servers in PJ's, flowers on the ceiling. Amazing food and service to match. I had a made-to-order bagel sandwich, but we also ordered omelets and kids meals. Everything was outstanding. To top it off, service was prompt, friendly, and helpful. We will absolutely go here again.    Recap: great ambience, food, and service. A short car ride from the strip that is well worth it.

LPW8AObJPouSoEw3cI7OYg.text: My go to breakfast joint. They just opened up a new location, been there, but I prefer the one in southern highlands. But it's getting to busy, my secret spot not so secret anymore..lol. My favorite is the house made corn beef and hash, quality meat! I love there pot of bread but these past years they turned it into an espresso cup, more like a bite, no good and with there success I would like it to go back to a pot, please.

LdK8gQ4oYkzqa38OzvnX3w.text: I had a wild craving for some chicken and waffles while waking up after a night in Vegas, I started searching for nearby eateries that served chicken and waffles and also had pretty good ratings (which is always my determining factor) and came across Rise & Shine.  After looking at the photos on yelp and reading the reviews I had already made up in my mind that I wanted their chicken and waffles, but once I was seated and saw how small the waffles were, I asked if I could have pancakes and waffles instead; and indeed did I make a good choice.  Those where the most fluffy, soft, and flavorful pancakes I've ever tasted.  The chicken on the other hand, could've used a bit more seasoning but overall, I enjoyed the food and the service.

PxRpw6mAH7iSIJECwdvJHg.text: Good breakfast, cute decor. The breakfast options are very good and the prices are reasonable. The service was not bad either. When I am in town I would come back here for breakfast.

k4BStQU2-tFXTM2itzrp6g.text: This is the go-to breakfast spot for my BF and me.  Conveniently located right down the street from his house, yummy food, and waitresses in PJ's make it worth the sometimes short-ish wait.  I'd for sure give it 5 stars, but I sometimes want a bloody mary or mimosa with my breakfast....especially on an early morning, after a late night...but alas. There is no booze to be had.  The coffee and fresh squeezed orange juice has to get me by, and they do so pretty well, being super delish.  Service is always awesome. Sometimes I think I'll wear my jammies to fit in, but I always forget.  Next time!

yn5XCy1lrkeBTDWBdT0UJw.text: Back for the chilaquiles. Really, really good. We split the order which was huge and we both had plenty. Like before the pajama crew was great. Looks like they are knocking down a wall for more room. Se ya next time.

MH9FmtbYdJ-dltCf4N0hpw.text: Great costumer service!. The servers looked cute on their pajamas hehe. The food is great! I had the chilaquiles with steak and it was delicious!!!. OJ is fresh squeezed. I also try the cinnamon French toast, which had real pieces of cinnamon french toast!. Overall this place has really good breakfast. I would definitely stop by again. Until next time!

2bvq1duXvsa9eoZFLmksrQ.text: Absolutely amazing breakfast. Wonderful server, super cute atmosphere! Try the pot bread, red velvet pancakes, chicken fried steak, the ultimate and eggs Benedict. We loved everything!

rjfz2NTCJ5kaqxhiVoH7HQ.text: Used to love this place, then they changed from their amazing Tillys coffee to something very bitter...yuck love coffee but can't drink that! Second they change from delicious thick bacon to something that taste microwaved...disappointing Time to try somewhere new

sZ1SBl1fzGyJ0v_aORexNA.text: Happened along this restaurant and was pleasantly surprised. The food was excellent,  service was awesome, location ehh a little far from home but its all worth it in the end.. we had the bacon wrappped steak and the ham steak both were cooked perfectly.. the little pot of bread was cool and a great twist on a cinnamon roll.. this place is great can't wait to visit again and try more items from the menu..

bi9Jj887gvN8C4-yANil4A.text: I wanted you to know th experience I had here today. My husband saw this place and we decided to try it. Initial experience was okay nothing great. The waiter came to take the order and instead of seeing if we had any questions with the menu she kept asking if we needed more time like she was in a hurry to walk away. We did so she walked away and went chatting with another employee, I turned over and she was eating fries from a table nearby. What really blows my mind is that a couple walked 20 minutes before closing and she made it a point to mention to them twice that they were closing shortly and would have to order soon. Not only that but before that couple walked in she made a comment to the other female employee about the couple walking in. Needless to say they left without ordering. Again another couple walks in and she again makes a comment. They sit and she makes it a point to let them know they were closing soon. I asked for a tea refill as I was finishing my food and tells me that they are running out and will check what they have left. She then walks over with a full pitcher. The food was decent but the slaw lacked salt and is not comparable to replace fries. I would not recommend this place based on this experience. I hope this does not fall on deaf ears.

JOEVoO6Y-FMCZeWcnnXUhw.text: One of my favorite places for Sunday morning bfast. Love the menu, service and everything. Waiting sucks, restaurant is small, but worth the wait.

kBERUXAWVDS_LEtiawUdXA.text: Just in Vegas for vacation and found the place on Yelp and was pleased with the food and service. I would definitely recommend and come back.

gvFhAGejuNUfK2rkjwjhbQ.text: Beautiful restaurant, great service,  and amazing food!! Get the French press coffee :)

1DxV_iYVoQJVM-YnAwmqXw.text: Went here for breakfast this morning. Will NOT be going back. The food was very good and the service/staff was amazing. But breakfast for 2 adults and a 1 1/2 year old was $50.00!!!!!!! Unbelievable!!!! Belgium waffle the thickness of about 2 pancakes was $8.00 and to add maybe HALF a banana was $2.00. Omelette was $8.50 and to make it with egg whites and add bell peppers was $5.00!!!!! And the bell peppers were MISSING and there was very little egg. Babies food was 1 pancake, 2 eggs and 2 pieces of bacon for $6.00. Not bad. That's about average. Again, the food is amazing. But the price is WAY to much for the little that you get. Will drive all the way to Jamm's for something almost as good and A LOT more food for a reasonable price (even with paying for gas we will be ahead of the game).

4KTxnWPBxvMet9IJXH-t4w.text: Drove all the way from Summerlin to try this place & I was pleasantly surprised. Food was excellent, great service nice clean modern interior. My baby girl loved the swirling flower umbrellas on the ceiling. I would do the drive again to eat here.

YO9Q1-NJCugc3sB1KJ6yLg.text: WOW what a fantastic find, the food was fantastic, very fresh.  The service was top notch, thank you Riley for the wonderful dining experience.  We will definitely come back next time we are in Vegas..  #fighton

_kU2kGt5E3SgL6Vg6xl3TA.text: It was good.  I live 1/2 a mile away so after reading the reviews I had to check it out.  Yep the servers wear PJs.  They look good too.  My server was A+ she explained the menu very well.  I had a nice three egg breakfast with the smoky bacon and hash browns.  Maybe not the best I've ever had but very good and their coffee is terrific.

_GMTxEnIOmsF27w6k6Zzcg.text: Very cute local breakfast spot, all the servers wear pajamas. I was very pleased with the service I received last time I visited. My server's name was Vanessa, and she was the sweetest!!! Very attentive, pleasant, and knowledgeable.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gE2slGF_a7GLPnCW4ogBCw.text: Excellent breakfast destination. Everything we have had is excellent. The staff is super friendly. Our server Kim was super helpful in suggestions and provided great service. Fried chicken and waffles is my favorite.

8uxueqLsF16gXm8q0AnQKQ.text: I was totally hyped to check this place out because I love love love chicken and waffles and really that's the only reason why I came here. I placed a to go order since the boyf wanted something else. We were greeted by this woman who either didn't want to be at her job or didn't want us to be at her job. I couldn't tell. Nonetheless, this brief and short interaction wasn't pleasant.   I ordered chicken and waffles - both were bland. The chicken was a breast filet that desperately needed seasoning. The waffle although is a waffle, was nothing special either. Hey at least it wasn't eggo frozen waffle right? Ugh. I also had the breakfast plate of biscuits and gravy with 2 eggs and hash browns. Again, nothing special. The gravy was almost too salty and the hashbrowns were just meh.   These 2 dishes were just MEHHHH!    This place is overpriced and overrated. That lady needs attitude improvement (not necessarily everyone's service since this was a take out order I wouldn't know the general service). Go back to bed crabs! I will most definitely not return.

SRDev9BChcSFJ_oFOROmVQ.text: I have visited this business twice and I must say I really do owe them a review.  Is it about the fact that the servers all dress in their pajamas and looked so homely or that the food is amazing. Oh wait did I mention that it's gigantic too. It's fairly pricey for someone like me but it's worth every cent. The omelet plate comes decorated with orange slices just for fun. The juices are bomb with a slice of fruit of whatever juice you ordered hanging on the side.  I love that they don't bother you while you dining by asking every second "are you okay?" Just because there is a line (unlike most places I have been). Eat your fill and take the rest to go. There's no contending that I won't be visiting again

Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffles!!!

JTgtOjhMd8m0mBz24owryg.text: We tried this breakfast place finally and we all are highly impressed!! The food was actually pretty good!! I highly recommend to try their freshly squeezed juices!

RU1JNyPcwKNbP9MRR99zgQ.text: This place has gotten so much better from the first time I came here! They even have a little fresh juice and espresso machine area now! Usually nothing can compare to Babystacks but this place is giving them a run for their money! Red velvet pancakes we're so perfect, almost cake-ish and crispy ends yum!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wPZ_Yplb7fQGXm2kadrILw.text: This place was a little more unique with servers wearing pajamas as their uniforms, and cool decorated parasol lights and fans hanging from the ceiling. We got seated right away although it was busy. It was nice being able to get fresh squeezed orange juice and other juices there. The food was overpriced though and honestly not as good as Ihop omelettes and hashbrowns. Eggs seemed a little overcooked and not as seasoned and fluffy as Id like and not enough cheese in the  omelette. The cup o bread is unique and like a fluffy fresh baked tiny bread roll with frosting to dip it in. I recommend it. Servers were nice and got us everything we needed. Overall it was ok, but i wouldnt miss it if I never went again.

By5xrOlT90myv5hduWyvsg.text: Food was amazing!  The staff also wears their PJs which makes you feel like you're right at home getting a home cooked breakfast!

gICAYxOrHaS_nY0j4qbmQg.text: This is my 3rd time here.  The food is always good.  This time the service seems slow.  It took about 20 minutes before we even got water on the table.  By the time our waitress came to our table we placed our drink me good order.  She even forgot that I ordered water.  Maybe just a bit too busy.  This is a popular place.  The food was good tho - had corned beef hash and eggs.

6b2jww_5VgoCuoF_lEy3zQ.text: I read good reviews and so I went. First impression restaurant packed with people inside and on waiting list, your seated quicker than served. They are extremely busy and not able to help seated guest in a timely manner.  However, when you do get your food, it is wow with fresh ingredients and their bread in a cup yummy!  If you have the time to give up than I suggest.

843ishy3LtKAawnU_QennQ.text: CUP O BREAD! Definitely a must. Tried the fried buffalo chicken. It was absolutely great. Everything we tried was delicious. The only downfall was our waitress. She kind of seemed like her head was somewhere else.

WCUgryHkqy9Ls_cfy1MZgA.text: Love that the servers were pajamas. Food was great. Service was quick prices were acceptable. I would go again.

_kMXxxRCZRulbButq4rx-w.text: Fabulous, fabulous, fabulous!!!! The manager, Vanessa Lirette was wonderful, so accommodating and made our visit and trip to Rise and Shine one of the highlights of our vacation. She introduced us to menu items we loved, she spoke affectionately and passionately about her love for her job and her employer and her employees seem to respect, love and value her and the large team of employees were happy and seemed to work in harmony. Not something you often see in restaurant operations. She is a jewel and should be cloned!! and promoted!  The quality of the food is excellent, the presentation is wonderful and the portion is big and the "bread in a cup" is DIVINE. My girls wanted to keep ordering the "bread in a cup" - a wonderful sweet roll with a decadent cream cheese concoction on the side and I finally had to cut off the number of bread in a cup orders they wanted to eat!  The restaurant is spotless, with colorful and fun decorations and I would recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for an excellent meal, impeccable service and happy employees that don't roll their eyes when you receive the fifth cup of coffee so you can wash down too many to talk about bread in a cup orders!

TkDwAxfFPrscuHbHTZYYNg.text: Yes yes yes yes yes !!!!!!! Come here and eat breakfast!!!! Food is awesome people are friendly.... got the original pancakes and made it a platter  and the special country fried chicken and biscuit!!!  they keep up on the coffee refills too !

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WCOCLLXqFSj6l1fAg-t8tA.text: I had the Chilaquiles with the steak. Either I was really hungry or the food was really good.  Best breakfast I've had in quite some time.....eat here!!!

R4O2Nmnw5JOJcwMXaydiog.text: The corned beef hash was edible, but I would not order it again.   The pot of bread is worth every penny as well as the fresh squeezed OJ.   The coffee is acceptable, but not great.

c-KB_2wqh52PpHD7edHrdw.text: My friend was visiting from out of town and we are both fans of Steak & Eggs, so we decided to give this place a go. We went on a busy Saturday morning, the weekend of thanksgiving, it was packed but we were seated in a timely manner. Service was good for how busy it was. The steak was alright and the eggs were, well....eggs. You get a choice of toast, biscuit or a cinnamon roll in a mug (bomb). I was a fan of their coffee and the ambiance of the restaurant is nice.

0W1IwWs0OVkYbiqu8g8S3A.text: Food is terrible, food over cooked and greasy.  I have gone many times tried the so called home made corned beef hash, it was thinly sliced deli meat, the worst I ever ate Eggs Benedict sauce too salty and they put so much on the muffin is mush.  Went today ordered eggs over easy bacon and hash browns. Eggs came crispy had to return them, bacon looked cooked but wasn't and the hash browns were greasy over crispy.  The cost for this and coffee 17.00!!!! Never will eat here again.  Better food from McDonald's for 5.00

cdanoaIe-KFsPFko_W313w.text: Five stars due to service, presentation, and food quality!   The place was recommended by my fiance's grandmother, and was his late grandfather's favorite place to eat. The atmosphere of the restaurant is very bright and relaxed. We loved how the servers were all in their PJs! Our waitress Halle was very sweet and energetic, and made our experience that much better.  Their fresh orange juice is definitely recommended, and their "dinnamon" rolls (a mix of cinnamon roll and dinner roll) were amazing. I personally got the smoked salmon eggs benedict which came with hashbrowns and was topped with hollandaise and capers, and was very happy with the food. My fiance got the buffalo fried chicken with eggs and hashbrowns, and couldn't finish all the chicken since there was just so much! All in all we both were happy with what we got, and definitely plan to come back next time we're in town.  Hopefully next time I won't accidentally forget my sunglasses!

Kxsa7KpVMoFjEu0NHZ2vAw.text: Always on point. Food A+ Service A+. Love having an amazing breakfast place near me. My favorite meal!!

v4NYt6ShkpB9crOEbtTWwg.text: I was in the mood to try a new place for breakfast and I checked Yelp and found this place.  It's a good distance from where I live, but why not drive a little to get a great breakfast, and that's just what happened.  I like it so much when menus are posted online and I had already chosen the breakfast I was going to get.  When it came time to order, I took my server's recommendation and ordered the rib eye steak chilaquiles.  I chose the pot of bread instead of toast or biscuit.  The bread was good, but I wish it had more cinnamon.  That would have made it and outstanding breakfast accompaniment.  The main action was the spice rubbed rib eye steak--there was a small amount of rub flavoring--and it was done rare just the way I ordered it.  For the eggs, I got over easy which was put on top of the refried beans and chips of the chilaquiles.  The cotija cheese added so much flavor!  The eggs were topped with sliced avocado.  Very nice presentation.  My server, sorry I didn't note the name, was quite good.  The restaurant is not large and when I was leaving around 9:30, there was a wait for tables.  I think I'll go back sometime and get my original choice and compare the two!  I am glad I gave Rise & Shine a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and eggs chilaquiles.

D37b4yxQMCkdHGJJCBomUw.text: Not only do they have the best steak and eggs in town they also have the best ice coffee's and fresh juices ! The staff is awesome I try and go every Saturday and the wait time is usually pretty decent 10-15 mins max! The waffle is also beyond amazing !!! Love this place always come back !!!

l7KiGLs9flgmuN2tYygBOA.text: Meh...I had better, my eggs & cornbeef hash was underwhelming. Also, my girlfriend had the bagel eggs and bacon sandwich not so much flavor. It wasn't terrible, but we expected more.

5XA_GiskEYJFAQSum1M8xQ.text: Everything was so good!!  The pot of bread is delicious.  Red velvet pancakes, steak and eggs, French Toast, and Chicken and Egg White Omelet were all really good.  Service was actually really great.  We had to send a dish back and she was so nice about it.

Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak omelet

mnwdz-Wx4HwSZom2ADMTGg.text: Fabulous place. Food yummy. Service excellent. We had the county fried steak and eggs, and steak and eggs. Steak was cooked perfectly. I highly recommend if you want a delicious breakfast at a reasonable price point.

PK_fZCOGbPJQBmuB1SvBtw.text: Service was amazing! Food was amazing! Prompt service! Clean atmosphere! Great hostess! Great start to our trip!

uTDGum80DzkQ13hNC0Fsww.text: Great find.  On our way out to Zion and stopped off the freeway and found this gem.  Lots of healthy options and incredibly sized portions. Vanessa was attentive and nice and very helpful. The cooks in the back that you could see were doing a great job throwing it down and not taking any shortcuts. Will definitely come here again the next time we drive through.

MT2VS7-dgUSQz9H_riQ4LQ.text: Had no idea this place would be as good as the pictures looked. When always reading ratings most people are four stars and rarely fives anymore. This place deserves a 5 or close to it. Great service, interesting choice in attire where the servers where pjs lol but it's cool. Beautiful inside and even more amazing to eat outside on a beautiful morning.  Besides the appearance and feeling you get being in there comes the food! When going through the pics on here everything g looks good so here is what we found out..... EVERYTHING IS AMAZING AND FRESH AND MOUTHWATERING!!!!! From basic eggs, hash browns to the chicken and waffles and fresh squeezed oj. You got to save room for the bread in a cup thing which should be eaten first or maybe have the waitress wait to bring it out so it's super warm and more amazing. But yes love this place and will be coming here every time we stop in Vegas.  Oh yeah wait time for party of two was a minute if that so don't worry it's worth it. Thank you for being amazing we love your establishment.

yLFTaogNlBh1xOmxtzzT_A.text: Get the pot of bread, it's delicious!  Chicken and waffles are amazing.  My son loves the pancakes.   Come early or there will be a long wait.

6tIdVyJyBuBJoUDm6CqqRw.text: What a cute place!! I came in during my lunch break. I had looked through the reviews before hand and the chilaquiles (I totally had to google spell check that) looked delicious! So I tried those, they were a little more like nachos but with the overeasy eggs on top, holy cow that was good! I need to go back and try the steak soon.

CY61TtRrnbLWXFmZAY00zA.text: Absolutely one of the dirtiest restaurants I have ever been to. They DO NOT wash the coffee cups  This place is right by my house in Vegas (Southern Highlands). The first time I tried them, I had to send my coffee back because it had LIPSTICK ON THE COFFEE CUP. When the server brought back a "new" cup it had a DIRTY COFFEE RING on the inside (like coffee had been sitting in there, but not washed) I finally just asked for a to-go cup.  Decided to give them another chance since they are so close. The second time.......THE EXACT SAME THING. Coffee cup with dirty coffee ring on the inside, AGAIN!!!!? We IMMEDIATELY got up and walked out.  If you go here, make sure you inspect the cups / dishes.  Something is very wrong here.

nZiJZI41CORRLtjCJOrp1g.text: This place is so good. The customer service is amazing. The orange juice is fresh squeezed and tastes like you're drinking it straight from the fruit. The Steakhouse omelette is the best thing to get! By far my favorite place to eat breakfast!!

Gf1AQ-p3LNsNgtcdwI6BTQ.text: Didn't know about this place and happened to come across it on Yelp...so glad we did! We usually frequent Cracked Egg, Egg Works, etc and we were looking for a new place to add to our rotation. Servers wear pajamas which is really fun. I ordered an omelet and it was delish; came with the pot of bread which was very tasty and such a cute idea! My husband ordered the cinnamon crunch French toast platter....I kept stealing bites it was so good! We will definitely be coming back, there were a lot of things on the menu we would like to try!

a-Lg0gWouGAHnDJK5hxIEQ.text: We didn't get the memo but apparently you can come in your PJs! Pajama party coming soon!  It is a fairly large and colorful place with upside down umbrellas hanging from the ceiling. Although a pretty atmosphere there is definitely nothing stuffy about this place with all the staff in their pajamas going around serving coffee like you never left your house.   They have an extensive menu selections so good thingd our waitress was really patient while we made our selections! We split the Fried Chicken Breast and Waffles and The Ultimate Steak and Eggs Plate, with the potted bread accompanied with some fresh squeezed orange juice and delicious coffee.  Two xx large chicken breast  was juicy and well-seasoned along with the crispy, light waffle which we drizzled with their cinnamon infused syrup. The ribeye was cooked perfect medium rare as requested, and the hash browns were to dance for. Crispy on the outside, soft on the inside.   The potted bread was the only item left to sample but came until the end which actually worked out great since it comes with a cream cheese glaze we treated this as dessert

Z4AwuP6QqN2BjVhUyDpXuA.text: All I wanted was to place an order for pickup. Someone picked up right away and said it'd b a moment then placed me on hold. I waited for 20 mins then hung up. Why make something so simple so hard? I'm over this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 20 mins on hold for takeout so I hung up. Service is a joke

yywmx43P8pcEYBx97HrXdg.text: Simply amazing food, me and my gf are vacationing good is outstanding. And everyone is like they said In pajamas!!!!

EoIbOHs_sWsf988aeGWk_A.text: Great experience here yesterday with a girlfriend of mine! We went bright and early for breakfast and catching up. The food was great, it was a quiet Monday morning at rise and shine which allowed for us to catch up. All the servers were super sweet and friendly, we will certainly be back to try more of the menu!

-_SWY3eGqR_Zebz3wgY6hw.text: This used to be one of my favorite places. Recently they expanded their dining area and changed their menu. It's clear that even though they expanded their dining area by a lot they didn't expand their kitchen. The last time we were there we waited 45 minutes for our food. I ordered 1 soup and my boyfriend ordered the chicken and waffle. Really? It was a very small order and zero reason for waiting that long.  Also, they removed my favorite lunch combo (soup and southwestern chicken salad) They no longer have the soup and salad combo and they no longer have the Onion Soup or the Southwestern Chicken salad. They also removed the delicious Pot of Bread from (at the very least) the Chicken and Waffle.  You simply shouldn't remove items that accompanied entrees in the past. If you want to remove an entree fine but removing an accompanying item gives a bad experience.   I will not be frequenting this place as I did before.  We used to go almost every weekend and there's zero loyalty, they simply wouldn't budge and wouldn't allow me to order a soup and salad. I'll be taking my business elsewhere.    This is is exactly how businesses fail. Poor management.

4Lbw568G3taUDTzf8GGiEA.text: I come here rarely when I absolutely refuse to make my own eggs. I have eaten here several times, but the most recent one to date... I ordered a special egg white omelet with specific ingredients. I came about 35 minutes after I ordered the food. I was fine to eat the food... But they had thrown it away and offered to just make a new one no charge. I was very appreciative..(I just always have a fear of cooks doing something to the food in orders like these.) but I accepted and it was quite delicious. Maybe a little runny. But sizzling hot and I guess as good and as exciting as an egg white omelet can get....   One thing I'd like to note... I know it's 'their thing' to run around in their PJs. All the servers etc... But when I come in there sometimes it looks really messy. I see people in their PJs. 3 tables that still haven't been bussed and crumbs everywhere. Just something they might want to take note to. Also, the cooks and servers are always shouting to one another from across the room... Because the cooks station is open to the restaurant. (You'd understand this layout I'm mentioning if you've actually eaten here).    BUT.... It you are in the area, they have consistently good breakfast food and always seem to be pretty busy. All servers I've ever had have been nice... Some of the hostesses make me nervous... Like I have to be reallyyyyy nice to them because they're having an 'off' day. I know we all know what I'm talking about here. K hope everyone else enjoys !!

7EtLBmOm92lLQNY1O03Y8w.text: Excellent chicken & waffles.  Absolutely the worst coffee I've ever tasted.  Bitter swill.  Two sugars and 50% Creamer and its still unpalatable.  Impressively bad coffee

7PfFXLFPFXANFGfGGsSp3w.text: This place was fantastic! Great atmosphere, and lucky enough for my girlfriend and I, it is right across the street. That means we will be frequent customers. Excellent service as soon as you walk in . The parfait was amazing, perfect for 2 people to share. Chicken and waffles was to die for, and the pot of bread was just the finishing touch! Definitely recommend this place to anybody who loves a good breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Southern chicken fried steak and eggs!
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles!

Zz7p___qVRYvT4b4zvk5sQ.text: Cool and casual vibe with the servers dressed in pajamas. Food was excellent. Ambiance is okay and service seemed perfect overall except for our server who may have been a little annoyed about having to work during 4th of July  weekend. Steak was super tender and I highly recommend it

jEspYE-fNOH0WG914xRiBg.text: Came here on a Thursday morning and we were seated right away. We ordered plain bagel and their ribeye steak and eggs. My steak was perfectly cooked! I ordered medium rare and as much as the meat is not that thick, it was still cooked how I wanted  will be coming back to this place and will be trying their chicken and waffles!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EcZoP8VWN_Vj9P7NUzjf3A.text: Probably the best breakfast we've had in Vegas! Peanut butter and blueberry French toast and pot of bread were amazing!! Service was friendly and great

MyEHTObE58c5_YToc1HtXQ.text: This is a little hole in the wall in a shopping center.  My expectations were well exceeded.  I am picky about my omelettes, but theirs was perfect.  And the hash browns did not taste like the frozen stuff out of the bag either.  The coffee was great quality, strong.  Loved the bread pot..tasted like a cinnamon roll...and we couldn't help try the red velvet pancakes with cream cheese butter!!    The ambiance of the place was fun with the waitresses serving food with their pajamas on.  And the umbrellas on the cieling were fun too.  Apparently the owner or manager here is also in charge of the restaurants in Caesar's Palace.  The place is mostly no frills, but they certainly get it right where it counts.

NJYvlYIozDe5HIauk9eVvQ.text: I have been going to Rise and Shine off and on since it opened and it continues to disappoint. Merely by virtue of being the only non-bar breakfast place in the area it lasts despite mediocre food and terrible service. I have yet to eat a meal there that was not lukewarm and the victim of bad execution.

13y2yvRGf1ecQhkPmfaE0Q.text: First time checking this place out, I'm pleased. The food was delicious and beautifully presented! My friends loved the bacon! I loved their hash browns and pancakes! Their decor is interesting and unique. Seems like a family owned place. It took me a little while to realize that the employees wear pajamas, I think it's a cute idea! Overall, I had a perfect experience. The food, service, and atmosphere was all really great! I will definitely be back.

yfCGqah4hmzCJ6AaPDmOiA.text: The best breakfast EVER!! Our new "going home" breakfast place:) Food was A+, Service was A+, very pleased!!

E8CqzJCrj33aUvHaNyOZlw.text: Food was good.  We shared the chicken and waffles with a side of the sausages.  The pot of bread is like a soft cinnamon roll and is tasty.   Our server was a bit slow and the server at the table next to us started taking care of us.    There seemed to be a lot of screaming children and crying babies.  So if you are trying to socialize your children it may be a good place to hang out as the food is quite good and I mostly just knocked it down for our server and the noise.

YxpJ5eLqSpOR5QirQpCaCA.text: Nice yummy place to have breakfast! Awesome service as well! Definitely will go back!

ZKf-_nSbDpYh3ld4MpQPog.text: Not one complaint here! Will come back again when we come back to Vegas! Everything was delicious! Group of 4 ordered Chilaquiles, French Toast, Belgium waffle, biscuits and gravy and patty melt everything was the bomb.com.

FU0FNLQ6Y0Vk-ScJVhJQPQ.text: I was hoping this place would be good but sadly no. My omelette was very runny, my husbands breakfast sandwich was very small and flavorless. Nothing special about this place and overpriced. Go to Egg Works instead.

I1qhaAtIZOWcoOed-FE0dg.text: We were a bit disappointed with the food quality today. The coffee tasted burnt, but it turns out they changed the brand. We went for the French press the second round and it was better. The chicken on the chicken and waffles was almost burnt and same for the chicken fried steak. Over medium eggs were also over cooked. Also found the kitchen won't take the time to split the order on to two plates any more. It was a busy day for them, and our waitress was absolutely wonderful as always. We will be back and hope it was just an off morning.

-sZNAQkd434WvfYEWX8f8g.text: This place is good if you're not on a diet. Otherwise, trying to order a custom omelette or breakfast gets VERY expensive.

RCoMN_JggAiVVHESER30Fw.text: I have been to this breakfast place when I am in the area and I have enjoyed every visit. Sometimes, it can take a minute to get seated because I have seen the host also bus tables. Other than that, the food and service have been great. The first time I got the Cinnamon Toast Crunch French Toast with real maple syrup. It was delicous. The second time I got the Chicken Fried Steak. Now, they are known for their steak and eggs so I would stick with that. My sister got the omelette which just seemed like any average omelette. My mother got the waffle which was soft and tasty.But the Chicken Fried Steak was THE BEST and the gravy was amazing. I was in heaven.They also serve illy and French Press coffee. I loved the French Press myself. If you're in the mood for steak and eggs, I would come here. :)

X9ih0dxFNKtMyd12Zwew_Q.text: Took the family here on a recent trip to Vegas and desperately wanted to get out of the downtown areas scene of food. Looked this place up on Yelp for favorite bfast spots and saw all the great reviews. All I can say is I am glad we stopped in. This place is tucked into a strip mall which I could care less about. The scenery inside is very eclectic and relaxing. I was more excited about the food!My only suggestion is if you come on a Sunday is come early...we had to wait about 30 mins for a table which was ok because we were not in a hurry. Once seated we ere greeted by a very friendly waitress who suggested a hot pot of french press coffee for the table which was delicious! The menu is packed full of great selections, but they specialize in steak so I decided to get the steak house omelet. It was pretty good, but not the best steak I have had so not judging it off the Ruth's Chris steak quality. My daughter ordered this 2 fisted bagel sandwich filled full of eggs, bacon, ham and homemade sausage and it was killer! I was overall very impressed by this restaurant and most importantly the exceptional service. All the waitresses wear pajamas which my daughters thought were fun. I will definitely be back to this place when in Vegas time permitting....

lpdZ2fy98JX_u_xTd3vd1g.text: Our last day in Vegas so we hit up Yelp for a suggestion for Steak and Eggs, one of the best meals of the trip, just a few minutes from South Point, open for breakfast and lunch only, great service, fair price, small local place.

JtacntPkZF_aShYSXKTUtQ.text: Very good food and fast! Kids menu is very good sized for a 7 year old and 2 year old to share (they both don't eat a lot). Very polite staff. Would definitely recommend it if ur looking for a quick service breakfast. Can't wait to come back to try their tomato soup with grilled cheese for lunch.

0Z0Ld04Z2jiiGuoHiw2mSw.text: Great food. Friendly staff. Good service. Moderate prices. Great local spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Full stack with turkey sausage
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak &amp; Eggs w/ hash browns

JTQHJPpwaniAJRr2GXS3Xw.text: Love this place! Great food great service! Love the pot of bread and French press coffee!!

M3Swj9jOaBt8kz2hXLe2bg.text: Superb! Delicious food. Coming from out of town and yelped "good breakfast burrito" and this place came up. I'm glad we stopped. I got the rise and shine burrito. I would get it again and again! Send your friends they won't be disappointed :)

MAI6MzqfAKTanyajesml5Q.text: We love rise and shine for our breakfast! Their steak and eggs are super good! The staff is always really friendly. Sometimes the wait can be a little long but the food is always fresh so its worth it!

J4YJwckUQIiWNF-QOzKsSg.text: My boys picked this restaurant for their birthday breakfast.  The staff surprised us with a Red Velvet pancake with whipped topping and lit candle for each of them.  I love this place!  Thank you Rise & Shine!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday Breakfast!!

F4IWbaQjuHBWoXYcdlwfQg.text: Came there today for brunch, first I was greeted as a gentleman since I have shorthair and I had a baseball cap on, so that already started off the service with a bad taste in my mouth literally. She apologize, but clearly I'm not a man. After ordering my food, I discovered there was the longest piece of hair in my omelette to where I couldn't even stop pulling the hair out!!! After that point I was pretty disgusted.. they apologized, remade my order for me. But still charged us for it  gave me a five dollar voucher to use on the next visit. I won't be coming back lol.

hdQmjIlofouC8cKWO5ThVA.text: This place is good. Service is standard for a breakfast joint, wish they served mimosas or bloody Mary's. Laid back and relaxed, more expensive than competitors being that breakfast food is cheap.

lrbOWXdp0viUr-Q3VHAagQ.text: This place is off the strip in a plaza with other restaurants and eateries.  We waited a while to get seated and for the food to come.  Our waitress was nice, but did not write down our requests, so as a result got a lot of our items wrong. We had five people with somewhat specific requests, so it is better to write it down. Usually they do at restaurants I go to. We did not want to send back our items as it would take even longer to get the right items.  The restaurant is not too fancy. Not too new. Reminds me of a Denny's. The price isn't great either, same as strip prices just about. I thought going off the strip is supposed to be cheaper. Their most unique item is the bread in a cup. It's bread baked into a cup. That was really good. Fluffy and flavorful.  I got the omelette with fruit, avocados, and hash browns. Nothing special. Just a regular breakfast. Won't return. Will stick to the strip next time. Closer and cleaner!

AAI8HdIcfe2CNPOlDXt-1A.text: Took my daughters for a late breakfast and because I had eaten earlier, I opted for a cheeseburger. Man alive, I couldn't believe how great it was.   Burger was great... cooked perfectly, tasty and hard to finish. Fries were crispy and season perfectly.  I've eaten burgers all over town, including on the strip.  This burger is now toward the very top of the list.   Only negative? $30 (plus tip) for a kids meal, an order of pancakes and a burger.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheeseburger and fries

-5gDoCo7eBwD-fD-sa8Ujg.text: My husband and I are here for breakfast before leaving Las Vegas.  It is a nice place, and it is decorated with cute umbrellas hanging upside down from the ceiling.  All of the wait staff are in their pajamas, and everyone was super friendly.    I was happy that they had enough healthy and vegan items to select from the menu.  I just had the Go Go Greens Juice, a fruit plate, and potato hash.  They were all delicious.  I could have ordered oatmeal but decided to go with the potato hash for my carbs in the morning.  My husband had the eggs and corned beef hash with sourdough toast, and he enjoyed his meal.  I would come back here again if I am in town.  It is in a quiet neighborhood, and it is very close to the 15 S Freeway south of the busy city of Las Vegas.  Lovely place.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side of sourdough toast
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs and Corned Beef Hash
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side of hash

CAeFQZTLN4Y2ZdmKBWn7Yw.text: I walked into this eccentric, hip restaurant and saw this guy eating something that resembled nachos and thought "that looks amazing" I asked our waiter what he was eating and he replied "that's our Chilaquiles and it's amazing" that's all it took, I ordered and I honestly have to say it's probably the BEST breakfast I've ever had!! If you never had Chilaquiles it's like breakfast nachos! Chips dipped in ranchero sauce, carne Asada, cheese, avocado and eggs however you want them (drooling...) it was so delicious!! Everyone at our table had an amazing meal, the portions were great and it was close to the hotel we were staying at (Southpoint) only 2 miles. I highly recommend this place, if we ever go back to Vegas this is on our "must eat at" list

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne Asada Chilaquiles

fKLzYj6Uc1qLTZArTxw4Mw.text: Well it's my first time here because my cousins told me to eat here.  I tried the Ultimate Rib Eye steak with 2 Eggs (Over-easy) then the steak cooked (Medium well) with Hashbrown & Cup o Bread.  Pros:  Friendly & Accomodating staff Eggs were perfectly cooked as what I said Cup o bread was so good I ate my cousin's cup o bread Hashbrown was great My steak was perfect  Cons:  There's a long waiting line even we went there around 11AM The my cousin's steak was burnt on the outer layer almost to the point that it was unedible When I was going to the toilet I saw their kitchen it was so dirty  Tips:  Call them before heading there and maybe have a reservation. Always check the food when the server is giving out the food.

eaeD2eELVMJjpgMCMihJwQ.text: What a find! Thank you Yelper's. Before we left our Strip hotel we wanted to find a local place on the way home. Just a couple of miles off the freeway was this gem.   Whimsical decor and fun waitstaff. We ordered the pot of bread as recommended and were not disappointed. Just the right serving size in its little teacup.   Someone else suggested the corned beef hash and eggs. Not my go to breakfast but I haven't had it in a long time so I gave it a try. So so good.  Our waitress Cary was delightful and attentive, always filling our glasses even half full.   We will definitely be back

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

p_J-BS5fPfnzj1s1xZVamw.text: I've been here only once but my first impression of this place - I love it already. One of my top favorite breakfast places in town now. I've been wanting to try this place out for like six years and FINALLY just got to try it today. I wish I tried it sooner ! There was no wait when we came in this morning too.  They have an extensive menu and everything sounded so good for breakfast but I finally settled with their crunchy cinnamon french toast. They have the BEST french toast in town ! And I'm not just saying that because I came in starving lol. I really enjoyed their variation of french toast. It wasn't too sweet either. It's a must try. I also ordered my french toast w/ egg whites and turkey sausage and my friend shared some of his hash browns. Loved every single part of my meal. One of their other highlights is their pot of bread. Presentation is cute , it comes in a small mug. It's like a cinnamon roll and you dip it into their cream cheese icing (or whatever the deliciousness is). It's also served w/ butter on the side but it's that good on it's own so it doesn't need it.   Love the theme they got going on too - they have twirling flower umbrellas on the ceiling and all the servers wore PJs. I would love to come back here again if it wasn't so far from my house. If they could open another location in Henderson that would be perfect :)

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clockwise: buffalo-style cripsy chicken breast &amp; eggs , chicken &amp; waffles , chicken &amp; egg white omelette , and crunchy cinnamon french toast
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot of bread ! Yum

8mwmbeU6hIN1F_YprX9cEw.text: Great service and good food, close to home and I have never had a bad experience here.  The decor is nice too.

4-VrJjKzEnGrjJ8NkMGb6A.text: The best Las Vegas breakfast to date. Excellent service, fantastic menu and decor and the food was amazing. I highly recommend driving to the south end of Vegas for this top notch breakfast experience of the highest quality!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh fruit!

60LGpuoKGILcjWbp0RWvhQ.text: Very disappointed! I wanted to take my son and grandson to a new place for breakfast. Such a waste of money and time. First I have to say the restaurant itself is cute. I loved the umbrellas on the ceiling. Very unique and adorable. That's the only thing I could say I actually liked.   The service was the worst I've ever had and I mean worst!!! As soon as we were greeted by the server (christine) we felt her negative vibe. You could tell she didn't want to be there. She even rolled her eyes and started looking around the restaurant while we were taking to her. I was really hoping my son wouldn't notice because he's super picky about customer service. As soon we'll she walked away he's like "Did you see that"!!! Unfortunately I did. Not once did she not ask us on how our food was. When they (her and another server) dropped our food she didn't even ask if we needed anything else. My son waited 10 minutes after our food was served to get sour cream. He tried getting her attention....She looked right at him and walked away. Finally he just got up and went to go ask the cooks for the sour cream.   The food was not worth the $44.00 we spent. I had the red velvet pancakes with a side of eggs and bacon. I specifically asked the server to make the bacon well done. Didn't happen. The pancakes were hard and crispy. Really pancakes crispy!? Ugh. My son had the steak omelette I think. He said it was ok but not worth the money.   All in all I would never go back to this establishment. The service alone killed it for us. Then to have mediocre food ugh. Honestly there's so many good places in Vegas to eat breakfast... believe me I'm a native and have been to plenty. Try somewhere else!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Only thing I like about this place the umbrellas....
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stale red velvet pancakes. No flavor at all.

J8obF-uX0g_M-zD6rrUV0w.text: We come here quite often and today was the worst I've ever seen it. We had Jerry as our server and he was good at first but then it got off the rails. He checked in on us once after food came out. We observed him helping every other server by delivering their food, etc., while we sat there for over 15 minutes with no drink refills or the check. We had to try to waive him down 3 times before he finally saw us. He then asked if we wanted refills. Maybe fifteen minutes prior yes but not when we're agitated and ready to go. He could have at least offered one to go? Not impressed. Then when I mentioned at checkout the experience wasn't great the manager just said, breakfast wasn't great this morning? When I said no the server was terrible, she just stood there, so I grabbed my receipt and left. Don't ask me unless you are going to make a point to try to fix it. Took too long to even recover the issue. Won't see us back anytime soon. Many more options.

HKWl0zw9YXzKIaeQNvwqnw.text: Some of the best food and atmosphere I've ever experienced! Their chicken and waffle were so flavorful, they have large portions, and of course I couldn't leave without buying a "Rise and Shine Mother cluckers" shirt. Next time I'm in Vegas this will be the first place I stop!

GEcF9OFFnj06X62H8yCJbQ.text: Went in on Sunday to have breakfast and didn't know where to go and eat and stumbled on this place via yelp. Read a lot of good reviews on here and were very excited.    As we entered the establishment, we were greeted with a welcoming smile and presence from the hostess.  We immediately sat in a comfortable booth.  Noticed that all the servers were in pajamas and thought that was really cool and different.    We then browsed through the menu and were quickly welcomed by Desire! We could tell she knew it was our first time there and simply made it a breeze with the menu and picked out her favorite items on the menu as well as some favorites from previous guest(s) she had.  So we started off with the "Crunchy Cinnamon French Toast" and we both had our own teacup muffin thingy which was absolutely freakin' amazing.  Shortly after we had our main items which were the "Philly-Style Cheese Steak & Eggs" and "Fancy Steakhouse Omelette" which were just out of this world phenomenal.  As time went on, her section was full but she made each and every table she had her priority and that the guest(s) needs were met at %.  We eat at a lot of place and both were in the service industry and she by far was one of the best servers we've ever had.  Overall the experience there was impeccable from the welcoming of the host staff to our service by Desire and our food presentation.  Thank you again very much "Rise & Shine!"  We will be back!

ELAy2Ds0X69Sv1daXdoSNA.text: Came here for bfast based on reviews and was somewhat disappointed by the food. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing - I went with the smoke salmon and eggs Benedict. I'm always a huge fan of eggs Benedict but I wasn't a fan of this dish. The spinach didn't come cooked and that was a bit odd because everything else was hot. My friend ordered the ham and egg Benedict, and he said that his was delicious. He ate everything and the hash brown. He also ordered a side of sausage but was not a fan of that at all.   The customer service was great! Our waitress was very kind and checked in with us often.   Cute place but wouldn't come here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked salmon and egg Benedict
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ham and egg Benedict

pJl1ot8PW1EjEbQFIhvUuw.text: Who doesn't love going to eat in their PJs?! The staff is adorably dressed in jammies. Even our pickiest eaters love this place. Just an FYI, they cook bacon well done/crispy as the standard, which I approve of!

-i0826OgnXfS3ywpvPIEAg.text: We had never been here before and went off reviews on yelp and decided to try it. We had a great breakfast, the staff were very friendly and the service was good!

Zthwh2H2L8pH8K1nsV-OXg.text: This is a good breakfast/brunch restaurant. I've been here numerous times and have been happy each time.   Ive had the 3 little pigs Bagel sandwich that was delicious, it had plenty of ham and bacon.   My favorite is the steak chilaquiles.  OMG, this is yummy. Tortilla chips are just right, nice and crisp. Not soggy at all. Just enough toppings. The steak comes on the side. The steak is good by it self but I personally cut about half of it and put the steak pieces over the chilaquiles. I would say I've had it about 3 times and each time is just as good.   Each I've been there the service has been pretty quick and the people working there have been nice. The staff wears pjs which is kind of cool. I do have to agree with another reviewer that the fans should be dusted but its not a deal breaker for me (:

vmGr89gt8ufZ6WicZUZyOg.text: Delicious food, fast service, hsd the lox omelet . Totally enjoyable will definetly go again.

LjUVJAilNFRZu4h421wlYg.text: Tried this place a second time to make sure it just wasn't what I had to eat. Had the chicken fried steak and gravy. Was a bit better, but still lacked greatness. The Chilaquiles and the French press coffee is still my favorite way to go! Great service with a smile.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hash and eggs.
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and eggs.
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilaquiles and a French press coffee.

mZHDdo1yMq_bFv1k1xvP4Q.text: Great breakfast place.  Good food and good friendly service!  Had the bacon & eggs.  Husband had chicken fried steak & eggs.   Mine was good ( bacon could have been thicker) husbands chicken fried steak was huge and very good.  Will be back.

fRNR2q86-ljtF-yP5CapbQ.text: Cute place always busy.  Always our pick when we have a large group, very big menu everything comes out fast!   Wish they would have more vegan choices tho

YsotxiMjiSAXYuX2eFBFUw.text: Update: They raised the prices which is unbelievable considering very few items are made from scratch. It's all add water mixes for the pancakes and the egg whites are from a container not separated eggs. The omelette was over cooked to make matters worse. I'm so over this place especially since my two favorite servers have left. The remaining staff seems miserable and it makes one wonder why. On to other places for us.   My husband and I frequent Rise n Shine at this location. Our first experience was made phenomenal by our server, Christine! We love her and request her whenever we go. She is very attentive and professional. I think the prices are high but I don't mind paying a bit more for the great service we receive from Christine. I can't imagine anyone feeling a negative vibe from her, she is always cheerful and funny.  I love the waffles! The caramel coffee is delicious and I don't have to order when I go in, Christine knows what I'm ordering. Lol. Go on in and ask for her!!

Z7jNb0H3LNIlLkN52cjVHw.text: I'm obsessed with this place. Everything is so good. Their fresh squeeze orange juice is just amazing. My sister doesn't even like OJ and this she loved! Their coffee is good. Their cup-o-bread is BOMB!! Even their fruit plate sets them apart from other breakfast places. Pineapple, strawberries, bananas, blueberries, and melon! I mean YUM!! I haven't had something I didn't enjoy. I also love the atmosphere in here!

iSa41G89ttHG2eAn6RLlkA.text: My husband and I came here today for breakfast, we both got the smoked salmon eggs Benedict and we also shared the bread in the cup . Both were very yummy !! Our waiter was Vanessa, she was super nice and had a great personality! We recommend to come here !! And we will be back :)

pHmbi0B9pjRiLUi0DA-GJA.text: Big parties not welcome. Don't come here if you have a big party where more than person is paying... they don't split checks more than two ways. Per the cashier this is a restaurant policy. They don't warn you verbally, but apparently it's somewhere on the menu. Hope you see this owner and change this unfriendly policy.  Edit: The waitress and the cashier played this fun game of "maybe the other can do something to split your bill."

GYNnDdkEMe8uvDX73cR2hw.text: Amazing breakfast. Have the biscuits and gravy or chicken and waffles. Brought many out of town guests here and they ask to go again. Only reason didn't give 5 stars is because it's pricey and they serve Pepsi not Coke. Shouldn't be $13 for a breakfast sandwich.

0uA4rCETWtSbWObhurPPyw.text: This place was delicious and fun. The servers were dressed in pajamas. I ordered the eggs Benedict with hash brown. It was yummy. Their coffee is great and it's a cute place to get breakfast. Portions are pretty big so I think it's shareable. Next time I'll come back in pajamas as well. Haha

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their ceilings
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My eggs Benedict

D1mZmnO-oQvjNzicDuA0pw.text: First time eating here and it was amazing.... Great food.... Great portions... Are waitress Gelato was amazing made us feel very welcomed and took great care of us.... A must visit when in Las Vegas.

fgS2132_ubPuINfu2u-3RQ.text: I just had breakfast here. There was a 10 minute wait, so worth it. Made my own omelette. Comes with hash browns and your choice of bread. I got the bread in a cup which is delicious. Everything was sooooo good and well seasoned. I ordered a French press coffee, very good and makes 3 cups. Atmosphere is lively and family friendly. Customer service was great. Will definitely be back to try other stuff.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread in a cup.

z_TVmmdyKVOgZOetRRp7BQ.text: Omg!  What a gem!  We found this place on our way out of Vegas. It will be one of our usual places now that we've found it. It was very cute with the wait staff wearing pjs.  They have several types of Benedicts, yogurt parfaits, and do many other dishes. Everything was delicious!  I had an avocado Benedict which was amazing. My husband ordered the buffalo chicken breakfast that was fabulous. Can't say enough good things about this place.

IEkWp2P3BXYpF7hFnK4Nmg.text: Another good Yelp find! Lox and cream cheese omelette was fantastic. Coffee rubbed rib-eye & chiliquilles were so good they brought us back 2 days later. Ham steak was less salty and more smoky which was a great surprise and one of the best breakfast hams I've ever had. Fresh squeezed juice were so refreshing. Nice vibe to the restaurant with the wait staff in pajamas.

cSph1wL3Zeru_zVnrPEAsA.text: Oh my deliciousness!  We happened upon this little gem on the way to LA.  The steak was cooked to perfection, cup of bread was a sweet little taste of a yeasty cinnamon roll with a yummy dipping sauce.   Serve was AwSoME!

cGODGUyJnZvslw59aMdO8Q.text: Great little joint. For a holiday weekend and only having one server for the entire restaurant she did a great job. Poor management for only scheduling only 1 until 830.

myIw-3_x71OhjQFaAifuNg.text: Over priced and just looked dirty, food was not even good. Seems like a black cloud in the room.  Left me feeling very doom and gloom almost depressed when I left there.  The Waitresses look like they just rolled out of bed and very dirty looking like they had bathed.  Will never go there again

DCeHbrRNTR-d8SJluxGRXQ.text: This was the best part about my brief stop in Vegas. Service - very friendly, our waitress was new but had the perfect suggestions. She also accidentally brought us a bread-cup, which was tasty (no charge). French press coffee was perfect for 2, strong flavor. The ribeye chilaquiles were outstanding!! The meat was cooked just right (med-rare), even the fat just dissolved in my mouth. The chilaquiles themselves were just crunchy enough and not soggy at all. The decor is fun and I love the fact that the servers get to wear comfy PJs and be themselves, tattoos, piercings etc just make everything more genuine.

oe8-SVqw6V7FStKZzOdeIA.text: Thought I'd check out the "New Place" in our neighborhood. Always anxious to find a good Breakfast Place especially one so close. Being close was the only Good thing about Rise & Shine, Valle Verde Location.  I realize flavor is a personal thing, so I shouldn't complain about how things tasted. I had ordered the Two Eggs, over medium, Hash browns, Sausage, and the 'Cup of Bread'. The two eggs were perfect. The Hash Browns were more than the normal hash browns. They had "spruced" them up with spices and the texture felt like they were "Freeze Dried-'just add water' and heat". There wasn't any "skillet type"  items on the menu so I created my own. I also asked for a side of Gravy, noticing they had 'Biscuits & Gravy' was on the menu. The 'Banger" sausage had a good flavor, but it is not a breakfast sausage, in my opinion. The Gravy was flavorless, except for the black pepper. The 'Cup of Bread" was too doughy and the "dipping sauce" wasn't very tasty.  I usually eat less than half of my meal, taking leftovers home for a future meal or snack. So, I realize that the waitress may have thought I wasn't quite done, but it took her a very long time to see if I was done, and if there'd be anything else.  She  dropped off the bill and said "I can take that up for you, but take your time". Placing my credit card on the bill, I feel, indicates I'm ready to pay. I waited at least 15 more minutes, with different wait staff passing me by  numerous times. I was NEVER asked if I needed a "BOX to GO" and if there may be something I didn't like about the meal, due to the amount I hadn't finished. Like I said previously, taste is a personal thing,and I wasn't going to take this breakfast home for later. So, I just got up and went to the front reception desk, and paid my bill. One good thing I noticed was that the Wait Staff was dressed in Pajamas. I thought that was very clever. But, I won't be going back, just to see the pajamas.

UpbiH8Xe_8uFZm7trC3rkQ.text: This is a simple review: best place for breakfast period! But you have to ask for Amber...truly the best server here...you have to have the best service with the best food...just makes sense

5uEDxm7KNRSH1WVQKnGmCA.text: I was tempted to give 5 stars but there must always be room left for improvement.  Great little spot, a hidden gem in Southern Highlands.  I hope not too many people find out about this place as I hate waiting for my Monday morning table.  Keep up the great work!    First times try either the Steak Benedict or the Chicken and Waffles.  *Quick note-  Avoid Sunday's at all cost, 1hr wait at times, plus folks bring in there screaming kids, that haven't been taught how to behave in public, which ruins the whole experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak Benedict!  Amazing!!

Qh2qrs2FFfg2PzT_FtAieA.text: Went here for breakfast. As usual the food was excellent. Filling   Although this establishment always shows live for the military.  We were surprised to find that a special consideration was bestowed upon us for Veterans Day.  Love the food will definitely make this a favorite breakfast stop

V5Aq-zURTe6ga2c_c48kHQ.text: I found this place by accident when leaving Vegas with the hubby.  I searched and search and drive the 20 off the strip to eat here twice. This has to be one of the best places to eat in Vegas for breakfast. Pot of bread is great. Plus 13.95 for rib eye chilaquilas!!!! Love it also cinnamon toast crunch French toast.  Both worth braking paleo

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib eye
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot of bread

lAKXXVHzhRzOMVxMBXPRig.text: Unfortunately, we're going to stay away from this location after our last time here. We both ordered the steak & eggs, cooked medium... and both of ours came out looking burnt. And not surprisingly, both steaks were very well done. We're usually not ones to complain, but when our server came by to ask how the food was... well, we brought it up and she offered to have the kitchen cook up another steak. So okay, cool.  Sadly the next steak she brought out was even more well done than the original. How that was even possible, who knows. She offered another time to have another steak cooked up medium.   How it was possible who knows, but each steak brought out was progressively cooked more and more well done.  There was absolutely no hint of pink in the middle or the sides or anywhere for that matter. The server was getting exasperated herself and kept apologizing profusely, and we didn't blame her at all. It wasn't her fault. But even after all that, the most they could do was take 15% off our bill.  That was a little disappointing. They failed to deliver an edible steak, and it felt like the fair thing would be to take one of the steak&egg orders off the bill. Especially when it was their kitchen staff's fault for messing up so badly, four different times. We didn't think it was a fair gesture, but we weren't going to make a big fuss over it. We're simply not ever going to return to this location.    Sad because we enjoyed the first couple visits here.

oewxUD_wq8Y1cj2_9w4N8A.text: This is one of the places I recommend to everyone. We are here at least once a week and if for some reason we don't get out there that often - we crave it like crazy.  The french press coffee is awesome and I am a big fan of the bacon wrapped filet bacon sandwich. The hubby loves the chicken & waffles. We both love the country fried steak BUT sometimes it has too much fat on it for our liking.  I love the ambiance and great service.  We try to get there early enough to beat the rush and when the weather's right, we love eating on the patio with our dogs.  Highly Highly HIGHLY recommend

jzTYwjdLJAmf5LtWfS2uxA.text: I think we found our Vegas morning spot! Red Velvet pancakes were insane! Only drawback being that the whip cream wasn't homemade, but from a can. Be what can you expect at that price? Great service as well.

IsncxzQ_CKfibkOHASNiXQ.text: Perfect spot for breakfast! Had the cinnamon toast french toast.. To die for! Idk why it has taken someone this long to create that! Can't wait to go try some more!

CgGgS-XKWBdTJHLedLZ3eQ.text: Had the chicken and waffles, probably one of the better ones in town. The pot-of-bread was tasty but it picked up a clay-ish flavor from the pot. The bread itself was very good. The french press coffee was outstanding and reasonably priced. For the chicken n waffles, they used a chicken breast that is scalloped meaning, cut in half but still connected which gave it some size and helped it cook quicker. It was crispy and well cooked. The waffle was nice but kinda soft, and that is something common for most the waffles in town. I like the  crispy style waffles at Bread and Butter or Bouchon. But solid place

w1sYD8M5neBHP_0Bnh36bg.text: Found this place with my girlfriend and although we enjoyed the decor, the customer service and food sucked. As soon as we got seated the waiter seemed as if she was in a rush, but the place was no where near busy. She took our orders, but never let us finish speaking because she kept interrupting us; again feeling "rushed." She gave us our food and asked what else we needed, and she forgot our utensils, in which she basically threw them onto our table; once again, rushing! The prices were way too high for the quality. I ordered a steak and it was not juicy, it was bland when I asked for medium rare. My girlfriend ordered a southern style chicken fried steak and it did not taste like anything. The breading was horrible too. Paid almost $50 for just the two of us. Would not recommend this place.

9TbIl5b5_mW_gA6eWZS3dw.text: If you want great food...great service in a "Mom's & Pop's" atmosphere...this is definitely the place to come for breakfast!!! Try the Steak & Egg white's Benedict...it's AMAZING!! Oh but wait...don't forget to also try the Red Velvet chocolate chip pancakes!! Can you say FOOD COMA!?! Stop by here and try this place out...food is Bomb.com!! ;)

LhJcP8M0gM2wvujhSczLOQ.text: Ultimate breakfast place.  Delicious food, great decor, awesome service!   I had the cinnamon toast crunch French toast.  I couldn't stop eating it...to die for!  Friends had the hash browns and omelets and loved it.  Will be back to try their other menu items!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super cute decor!
