3GpSRdyLFcUqDVOCb9n1CA.text: Great place to have wonderful meal. Went with my family and everything we ordered was delicious. The pot of bread is a fun little starter. I ordered the ultimate steak and eggs and it was cooked just the way I asked for it (medium rare... Yum) the chicken and chorizo burrito is huge, but taste great. If u are not a fan of spice be careful, it's loaded with Jalapenos. we did get a kick out of the waitresses wearing PJ's. All the staff was very friendly. The one thing I did find quite funny was the POS system that was mounted on the wall... It's mounted so awkwardly high.! Hahahah

cMNimFsWVBn1PxLx598Aww.text: Get there early to avoid the crowd. My favorite meals are the Steak Chilaquiles and the Chocolate Velvet Pancakes. The pot of bread with cream cheese sauce is a must.

9biNXeTxHHbzxj4eDxqfjg.text: I don't know why this place has 4 stars.. It should clearly be 2-3 due to the lack of service. They are so slow!!! They wear pajamas and the pajamas fit their service. I don't even want to talk about the food bc no matter how good or bad the food was.. The service made it all taste terrible!!!!!!!! Bad bad service I can't stress enough. They are so slow it blows my mind. Only come here if u hv a 2 hour breakfast window. And it wasn't even busy when this whole meal was happening.

8ruQ5o76MGJW2K_jJdsu3A.text: Service very friendly. Interesting menu with red velvet pancakes, French press coffee, real maple syrup and fresh baked-bread. Southern food offerings like fried chicken & waffles, which comes with homemade cinnamon rolls --what I ordered. In a large shopping center, so tricky to find with just address.

dNLikF0CJ8rnd178OmjDog.text: Our first few visits were great. The service was efficient, the food was well prepared and made with quality ingredients (fresh & flavorful). We have been bringing visitors to Rise & Shine telling them what a "great place" it is. Unfortunately, our experiences of late have not been great. The service has slowed considerably. Drinks are empty before refills are offered. Butter or syrup come well after the meal is served. The food is room temperature and the portions have diminished. Tomatoes are yellow and scarce in a dish, eggs are dry and overlooked, toast is barely brown. The fruit waffles are just a plain waffle with fruit in a cup on the side. There are a lot of restaurant options for Southern Highlands area. It is disappointing that Rise & Shine isn't maintaining the original level of service & quality needed to keep my patronage.

UEoRn4_UINqP2QvAmGtWig.text: I'm so sad they're not in the San Fernando valley. I absolutely love this place and I only had one meal. I don't care about ihop, Denny's, norms, or cocos or really any breakfast place. This is my number one! My dad and I were disappointed they discontinued corn beef hash at ihop, but this place oh my god!! I swear it's like butter! Like I can taste the butter in the corn beef hash. If I could I would refuse every mashed potato meal/side and just have the corn beef hash from Rise and Shine.

LnHSvAfMERYwJ-3eo3VFtw.text: New place for us, tried it because a friend recommended it.  Servers are dressed in PJ's, ours was prompt and polite.  Smaller menu, a little more pricey than most breakfast joints.  The kitchen is open air , so with the radio blasting, cooks singing along to the music, and the constant shuffle of the plates and silverware it's a bit noisy.  Distracting from the nice quiet breakfast we were expecting.   I ordered the Steak/Spinach Benedict and she ordered the Ham and egg Benedict  My plate has a good sized portion, but once I cut into the steak I find its mostly gristle and fat. The hash-browns were good.    The Ham and egg Benedict was missing hollandaise, and the  aged-balsamic sauce.  Requested from our waitress and promptly received.   Probably will not be returning to dine again, the noise was a big factor.

UQMk-hvVdHbkWNN9FvHp5g.text: This is THE BEST kept secret in Las Vegas. Almost debated on reviewing, so I could be selfish and KEEP it a secret, but it was so good, I have to give the owners props.   Here are all the reasons this place deserves MORE than 5 stars.  - Came at 10am on a Saturday and everyone was friendly. We actually had no wait, but I think that was more luck :) But it's still a positive in my book. - Bread in a Pot. Delicious cinnamon swirled bread that was soft and buttery. Almost like a croissant... warm and came with whipped butter and strawberry jam. TO DIE FOR!!! - My Man got the filet wrapped in bacon with eggs - cooked perfectly. The meat was tender, and you could tell it wasn't just cooked properly but that this place orders high quality ingredients. - I got the chicken fried steak and eggs, and WHOA, the outside was cooked so crispy, and flavorful. Had a little spice kick to it which made it even better. Eggs cooked perfectly.  - The side of potatoes were seasoned like an expect would. Not too salty, full of flavor. I don't like ketchup, and at other places I always end up with bland hash browns that need flavor and ketchup is the obvious choice but these tasted excellent plain. TWO thumbs up!! - They serve illy coffee, and it is so good. Much better than typical diner coffee. It was refilled without me asking - another thumbs up! - The server was friendly and cheery but not TOO cheery if you know what I mean  - 3/4 through our meal, the owner stopped by. I think this is what tipped the review. He was friendly, and I LOOOOOOVE when someone in charge stops by your table. They should come by when things are good and bad, and not just when there is a customer complaint. He truly wanted to see how everything was, and it was very personable. Obviously we raved about the place to him, and I can't say enough what a great first impression it gave us. - My man is an executive chef, and even he said this is the best place we have EVER had breakfast (totally exceeds Hash House, Egg & I, Cracked Egg, or ANY OTHER PLACE)  We will be back for sure. Our favorite thing on the weekends is to go out for breakfast, and this is definitely our new spot.

_YvsZAmubcTevZ8VddeNyg.text: Fabulous food; terrific service and reasonable price. Love it!

6B845WVQnHNhAqxvfCSOAw.text: Hard night at the bar? Looking for a real breakfast that has not been sitting under a heat lamp? Well Rise and Shine is the perfect place, awesome service, french press, and great chicken fried steak, need I say more? But have taken bites of the french toast from my wife plate and it delicious as well. A must for those like myself that enjoy a great breakfast

3cqzJjhYICSOe3xn-D29oA.text: Great food, great atmosphere, great service! I had the Texas Toast Style French Toast and it was delicious! I can't wait to go back and try something new next time. Their menu had anything you could ever want for breakfast and SO much more! I would definitely recommend Rise & Shine!

Qo9wpJc8tv3nh399ZbSWIg.text: Originally I had a draft for this place last month.  This breakfast place in southern highlands has been great for the neighborhood.  The only other closest breakfast place in the area is the griddle on Eastern and IHOP on LV blvd.  Which is crazy busy, because of the tourists.  My original review gave this place 3 stars because the service was very bad and I'm sure it was because they were new.  We have since eaten here 4 times and I have to say that each time has been better service.  The second time we went our waitress never came back to us.  We had another waitress tell us that she would be our new waitress.  I haven't seen that other waitress working there since.  I know I'm focusing on the service on this review, but let's face it.  It's just breakfast food!  I like it because it's close to our house.   I have to say a little about the food.  I have ordered the ribeye, tenderloins with open face omlet, and the chiliques.  all of these dishes were great.  It's not steak house quality but it's also not steak house price.  My wife always orders the french toast.  She said the french toast is great because it is big texas toast and fluffy.  She makes it a platter with eggs and bacon.  One thing I enjoy about this place is I think they make their own jelly and maple syrup.  My wife also gets the freshly squeezed orange juice.  Overall this breakfast place is a must try!  be prepared to wait for a table on the weekend but at the end it's worth the wait!

200pWnVwqXmoS_LJr7-fIA.text: Excellent food, great service, and great uniforms (they go to work in their pj's)!

FyTTOluPjQ_Gy_XJozqPpg.text: Again this will be short and sweet. I love coming here because my monkeys and I feel like family. I brought a fellow yelper (YAY Mackalicious!) to see what I was bragging about and he felt the exact same way. We love you Steve and crew. Will be back soon for more breakfast goodness.

hFJd6qSqUF_-I9SKHDY4Sw.text: Awesome new place for breakfast in the Southern Highlands area, we so needed this place! Amazing food.. only downside is they dont serve alcohol so no Sunday morning bloody Marys or Mimosas!!!

QrkeSr-bFEyvBugz20uz1A.text: This is my new favorite breakfast spot. I had the pancakes with the 2 egg and turkey keilbalsa wich came with real maple syrup and cinnamon. Great customer service and I was very impressed by the presentation and reasonable prices.

VQGOdTNjk7jIpavD9uPF9g.text: I so want to love this place. The decor is whimsical and colorful, and the servers being in their pajamas is a fun touch, but after eating there twice, the food and the service just aren't worth the price. My first trip, about a month ago, I ordered the Ham-N-Eggs Benedict, and it was just OK. The entire dish was barely warm, the english muffin was barely toasted, the hash browns were really nothing special, and the overall dish was just mediocre. I took my friend there for her birthday today, and I was so disappointed in the food and the service that I probably won't be giving this place another chance. I figured that since they call themselves a "steak and egg place," I should probably try their steak, so I ordered the Bacon Wrapped Tenderloin Steak. The description on the menu on their website says it comes with "dijon brown butter onions atop a swiss cheese open-faced omelet & hash brown potatoes" for $13.50.  The waitress asked me how I wanted my steak cooked, and I ordered "medium." The dish had not one onion on it, so I politely asked the waitress if it came with brown butter onions, and she said no. I asked her to get the menu, we looked at it together, we could both see the word onions in the description, yet she pointed to the little yellow squiggle of sauce on the omelette and said, "that is the dijon brown butter there on the omelette." She then asked me if I wanted a side of onions, and I said no, and I reiterated that the description said it came with onions, yet she flat out ignored that fact. I felt like I was in Bizzaro land. I wasn't rude in any way, I just wanted what the menu described, and she acted like we were reading two different things. Seeing that I took my friend there for her birthday, I was trying to be very nice and low keyed and not draw attention, so I moved on. Next comes the bacon wrapped tenderloins. They were cooked "well done" and dry, even though I ordered them "medium."  The potatoes were the same as before, really nothing special. They're like thick flat potato shreds with not much tasty crust, so I consider them undercooked and just not my style. So I ate a couple of bites of everything, decided it needed help, so I put some ketchup on the potatoes, hot sauce on the omelette, and A1 on the steak, but nothing helped. It just was not a good breakfast, certainly not a $13.50 breakfast, so I stopped eating at about 1/3 of the way into it. Again, not wanting to draw attention, I figured perhaps the waitress might put two and two together, see that I didn't eat much of it, and ask for some feedback, or see if I wanted anything else, but no such luck. The best thing about this place is the decor and the hope of having a delicious breakfast, but alas, 'tis not enough for me to give them yet another chance.

tmt9cYEWw38e_cnEgTmKYQ.text: It was fairly good came with the family only problem the pancakes were half cooked but they kindly took them and brought us new ones

NJLXuFbem-lxc0hvArPcdA.text: Love this place!!  BUT, what happened to the pot of bread?!?  The last FOUR times I've been in they've been "out" of them.  If you keep running out of them over and over, wouldn't that be a sign to start ordering more?  The food is great, but for the price you pay, they should have it more together.

qskkv4eFLJk3q5joJ4sMjA.text: Absolutely amazing!!! Great service and even better food! Huge, home made delicious portions. Very family friendly. Manager is great! We have a 2 yr old and they go out of their way to make every trip fun. Vegas needs more places like this! One of the best breakfast places in town.

T06pspVTtOBbAhAQcHA9lA.text: Best steak and eggs ever! It's fairly busy on a Sunday but they generally do a great job with getting you in. You will leave this place feeling more than satisfied. Seriously, best breakfast EVER!!!

YlvK2-z5sXOeF7r7-r_D7Q.text: Yum! This place is our new favorite breakfast spot! Everything on the menu is awesome! The prices are a little high for a breakfast joint- but totally worth it! The staff is super friendly and the decor is very cute!

9Mz-z8_VC6SGixjj5lxAfA.text: Delicious!! Really nice waitress (dressed in PJs) and good service. I ordered a short stack with bangers and my friend got the infamous chicken and waffles. Both were great and we totally finished it all. I highly recommend their pancakes--crisp around the edges, fluffy in the middle. Thin but not too thing. Their bangers were delish too, I'm pretty sure they were in a natural casing. The chicken was tender and spiced just right.  I highly recommend this place!

BftL8UQeoT41A2vy8r2eqw.text: Great family eatery.  Cool decor, tasty food for us and the kids and our waitress was awesome (April).  Will definitely return and take out of towners for a treat.  I might even wear my pajamas.

mA_fwySCGn9BE8vw3zy0iw.text: I have wanted to try this place since I saw it in the Review of the Day.  My wife and I decided to head over this past Saturday and we were not disappointed.  The Pot of Bread was delicious along with the jam and butter.  I ordered Chicken Fried Steak and my wife ordered Eggs Benedict.  The Chicken Fried Steak was big and very fried but as I told my wife, you gotta know what you're getting into when you order something called 'Chicken Fried'.  It was very good and for once my over-easy eggs were actually over-easy at a restaurant and not over-runny-raw-and-gross!  I have never been a fan of Eggs Benedict but I did my usual 'cleaning of my wife's plate' after she couldn't eat anymore.  Wow, was it good!  There was tons of ham and it was sliced perfectly!  The Hollandaise (which is the reason I don't like Eggs Benedict) was actually very good and I would even considering ordering it if I went here again.  Service was great!  Very friendly waitress/staff who seemed happy to be working.  Even though this place is a ways from our house I can say with confidence that we will go back for more!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot of Bread
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Fried Steak

jmHSX68aoerc2A5nyifSTg.text: What a great find for breakfast!  All four of us enjoyed our choices of pancakes, waffles, salad and homemade cornbeef hash.  The only thing that topped the food was the excellent service from our waitress Lisa, kitchen and staff.    We'll be back to try more of the menu.

Xv8o4Z_Ks9zqB6tysdQTXA.text: The food and service are great. The food took a while to come out, other than that it was great.... will be back agai n

D7uApXs-ltgm-HjzdCXDRw.text: As a frequent visitor of Las Vegas, I don't know how I could've possibly missed this super awesome and delicious eatery!!  My friends and I had arrived into Las Vegas, and I just just arrived from New York, while my friends were recovering from a long night, and we were clueless as to where to go for some good lunch/breakfast.  We yelped on our phones, and when we came across chicken and waffles, we thought well, could they possibly be better than Roscoes?  Well, let me tell you...  The Staff & Service  Impeccable, supremely dedicated to customers, and so friendly, I thought I was in another planet!  Seriously, everyone's smiling, and so welcoming.  Customer service is super important to me because I work in this field, and when I don't receive supreme customer service, I ain't happy!! We didn't know what to order, so we asked the nice waitress, and with her recommendations, my friends and I ordered our dishes.  She gave us enough time to order, and she was spot on with her recommendations.  To summarize this area, the word to be used is: perfect!  Rating:  5 out of 5  The Food  My friend and I ordered the original Chicken & Waffles.  Let me tell you...it's far better than Roscoe's.  The fried chicken wasn't dry--just perfect and crispy.  The waffle was delicious--no flaws for sure.  The portions were just about right--I was super hungry so I ate it all.  My other friend ordered the Rib-Eyed Chilaquiles.  The steak was juicy, and the chips that were layered beneath the steak was to die for.   The "pot of bread" was a first for me.  It was delicious--not too sweet like cinnamon buns, but just perfect.     Rating:  5 out of 5  Overall  I will most definitely be returning to this restaurant from now on, every time I visit Las Vegas.  This would be place for me to get a hearty breakfast without a doubt.  Rise and Shine: If y'all are reading this, thank you for your awesome and delicious meal!  You guys are awesome!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken &amp; Waffles at &#34;Rise in Shine&#34; off the strip in Vegas :D

7pNNcsbBSyvqNxu5iqqHvw.text: Our first time here. The service was good. My husband had the Chicken and Waffle. It was delicious. I ordered a omelet with Swiss, turkey kielbasa and onions. It was also delicious. Both of our plates came with the Pot of bread. It was a very cute idea came with butter and cinnamon cream cheese. The bread had cinnamon swirled inside.  FYI, the coffee is on the strong side. They also had cute umbrella lights hanging from ceiling that were different flower designs. This place is quite pricey when you take into consideration that there are many great local spots nearby that are about $3 less per plate. Their normal eggs/meat/potatoes and bread plate was $10. Not somewhere we will frequent, but if we have a craving for Chicken and Waffles, this is the place.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and Waffle. Omelet with hash browns and Pots of bread

yUgCIxZJafNkxlibfg9a5Q.text: This is one of my favorite breakfast places when we visit Las Vegas.  The ambiance is cute, colorful and quirky. Servers in PJ's give the atmosphere a very homey quality.  Food has been delicious and consistent on each visit.  Service has always been good as well.  Order the pot of bread...it's delicious and unique!

lRt9qwLkT8htJJ1nBoCLFQ.text: I've been wanting to come here for a while now and finally i did yesterday! People are friendly. I love the menu! They have a great selection for lunch as well! Small place, goof thing there is also out side seating. I ordered the crunchy cinnamon raisin french toast and i made it a meal, The eggs were really nice and fluffy and the sausages were nice and tender! My boyfriend raved about his ham and cheese eggs Benedict, it came with potato hash browns on the side. The hash browns were soooo good! We also ordered the pancakes , regular ones. The pancakes were super fluffy and almost melted in my mouth! Best pancakes ive tasted in a while, but it didn't beat the yummy french toast i got!! Can not wait to come back, its all ive been thinking about. Service was okay, could be better.

Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict!

pxj413CdK3bREvu6D0H1dQ.text: Love this place it's beyond cute inside, food is yummy portions are big staff is nice... you'll smile as soon as u walk in.

Orgg_96MQZhj0hqkrxRC4w.text: Great place for breakfast!  We dine in here on a regular basis and the food, service and fresh squeezed juice is always on point! Yesterday we placed a to go order with Chris and she was awesome!  Only reason they don't get 5-stars is they are a bit pricey.

SUpu8EMam0WibArwq3_dag.text: I love how cute this restaurant is. The wait staff wear pajamas and there are adorable upside down flower umbrellas that adorn the ceiling.   I've tried a few things on the menu but today I'll focus my review on the Chicken & Waffles. The batter for the Chicken comes off as really spicy and peppery (if you don't like spice it will be too much for you) and it's paired with your usual waffle. The trick though is to smother it all with the maple sauce and voila! The sweet off sets the spicy perfectly for the right amount of salty, sweet with spice.   The tables are placed really close together so if you're not into that kind of thing, this isn't the place for you. It can get really busy, especially on the weekends. The open layout leaves you to view the kitchen and the cooks like a diner so the atmosphere is really casual.   Overall, if you're in the area I'd say definitely give this place a try. They're only open for breakfast and lunch though so if you're trying to go there in the late afternoon, I'd call first because they're probably closed.

_PIoWDmra4y27t2aLtzAjQ.text: Bring your appetite.... because they're passing out Big portions!   The setup is nice, quiet (during early hours), and cozy.  The waitresses are wearing pajamas which goes perfectly with the atmosphere.  Definitely will be back.

WdU2dmgprQm6f-xuTVdDmw.text: great food and service. Get the bread in a cup. Fresh juice A+.

DiOoVfjPJ3cjkzLB05URfg.text: Wow... What a menu! They've got something for everyone! I might be one of the pickiest eaters out there! We ordered a bunch of items and everyone one in our party was beyond satisfied! I will definitely be a returning customer.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome breakfast selection. Cute and quiet little place. Friendly staff and the food was prepared in a timely manner.

4fQHJvflzCXyXg-V_eZnGg.text: We have eaten here since it opened, amazing food and a super whimsical atmosphere gave it a unique bed and breakfast feel/ the other day I came in and it was an hour from closing, hardly any people in there. The service was terrible, the cashier had an attitude,  and the music was deafening and annoying. It felt like the parents had gone out to dinner and the kids had gone rogue. I'm leaving this review in hopes that the owners or management will see it and bring us the great place we were used to.  Keep an eye on these employees, they aren't doing you any favors. Food still great but the ambiance is off. I'll keep trying in hopes that you get back to the 5 star place we loved going to.

9b6AHHLI7e0ueaEj4_bM_A.text: This place is expensive, but they have excellent service with very good food and generous portions. The drip coffee was good as was my build your own omelette. The hash browns were excellent as was the gravy for my biscuit. My spousal unit had a ham steak with her meal and the ham was very tender, and tasty. The waitresses wearing pajamas, my wife thought the concept was really cute and unique(yes they were all decent pj's), the wife loved it! And her and my sons pancakes were light and very tasty & the syrup was piping hot-yummy!!

QZgYTbHzIt95BelR5IdJsQ.text: This place hits the spot... Even ran into 3 people from Utah where were from. Just ask the server what's good and you will be fine. Vanessa was awesome and her recommendation of the the buffalo chicken breakfast was right on the money. Put a little syrup on top of the buffalo sauce and I was in heaven.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot of bread
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo chicken breakfast

AWRbrh7UHS2hfC8NMaUbLw.text: I don't even want to write a long review for this place. They made us wait a pretty damn long time just to "create" a wait time when clearly, there were many open tables.  Food is eh. Bacon wrapped sirloin? Sounds good right? WAY overcooked and disappointing.

QjT9e1ACQrSpB2OBezxzGg.text: Met up with some friends here for brunch. Ordered: chicken and waffles, cinnamon crunch French toast platter, corned beef and hash, steak and eggs, and pot of bread. My friend got his chicken and waffles and the chicken was undercooked. The staff was nice enough to change it quickly. I ordered the cinnamon crunch French toast, it was pretty good, nothing special really. I love the warm cinnamon syrup they serve. The pot of bread is basically cinnamon bun in a cup. It got hard quickly so I kinda didn't like it. Banger sausage and hash brown were so good. I usually love my hash browns well done, crunchy, and we'll seasoned. And of course, steak and eggs were on point.

BYf1ARtXRrGMNqnaFGcLtw.text: This place is great! Breakfast is made to order and perfect every time! Clean, spacious and a cute gimmick with the pajamas. Love living close to this spot!

oAhHaX6uvz1qlpChM3FOpQ.text: This place was great, really. It was on a Sunday morning and had to wait about 25 minutes but it was totally worth it. We went to the bar next door and had a drink or 2 while we waited. Service was awesome with friendly staff wearing pajamas. Nothing on the menu jumped out at me and I went for the waffles and made it I a platter with bacon and eggs. As basic as that sounds, it was amazeballs. Everyone I was with loved their meals as well. Can't wait to come back next time I'm in town.

0B5RDGxCVqMtQIDj9yJHeQ.text: While at a basketball tournament we stopped here between games and it was a very good choice (thanks Yelp). Portions were huge and the breakfast was great. If in town again we'd definitely be back

jEW8mYsGZ4Hge-vgEUB33w.text: The staff wears their PJ'S to work in. I like the upside down rotating shape umbrellas in the ceiling.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hXB_BVcgdJwJ_sMOkbK8zg.text: Place was okay, food items were wayyyy overly prices and food was sub par honestly, dont care to ever come back here breakfast failure

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red velvet platter

WBSAiQj9Lx2nomNhRM5HEg.text: You walk in and think "Old Navy Commercial meets Mrs Buttersworth" but that's not necessarily bad. So you sit down and see the waitress' in pajamas-and you can't help but smile as even they are almost apologetic about the uniforms. But seriously if I could get my entire family to dress that way for breakfast I would! The menu is large and has a wide variety of items, the pop up breads in cute little pots caught my eye, when asked about them, the waitress was shocked I hadn't tried them and rushed one over to the table! It was scrumptious-as was everything else we tried!! My friend had the chicken and waffles-as I write this from my Atlanta based home-I must say it beat Gladys Knight  with an egg beater! I stuck to the basics and had pancakes, potatoes and bacon yummy! A few days later I brought my 3 year old back-and he had the steak and eggs (yes they have steak and eggs on the children's menu) and it was heaven! I love this place! And as a new vacation home owner in Southern Highlands I will be there often.

g96ef0lmXsusIFkYf0k1IQ.text: The best breakfast ever!! Have to try the chicken and waffles !! Bread pots are yummy and steaks are tasty tasty!!

rPHnB3UQv61Jlyat_Ttx6Q.text: Ate there 4 times with only one good experience.  We ordered eggs benedict on a visit and the eggs were runny and gross.  The waitress agreed.  The Chef at that place reminds me of the Soup Nazi guy on Seinfeld.  He began to argue out loud where customers could hear with the waitress about our order. She handled it very professionally and told him that she is not there to argue with him.  This does not serve the restaurant well and made us feel that the food he prepares is his way or tough shit.  Today, we went there to give them another chance.  We ordered a Cobb Salad.  The Salad came back with FRIED chicken strips on it and should have been grilled chicken strips.  We thought, here we go again.  The Cobb salad comes back and now there are diced pieces of chicken on it (not strips as before) and much less.  We questioned why the salad did not have hard boiled egg and blue chees crumbles on it as is stated in plain english on the menu that the restaurant hands out to customers to order from.  I showed it to the waitress and she said we were right. At that point, we had been there about 1/2 hour and decided we had to leave to get back to work on time.  The waitress then takes the salad back to the Chef and the Chef says IT IS A COBB SALAD.  I told the waitress that perhaps the Chef SHOULD READ THE MENU that customers order their food from before he prepares meals.  I gave this restaurant the benefit of the doubt and hoped the next time we went there to eat they would get it right.  Well, no such luck, this place sucks due to the Chef's attitude.  I will never go there again because of it.  I recommend that if you go there, read the menu and see if they get your order right and that you receive what you paid for.  They can't seem to for us.  A complete waste of tiime which should otherwise be a nice and enjoyable experience.  Note to Management:  GET ANOTHER CHEF.  Your currfent chef is not doing you any favors. In Fact it is because of him, we will not recommend your restaurant to others.  We will not be back.

FcgWEk2SN2gNaelmQMlrJg.text: Me and my girlfriend just got back from Las Vegas this past weekend and tried new food spots we never did. We decided to try the Rise and Shine place that was near my friends house that lives in LV. Wait time was only 10 mins or less for us and our waitress was very helpful (which everyone seems like there). My girlfriend got the corned beef and hash (around $10), and she loved it because of its authenticity of real corned beef. I got the steak and eggs ($12) because I figured that is what they're known for. I got the medium rare steak and it was so juicy that I did not need steak sauce, only tobasco. Great portions for its price. Only downfall is that there are other steak and eggs spots in LV that are only $3.99. But I guess this is quantity and quality in the same time from my opinion.

9YCLV4L1RfFcyG3vDXcv6Q.text: This could be a 5 if not for our server, Amber.  We found this restaurant on Yelp, and with the near ease of our Navigation system, managed our way to the restaurant.  We were seated almost immediately, which was great since about 20 people showed up in the next 15 minutes or so.  After waiting far too long to be greeted at our table, I walked up and asked the hostess if there was someone assigned to our table.  She said yes, and that she would go find her.  She returned in just a couple of minutes to say that the server must be in the bathroom, and offered to get us started with coffee.  We told her that we were in a hurry to order because we were trying to get out of town and back home (who'da guessed we were in for a 6-1/2 hour traffic jam all the way back to San Diego) to our kids.  She suggested that she could take our breakfast order and get everything started until our server was able.  And she did.  Amber appeared on scene a few minutes later.  We knew it was our server, because the hostess was going over our order with her, and because we hadn't seen her before.  She was either sick or just unhappy to be there, and her demeanor when she did finally come to our table reflected that.  Her energy, or lack thereof, was the counter balance to all the other busy bees.  In fact, she even dropped one of the pots of bread on an adjacent table.  Our food was served by another server - who we are guessing was either the owner or manager.  She was extremely pleasant, and the food was delicious.  We asked Amber for our check - again, because we were trying to get out quickly - and it took her several minutes to drop it.  I was just about to go up to the hostess stand to request it when she dropped it on the table.  When she noticed I already had cash in my hand, Amber did offer to go to the register and cash it out for us.  We didn't take her up on it, but that was something.  I would have just liked to have seen some degree of service before we were on our way out the door.  This was our first trip to Las Vegas in more than 10 years, so it's unlikely that we will be going back soon.  But if we were in town again, I would absolutely return for breakfast.  The food was delicious, and with the exception of our one service experience, everyone else seemed very accommodating.

RPGag4ABbVpGNoxvqtIcjg.text: Found my new breakfast spot! I met Shannon, one of the servers/hostess, at another restaurant in Henderson, where I live, and she told me about this place all the way over in Southern Highlands, where she also works. It takes me a while to get there from Henderson but it's so worth it. Evey time I go in I'm greeted in a very friendly manner, unlike most places here in Vegas. She's extremely friendly and she gets me right in and takes care of my order personally. The food comes out so fast that I don't always get to sit and enjoy the atmosphere for as long as I'd like because on top of the speed at which they make it, the food is so good, I usually eat without breathing. Lol. They always keep my coffee cup full, even after I've paid my tab and they never rush me out, even though there's sometimes a line waiting to get in. It's the place I'll be having breakfast every Sunday for the rest of my stay here in Las Vegas. Great atmosphere, friendly service and fast, great food! Give it a try. You won't be dissappointed!...and feel free to wear your PJs...everyone else is. =)

PdA4Lofg75P-JbxGzRAWLg.text: This place was good not bad but not great I will still go to one of my favorite spots for breakfast on my days off which is MIMI'S. I live in Southern Highlands and I was hoping this place was going to be my spot when I don't feel like going to MIMI'S, but no I'll go to Rise in Shine if I don't want to drive far.When I got there it was busy and we had to wait about 45 mins. It was a Sunday so it was expected didn't mind... we waited outside because there is no place to wait inside, what I think they need to do is get some chairs outside or put a bench so people can sit while they wait. When they called us to be seated the hostess was very friendly and so was the server. But what I didn't like is that when I ordered my glass of orange juice it SUCKED and that's what the customers are looking for,especially if your eating breakfast!!!! The orange sucked because it was diluted with water to save money. It tasted just like water and the color was not even orange it looked yellow. From the moment I saw it when the server brought it to us I knew something was up. I wasn't the only person who notice that it was others too. Then what I ordered to eat was chilaquillas, I was expecting the traditional way but I was wrong, the server explained to me what it was and she explained what I thought it was going to be the traditional way. But NO it was more tortilla chip than anything else very little sauce, very very little eggs, and two slice of avocado, overal it sucked. If you never had the original chilaquillas before u wouldn't know the difference then I guess.... But I think the owner should not call it chilaquillas and call it Chips and Egg; and yes I said egg because it was only one egg.So overall to conclude my review it was OK I had better before. I hope they read this and hopefully change what I wrote just so I and others can go there for breakfast!

qniNVXHuMKJttWtvkxn_cQ.text: Rise & Shine is AMAZING! Definitely needed in Southern Highlands.  This place has an awesome breakfast and lunch menu, and the theme and staff are quite welcoming.  Breakfast and Lunch menu are thorough - have all the classics and some great twists.  Prices are slightly above standard - but the quality of food makes up for any hesitation.  Keep in mind that this is not a tavern or pub with Video Poker and cheap eats:  rosemary potatoes, rubbed ribeye steak and eggs, fresh squeezed lemonade with agave sweetener - you get the idea.  No beer or wine - kind of a bummer for Mimosas or Bloody beers on Sundays, but I'll deal with it - it's a family joint.  No espresso, but they do offer French Press and Illy brewed coffee.  I love going there every weekend!

7QYExW04ySW2NgKmhQoVAQ.text: I usually wait at least  5 visits before reviewing a place because I feel like you can't get a good feel for the nuances of any dining establishment on the first time you dine with them. That being said, today was my 5th visit. So here we are, on Yelp, yelping away. I read most of the reviews here and was surprised at many of the recurring themes, most saying that food was bland or service was slow. I can say that 100% of the time, my food always arrived exceptionally flavorful with just enough seasoning. Not once did I have bland or poorly cooked food, which is awesome. I'm a righteous pain in the butt when I order, too, so I don't make it easy.   Seriously, who orders corned beef hash with medium poached eggs? This guy. And the eggs were perfect. The other times I dined here, I ordered the cinnamon crunchy french toast (I think thats the name. You'll find it), the eggs benedict, and the chicken fried steak. Let's go through these dishes one by one. The eggs benedict? It arrived with properly poached eggs, thick slices of ham (honey glazed), and crisp muffins. Topped with Balsamic, it was just phenomenal. Why has no one thought of putting balsamic on eggs benedict? Shame on you other chefs. The cinnamon crunchy french toast had large thick slices of bread, battered in a cinnamon batter, and topped with Cinnamon Toast Crunch cereal. This, too, was a good idea. The chicken fried steak was so colossal that I couldn't finish it (and I can eat). It was everything I expected it to be. Great gravy and crust, with the right amount of seasoning on the steak. Theres only four dishes here because I had the eggs benedict twice. Which I never do when I'm prepping to review a restaurant. But I said damn the procedure and had them again anyway. Because they are just. that. good. Also, they serve illy coffee in a french press, which is amazing. If you're a coffee fan, I highly recommend going for this alone, even if you're not hungry.   The service was a bit slow on one of my visits, but by my count they looked to be short a server. I didn't inquire to see if they were, because that just seems weird and stalkerish, but even then, we were seated quickly, and maybe had to wait an extra 90 seconds for someone to get our drink order. Big deal. For a place that has food that is this fantastic, I'll wait an extra minute to get my french press.   Keep it up, Rise and Shine. You're a beacon of hope in an otherwise abysmal sea of fast food joints and generic breakfast cafes serving frozen pre-prep dishes.  I love you.

W0t7g5J1mRBUHciJV_0YgA.text: Favorite breakfast place in Las Vegas.  Even better than cracked egg.

w29ahkDaz36HQ9f1SfGoRA.text: I will say we went here for Brunch on Valentines Day. This place is AWEFUL! The food is so salty like it was soaked in the Dead Sea before they served it to us! The crispy chicken sand which was so over done to the point there was no longer any chicken in it anymore. The server brought it out any way and piled all the fixens on top in hopes I wouldn't notice. I sent it back and ordered the grilled chicken sand which instead. There was a salty sliver of chicken smothered in cheese and once again all the fixens were piled on top. The French fries weren't fries as we know them they were smothered in salt basil and lime. Yuck! It took over a half hour for my new meal to get to the table and it wasn't even busy! The owner had sat exactly two other tables since we had arrived. When the server came over to tell me my order was on it's way a half hour later I just asked for a box. She seemed shocked. I made them take my order off the total of the bill. The other people with me seemed to like their food but they all had breakfast items. All in all I will not suggest this place to anyone nor will I ever go back! Oh and I would have felt guilty feeding this to my dogs (as it would probably kill them being so salty) so I put it in the trash where belongs. YUCK!

jIR7vLfAIKxSkov2ld2GQQ.text: This place serves an AMAZING breakfast!!! Your trip to Vegas must include a visit to this wonderful restaurant, one of three in Vegas.  For your bread option, be sure to select the "cup o' bread," a fusion of cinnamon swirl and savory breads baked together in a cup, drizzled with powdered sugar and a warm cream cheese syrup.  Their made-to-order omelettes are served hot off the grill and loaded with whatever you want. They got the hash browns right too - super crispy and very tasty. Lastly, the latte I ordere had Nutella mixed in and was topped with whipped cream and chocolate syrup drizzle. All AMAZING!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

v48oX3z-YQ5LQe8D_WWj3A.text: My husband and I have been here several times since we moved in town a few months ago and I can tell you that we will continue coming back here! Their whole staff have always been very friendly and our food comes out so fast! There is a variety of food selections on the menu and the food portions are definitely for those with a hearty appetite, so my husband and I do share a meal most of the time.  We have brought guests visiting out of town here for breakfast and they really like this place, too!  Weekends can be a little tough to get a table in the mornings. I suggest coming between 7am-8:30am to get seated promptly. After that, you will most likely find many people inside and outside the restaurant waiting to be seated. The most we have waited on a weekend morning was 30 minutes.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is after cutting it in half...it was very tall! Eat with knife/fork OR smash it together and enjoy!!!

Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. (Crispy) Chicken &amp; BLTA Sandwich (I added an over easy egg for an extra cost.) The bun is lightly toasted with butter, extra yum!

0oDuMf1g49UiKJP0hxY62g.text: If you are in the mood for an overindulgent, delicious breakfast with extensive menu guaranteed to have something for everyone then go no further than Rise & Shine. Our personal favorites are The Ultimate Steak & Egg Breakfast, Grilled Steak and Chorizo Burrito, Belgian Waffles and a side of bacon. I have also sampled some of their omelets and they were all very tasty, yet we seem to gravitate back to what we know and enjoy. The prices are mid range and breakfast of that magnitude typically will run into $50-$60 territory. However, the staff is friendly, portions large and filling, left overs galore and we have never had any issues with our order not being filled in timely manner or long waits. I believe they have multiple locations throughout the valley but our go to location has been the one in Southern Highlands.

PgCU-kJqBpeHzFNmRsxIAA.text: The hostess, Jaylin, was welcoming and sweet. Philly style cheese steak and eggs was delish!

wFoeu4atMc6U_YZM2QATog.text: Seated quickly on a Wednesday morning. The decoration and environment is super cute with the umbrellas and rocks. Our server was nice, she was ok though. Personality wise, not as friendly as I'd like but good nonetheless.  I had the Steak, Avo Egg White Omelet with the bread in a cup. The bread in a cup came first and was good and cute. Although I wish it would've came with my food, if you don't eat it soon - the air will catch it and dry it up. The sauce was yummy and not too sweet. My Steak was cooked a little over what I like but it was ok, the omelet itself was good nothing special. The hash browns though are great, crispy-seasoned and made with green onions which is rarely if not ever seen.  My hubs had the Fancy Steakhouse Omelet- dame thing as mine. What really was delicious was the Cinnamon Crusted French Toast. Omg I would go back just for that! My 1 year old had pancakes and I tasted one- better than IHOP and Denny's that's for sure. Buttery, fluffy, and a hint of vanilla. Overall I would def go back to try other items and a side of Cinnamon Crusted French Toast

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Steak Avo Egg White Omelet
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My baby love enjoying the spinning umbrellas
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Bread in a Cup

3CF7FcoLx6iD2oOEFs4Jkw.text: Great place for breakfast. Service is top notch and the food is just so good. I'm from So Cal and always stop here before driving back to California. The loco moco with spam is my favorite dish. Such a huge portion, too. I've had other dishes but I just love the loco moco!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loco Moco w/Spam!

XqTuAeH4mxXSwo8ao0isAw.text: YES THE SERVERS WEAR PAJAMAS! Next time I may too!   Great spot for breakfast. Usually a wait but worth it. Service great. Food good. Had the steak and eggs (what else in a place called "a steak & egg place?).   Wasn't planning on getting the best steak in the world. I knew I wasn't at Wolfgang Pucks, Chop, nor was I paying $75 either!  The steak, which the menu said was ribeye, was decent, thin but decent. Diner level. And this place feels like should be in a small diner but it's a large area in a typical strip mall.   Food was good and the service was friendly and efficient. I left happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. With a menu cover like this it has to be great.

pjCXFsSLVNM1JY9mnDtrKQ.text: I have been visiting Rise & Shine since the first opened. The food was great, the staff was great and it was one of our go-to breakfast places.  The last two time we have been a disappointment. The staff is excellent, no complaints, however the quality of the food has gone down significantly. I'm not sure if it is related to opening a new restaurant, in the same complex, or just a change in staff, however the steak omelet that I normally get was awful. Both the steak and the eggs were overcooked.   I hope the owners spend more time in the restaurant as when they were running the day-to-day, this placed rocked, now, not so much.  We won't be back, which is sad as they started out as an amazing place.

xVf7UsIGj-WltsiWziMO_g.text: The food is very good. It's $$$$, not the $$ as stated in the summary. If you just wanted simple egg breakfast, go somewhere else. The coffee is good, and it's $3.25 for a cup that is ostensibly bottomless, but actually ends when your check arrives and the waitress needs to check her mobile phone for extensive periods.   You can make your breakfast keto, if you'd like, and there are lots of omelet options that are great. If you need to fuel yourself on carbs, you're in heaven here, and you and your waistline will be rewarded. You can substitute carby things like has browns and their weird cup-of-bread for avocado, if you like-- or so I was allowed. Otherwise, this is a carbohydrate economy and you'll unlikely walk away for less than $10, more likely for $15-20 per person.   The coffee was pretty good.... when it arrived.

APmEG2vv28TLAlH9yNChGA.text: Great breakfast food! We got the ribeye steak and eggs medium rate. Great flavor. Definitely tastes like homemade steak! Eggs (over easy) was cooked in perfection. We also got the chicken and waffles. Great juicy chicken with a crispy bread coating. Waffle was nice and soft in the inside and crispy on the outside. The syrup was warm when it arrived at our table. Overall great breakfast place and highly recommend ! Probably the best food we had in Vegas!

0eRgTaqThSrCpm2DEWQpWA.text: Jaylen at the front door was amazing. Took quite a while to get our food but it was worth the wait. We will be back.

8zh2umc3XFuAuCD1pMNB3Q.text: Popular local brunch spot in Vegas outside the strip.  Came here right when they opened at 7 and boy we're glad to skip the lines. I've been here during more "peak" brunch times 930-12 which can be such a pain and expect to wait closer to 2hrs especially on a weekend. Overall cute atmosphere, can accommodate big groups. They have a wide array of brunch items. I don't think you can go wrong with anything you order. However what surprised me was how good their loco moco. And of course you have to try their cup of bread. Reminds of the Lucille's biscuit. So fresh and good!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rise and Shine

SEnapKGqgMcuguq7n7GwIA.text: BS +++  COT DAMN! I finally found  a breakfast spot here in LV that's worth  reviewing.  Coming from NYC breakfast is important.  This place is as good as it gets.  The hostess is super nice and cool.  The waitress is super nice and very attentive.  I ordered the XTRA protein breakfast.  The  cook kills it! Everything about this place is good.  I checked out the restroom and it's clean and  it has a slimming mirror.  Pajamas! They wear pajamas! How chill is that?   I recommend to visit this place whether you are a local, a tourist, or just hangry like I was.  I saw check out the website before you come  so you can  set your target on your food and order ASAP!  And lastly, there is a big cock by the door and I'm not talking a rude  guy either.  It's so cool!  Food is BOMB Restrooms are CLEAN Tables CLEAN Table wait time NONE Take out wait time is QUICK Mood is CHILL AF Customer service is GREAT (super friendly and huge  smiles) Ambiance Super hipster like with upside down umbrella Kitchen SUPER CLEAN  * Boomsauce scale. BW = Dis $@% is BASURA! (Garbage).  Not recommended. BS = it's just O.K. (experience) BS+ = Yo! I like this place. BS++= That's Whoa! This place good. BS+++= Dayumm! This place is fkn DOPE!

qgH72wDLRomBicLQlQnejg.text: Cute breakfast joint just outside of the Las Vegas strip. The servers wear pajamas in the restaurant so hey, you can really wear whatever you want and not look crazy!   The servers were friendly and quick to serve. The menu has a variety of food ranging from fresh juices to waffles, breakfast burritos, pancakes, and omelettes. It's a wide variety that can really meet the needs of anyone visiting the restaurant. We ordered the breakfast burrito, which we split. It was delicious and flavorful.

J8wjIEZcUhB-hbaggVtEzA.text: first thing I have to say is the orange juice is the freshest orange juice ever. They hand squeeze their juice and it tastes as it should. Ordered the steak omelette and biscuit and gravy plate. All the food was wonderful and perfectly cooked. Steak was on point and the hash browns were perfectly crisps. only thing I was a little sad about was the waitress visiting our table once when we were done eating. Only suggestion for them is just checking up on us just a little after you drop the food off would be great in case we needed something. Other than that it was fantastic

VEAOqxDPN_j6BgTFDnn0vA.text: Bad service!  We decided to go here instead of our usual breakfast place because of it's location.  Its right by my house.  Our server took forever to get to us to take our orders and when she did I had to repeat myself twice because she got kept getting my order wrong when repeating back to me.  I said "I'll get the steak and chorizo breakfast burrito." And she would repeat back "chicken burrito".  I fiance ordered the chicken fried steak.  After that she disappeared forever.  Someone else came to bring our food and no one came to ask how we were doing.   My steak and chorizo burrito tastes off.. like it was 90% chilies and eggs so I cut through the burrito and found chicken!  After repeating myself and hearing the server repeat my correct order she still got me a chicken burrito.  She walked by us at least 4-5 times and never once looked in our direction once so we weren't able to let her know.  We got someone else's attention who notified her and she came to apologize and take my plate so she could put in an order for the right burrito. I ended up canceling it completely.  My fiance would have been done eating by the time it came. Regret coming here.  Next time I'll stick to our usual places.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and Waffles..Country Fried NY Steak and Eggs.. and a side of Biscuits and Gravy....all very good!

b8kEbyeWT1ETIBuOoBq-UA.text: So yummy I love this place ! Perfect to bring my laptop and do some work .  They have a good selection of smoothies and coffee .

pfKFRIlala2phwCBoOXDbA.text: Slow service, like 40 minute wait for food. One dish inedibly over cooked. Two others with underdone eggs. Really nothing special and rather expensive, as in thinks they are on the strip expensive.  Long story short, we won't be back.

0ckHHSoy99B9qzPeQaf0bQ.text: Came here this morning and i absolutely love this place, i know the wait might be long but i promise it's worth it and all the waitress and waiters were nice and gave us Good service and great quality tasting food!!!! Jaelyn was our host who was very welcoming and our servers name was Amber !

m6JkpxsNpCigzy1BXqP1eg.text: Was a little skeptical of the balsamic on top of the Avocado Benedict but is was awesome!! A must try.

RMWm9rXwVSzIWVe72gFO3A.text: Came here with my family for a nice sit-down breakfast, and the experience was so pleasant! When you walk in, the ceiling is covered in upside-down spinning umbrellas, immediately creating a light and whimsical atmosphere.  The service was excellent! Our servers were attentive, quick, very happy, and everyone was dressed in pajamas -- if the staff dressed in pajamas isn't awesome, I don't know what is.  I went simple and had some oatmeal with pecans, brown sugar, milk, and raisins; the portions here are HUGE! I swear there was about 3 servings of oatmeal in my dish. My fam had the chicken and waffles, red velvet pancakes, and benedict, which they all enjoyed.  Even after my family stayed a little longer talking at the table after having paid, they still brought us fresh coffee every couple minutes. Major thumbs up to Rise & Shine!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oatmeal with milk, brown sugar, raisins, and pecans

JBniLZKDExE_FvriEhJELQ.text: This place was a wonderful find! On a Sunday morning, this place was packed. But we only waited a few minutes. The staff was excellent. They were very kind & helpful with the menu. Let me tell you...that cup of bread is life changing. Don't skip that. But don't get too full for your meal either. We had that ribeye breakfast & the philly breakfast. Sooo good. Will definitely be hitting this joint every visit to Vegas. Until next time.

r_17U6kbY3K_KqRqCvc3BQ.text: Such a great breakfast place. I love to go to different restaurants in different cities to try their eggs benedicts, and their's doesn't disappoint. They take a classier approach to the breakfast staple; the classic elements are still there, perfectly toasted English muffin, runny, poached egg, and a creamy hollandaise sauce. But then they top it all off with a balsamic drizzle that is tart and compliments the hollandaise sauce perfectly. It comes with a side of crispy hash browns and don't forget to try their pot of bread! Their pot of bread is a fluffy, lightly sweet, hot piece of cinnamon bread that is served with frosting. Amazing place!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict and a pot of bread

HT_tLBoaj01PRN6JPs7RZw.text: I love me some rise n shine! This is a quality breakfast joint and a southern highlands staple restaurant! They are always on point with their fresh pressed juices and fried breakfast meats. I usually get the chicken a top a waffle or biscuits and gravy. Today I came a little closer to lunch time so decided to try the friend chicken and avocado sandwich! And let me tell you it did not disappoint. Juicy chicken fresh avocado and perfectly cooked bacon made this sandwich almost to die for! Thank you for being the quality we need in the southern highland neighborhood!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried chicken and avocado sandwich

jY55ozRUr26iXAWVEsaapg.text: I love finding new breakfast places and so I was really excited to try Rise & Shine. I was surprised to find how cute and well decorated the inside is!!   However, I noticed immediately that the service was lacking. Everyone here seldom smiled and seemed like they didn't want to be there... Breakfast places are usually notorious for their overly friendly service but not this one. Our server, Christina, was very insincere and seemed impatient when we were indecisive about what we wanted to order. After our food came out, she didn't come back to check on us once!!  The food is edible. I ordered the corn beef hash which I didn't really consider to be real corned beef hash because it was just beef cut into small pieces. It was hard for me to want to finish.. Also, the bread in a pot that we ordered tasted kind of stale and not fresh like I expected.   I really wanted to like this place but this restaurant as a whole needs improvement

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their version of corned beef hash..

-oak3vwXAlOqqrIM5ctXZw.text: Loved the Cinnamon Crunch French Toast. Hubby ordered a burrito. Delicious. We were happy with this place.

lBt42L9tRacIVgPkvUWbDQ.text: Ordered the Three Little Pigs bagel sandwich. It was delicious! The service was...eh. Saw our waitress once ten minutes after we'd sat down, for a quick "Everything okay?" right after someone else had helped us & brought our food, & another time to bring the check. Had to ask a bust guy for a refill & some napkins. Then again I only saw 3-4 waitresses with a full house & a 10 minute wait. Did see/hear our waitress do some weird stuff at the next table. She literally picked up their kid to get him off the booth that was about to fall apart & also blew raspberries over their table before a laugh. Probably a bit of spit..it sounded gross. Anyway, good food, eh service. Maybe catch them at a better time than a Saturday afternoon.

4TvPOylZ-OVnxHNuQzCqqg.text: Chicken and waffles?  Yes, please!  *military discount*   TL; DR version: Delicious food, quick but spotty service.    Long version:  Went on Sunday 12-27-15 around 10am.   $37.44 got us a chicken & waffle breakfast, an ultimate steak & eggs breakfast, a side of fruit for the boy, an apple juice, a coffee, and an orange juice.  I love the spinning floral umbrellas on the ceiling but they are all dusty.  It looks like they would take them down and clean them! It's quite distracting....but I liked all the servers wearing pajamas...I thought that was really cute.    THE ULTIMATE Steak & Egg breakfast comes with a ribeye steak, two eggs however you want them, hashbrowns, and your choice of bread.  My husband ate this and complained that none of it was seasoned properly, although the bites I had were delicious and my boy enjoyed the eggs a lot.  He ordered pot o' bread as his bread choice and it didn't show up until we reminded our server.  We were done eating but it was fine because it was kind of like a dessert LOL     Crispy Fried Chicken Breast and Waffle was really good.  I never thought I'd say this about chicken but the chicken was....fluffy....it was crispy and light and airy and wonderful although it was terribly bland.  The waffle was crispy and delicious and I loved that their syrup is served warm.  I ate every single bite of this breakfast but did not leave feeling like I hate myself, which is always a good sign that the portions are properly sized.  Pro tip....pour a little cholula on your plate and dip the chicken in it!  Give that chicken some flavor!   I asked for a side of fruit for my boy ($1.95) and the waitress asked if I wanted the honeydew/canteloupe/pineapple mix or the blueberry/banana/strawberry mix and we picked the latter.  What was delivered was just bananas and strawberries so either they ran out or forgot the blueberries.   Solid breakfast place!  It is 30 minutes from my house and not worth the trip back but I thoroughly enjoyed this breakfast.

GKSISe2fXaBffB_GePT4Cg.text: I'd love to give this place 5 stars for their GREAT SERVICE and DELICIOUS food but it's just a bit OVERPRICED. $9 for a single waffle is ridiculous. But it doesn't stop me from dining here and ordering the buffalo chicken and eggs special.
