ZGpnUtvyviawNn5YCxTZzw.text: Great food, good prices, generous portions with stellar service!!! Shout out to our spot on server, Gelato... (memorable name!)... Loco Moko was insane and the Corned Beef hash was home made with bits of real corned beef... everything we've had here was "special" in some way...

4wpwVB2t84IoJ-YPfyghFg.text: We really like this place and are super impressed with the service and have always had good food! The prices are a little bit high in my opinion for breakfast but the service and the quality of food makes up for the difference.  Updated  It will definitely be a season before we try this place again. I went in today on Mother's Day and we knew it would be crowded and we allotted for that we're sitting at a table right next to the cashier and got bumped and pushed by workers and customers the entire time.  The music was so incredibly loud that made it feel like chaos no matter what   Pancakes where not done , eggs Benedict were practically hard boiled, kids waffle tiny for price and had whip cream which in my opinion should be asked for kids menu items, coffee taste like water ... I know what you're thinking why didn't we talk to a manager... it was so loud and busy and that I didn't even feel like it was worth it to try.

VtFtvP2CqES5VpeMpEPGnw.text: I'm sure this place is probably great besides this one server, but.... Today we went and within 5 minutes of being seated, our server in pink pajamas asked us if we were ready to order 4 times! The last time, she said "Sure I'm in no rush" in a passive aggressive manner. Feeling pressured and uncomfortable, we left.

IdmSz3OwU-QKOjVrjDQ5Kw.text: Upon first walking in, you are greeted by an Instagram-able paradise. The decor is so cute, so naturally we all had to boomerang the spinning umbrellas on the ceiling :) We had to wait about 10 minutes even though they said 20, which was nice.   It was really hard to decide what to get as everything sounded SO GOOD. My friend and I got the steak & eggs and it was truly one of the best breakfast joint steaks I've had. My sister got the red velvet pancakes, and they were to die for. Pretty sure I ate half of her plate!  My only complaint was the strange service we received. Example: I ordered salsa, but it somehow ended up with my sister's side of eggs. When I asked if I could get a fresh cup of salsa, they said "Oops, here you go" and took it off my sister's plate and put it on to mine. Then my friend asked for a side of butter for her waffles. The waitress looks at the cup of butter on my other friend's plate and says "but there's already butter here." So...we were supposed to share butter off each other's plates? This was a weird thing to say instead of just grabbing us a fresh cup of butter.   I'm hoping those were isolated incidents, so I wouldn't let it deter you from going there.

hzJDSEi-1vU_JcXVsmzJog.text: Everything we had, from chilaquiles and moko loko to the pancakes was truly delectable. I have 4 picky boys that devoured every single bite of their food and some of ours.

gzmscz1CHlKNX-4n8MGiQw.text: This just became my favorite breakfast spot in Vegas! I sat at the counter and ordered poached eggs with avocado and hash browns.  The best hash browns! You'd think hash browns are hash browns?! Not after you try them at Rise & Shine! Busting with flavor! No extra seasoning needed! Just the perfect texture!  Every server and host was beyond friendly and accommodating. They all had a smile on their face and were fast and attentive. And coffee kept coming!  This is definitely a must!

mzXb5rlvaKd6LCjr_Eo66A.text: I love this place and Amber is so pleasant and sweet, I love almost everyone in here except for the dirty looking girl with all the tattoos and nose ring..I'm so glad she wasnt our server.. she looks very dirty, and I always hear her complain about her job.. anyway thank you so much for the great food and service.

79tsFzSQQ7uJlpXtRFlUfw.text: This is our new favourite breakfast eatery when in Vegas . Great food and great service both times we ate there this week . Can highly recommend

lZvcYVXXKuSyCEmeSJH1hw.text: Excellent breakfast spot, came here for the ribeye steak and was not disappointed med rare as ordered. The french press coffee is absolutely superb and theres no shortage of breakfast items should you choose to eat something other than steak and eggs. Our server Ashley was great. Only note I have is that I had to fetch our utensils as they were not provided at the time of our seating. Other than that had a great experience! The cup of bread is delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yv-C2wJ6DMoLtHyKVKtt9g.text: You can find Rise and Shizzle tucked in the Southwest corner of the Southern Highlands shopping center.  Other nearby eateries is Barcelona Tapas and Off the Strip.  R&S is just another addition to the ever expanding Highlands area.  You will notice the warm and friendly staff from the outset.  Its hard not to see that they are struttin' around in their PJ's, no it ain't no Loberace show, but equally thrilling..j/k.  I love theme based restaurants, Anime Ramen takes the cake though.  Anyhow, I got a kids meal steak and eggs while my patnah got the chicken fried steak.  I wasn't starvin' Marvin, but needed to get something in my stomach, pronto.  It was 10ish, so decided to keep it small.  Its still a nice portion if you ask me.  The steak was done as requested, medium rare, with fresh made hash browns served on a hot skillet.  I threw in a cup of French onion soup for good measure.  The steak was not overly seasoned which I prefer to get that True steak flavor.  The soup was piping hot and came in a stoneware cup.  Its hard to find good FOS, and this place doesn't disappoint.  Not the best I ever had like Drake kinda good, but not bad at all.  Most of the other dishes are pretty generous, unfortunately, the prices aren't.  I would suggest sharing if you are not a breakfast gorger like most of us.  The prep and way the food is served is legit though.  I like how the menu is simply one page, but it can get difficult to find certain dishes.    The ambiance is nice and quiet and spacious as well.  The inside is decorated like most new and clean breakfast joints are, yet, the twist, literally, is the ceiling fans are fitted with decorative umbrellas that accent the ceiling along with other festive colors.  Looks like Steve Wynn designed it considering the loud colors...lol.  A nice touch nonetheless.  To me, rise and shine is a hit and if you are in the neighborhood, or don't want to venture off to far if you live close by, like me, this place is as good as it gets.  Break that fast at Rise and Shine!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French onion soup
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and eggs

MOCQrpVmNG1sTeW90mJcZA.text: Going out for Breakfast can be hit or miss. This place has consistently been AMAZING!  The staff are extremely friendly and the service is top notch.  Their quirky takes on dishes such as Eggs Benedict and Chicken and Waffles are incredible. They offer Illy brand coffee which tasted great and even have a French Press if you're into something a little stronger.   If you are looking for a great, relaxed, delicious Southern Highlands Breakfast spot then look no further.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. AWESOME!

gzRi2vf39eAx7O9Mx7q6cw.text: This place is wonderful. All the servers are friendly and so accommodating. I have a hard time deciding between breakfast and lunch items, everything is just so good. I'm a regular and the food is always perfect. Great with kids too!

Ak5OV_4WJj8qS6jY4t8t2w.text: I find the food in this restaurant to be some of best in this price range. The casual atmosphere is enhanced by the fact that the wait staff all wear pajamas. It's a cute touch.  We always make a point to order at least one pot of bread, because they're fantastic. Of all of the breakfast restaurants in Las Vegas, this one of my favorites.  The only negative thing I can say is that the biscuits and gravy are a little too spicy for my taste.

wXtHXvwv4F-jw9AEOpFTzA.text: Living in the Southern Highlands area there are not many choices for breakfast. I happen to stumble across this restaurant on Yelp and the restaurant had 4 stars. My experience was far from 4 stars. We waited 20 minuets to be seated only to be served by a overwhelmed server and to top it off the restaurant was really warm. I ordered the 3 egg breakfast scrambled with American cheese and sour dough bread. My eggs were greasy and it looked like they stuck a craft single on top of my scrambled eggs (it wasn't even melted all the way when it showed up.) My sour dough bread showed up dry and cold and my bacon was cold and greasy. This was my first and last time at this restaurant. My plate was not worth the $14 I spent on it or the stomach ache I got afterwards.

VZ5-lDpQGCTgALkkK0DNjA.text: Came in with my wife and friends for breakfast. It was our first time there. Menu had a wide selection of menu items. Our server Chris was so happy  and cheerful. Asked us if this was our first time here? Suggested some of her favorites. Went with Steak and eggs one of her favorites,  and my wife went with the servers suggestion  Veggie Benedict. Server told us about the pot bread she was so excited about us trying it. Food was quick and we loved our food. Server was attentive asked how we were doing. My wife and friends loved the atmosphere.  All the servers wore pajamas. Prices were fair. Chris was one of the best waitress we had in a while. Definitely well be back for the food and to see Chris again.

opTgeI0doA0xdkLdWsHpHA.text: Our party of 2 arrived Sunday morning around 10 AM. We were told 20 mins for a table and got our table exactly 20 mins later.   Service was ok, not overly attentive but there when it was needed.   Had the Texas French toast  and chicken and waffles, both were just ok and average.   For the price and service it was all just ok.

Sq2Fp0qHsLKT08YD-i_heQ.text: So many times w come here and the food is great. Blueberry pancakes, avocado eg sandwich and chicken wrap all super tasty. Great service.

ZgAA-6dkTGA9jDRL4glQaA.text: By far and away my favorite breakfast place. We eat at the one in Southern Highlands. Today they weren't up to their normal standards. They were out of tortillas, a bit frustrating but ok. The pot of bread was way over cooked, to the point it was rock hard on the top. The eggs were under cooked. We had to ask for silverware and syrup. They were just a little off with everything, not sure if the owner is focusing on his other restaurant, or just an off day. We won't give up on this location. Yet:)

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RCtb19xg2elUVTPCFED5Xw.text: This place is busy, busy! Choose your timing well; regardless, it's worth the wait!   I had the steak and spinach Benedict. Huge serving (for 2 hungry people) but the meat was tender, cooked perfectly and I love their hollandaise sauce with the balsamic extract. YUM!   The spot is clean, well decorated, and I can't speak highly enough about the service. 5 stars for the service without a doubt.  I feel their menu is slightly limited and given their huge portions (a lot of meals are pretty heavy, too) I won't make this my "go-to" place, but I'll get a craving for it (and their cup o' bread). We'll be back!   Worth checking out (for you meat lovers only).

YUFd-TbWta337IB8_K2jUQ.text: My favorite breakfast joint in town. Their Chicken and Waffles is to die for. Everything on their menu is deliciously homemade from scratch and all the ingredients are fresh. The staff is very helpful, friendly and fast. The atmosphere is very fun and casual.  I have ordered carryout from them a couple times and all were pleasant experiences.

LHTsrWaXZpPJPn9cutBzDQ.text: Just go to Rise and Shine, you'll give it 5 stars too! Great service, quaint environment, and delicious food. Beware this little cafe is a hot spot for Sunday breakfast and brunch so plan accordingly. Well worth the wait!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is one is going to be delicious. Chicken and egg white omelet.
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot of bread and coffee :)

lDENSgloD3NoHRo77IZUIg.text: My fiance and I just moved to the area and came across this place and knew he had to try it. We looked up reviews, of course and saw good ones, and the pictures looked amazing.   Long story short, we came, we ate & i personally expected more. Customer service was on point, our waitress was absolutely amazing and they give a huge portion. The food itself was mediocre, not anything I haven't experienced already. Maybe we'll give it another shot and try something different.

qR15WBKA6CxfZz7__s4tTQ.text: We are new (two years) to the LV Valley, and live in the Seven Hills area of Henderson. There is no lack of restaurants in the area, so we've been doing our best to try new places we've never been before. Sadly, we have tried a few breakfast spots and none have wowed us. Until now. We finally found a decent place with good food. Rise & Shine is a bit far away in Southern Highlands, but at least it's easy traveling time, not near the strip. It's in a outdoor mini mall area with an Ace Hardware store and a supermarket. We had to go to Ace early Sunday, and decided to try the place. It was decent size and cute decor, and the servers wear their pajamas, which took a second to register at first, but cute idea. Big menu, with lots to choose from. My husband had the daily special chicken fried steak and gravy, and loved it. I ordered the chicken and waffles, and was blown away at how good it was. Even better, in my opinion, than Roscoe's in California, but I'm sure some will disagree.  The chicken breast was flattened and fried, but the flavor was rich and deep, and the batter was so crispy and flavorful. I asked, and the server said it was just salt, pepper, and flour, but it must have been dipped in buttermilk, because it really was exceptional. The waffle was light and fluffy, and their logo was stamped in the middle. The piece of chicken was huge, which was good because I took half home and ate it for breakfast the next day.  They have something called a pot of bread, which is a hybrid of a cinnamon roll stuff in a cup. We didn't try it, but will next time.  We were there at 7 am when it opened, so the crowd wasn't big, but they obviously had regular customers with whom they were really friendly.  Only downfall is that it's a bit cher...Our two meals with coffee and a hot chocolate came to about $40. So not something to do everyday, but for a nice Sunday breakfast out.

wCzgOFtP2PfAvS8oSrub3Q.text: Maybe I missed something. Or, maybe I just ordered the wrong food but Rise & Shine was not all that to me...at all.   I arrived around 11am and it was busy. I drove here from Lake Las Vegas so when I was told the pot of breads were all gone, I was definitely disappointed.   I had some coffee to start which was actually a good cup of joe. My waitress was really busy and I was in a really patient mood so it was all good. She finally came to take our order. I ordered the Ultimate Steak breakfast which consisted steak (obviously), 2 eggs, hash browns and my choice of bread (except the pot of bread).  I ordered my steak medium but it came more well then anything. We waited about 20 minutes or more for our food so I decided to keep it. First off, this rib-eye was super thin. I have never had a rib-eye steak that was so thin.   I ordered my eggs over medium. The yolk portion was perfect but the eggs were a little too brown on the outside and they were more yolk than egg white. It was like two big eyeballs on my plate. Not sure what happened to the egg white portion.   My hashbrowns were okay but like most everything else on the plate, it was cold.   NOTE TO RESTAURANT: Why is the air up so high. My food was cold in a few minutes.  I saw some other plates going by that looked pretty good but my food was not up to par. I would say it  was okay, so I won't be back.

2GjzXODXWNKW9GbzBanVuA.text: Never disappointed, best steak and eggs in town. Rib eye!!! And chicken and waffles to rival all others. The pot of bread is like a cinnamon roll in a cup. Every single thing on the menu is fantastic. **the summerlin location has bananas foster pancakes- a la mode!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge.
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles! Sweet!!!

79WWSqoh6xLUMMMFxm8K-A.text: This restaurant is on a downhill path and they need to fix it. Based on the recent reviews and my recent experience everyone seems to agree. The wait time are out of control. Really waiting over an hour for breakfast!  The wait times are caused from poor table management. There is no sense of urgency. Tables are left dirty, servers are not moving the flow and customers are left waiting.  This was a very disappointing experience

h4Lx-xW2qFhtbYHjvEke9Q.text: I got a breakfast burrito.  They used hash browns, and I prefer sauteed or roasted potatoes. The refried beans tasted like the ones from the grocery store that you get out of a can.  They were extremely busy when I ordered to go, and it took a very long time to get my order.

qnW1SGKIU5TP0iW9to7sHQ.text: I've been here twice in July and twice in August.  I love this place because of the food.  The place is a descent size, cleanliness is average, but the food is awesome and the people are great, and that is good enough for me.  Price is average, not too steep.  Love the ceiling decor, great location, tons of parking.  My favorite brekkie place in VEGAS.

imW0ICABbcpM8Aeif9Gv0g.text: This place is awesome.  they are great for both breakfast and brunch. It seems to get busy in the morning, but worth the wait.  Any time I'm in Vegas I make an excuse to swing by here now.  Nothing but good memories and great food.   The red velvet pancakes are amazing.  Super rich and very delicious. The omelets are good too.  I recommend getting both something sweet and something savory, then sharing!   The service here is spot on.  Very friendly and they seem to actually enjoy being there. All the servers wear pajamas. Maybe it's due to the comfort of the uniform or the people at work, but everyone there seems to really enjoy it.

Q_0VhQ-PeFqUSyFJC7x-9g.text: Very fortunate to live pretty much next door to one of the best breakfast spots in Vegas. The servers are all in their pyjamas which adds a fun and upbeat atmosphere. Not to mention the classic Christmas songs playing which made my breakfast even more merry. I chose to go for the cinnamon crunch french toast....it is unreal! Price is very good and worth every penny.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The cinnamon crunch french toast.

3NArcv5H1QibL9KEN9QccA.text: This place inspired me to coin a new phrase : BESTFAST!  Worth any drive within 30 miles. Fried chicken and waffles rival the best I've had but are just one of a menu full of great choices. GO HERE only if you want the best breakfast in the Vegas area.

Mb6y3_mH7AKGeYAOlocTZQ.text: Worst service ever. Waited more than 15 minutes to be seats. food was okay. The owner had a rude attitude when I spoke to her about an issues. Would never come here and eat again.

Ztje-cqIdwkiTWdmv7-gAA.text: Don't mean to make a stink, but I did a take out order today as I was doing a smiths run. I ordered chicken and waffles to go and got home and had raw chicken and waffles. I just threw the plate away as I am super paranoid.

O0tEDHMRikgwbryZPHbZvQ.text: The hostess in the pink and black polka dot pajamas was bitchy rude seated people before us when asking about it got snotty attitude   The food was sub par eggs Benedict came hard boiled. As the waiter he was sorry and was told they were short staffed. Not into excuses.  They did give  a small discount on the Benedict. 2 bites of the Benedict and was done.

ljzYvrDlUaA9Je03dsvsfQ.text: This is the best place for breakfast. They get pretty busy because they are good at what they do, so expect that. But overall everything is killer. If you read any other reviews that contrary to that, they're crazy. These guys really have hit a homerun especially thriving in a strip mall plaza style.  I try to eat here at least a few times a month. Everything is good. Great choices for kids, like silver dollar pancakes (with chocolate chips!)

yJw0nU0CJQ0d0NNP-w9oSA.text: Good food, just a little expensive.  Almost as much as the prices on the strip.  Sitting on the weekend is a little tight, nice and clean place.

b8a_qp86jYxXgsUVK75ufw.text: Man i love coming here the staff are friendly and make it a priority to get to know you. The food is amazing and the prices are fair.....

MvXanfE1hdT_HqGaBKiA9w.text: the best breakfast place in southern Highlands. been going here for years and have yet to be disappointed by the food or service.  I'm all about eggs benedict and the ham eggs benny is always on point. the ham is freshly sliced and not that cheap kind of boxed ham. I love the light balsamic drizzle they use on top to give it a kick to the taste. the seasoned home fries are also awesome.  if you like cinnamon rolls, you HAVE to try the pot of bread! it's freshly baked in house and served with sweet cream and butter. getting this is a must!

7Pf6KUOOyvBz8-eqd2fYGQ.text: A friend told me about this place and raved about the chicken & waffles so I had to try it.  I was not disappointed. I ordered the chicken & waffles and had to share it with a friend.  My other friend who can ordered the ham steak and it was almost bigger than the plate.  He had to take the ham steak off to get to his potatoes.  WOW! I will definitely be returning and sharing with my friends :)

HJ9BT8LAl0wLP1RGfd180w.text: 5 star for French pressed coffee and peanut butter and blueberry compote French toast. 4 star for service and cute bread in pot (but now that I tried, I won't wait for it next time) 3 star for the steak and egg. Our steak came out over cooked. Their saving grace is our server sent it back and brought out a much improved version 2 star for the over priced juice and milk in small glasses:(

B3kvKLSNUypad7BJ60lp1Q.text: Way more than I have ever spent on breakfast without drinks... or any meal without drinks... But food was REALLY good... so if you have lots of money and want really good food.... here u go!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuits and Gravy with hash browns and 2 over medium eggs $9.95

l24SuKaAv0g97Nd7-mfWvw.text: First I have to say I went here when it first had opened I had so much fun the food was amazing. Now a couple years later craving the food the menu is different food was good but not what it used to be didn't get greeted as I walked through the way everyone was dressed was very sloppy and not as uniformed as used to be. They over charged me for French toast you can go to Ihop for half the price. I asked if I can have blueberry French toast and the server Vanessa says "sorry we took the off the menu" and offers something else, comes back with the food and said "sorry that's the best I can do for you". Turn off right there if I could I would have walked out of that place immediately, but I didn't want to embarrass my family. Moral of the store is I will not be returning and very disappointed, because that was the place I recommended to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Extremely disappointed

vVkwXCB6LZE-fN-kkYG-TA.text: I don't even know where to begin. The decor is whimsical and fresh. The staff is friendly and there uniform is pajamas- freaking brilliant. The menu is reasonably priced, and the food is incredible. I had the chicken and waffles, season perfectly and very filling. It also came with the bread in a pot I thoroughly enjoyed. This dish also reheated well when I decided to finish it for a late lunch. My friend had the blueberry peanut butter pancakes, also delicious. I will be revisiting, just haven't decided if it will be every weekend or make a once a month thing so I don't over indulge.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread in its pot
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread out of its pot
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You will have to try!!

hBINUfBA4aqHQ6tL46IKYA.text: I was trying to find a reason to give this place less than 5 stars, and I couldn't! (It's Nov 17, and they already have Christmas music playing. I love that sort of thing, but maybe those who think it's too early for all this festive cheer may dock a star.)  Shannon our server was so sweet!!  Almost as sweet as the freshly squeezed OJ. (You have to get a glass of this stuff!!)  We ordered the biscuits and gravy, which tasted great!  The biscuits weren't too doughy, and they were covered in that quintessential Midwestern gravy.  Also had the double fisted crispy chicken bagel sandwich.  They weren't kidding when they named this thing. It was giant, with a tender piece of friend chicken, scrambled eggs, melted provolone, spinach, AND bacon!!! I got it on an everything bagel.   If you want a satisfying and flavorful breakfast off the strip, this is your place.

StMFWLMb-uzZV_7V6-KSqg.text: A great breakfast place with friendly service and well trained cooks.  Omelets are fantastic, and they have nice touches like a mound of cinnamon bread served in a tiny planters pot (pot of bread).  I had a spinach, bacon, and cheese omelet which was delicious.  Very well prepared and the portion was a good size.  The hash browns are well prepared and tasty.  Menu is a little on the  small side, and $2.50 for a cup of coffee is a little steep.  Expect to pay $17-$20 per person for breakfast which is a little steep.  I tried the banger sausage and found it just okay - the bacon was better.  Seems to be a hickory bacon that's well seasoned.  I can't give it 5 stars because of the price.  A limited menu is okay for me.  It's impossible to make 200 things very well, so focusing on making 20-30 things increases the quality.  Definitely worth a trip to check it out, but for my family and I, the total bill was $62.  This is a little pricey for 3 adults and a child.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A great breakfast place.  Try the pot of bread and omelets.

_XMTfoq-XZUfKPyMHeAqIw.text: Food is good. Location can be busy and staff seems overwhelmed at times. Not sure why they have to wear the pajamas...

h4ZGCUWwV9mCv-kUfEgwOg.text: Good food, good service. Sweet or savory they have the options. Waitresses are very nice and adorable in their pajama uniforms.

OxwmZ5gKAtx8KwpEGi1Mbg.text: Wanted to like the place, I really did. Cute idea with the jammies and umbrellas. French Toast was good. But my sister ordered a burrito with NO MEAT and they put chorizo in it. When we asked if there was meat in it she said no, just chorizo. Ok so chorizo is what? And she says sausage.... ummm. So cool, I haven't eaten meat in 7 years until I tried her burrito. Sweet. The server felt kinda bad but maybe she should have an understanding of what is in their menu items. Lame.

jO6F-MLUCcp4y7rG8dG1TQ.text: Read reviews and since I'm new to the neighborhood wanted to check it out.  We were seated right away but, waited a little too long for drink order.  Waitress was very nice.  Ordered country fried steak and eggs. $15.25.  Generous portion but hash browns were burnt.  Steak was bland. I was a little disappointed based on reviews. No bread came with meal. $3 for ice tea that was refilled.  Gonna have to push myself for a second time

Ogd4xGa5MqQIL5Y-WtecNw.text: I came here today for breakfast ..... Omg!! It was absolutely amazing. It was super busy.... Which has to tell you something!!! I mean this is the spot!!! There was a wait for 25 minutes.... I hate waiting but it was worth every minute that I waited!!!! the entire staff here was great!!! My waitress was the best!! I got the ultimate steak and eggs with a side of red velvet pancakes! I can't tell you because there are no words to describe to you how awesome the steak was.... Then the red velvet pancake ..... That was heaven in my mouth! It was just an overall great experience I was talking to the table right next to me they said that they have had a rise and shine addiction for 2 years now!!!  I totally see why! Great job rise and shine I am your new biggest fan!!!!!!!

JgBXGfuGAOIa7mjjUGlWDQ.text: I went on sunday and it was crazy!  I sat at the bar so i could see the cooks and man are they efficient!  Chicken and waffles are to die for.  This place is a well oiled machine. Good food, good service, i will definitely be back..

NZf_srpF7U_ZKFNoyCEI0A.text: Wtf? Couldn't get through to this place for 20 minutes to order take out. Once they finally picked up Keomi picked up the phone and put me on hold for 10 minutes. I could hear the phone laying on the hostess stand as they socialized. When I called back to speak to a manager I was a denied to. Reluctantly I made my order because this place's food is still great but they get 3 stars for service. Not ordering take out again.

lmgFug6dQ-TIaffU9HvItw.text: Yummy breakfast place on our drive home from Vegas.  The wait staff are dressed in pajamas which is super cute, the coffee was great and the food was excellent.  Everything is fresh and portions are decent.  Each traditional breakfast dish had a twist to it that separated it from the norm.  I'll definitely be back on my next drive to or from Vegas.

jyfYjSBM-IIzPHz0U9YXzA.text: I really liked this place. Nothing negative to say. Cute idea and execution; especially the uniforms. Food is well prepared and very flavorful. Will def go back next time in town. Wait staff was awesome and aimed to please the customer!

SCSZ66GmbmM4vqwnhy2J4Q.text: Hands down the best breakfast place in Vegas. Great coffee, great eggs, and the steak and eggs are incredible.

A_2dAc6PcV8Z_7LhDJil9g.text: BEST STEAK AND EGGS EVERR!!!!!! Great service, great vibe, great food! I recommend to anyone!

SB4UDzqSfPa0hrvA2KcNiw.text: We were staying off strip and this was the closest breakfast joint to our hotel so we stopped in. The waitresses were super nice and provided great service. They also wear pajamas. Get your mind out of the gutter though, nothing naughty to see here. The decor is really unique and colorful. I had the Chorizo burrito and it was outstanding. We'll definitely hit this joint again if we're even south of the strip again.

OeoiIpUWlrfG1Pbyd6QQrw.text: Great service, we got our food quicker than expected, the only downside was what my friend ordered. She ordered a corned beef hash, but there wasn't really enough corned beef on her plate, it was mostly potatoes. She was upset to be eating eggs and potatoes on a "corned beef hash" plate. That's alright, we'll try other things on the menu next time!

u7UTHD2X4RPTJbXrLYFGcQ.text: If you're like me, breakfast is your favorite meal of the day. After my first visit here, I was hooked. I made it a point to plan the rest of my stay in Vegas around having breakfast at Rise & Shine. My wife and I found each experience to be more enjoyable than the last.   The atmosphere is pleasant, the staff friendly and professional. You have the option of dining inside or outside. The place is patronized by many people, and you may very well have to wait to be seated, especially on the weekends. We were there when it seemed to be peak hour for business and we never waited more than 15 minutes.  The menu! It screams "breakfast", yet with many creative twist to otherwise conventional meals. Overall it's the perfect combination of quality and quantity. I had the Ultimate Steak Breakfast, oh so satisfying. A large ribeye steak, eggs, hash browns and choices of breads. All made to your liking of course. What really blew me away, was the Cinnamon Crunchy French Toast. My taste buds are still having a party (licking my lips).  A must try place in my opinion! It's hard to go wrong with a place that has people lined up to eat there!

GpMTo2wYJeKq0WZC_m7CEw.text: First time eating here. The line was out the door but it was well worth the wait. The staff were all very friendly, our food came out quickly and everything was amazing. The kids loved the fresh juice as well. My eggs were not cooked correctly and the owner came out herself with a fresh order and said you can't not like your eggs. We were super impressed with the customer service. Best breakfast we've had in a while, we will definitely be back! Well worth the money and the wait.

KNlu6DVg8wtndxDLFmvFNw.text: We love this breakfast place! We eat here every weekend. The food is consistently tasty. Everybody is friendly. The servers wear pj's and are friendly and efficient! The host, hostess, and cashier are nice! The upside down spinning umbrellas are super cute! We try to get in before the lines start (after 10:00 AM). Our only complaints are there are (1) only 2 bathrooms for such a big restaurant, (2) it can get a little noisy with the radio on a high volume in the kitchen, and (3) the location of the register is a little awkward when checking out. It is right next to the door and is a combination register/hostess desk. So, when it gets busy and a line starts forming for incoming new customers and the exiting customers checking out, it gets a little hectic and jammed. They've recently expanded, and could possibly put the register and exit at the new door. This way the entrance (main door) is just for the hostess and the exiting door could be designated as the register/checking out area.

wU1ZFPQd2FleD0w18HD8AA.text: Had the "ultimate" steak n eggs as they call it...  It wasn't the BEST I've had but good, it may need more flavor, it kinda had a burnt coal taste? Eggs n hash browns up to par, I ordered side of country gravy for my biscuit and it was a bit bland, needs more sausage grizzle in there or salt... Either way it should be savorrrrrrrry to the tongue.... Service good as usual... Lisa was very nice. I will have to stay with the chicken fried steak as the winner here.... Next time it's flapjacks to try!   C

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;ultimate&#34; steak n eggs as they call it

LN5yH_Q0mUfE7eueFHPdoA.text: We came here today for breakfast. It was pretty busy. We waited about 25 minute before we got seated. I got the ham and eggs Benedict. I liked everything except the ham it was pretty salty. Our server was nice but slow. Would come back if in the area.

D5ayCJUF6B8cCZxjuCsBHQ.text: Sad to write this, came on a Wednesday morning, we were immediately seated, 20 minutes later no one came to our table. After watching three other parties get seated, and attended to, and  have a waitress and busser walk by our table multiple times without service we decided to leave.  We love to support local places, but we will definitely tell our friends and family not to support this place.

Of3j9MKTUl1s9DDyIlWxLA.text: I'm very picky when it comes to Breakfast and most importantly eggs and how's certain people make them. I chose the ribeye and 3 eggs with cheddar and I had zero complaints!!!!! Will definitely return the atmosphere is nice and our server was definitely cool to.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheddar scrambled eggs, rib eye , hash browns best breakfast I&#39;ve had in vegas

XXgOdYZ1dpYQ5ebaAsReEQ.text: We sat for 15 mins and weren't greeted/ acknowledge AT ALL by our waitress. I get that it's busy, but a simple "I will be right with you, thanks so much for your patience" would have sufficed! Not even asked for anything to drink... I made sure to tell the host (a man in glasses) that we left for this reason. I was really looking forward to eating here.

IgTplDgN1BuiV3KaG_sBBw.text: The ambiance was great and our server awesome.  It's cool to come in and see flowers hanging from the ceiling, you'll know what I mean when you see it.  The servers are dressed in PJ's, just a really cool, quaint place that isn't overly loud or overly quiet.  A great place to catch up with friends.  The servers are pretty awesome too.  Come check it out.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great servers that make you feel at home :)
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chiliquiles
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flowers from the ceiling :)

oxADxdNa31gRpF2Pk5Y9cw.text: This is the second time at rise and shine. The first time I ordered the chilaquiles with the steak. It was different than most that I had. But still very good and a good portion. The steak had a good seasoning and was very tender. The second time I ordered the chicken and waffles. The chicken was very very good , nice and crispy , and the waffles tasted like fluffy cake batter. It went well with the chicken. Orange juice is squeezed fresh and sweet. Not bitter at all. And you get a little pot of bread with a side of cream cheese syrup . Also very tasty! Service is good and it's adorable inside!

QJkPqGNSTq-BACLGeEXbxg.text: The staff was not sitting guests in hopes for the kitchen to 'catch up'.  Also, while whimsical pajamas day for the staff only remains funny when the restaurant actually has efficient service.  Don't try to be funny if you can't make your guests at least sAtisfied.

wTjL47Kg68xF31dK9K03vQ.text: The hubby and I had a great breakfast here but I would have to agree with Michael U., a most conscientious and loquacious Yelper, that this is probably not the best breakfast in Las Vegas. Still, it's good food and very reasonably priced. And I do think it is cute that the waitresses are all in PJs... it goes with the whimsical decor.  Hubby is a huge steak and egg fan. That is his go-to breakfast order. So, it was fun for him to have some different options. He settled on the spice rubbed rib eye and he said the steak was perfectly cooked and seasoned. The chilaquiles were not that great, but I do give them props for making their own (some places just use store bought tortilla chips and enchilada sauce, bleh). Since we had about a 30 min wait for a table I had plenty of time to look at the menu and spent most of it deliberating between ordering French Toast or eggs. I am not a huge fan of eggs but we were about to get on the road back to Phoenix and I knew I needed some protein or else I would get hungry on the drive. Fortunately our waitress pointed out that if I ordered the French Toast I could add 2 eggs and a meat (sausage, bacon, or my choice turkey kielbasa) for only $3.50. So, that is what I did. It proved to be too much food for me but all of it was yummy so I didn't mind.  They were very short staffed that day but the service was still friendly and efficient. I would say the food was probably only 3 and a half stars but the cool atmosphere and staff rounded it up.

FQyzBrYvNz6-Tr59NXRAsQ.text: I had the chicken and waffles....chicken beast without the bone, juicy lightly crisp. Waffle hot off the griddle, served with chicken on top of the waffle and sprinkles  Of powdered sugar. I liked the way the syrup is served......warm in a bottle of cinnamon sticks:)

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and Waffles, served with warm syrup .

lykrf0f4Ww2SlzRQokLg4A.text: Our waitress Ashley was amazing and the food was delicious! My parents were in town visiting & I'm pretty sure this is their new favorite place they eat breakfast. Plus it's my birthday today & she brought me an amazingly delicious red velvet pancake. Definitely coming back here again!!

ZHk_Q8rFEtAG9iSvYsGAsw.text: Alright place for a steak and eggs breakfast. The steak that I got wasn't the best cut, it was full of fat and eggs were bit overcooked. I'll definitely try to place out again to see if it was fluke or not. Service was excellent.

m4qJTYC5r-wwsx5ZBlYAhg.text: The BEST chicken and waffles I've ever had. Definitely better than Roscoes. The buffalo chicken and eggs were awesome too. My family and I went to Rise & Shine two consecutive mornings because it was just that good.

EchDDTex9J7MXyxFAkAL5A.text: I was looking for a place to have a brunch while casually celebrating my husband's birthday. There was going to be a total of 8 family members, varying in age from 23-86, so in other words, a variety of palates to please. Since we all live in town, but not all in the same area, I wanted a place that was easily accessible for those that lived further & not too far, for the senior drivers.   When I stumbled upon Rise & Shine in my Yelp search, and saw the huge quantity of great reviews, I knew, that we had to give it a shot. I knew in advance that they didn't take reservations, so I warned everybody that we could have a possible wait, a 15 minute average on the weekend mornings, I was told. Everybody, whether via phone or in person, was delightful, and the service was just as good at our table. I don't recall our server's name, but she handled our table of 8, no problem. The food was great! Almost everybody ordered something different and not one complaintThe prices were very reasonable, for the quality & quantity of food.

AXx9jskaNszWP4qj1-SA6w.text: The food is excellent and the staff is friendly. My wife and I  enjoy eating here. However, I have two issues eating here. The first is that they do not have pancakes as a side.  I could never eat just pancakes for breakfast. I normally like to get two pancakes to eat with my breakfast,  but that is not offered here. I did, however, find out from our server that you can substitute toast for a pancake. Note that this information is not on the menu. A compromise I suppose,  but I like my eggs runny, and everyone knows that requires toast. The only other option is to order 4 or 5 pancakes.   But the biggest issue is that many employees touch the areas of dishes and silverware that you put in your mouth. For instance I've seen an employee prepare silverware settings by touching the knives on the blade part,  with bare hands. I've seen many,  many instances of a server ring up an order on the wall mounted IPad and then bring your drink to the table by holding the glass at the top where your lips go.  I have also seen servers grab toast out of the toaster and put it on the plate with bare hands. This is all done without hand washing. I would like the staff to be more aware of where their hands have been before they touch my silverware or glass and more aware of where to touch the dishes.

M16-viH8uGpCmUpep9ZZxg.text: This is one of our favorite breakfast place. The only thing that I dont like is I always order medium rare steak but it ALWAYS comes in well done. French toast is great! Fresh orange juice is great!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steakhouse omelet and french toast.

YcXReJ4n1Yxu9c0OUiY_iw.text: Pot of bread.... nothing else has to be said.  Yes, good food, nice servers in cute pj's, order the pot of bread and it will make you smile. I don't even eat bread and I order it.

G0OyiJ8iWKvFIiVTuIJx-g.text: This place would fit in nicely inside a upscale casino hotel on the Las Vegas strip. Except then, the prices would be 40% higher! Worth the trip out here, even if you are a tourist or visitor. The restaurant is actuall just a couple of minutes off the i-15 at the Silverado Ranch blvd exit.   An omelet with steak was almost platter sized, biscuits & gravy was yummy as well. Service was friendly, and the place is very clean. I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice decor, clean restaurant and friendly service. Great place

IbZO3l8IlnDaTu972KxEBg.text: First impressions are important to me. I really want to give these guys more stars, but it didn't meet the hype that everyone have it. We were told 30 minute wait, we waited 45 then left. Might I add, I noticed 2 four tops 3 two tops open but not cleaned. The efficiency of the place can get better, I hope it does. I started my experience like most and washed my hands, the bathrooms were disgusting. Clean it up.

8PHEYY7DOuYivb3IgEHrAA.text: We found this restaurant on Yelp!  I'm glad we came for breakfast. Friendly and wonderful service...food was delicious!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LPeyWC2dGKiVA6A2CXLsjw.text: Our second time here today and like the first time, it was splendid.  The server we got today Jennifer was very nice but lacked the service we got last time. Thankfully for Seth he saved the day. He is awesome and from our hour visit, he sat us down, checked on us, got our second drink order and evem saw him cleaning the outside windows. We will definately be coming back.

j0qw_0l4SmgjGU0hbocBXg.text: Mother's Day wait was apx 1 hr but we stayed because of the great ratings.. Waitress forgot to put in our order so we ended up waiting 1.5 for our pancakes. Manager made the entire order fresh and turned an unpleasant experience to a great one.  It was their treat for the inconvenience. Loved the pancakes and crunchy French toast. Fresh coffee & great eggs & hash browns.. Loved the food

lXEqXyCp7WFGvEdUZPyFXQ.text: Very disappointing!  The table next ours was left with food and paper all over the floor for the entire time we were there to look at, until I mention it! The ribeye steak was over cooked and tortilla chips on the breakfast menu with eggs was overwhelming so many chips and where very hard and hard to eat! Would not go back!

XMEdhMgRJr5dIyCBKNaH5w.text: If you are not a local and you rely on taxi to get around, then you might be better off renting a vehicle for the day. If you stay at the Mirage hotel, parking is free. Otherwise, you will come off the pockets for taxi because it is off the beaten path from the strip.   We waited for a good 39 min (which is a good sign) and glad we did because the red velvet pancakes were delicious!!!!! Comes with 4 pancakes so it is a shareable plate. The breading on the chicken (chix & waffle) was sweet.   If you don't have a microwave in your hotel room, the pancakes still taste amazing without heating it up.

TRn3lR1fnMZY9wNxHZEU3g.text: On December 8 we came in at 2 o'clock.   Expectations were extremely high as I have heard of this place for years and their pot of bread is infamous in this area of town.  We felt neglected by our server as we had to ask Passer- by servers for silverware and refills.   My wife ordered the biscuits and gravy with Hash Browns lightly cooked and they came burnt. I like crunchy and dark, but they were burnt.  She also asked for hot cocoa to be X X X HOT, came out hot,  Maybe it's a legal issue, wish they would've microwave that.   My waffle had excellent flavor just a little mushy, but the biggest disappointment of the whole meal was The pot of bread had been sitting on the shelf for a while, and we watched the server take it from the shelf to the kitchen and microwave it. You know how bread gets chewy after the microwave; that's what it tasted like!   I would've rather had it at room temperature.  Very Disappointing.   The server did without hesitation refund the money for the biscuits and gravy and the bread. I truly want to believe this was a server issue and not a restaurant issue, the problem was our Extremely high expectations.

4rFi-Aa1LRX9xwYR27KLKg.text: Okay let me start off with my first visit at Rise and Shine was amazing. But I'm guessing it was because this was around the time they first opened up and they gotta shoot for the moon on great breakfast ya know.  But my last recent visit here, my pancakes were undercooked. Like I'm talking I cut it open and batter would seep out with my blueberries. Eggs were great, cooked perfectly. Was just disappointed to receive my favorite breakfast item and it being undercooked.   Customer service has been, and still is very warm and friendly.

IlUwQqMx1z8T02j51dbNKQ.text: Came in here do to the great reviews.  Service was great and the food was delicious.  The steak had lots of flavor the eggs are perfect.  The hash brown was good but a little oily but overall I was very satisfied.  I would definitely come back again.

LTjfwZ58OYdpry1XhdH0tA.text: Always love visiting here!  Fast amazing service courtesy of "Gelato" our server today!  The Ribeye here is unparalleled to any breakfast place in town!  And the hashbrowns....ridiculously good!  The pancakes are the best in town as well!

OreHJyGZI1USjE5CU1EJbQ.text: I had a wonderful experience yesterday morning. I was taken care of right away and treated very nicely. The hosts Jaylin was very sweet and had an awesome outgoing personality! Love this place and the vibe! 10/10 recommend!!!

ckwMMfZmHT7BhSiapdlwAA.text: Very good breakfast place.  Enjoyed the food, especially their house mimi cinnamon bread in a cup

Rfjlb27O5Zm8cUbH2MkSFw.text: On your way out of Las Vegas and want a local amazing breakfast spot to frequent??   Look no further than Rise and Shine, I prefer the highland area local but they are both amazing. The breakfast is good and clean with a ton of options.   Friendly and knowledgeable staff always greet you with a morning warm smile and the owner is always running around checking on things or expo'ing the line (restaurant terminology).  My morning fav is the two fisted avo-veggie sandwich, it's so yummy.  Enjoy and leave a review bc the owner definitely checks in with yelp!!!

K37iGTaKZanSx2K4DXK1LQ.text: This would've been 5 Star, but 2 small issues. Food while delicious was slow to arrive & my easy over egg wasn't too easy. More like medium hard, but our lovely server "Gelato", has a replaced promptly. The "child's" steal I had was huge & delicious hardly a "child or over 55" size. Delicious coffee & fresh OJ.  If we lived here it could quickly become our "go to" for breakfast. Thank you for a quite satisfying last meal before the long drive home!

cK-AkV1M_XeRv97cFkBfZw.text: WOW! The staff wears pajamas - our waiter Gabe was outstanding!  He explained the menu options very well.  The coffee was outstanding.  Gabe recommended the bread in a cup - it was SO yummy, served with a cream cheese concoction - don't pass it up!  Everything our party of 4 ordered was superb.  We'll be making another stop there before we leave Vegas.  Reasonable prices too.

Gy1ytgbYs1ozanoyelqyFw.text: The food was amazing,..HOWEVER, 50 MINUTE WAIT 4 MY FOOD!?! Server named Desire D  was trrrible. She blamed it on the kitchen and a big party, but the food never stopped coming out, and other 4 other tables sat after us and left before our food came. SO FRUSTRATING!

-c0VoG7M9lN-TDHk8NRUwA.text: If a breakfast spot calls themselves "A steak and eggs place," they'd better have some bomb ass steak and eggs. These guys do.  Cool, colorful atmosphere with employee's in their cute pajamas. I probably wouldn't mind working here just because of that.  I always get the ultimate ribeye plate with a pot of bread. Can't go wrong there at all. Their caramel iced coffee is good too.  Service is always good, but you'll definitely have a wait on weekends. I like to do Monday meetings here to avoid the big crowds.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. yess to the ribeye!

RzMfUPcnj5epD4e2ZMLV-w.text: Really looked forward to eating here again since I had a pleasant experience the first time. Was sadly disappointed. The staff was friendly and attempted to come back and check on us a couple of times but kept on forgetting what she was supposed to bring us. Our server forgot to put my order in so I received my food approximately 25 minutes after everyone had their food (which they were practically finished eating by then). Coffee / drinks were never refilled, never received our cup of bread (even though we reminded our server several times), and to top it all off the rice in my loco moco was raw! I understand that they were busy, however, they always are and that doesn't excuse raw food and incomplete orders. The manager gave us coupons for a sister restaurant as compensation but what good are those coupons if you live in a different State.

cm8bcMxUCan0igz7iBn--Q.text: I am visiting Las Vegas from California and I decided to eat breakfast at a restaurant that was not in a casino. I Yelped and found this restaurant that had 4 stars with over a thousand reviews. I decided to check it. I didn't expect for the staff to be dressed in pajamas. That made me giggle a bit, but great concept. The umbrellas on the ceiling were funny as well.  The extra protein omelette was excellent. The staff was great and the restaurant was very clean. I would come back and recommend this place to anyone.

J_hK8gluBLCdSN75xlaGSA.text: Great experience. Food is always awesome and service is 5 star!! Amber the manager is constantly to and from the kitchen making sure everyone's food is delivered hot and on time. Lucelle was great today! We'll be back....again!

rBxSaNCN-8MuW9yEm-h3YA.text: Great food with big portions, be sure to come hungry.   Lucy was our server and she was sweet and checked on us regularly,  making sure we always had fresh coffee.  Manager also checked on us and was attentive and very welcoming.  I waited  four visits before my review to make sure things were consistent.  This place is a great breakfast stop!

YlvXhiYLr4wrOL8VJZHhIQ.text: Excellent breakfast spot. Outstanding service and great food. Amber and Luci took great care of us and were very attentive. Our orders were delivered quickly. The restaurant is always clean and well managed.

Ou7scUVJMLr-qOM2Yt-QBA.text: Worst fucking service ever. Highly recommend never going here. Mess up ur order say they are gonna take care of it next time and just straight up lie to u and dont. Worker are incompetent cant even take a carryout order.would tell whole story but way 2 long anyways FUCK THIS PLACE

DaEG3LyoTr9WyxCjDFyu1w.text: Great waitress (funny, attentive, quick)  Fun atmosphere (music, temperature, vibes)  Great coffee (no nasty creamers at the table)  Amazing food (perfect steak of course, vegetarian and gluten free options, large portions)  Not too pricey.  $40 for two + tip.

Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sitting at the bar helped pass the line and it&#39;s a blast watching the guys in the kitchen.

TcnomhF81MqOHC2O2LxZzA.text: Delicious juices, smoothies and food. It can get very crowded in there and the wait times and sometimes not so quick service can be a pain but it's worth it. There are no other breakfast places close by for southern highlands residents so this works. Glad we have a great breakfast option. I wish they had mimosas or bloody Mary's but food at rise and shine and then drinks at zest next door always works! :)

IbgJqAR7Y3UAJoXX175rhA.text: I come here probably once a week (ok, sometimes twice, lol). Rise & Shine has the absolute best steak and eggs in Las Vegas! Highly recommend trying it. If you come on a Sunday, come early to beat the crowds

7pfUAysyOPJjbIIPfew_Tw.text: The family and I went here on a Friday morning as I was looking for Steak and Eggs. We had six adults and two kids. When we arrived we were greated and seated within five minutes. Three of us ordered the Steak and Eggs, two of the other adults ordered Eggs Benedict and the kids got kids meal breakfast (two eggs bacon/sausage and hash browns and bread in a cup). The steak and eggs were on point along with everything else, even the coffee. The steaks were cooked perfectly and the bread in a cup was just enough sweet to complete the meal. The Eggs Benedict were also fantastic and Cooked perfectly as well. The kids breakfast, according to my kids was "Awesome". The relative price point for this place was definitely a present surprise. For six adults and two kids (13 & 8) for under $140.00 was a great deal for the quality and quantity of the food. The staff was attentive and on point and we did not have to ask for coffee and water refills the entire time we were there. This place is a not so hidden gem in the souther part of of Vegas. If your looking for that off the beaten path local hotspot then this is it.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye Steak and eggs....

VLy9g6Q8vtkXBZCWY8CW8w.text: TLDR: Great food. That's about it.  So here's the thing. I go here at least twice a month. I have for YEARS. Before, this place was 5 star hands down. If you're ordering carry-out, you'll love it. If you're dining in, it's a mess.  The area for waiting is about the size of a bathroom stall. It's crowded with people waiting to be seated, people trying to put their name in, and people waiting to pay. It's always one person handling seating, taking names, and ringing out checks. The layout is stupid to say the least and sets the employee hosting up for failure.  It'll take a bit to get a table. When you get it, it's a 50 / 50 shot it'll be wiped. They clear it and seat you and whoever escorts you to your table says "Oh I'm so sorry" and wipes it down half assed and in a hurry. Not because they're lazy. Because they have a million other thing they have to do.  Then you order. Food looks amazing. Coffee is always lukewarm at best. In the last few months, they've started forgetting to bring your bread choice. If you get it, it'll be cold also.  You'll wait about an hour for your food. In this time, if you don't flag someone down, you won't get a refill. I have never been told "I'll check on your food" or "it'll be right out." They ignore you to avoid the awkwardness until they drop your food.  When you get your food, its about a 33% chance it'll be messed up in some way. They'll fix it quick, which is probably why you have to wait so long. They're always correcting mistakes. I go here with a part of 3-4 every time. Every. Single. Time. There is something missing or incorrect with someone's order. For the last year at least.  Then you eat. And holy shit balls, the food is good. It's the only reason I go back. Every time we decide to go, we literally verbally acknowledge to each other we're sacrificing a good experience for good food.  I started going about 5 years ago and it was amazing. For going on two years, this place has gotten worse and worse. There is one older blonde waitress who is a fucking pro. If you sit in her section, your drinks are refilled, your coffee is hot, and she checks in on you during your wait. If she's busy or off, best of luck and may the odds be ever in your favor.

C_QzyZ06JAEQKo9yGl-IQw.text: This place has the best steak omelette in Las Vegas so far. I've been to plenty of brunch restaurants. Rise and shine is gonna be my favorite so far. I would definitely recommend this place peeps.

KtlTTJUVEyxU3VpBjIYWPw.text: We found Rise & Shine - A Steak & Eggs Place on Yelp and noticed many good reviews on it.  I am always looking for a good breakfast spot that serves a good steak.  I ordered the Rib Eye Steak & Eggs, along with Hashbrowns and the Cup o' Bread.  Everything was very good.  The steak was decent sized for the price, and had a nice char to it.  I ordered it medium and it was cooked medium.  If I had it to do over, I would probably order it medium rare instead though.  The Cup o' Bread came with a cream cheese icing for dipping.  This was very good as well.   My wife had an Avocado Veggie Bagel with two eggs over medium on it. She said it was unique and very filling.  The Hashbrowns were good, nice and crispy.  Service was good, staff was friendly.  We will go again the next time we are in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avocado Veggie Bagel for my wife.
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib Eye Steak and Eggs with Hashbrowns!

YtaWP9j9nXG1JbymKCllpw.text: Food is Delicious!!! We always order the rib-eye steak breakfast and it never disappoints.

bUAEoxVLCFsk8xdQFpVR7w.text: I never give 5 stars but this place is close to getting a 5 start rating soon. I have been here twice and both times the food was FANTASTIC!!  Busy!! Be prepared to stand in line. Food is worth it!   Food: everything that I have ordered has been perfact!! Hot, fresh, better then expected. Cinnamon French toast highly recommend. Freash cornbeef in the cornbeef hash, eggs made as asked, sour dough bread toast was good, jellies was average, butter was great, diet soda a smidge flat, grilled steak & chorizo burrito was fantastic!!   Service: is ok, servers are super friendly,  but difficult to get your water topped off or keep your beverage cup full, They were pajamas *smile*,  fast service (not including drinks service), they give great recommendations. They are always busy helping people people or cleaning something.  Parking: lots Dinning area: inside-large, ok clean, they wipe each utensil after it's washed and dried, they clean all condiment at the end of day, a little loud, lots of talking, if you are trying do romantic, maybe sit outside (but can be windy at times). Cute flower umbrellas hanging from ceiling (some are twirling) Outside: lots of umbrella tables, big open spaces, very clean. Outside is nice.  Highly recommended for food!! If you are a princess the service here is not for you *smile* but the food is worth the wait.
