sLvdvm8Kez8FRk1TArf9og.text: Yum!  Great food and awesome coffee!! Cary was fun and sweet- tried and LOVED the French press!  A great find during a Las Vegas getaway.

b_aXsugmGHBuVfknQG9lKQ.text: Always good eats at this cozy food place. The servers are dressed in PJs so cool! Food is GREAT!! My Las Vegas family always enjoy our visit here for brunch. A must see during my visits from Los Angeles. Yummy

QcX0sM9nrhZaq06DboQcuA.text: Two days ago my boyfriend and I went in to have breakfast and we had an AMAZING experience! Him and I are both in the food and beverage industry and unfortunately receive terrible service often. We were beyond happy with the service we received and the quality of the food. I had a chicken sandwich and my bf got and omelette. Both meals were spectacular. Desire was our server. She was very attentive and helpful. Thank you Desire!

uYqdXC_ylNX_62CtYOXsXQ.text: This place used to be packed when it was the only choice in southern highland and food seemed better few years back. But my most recently visit don't find anything special about this place anymore....there are more options available in the neighborhood with more reasonable price and same or better service

0-4BIepVE0iX5AimCGi2SA.text: What a great, local spot for breakfast! I enjoyed the quirky vibe ex. pajama uniforms for the servers and upside down flower umbrellas for lighting fixtures. The staff was very friendly and gave great recommendations. The menu is pretty extensive so there is definitely something here for everyone and the portion sizes were generous.   I ordered a DIY omelet which was well executed but did not come with cheese automatically (my bad for not adding that to the order). Even though I didn't have the cheese, the eggs and veggies were cooked well so it didn't really matter so much. The side biscuit was really good! I definitely recommend ordering that over toast.   All in all, a great breakfast option in the Southern Highlands area. I will definitely be back!

3mSNDIrS25a2RzyCzpAVfA.text: I am a big fan of breakfast, so of course I was going to check this place out! At first glance, the inside decor is very adorable. Although there were multiple tables open on a Saturday afternoon, the hostess took awhile seating parties. The food was very delicious. I ordered the sausage gravy & buttermilk biscuits with a side of banger sausages. The sausages were SO GOOD! Tried a little bit of the bread in the cup, very cute concept. On this particular day, they were having oven issues in the back, so our food took over 30 minutes to come out. However, the staff was friendly enough to serve us attentively and make sure we were satisfied with our meal.

4s9cCANJl9AZFflALMIeZg.text: We were looking for a place to stop on our way out of Vegas that wasn't on the strip and I'm super happy we found this place! The bread in a cup is a must try. I had the biscuits and gravy & was very pleased. All the waiters wear pajamas which is super cute, Gabe was an AWESOME waiter!! The only reason for a missing star was that the food took quite a while to come out, but was still super hot so I know it was fresh. Looks like this place is a locals favorite because Sunday morning had a big crowd.

Rmy1UHf3S98cJMdtqkcitA.text: My wife and I came to Rise and Shine on Monday May 20, 2019. We were greeted right away at the front door and were sat right away.  Our server Lucelia, came up to us with in minutes of us sitting and took our drink order. The drinks came and she took our food order. She is a great server , very polite, checked on us several times.  I would recommend Rise and Shine to anyone who wants a quick home cooked meal. I give this place a 5 thumbs up because of the cleaniness of the place, the service and the food was tasty. Nice place all the way around.  Good job guys!!!

iVqhVDiAFjib_UWAwyGjsg.text: My husband, son, and I were in search of a different breakfast place and stumbled on Rise & Shine by accident. Let me tell you, it was a very happy accident! The food is absolutely delicious and unique. I had the Ham-and-Eggs Benedict. The hollandaise sauce was so good, the eggs were poached to perfection and the shaved ham and English muffins underneath were great. We also split an order of the buttermilk pancakes. So good! The portions are huge! We are taking most of the pancakes home.  Our server, Rae'ven was super friendly and helpful. We will definitely be back!

Ha7PlkEhU69UCnycxa8vGQ.text: Perfect place for a delicious breakfast. Had the steak omelette. Good sized portion. Absolutely loved the cup of bread!!! If I'm ever in Vegas again, I'll be sure to comeback.

iFQFuiNB5NmEljIMC_4jlQ.text: Not a big fan. The gravy for the loco moco was disgusting. My wife ordered ham eggs Benedict, because our server recommended it, and the balsamic vinegar made it a no bueno totally in edible. My father in laws smoked salmon Benedict was gross too, the fish was over smoked and mix that with capers, and raw not cooked spinach and raw onion, woof! My mother in laws omelet was over cooked and was barely edible. We won't go back as it's an $85 mistake we won't ever make again!

YzcYE2cGisHcj4sGi_kceQ.text: A great way to start the morning! I am glad I found this spot! Such tasty food as well as wonderful customer service!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wfPE8LHrTrL4RZ8nx53MEA.text: The reviews here seem to cover the bases pretty well, so I will only add the key points.   Foremost. this restaurant should seriously consider adding a newspaper machine outside or sell newspapers inside.  It seems like that is a must for any breakfast place.  Also, the prices are a little more expensive than I would expect, especially for a local neighborhood joint.  Overall its a good breakfast.

-RZ04GAfGfN6yhcfI8cJFw.text: waitresses in pj's, attentive management, and damn fine food.  the only thing disappointing about rise and shine is that it's not closer to where i live.  the perfect solution to a hangover morning or a lazy sunday.

lCsvuyi4X0HSu3yoTxvERw.text: We LOVE this place!  The pancakes are to die for!  The omelet and hash browns are also delicious.  We also tried the oatmeal and that was served beautifully and tasted great.  The service is great, the coffee is yummy, and all breakfast items seem to be delicious.  We are so excited to have this place in our neighborhood.  We hope to check out the lunch menu soon, too.  My husband's only complaint is that there are no newspapers to read and not a newspaper stand nearby.    Definitely go early on the weekends, or bring a newspaper and read it while you wait for a table.

3jjH6kT96wl5VoTXEgH-UA.text: Place is a great find off the strip! Amazing food and friendly people.

ZjOKW67l1Ks0yooKMhnwMw.text: Steak and eggs go together like Carne Asada and Fries. And similarly, I could eat them during anytime of the day too. I'm sure that most would agree that there are few things more satisfying than a good steak, throw some eggs into the mix and you have a match made in heaven. For anyone that appreciates a good steak and eggs, this place will blow your mind.

XxiGj9cRCleuYScoewNVhw.text: Best steak and eggs breakfast EVER! Quality food prices too low! Great value! Personal, yet professional service. Loved all of it.

Lu28v7ZLqcse17g_KsTDmg.text: Great food, great service (though, if you go on a Sunday, go after 11:30 am or expect a looooooong wait), and highly creative presentations.  The oatmeal doesn't just come in a bowl -- it comes in a ceramic pot and the plate beneath it is dusted with powdered sugar.  The Monday lunch special meatloaf comes out as a cylinder in shape and stands about 4 inches high!  I like these nuances and the kitchen's attention to detail. The orange juice is actually fresh squeezed and not watered down - such a treat.  Would love to see organic choices on the menu, but that's True for me just about everywhere.

uIHPusP1Jv24RvXe1RimbQ.text: Everyone writes reviews of places they love. I've written plenty about how much I love Rise And Shine here in Las Vegas. Well, you learn WAY MORE when things DON'T go perfectly: This Sunday, my wife and I were seated at "that" table. Y'know, the mystical spot where ONE waiter thinks it's the other waiter's, and the other one thinks it's the OTHER waiter's. Consequently, we waited 10 minutes with no greeting at all, and watched later arrivals on both sides get attention while we were ignored. Right around the time we were thinking "Let's get outta here", the hostess (Shannon) came over, and with True concern told us that she had noticed we had been waiting, and wanted to help. She took our order herself, gave us a 2-for-1 coupon, and brought us our food herself... then she checked back TWICE during our meal to make sure everything was OK, checked us out promptly while mentioning that she recognized my wife and I as "regulars", and was extremely pleasant and made friendly conversation, introduced herself and asked our names, and again took great care to apologize for the delay. All I was thinking was "WOW". Look, I GOTTA testify, their food is good enough to treat people like dirt and still succeed - the fact that they care so much makes it a NO-BRAINER. I've  trained Customer Service for a living for over 26 years, I know what I'm looking at -  Thank you, Shannon, thank you, Rise And Shine!

f9f4owWR8-bjVxUAKOEh0Q.text: The best eggs benedict I've ever tasted and the flower pot bread was to die for.  Super cute waitresses in their PJs and excellent serving sizes.  Would definitely go again when we're in Vegas.

CtDLme-MNy71HV1HJFuxSg.text: Every time we go its around 1-2pm, and although we love the food the service is below par.  We always have to ask for refills and then wait an undertermined amount of time before we get them, and remind our waitress of any condiments that we have requested.

qbJy7BEs8hsZReCoYcKSyg.text: My husband and I came to this place with some friends because of the great Yelp reviews, but we were very disappointed. We came for brunch and asked to be seated at the barstools (since we wanted to get in and out fairly quickly) and one of the hostesses Kelly denied us and said it would be a 30 min wait. We proceeded to wait 45 minutes to an hour and nobody was ever seated in the barstools. There was an empty table for 15 minutes and we still had to wait to be seated (we needed up sitting there. Why we couldn't be seated earlier? I have no idea). All of the hostesses were rude and looked like they hated their job. The only saving grace was our extremely sweet waitress and the food, minus my husband's French fries which tasted very old. On our way out there was a couple who asked how long the wait was and the hostess responded 30-35 minutes, even though there were 5 empty tables. I would not suggest this place unless you have some time to spare. Also beware of the rude staff.

9aCZSHPwFAqqfjsTnwu40A.text: 3 stars with the potential of 5 stars.  Rise and shine lacks service but makes up for it with there food.   I personally think they were overwhelmed with the amount of business they are receiving.  But there breakfast was awesome.  One the best steaks I've ever had!  And this is a breakfast joint...good stuff!  I'll be back to re-evaluate.

7hwM5wE3b4pVHd-Y-L3-Mg.text: I've been here twice and have had breakfast (biscuits and gravy) and lunch (French onion soup and California salad-I think).  Service was good the first time (lunch) and great the second time.

St2i7cbGfh2HwhxYDleb8w.text: OUTSTANDING FOOD AND SERVICE!! Great friendly neighborhood restaurant! Everything is yummy!! The ambiance is geat with jammies and hanging umbrellas. Potatoes are amazing with a hint of rosemary. The french toast- and I would recommend the addicting crunchy selection is always served with whipped butter and a bottle of warm syrup! The pot of bread with a touch of cinnamon is is offered with a spot of jam and whipped butter. A wonderful selection on their menu. They always wish to have your feedback for any improvement and the owner comes around to talk and ensure it is a pleasurable experience. Very personable. This is my first review and I eat out for almost every meal. Worth the time.. Hope you enjoy!!

bSjWeOiyzgnaNH65I06OvQ.text: food is always great and good service. perfect place to start your day...try the french press coffee!

4dgFE51synkuJJCmjQjw8w.text: i just wanted to say thanks to jessica the hostess. i couldnt decide what to order so she suggested the pot o bread. very tasty. i then chose egg whites only omelet with cheese, bacon. my waitress carrie made me feel at home she has a lot of energy which made us all smile and made it a fun visit. jessica and carrie your the best !!!!

POID_EJrzJctOp3RODRY8g.text: Took my Mom here for breakfast about a week ago. We shared French Toast and I added eggs and bacon. The French toast was absolutely delicious, the eggs cooked perfectly (over medium) and bacon was tasty - but limp and not crispy at all. Our food came super fast, along with the food came our check and a partial refill of my coffee that was still 2/3 full. The server never came back after that, and we sat there for at least 20 more minutes. I would've liked at least one refill of my coffee, and I kept thinking she'd come back - but never did. I hate it when they bring your check with your food, how do they know you wouldn't like something else? The guy at the counter we paid the bill to was really friendly, I expected him to ask how everything was - but he didn't. Oh well. The food was good, so I'd like to give them 4 stars, but the service left a lot to be desired. It could have been a fluke, but I'm just not sure I was blown away enough to give them another chance. There are too many other great breakfast places around to choose from.

OEmpmiQiAUTdxRRgJAeb_Q.text: This Place is delicious! My GF and I both got the Chilaquiles Steak and Eggs and by far that is some of the best steak I have had out to eat in quite a while. Staff is friendly and attentive and Management is GREAT. Towards the end of our meal Steve Bell came and introduced himself and asked us how our meal was. This restaurant has some of the best food and customer service in town, you will not be disappointed!! We will for sure be back!!!

BDFDJF0cJtibRHy7Nt8A4A.text: When someone doesn't care how far they have to drive to eat your food, you know you have a FAN! This place Rocks! From the moment you step in the door, it looks cool, it smells awesome, the staff is wonderful and the food.. OMG. Rise & Shine Chilaquiles and the Steak and Eggs Benedict are about as IT as IT's gonna get! As far as a breakfast/lunch spot goes, they just nailed it! I can't possibly imagine how it can get any better! (Unless of course, they build one in Summerlin.)

ucWoo6DI-AY10djLcZlHiw.text: So first and foremost, I'd like to say thank god for this breakfast place in Southern Highlands. It makes my heart smile, I love breakfast and hate the drive all the way to "The Cracked Egg" all the way on Rainbow. So about the food......my new favorite is the stuffed blueberry french toast.....it was deliciously warm and very satisfying. You have to try that plate!! My boyfriend loved the steak and eggs, his words the steak was to die for!! I was very impressed with not only the food but the cute and quaint decor.......the hanging flowers from the ceiling was a nice touch and I have found my new found breakfast place and would recommend this one to everyone who is deciding or contemplating on coming in to try this place....not to mention the prices are perfectly priced for the food...great job!!

fgR4zFg560vElGjq6GG8QA.text: Cali our server was great. Very delightful. However, Amy set the tone for my wife and I in a very unprofessional way. My wife and I were bothered to the point to where we couldn't even enjoy ourselves. Also, the food wasn't very good for the bill. $41.23 for pancakes I could of made myself and dried steak and eggs. Here's a picture. We won't be returning. The sad thing is , we were genuinely excited to try them. Oh well.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dried. Dull in flavor.

mIJ0lRQOGrjSBr_JIQ5cgg.text: New fan. Visited twice.   First visit, Rise and Shine Chilaquiles, portion is enough for two to share. Taste wise, the tortillas kind of tasted like I was eating Doritos, so if you're into that..and we tried the Crunchy Cinnamon French Toast, LOVED. Also, their syrup with a cinnamon stick in the bottle is awesome as well.   Second visit, California Bagel Sandwich, delish! Again huge meal. I only ate half. OH and those hash browns, sooo good. And we also got the Crunchy Cinnamon French Toast again.   Fast service even with how busy they get during "prime" breakfast hours. I know it's kind of strange, but the freshly squeezed orange juice is my absolute favorite part of my meal here, ha!

dF_KgIkMv_L0nwPXcKARDw.text: Looking for an unstuffy, fairly priced, delicious brunch off the strip on our way back to L.A. and found this kooky gem.    Decor is weird.    Sunflower umbrellas hang upside down, mosaic tiles of birds and stuff, generic diner style upholstered booths.  Waitresses in pajamas.  Weird, weird, weird but there's a line out the door at 11:30 a.m. on a Sunday, so I'm in.    We put our name on the list and proceed to wait.    There's chaos everywhere.    A waitress shouts, "Son of a bitch" from the beverage station, and then looks up, realizing everyone is staring at her, and then it's back to business as usual.  One patron complains to the girl at the register and there seems to be a lot of high tension.    We opt for two seats at the counter and I can't help but think of Anthony Bourdain and Kitchen Confidential as I watch these swarthy, kitchen pirates, working as fast as they can with large, sizzling grills full of pancakes, a mountain of hash browns, seared steaks and a deep fryer.  The smells are intoxicating.    We start with "Pot of Bread."  This is a soft, warm, cinnamon roll baked in a demitasse cup.  Delicious!  On to the main event...it took 40 minutes to get our food and we drooled anxiously as we watched every plate come up.  I had the biscuits and gravy.  Eggs were cooked perfectly and served over an obscene pile of some of the best, chopped, hash browns I've ever eaten.  Gravy was salty and chunky and homemade.  Biscuits were soft and dense, just perfect.    Husband had the basic bacon and eggs and the generous portion of bacon was so fresh, tasty and perfectly cooked.    Then came the pancakes. Oh my goodnight nurse, this was pancake heaven!    We were just talking about some disappointing pancakes we ate at the Aria cafe the morning before.  I mean, they were fine. They were warm and sweet and sort of fluffy.  But what was missing was that extra depth of flavor and a crisp exterior.    These pancakes at Rise and Shine are almost like a donut, with a thin, crisp crunch on a perfectly golden cake.  The flavor has texture and depth from buttermilk and the syrup has a cinnamon stick in it, which just adds another nice layer of taste.  We could not get through half of our entrees but we for sure took it all home in boxes to enjoy the next day.    Next time you're heading out of Vegas, try this place. You will not be sorry!

En2IvEERckGoGjVUW2gbqA.text: I love this place! My boyfriend isn't as big of a breakfast food fan as I am, but when I told him this place is known for their steak and eggs, we knew we had to come.  There was a wait when we came on a Sunday morning. They said it would take approximately 45-50 minutes. It was 100+ degrees that day, so we killed some time at the smoothie shop next door.  When we sat down, I realized that the servers were all wearing pajamas. I love that concept!  In terms of the food we went crazy tried: 1. Crispy fried chicken breast and waffle Dark meat is generally better than white meat. However, this fried chicken breast was the best I have ever tried. The breast is absolutely moist, and the outside is super crispy. The waffle was amazing, too. It's perfectly crispy on the outside, and it's the perfect medium between sweet and savory. I love the cinnamon maple syrup, which also comes with the pot of bread, and is served heated. 2. Bacon wrapped tender steak My boyfriend got this with hash browns. It was good, but not the best. The bacon was overwhelmed the steak. I think next time he'll probably just order the ultimate steak and egg breakfast or the chicken fried NY steak. 3. Pot of bread For both of our entrees we ordered the pot of bread. It came with jam, butter, and a warm cinnamon maple syrup. It was basically a cinnamon roll, but I loved how they came freshly baked. 4. Side of corned beef hash The hash browns, while good, are 100 times better with the corned beef hash, which is one of the best corned beef hash breakfasts I have tried. It's salty, but not too much.  5. Side of country sausage gravy I typically order gravy with my chicken and waffles, so I had to try their country sausage gravy. It's good, but not necessary because the chicken and waffles is so amazing themselves.  It's my favorite breakfast place in Vegas, and probably better than most of the places I go to in the South Bay.

PX6ccLHS7psIcNF_VxK9MQ.text: I love this place! Everyone here is always so friendly and open to assisting me. I think it's great that they have happy workers who love their job! They get to wear their pajamas to work and they are literally never in a bad mood or crabby no matter how early it is.   The interior is SOOOO cute! They have twirling flower umbrellas on the ceiling that instantly put you in an amazing mood.  My favorite is their eggs Benedict with spinach instead of ham! You can also substitute shaved turkey as a option. Their food always comes out in time, and my water is literally refilled every 10 minutes. I can't complain. I will definitely try to come here as much as I can since I live about 35 minutes away from here :(

JqL4e-iTLWpcOUBBx6cI7Q.text: Very mediocre and overpriced. Super slow service. Waitress was totally overwhelmed and it wasn't even that busy.   It's a shame because this is the closest breakfast spot near me and I really wanted to love it.

sp4RoLkDFa-kv1NUYTW8-A.text: The food is super good and the place is very original. The servers wear pjs because that's part of the Rise and Shine ambiance.

psySXqMrrfoZfd6tDCoy0A.text: Every time we come to Vegas we are always looking for great breakfast spots off the strip. This place doesn't disappoint.  I ordered the Ultimate Steak and Eggs and it was delicious.  Ribeye was a generous portion cooked perfectly, hash browns where seasoned well.  I started off with the pot of bread and it was decent.  Decor is very nice and the waitresses wear pajamas.  The service was excellent as well.  The only drawbacks were that the water cups were dirty and the tables were not leveled so they were rocking back and forth quite a bid.  Overall I would definitely recommend and come back.

TmTQ2YlLftiUNwlLFvL7Lw.text: Great breakfast spot. The country fried steak taste like real steak. Big portions and good food, everyone who I bring here leaves happy

WH77X2humdN_MYis6Is3ww.text: This place was awesome. The atmosphere was cool, our server named Vanessa was really good and knew exactly what she was doing and was very attentive. The guy back in the kitchen was fast and made excellent meals. They had a wide variety on their menu and had good coffee. I ordered the avo-veg eggs Benedict and wow it was awesome. Great place! Highly recommend.

T19TdjIUC-VXtBmvb-ENcA.text: Fun breakfast place to hit when driving back to LA. Has all the standard breakfast fair, but most with a twist, like their chilleqetas with steak.  It's made with Doritos, wrong but oh so right. The portions are big and prices reflect it.  I like that they have healther options like yougert and fresh fruit and granola parfets and fresh pressed juices.  Theur hot latte and ice latte were not that great but I'm picky.  The service was great, fast and friendly. Probably because all the waitresses are on their pajamas and their comfy.  They also have fun twirling flower umbrellas on the ceiling for lighting.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fun twirling flower umbrellas used as lighting.
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilleqetas made with Dorritos, wrong but oh so right.

JaYAbiZtGbBv_sGcyWQp1w.text: Oh, how I love chicken and waffles! After seeing the pictures, I had to go! Like almost everyone else, this place is really far from us in the NW but it was well worth the drive. It is kinda small and we went for brunch but I'm guessing during breakfast, you may have to wait a bit.  Of course I got the chicken and waffles...and it's one of the best versions I've had in Vegas! Even though I usually prefer bone-in breasts, they give you two huge boneless breasts that were excellent! The chicken itself is fried perfectly, crispy on the outside and super moist inside. Killer seasoning on the chicken too, it's not overly salty and even had a slight bit of spicy kick in it. The Belgian waffle was delicious, super moist, fluffy and they bring out a bunch of butter and warm syrup with the plate. My wife had the biscuits and gravy which she's normally really picky with but she loved it.  We really liked this place but I think there prices are too high. The chicken and waffles is $13 which is a huge plate but the biscuits and gravy was kinda small portion-wise and was $10. They also charge $2.50 for HALF an avocado which is ridiculous. The waitresses dressed in pajamas was a nice touch and ours was really nice. Other than pricing, we loved the food and would come back in a hearbeat!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuits &amp; Gravy
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken &amp; Waffles

ZpLK-7Qh70P-RB-reBD65Q.text: This is a great breakfast or lunch place. Food is great along with the service. It is always very busy which is always a good sign. Just have to go before or after those busy times.

HA6RcUJM-lGBrVeVMk3FUw.text: I'm writing this review before I get my food as I can already tell it will be awesome. It was super busy but they still managed to seat us right away. Love that the servers wear pajamas. Yelp is the bomb!

t_biTXeCjJyeAEYfUB_r8w.text: Really great place! The staff is pretty cool, very genuine, fast and efficient. A new fav among so many great breakfast joints around here.

zMTpTw5UxzPqDKKBHTxyfQ.text: Pot of Bread.  Italian roast coffee Flower parasol chandeliers  This is a great breakfast spot  I have never had anything less than a fantastic meal with friendly, cordial staff. This is how every day should start

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot of bread.
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hash
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon raisin French toast, banger sausage and delicious coffee.

IdZ7MKfsXUaweoA043ifMg.text: While in Vegas, I was laying in bed from a night of drinking, searching Yelp for breakfast options and stumbled upon Rise & Shine. Immediately, from the combination of pictures and stellar reviews, I knew we HAD to have breakfast there before we left town. I ordered the chicken and waffles, the bf ordered the steak and eggs benedict, the nephew ordered the red velvet pancakes, and the FIL ordered some thing that I cannot remember for the life of me. They all knocked it out of the park!! The chicken and waffles is a must try!! I recommend everyone ordering something different and sharing because there are sooo many good things to try.   First of all, the portion are enormous. Which is wonderful because the food is so stinking good. Which is bad because if you have little to no self control like me, you cannot stop eating! Ahhh!!!  Tips: order the pot of bread. Cutest little cinnamon roll I have ever seen. Also, get there early. They are busy, so expect a wait. But let me tell you-- it is WELL worth it.

VMFihlCKHmcPHyEWFDCo-w.text: Yes, I'm a fan...As we walked in I noticed the worker wearing pajamas which I thought was different and cool at the same time...The menu was can be a bit overwhelming at first, but thanks to our server who was so kind to go the menu, which made it easier to narrow the selection down. A must to order cup-of-bread and be sure to eat while it still nice and warm.

jJtThpPcnB1ReymcXFu8wg.text: I wish I could give this place negative stars because I would!! We waited for over 15 minutes then left, but before that we where never asked if we wanted something to drink or even greeted by a server,  horrible customer service, what makes it even worse is they weren't even busy. I would never recommend this place to anyone.

ehSH6jfECtSjsH6LlhSETA.text: Came here on A Saturday for breakfast...  Outstanding food, fun atmosphere (servers are dressed in Pajamas) and pancakes to die for. Love this place...  Will certainly come again.  The upside down ceiling umbrellas are so creative---

STvevL5VoeB3wCOZgde2yQ.text: Immediately walking into Rise & Shine we were greeted by the smell of cinnamon...the interior is delightful, and the staff is amazing!  This is mine and my husband's second time here..we brought his brother to show off the abundance of food served and the delectible flavors!  Our server April was genuinely nice and friendly.  I ordered the short stack which I didn't finish because it was more like a full stack!  They were all very attentive, never had an empty glass.  By far the nicest staff and the most delicious food!  My husband and I plan to make this place a ritual in our weekly outings!

6U2v4JKjQp9H7qmPCS9rsA.text: I just moved to Southern Highlands and having this place down the road makes that move even better.  Everything is made fresh and the prices are fair, portions will defiantly fill you up too.  The decorations are cute also and the staff wears pajamas as there uniforms, that just adds to the overall experience of a late breakfast on a weekend haha.  I will be back again and again

Z5H306PO06iUE9LVnIQOwg.text: Fantastic food, servers in pajamas and cute decor. The service was great and the syrup pourer was drip less. Can't wait to go back

Lidz64lLdoj73lyuU-U18Q.text: Seriously, I just had to post another review, we went Sunday for breakfast and had another great experience. Let me declare - Bacon wrapped tenderloin rules!!!

aIdB16iNXNK3r1p55CS2aw.text: I have been here twice, the first time it was amazing, my husband ordered the New York steak, spinach & benedict bagel and I had the country fried steak and eggs. The pot of bread was delicious! Service was great and didn't disapoint.  The second time was a different story, it was a beautiful morning so my husband and I decided to eat outside. Bad choice, it took the waitress at least 15 minutes to come and get our drink order, which by that time we already knew what we wanted to eat so we were ready to place our order, however she wasn't ready to take it. ummm...ok.... She came back with our drinks and then took our order. They were out of the pot of bread which was really dissapointing as that was one of the reasons why I wanted to go back there, my husband ordered the spiced rubbed rib eye steak chilaquiles and I had the ham and eggs benedict. His order was ok, the steak was great however my eggs benedict was utterly dissapointing! One egg was poached perfectly and the other was basically a fried hard boiled egg! I have NEVER seen that before. The waitress was nice enough to take it back and bring me a brand new dish. By then it was a little too late. It wasn't just our table that had issues but other tables as well. We even witnessed one of the hostesses ask another customer who had been waiting for a table for 45 minutes if they would like to continue waiting or if they would like to leave. Why would a hostess even ask that? If they were still waiting wouldn't that mean they want to stay?  Most of the staff were wearing shirts asking customers to write a review on yelp, my husband and I were thinking that they should take those shirts off. They were not having a great day!  I may give them another try only for thier pot of bread.....

eBbe_88fdEGSU_y-_Cv6tQ.text: Consistently good food and friendly service.  Slightly pricey for your average breakfast, but we keep going back because it's good, and close by.

ZJCKqm5mLE6Hzf4Og6q6JA.text: Amazing breakfast. Make sure you go hungry though because the portions their are huge.

268sIOwoOaZPtI3CsSuJgw.text: I thought I had a great CFS yesterday and I did, but today I had an even better one at Rise & Shine.  The steak's breaking was very flakey and light.  Not too heavy.  The gravy was served on the side with the eggs sunny up on the steak and hash browns.  The steak looked nice and crispy without the gravy smothering it.  The hash was crispy and the portions are huge.  They also serve French pressed coffee, but I brought my own Starbucks.  I think next time, I'll try their French press coffee.  They also have a thing called bread in a pot as a substitute for toast.  It's literally some bread in a flower pot.  It's combo of various breads/rolls.  I opted for the plain biscuit which was very good, but small in comparison to what you get in a bread pot.  I didn't finish my meal, so the biscuit was just fine.  The only complaint I could have is the sunny up eggs had a bit too much raw whites, but that's okay. It's just more gravy for the hash browns when mixed with the yolk.  I would rank this CFS right up there with Maple Tree.

A28GxQwVyzSK0cHU9v1ksg.text: I was sooo impressed with this place. I hate that it closes so early but I will make sure I get to go there at least once while I am in town. Everyone got something different at the table and everything was great! Can't wait to go back and get a biscuit

5Hr4lTcSksQv5p9uynfxSg.text: Place is really cute and love the theme of wait staff wearing pj's but the meals were very over priced and the kids pancakes were a joke there were 3 tiny pancakes and the kids' meals don't include drinks.  Glad we tried it but won't go back.

zZqBKZX5_pylCCruOjriXg.text: This was the second time I have been to this place and again was not disappointed. The two fisted turkey bagel sandwich is one of the best I have had. Includes eggs, bacon, cheese and avocado. Pretty delicious. Top it off with a side of cheesy hash browns and French press coffee and you're good to go. Service was a bit slow but definitely a four star experience overall.

lYXwvWlLZQ2zABsy3u6CjQ.text: Food was good, atmosphere was cute, but WAY overpriced for just some breakfast. Small place so a little crowded. Overall, not worth the wait or price.

dFH2GcxxRVtALmDxMnlRHg.text: I have been wanting to try this place and was not disappointed.  The food was made to order perfectly, brought in a timely, friendly manner and was proportionately perfect for the price! I recommend this little place to everyone.  Great brunch menu! Awesome breakfast menu! I can't wait to try everything on the menu!  We came in at almost closing and were there up til close and we were treated with respect and kindness!  Love this place.  I wish the fancy shmancy restuaraunts were even close to the friendliness of this place! way to go! we need more here!

Sl13jatGSzcfrHZ6f8ssiQ.text: Only have had breakfast here. Food is very good with good choices. Service is pajama service and good. Cute umbrella decorated ceiling. Usually order ham steak and eggs with hash browns. The steak is huge, eggs always done to my order, hash browns could be crispier, but that takes longer. Not cheap, but good value for your buck.

31T56iVoKgCd6RgiUOzwhw.text: Good food, fun atmosphere. The servers wear pajamas. And people are constantly checking to make sure everything is OK. If it were cheaper, I'd be there all the time. But I don't suppose quality is cheap. You've got to try the 'pot of bread'. Just sayin'.

JwfIMCJhMWEhp1U7Iv1mpQ.text: Came from San Diego and didn't want to eat in a hotel. By chance we came across Rise and Shine and it was was FANTASTIC! Great simple breakfast served beautifully, and hot. The waiteress are all very helpfull, friendly, and very cute in there "jammies" (bunny slippers would also be great). Service, food, atmosphere all A++. I will refuse to settle for runny eggs and swill from the hotels and will come to Rise and Shine every time we go to Vegas.

Ty4aIXFfvMRPtdwHJ93XXQ.text: OOMG...sat at the counter and got to see the magic firsthand.  Chicken fried steak  never before seen by these mortal eyes.  Chicken and waffles fit for a giant with culinary tastes(the chicken must have been from a Nevada A-bomb site- it was HUGE).  Panko breaded fresh chicken strips for the little ones.  Hand cut fries.  Ecletic breakfast menu- "One of each please".  My first time was today and second time will be tomorrow.

DDgJ0nXLHULNpJUKQpMeXQ.text: One of my favorite breakfast spots in Vegas! Love the chilaquiles and the atmosphere!

2BYnetlJ93IjtRh4DHyHJw.text: Help us...Yelp us!! WILL DO!! And DONE! Always excellent service and  love that it's close to home. I even got my birthday coupon in the mail and I am SUPER excited to use it!!

Hx4qSIe2AZU3VrB-INCLbw.text: HUGE portions!!! I thought Omelet House portions were huge but this place puts their portions to shame. Food was good, nothing overly special about it for me. The value is there and that's what matters. Wish they opened at 6am instead of 7am, but oh well. We will definitely be coming back.

KHqtiqtmd8_V8qY5ICzU8A.text: I eat here often but this time made me write a review. I am a Chef, i am writing this because its probably the best breakfast I've had from here yet. I ordered the Country Fried Steak which is normal for me but to start the portion size is well worth the money you pay for it. Second it was seasoned so perfectly every time i took a bite it honestly left my taste buds jumping for more. Kudos to the Cook that made it for me i will be only ordering it when you are on shift now because i don't want it any other way. Thank you for an amazing meal and service from the FOH staff keep up the great work!

xUEu7MHvqfoQjUWR2NduBg.text: Very cute atmosphere, especially for a strip mall establishment. I was really impressed with the decor and attention to detail on all of the styling.  The flower umbrellas hanging from the ceiling and tile framed windows made the setting more whimsical than industrial. The waitresses all had on pajama style uniforms which was a nice added touch. (Though I also have to mention the owner was working the cash register but didn't make much of an effort to make an impression with customers).   The food was very good - we ordered the chiliquilas and steak along with the Belgium waffles. We also got the French press coffee which is served at the table with a timer for the perfect cup.   So why only 3 stars?  This place was good but a little expensive and they charge extra for everything! In fact, a whole column of the menu has the run down on these charges... But these items arent really "sides" -- unless you usually eat avocado by itself?  Also, $4 for bacon?  I got my breakfast with steak for only $3 more than the chiliquilas by themselves so I'm not sure about the math on this one. Bottom line, this place is a little out of the way, nestled in a neighborhood strip mall, and could do better on the pricing for what it is... So, I have to conclude by saying this place is probably best left to the locals.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French press coffee right at your table

FQO68zsLGiw6SHfxqdsisw.text: Visited this wonderful cafe for the first time today! Absolutely loved the atmosphere, the service was spot on and the food was delicious! It was busy so I know it is here to stay! Will be taking the family there soon!

j8A5N3l9n8j4WkAVYqTGHQ.text: French press! I'm in love. This eatery is not close to where I live, so to come here is not convenient and I need to have a very good reason. French press is good, but not something to drive across town for. I have been here twice and had a very good experience the first time, but a not so good one the second time. Service and food were on point the first time, which brought me to the second visit... that kind of just fell flat. I might return if I am on that side of town.

SQwtgs8tVhxxP6z1Ileevw.text: Come for the steak and eggs which are a glorious start to the morning. The french press coffee is a must. Amazing! The chilaquiles were pretty good too, but the eggs were pretty runny and Cristina ordered them over medium =(  I wanted to give this place 5 stars based on my meal, but I gotta say when you're waiting to be seated. It's kind of awkward. I mean usually someone will come up and be like "I'll be right with you, Sir." Here, you kind of just wait lol. When they get your name, there's usually tons of empty booths, but it takes a few minutes for them to get set up. I'm looking for things to complain about now, but it's really a non-issue!  Definitely a great place for some steak and eggs.

s4EwToqPQaqv07kqyY-7vQ.text: The service here is very spotty. We arrive and or our name in and notice 3 table available. One party gets sat and the other two are left open and we continue to wait. All the while the rest of the patrons start to clear out were kept waiting now with multiple tables open. We get sat in the back by the kitchen and service station. How annoying, why would you sit a patron in the back by the service station when there's other tables available? When I worked in the service industry I would apologize to patrons for them having to sit there. So now all the traffic of running food and imputing orders is right in my face. The waitress is barking orders at the cook and complaining about her station and another server.... Very unprofessional if you ask me. Also the table that was used as the bus station was the table we sat by. Pretty disappointing to experience this when I make it a point to drive all the way here when I'm in town. Not sure if I care to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2nd pic of the &#34;bus table&#34; half of the stuff still gone and it&#39;s still full of dishes.
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. First pic of &#34;bus table&#34;

W8fKQHONVgXzH-DeTz1ORA.text: So I've been. To the location on flamingo and I wasn't happy with the timing of the service and the food was subpar. I figured I would give rise and shine one last chance but noooo.  I got my order to go and purchased a orange juice that they charge $5 and it was half filled in a small cup. Second purchased the pancakes.  Extremely dry . Must say they were huge but barely any syrup to go along with it.. never again

VMn82RSlbDxp0WVLkp1Zkg.text: I wanted some breakfast but woke up late today, and I had bookmarked Rise and Shine in my Yelp. Bruh! This is an excellent breakfast spot. The portions, The pot of bread , the staff was very nice. served till 3:00pm...I don't always do breakfast but when I do I prefer Rise & Shine first time in here but it won't be my last.

6D5w63qX5d9ZTIOckwk0TQ.text: Okay first off I am not a huge fan of breakfast foods in general.  My best friend loves it. So when a few of my friends wanted to go here for breakfast one day I was not looking forward to it. When we walked into the place it was fairly busy not overly packed. The first thing I noticed as the decor which was bright and fun with these cute umbrella flower rotating art hanging from the ceiling. It did make me feel a bit happy to be there. The next thing i noticed is the wait staff were in PJs. All and all the environment was welcoming and a cute experience.  Next the menu was full of options and i was told by my champions that all the food was good. I stepped out on a limb and ordered some breakfast items. I had a waffle, bacon, hash browns, and the potted bread. It was a lot of food but boy was it tasty. I couldn't finish it all but i enjoyed trying. The syrup is real maple syrup that is brought to the table hot with cinnamon sticks in side. The next good thing is i  tasted some of my friends corn beef hash, regular pancakes, and red velvet pancakes.  (another reason why i probably couldn't finish my food.)  Boy everything was a delight. Party for the taste buds.  Now i live in the area and highly recommend the place. If you really like breakfast foods you may fall in love with the place. If you are like me and you would pass on breakfast foods you will not be disappointed eating here. Its worth the trip if you are out and about and are in the mood for breakfast or lunch. (They are not open for dinner).  Make a day of it.

EN5LuX4iD9mLeHBXFkrtZQ.text: I am not a breakfast kind of girl and was not happy about going to a breakfast place when my husband told me about Rise and Shine.  So glad I did go tho!  I get the steak breakfast and it's awesome!  My picky kids like their food too!  It's a WIN for us.  We always ask for Colleen because she is totally sweet and takes the best care of us.  Did I mention that we are picky?!?!   LOL!  Can't wait to take my in-laws there when they come into town!

-k7gXniihzEzg3xuWDrVfg.text: Got here around 9am on a Sunday and only had a 10 min wait. Lisa, our waitress was very nice and helpful. We had the Strawberry Belgium waffle and Create your own omelette. The portion sizes were large and the food was delicious. We will definitely be back here.

Yp4mlDFGivuE5vpvbbJ09A.text: Outstanding place to have breakfast.  The homemade corned beef hash & eggs was amazing.

kigEUOR5yLueL-3rOjdS9Q.text: My fiance and I came here and it was our first time in. The food was good but our server really sucked. Her name was Kristie. I thought she had a bit of an attitude when we order water for our beverages because she walked away without saying anything to us, like she was ignoring us & not acknowledging us. But no, that's just how she was. She dropped off my fiancees bagel, I said thank you and she ignored me. Same when she dropped our food off, the check- everything. She charged us an extra $1 on our check, which we usually wouldn't complain about but we didn't have a good experience with her. So we told the host who was ringing us up and I think the manager had her apologize but she only apologized for the extra dollar charged- not her shitty service. When we told the host how she treated us she gave us a friends and family discount- which we weren't looking for a discount but it was a nice gesture. Hopefully Kristie leaves the hospitality industry soon.

nxvD0h8HfKqnoSAVzgiRxA.text: We had steak chilaquiles, medallion bacon wrapped steak with eggs, 1+2+3 kids breakfast and a side of sour dough toast = $41.00.....wait time was about 10 min on a Sunday afternoon (no bad).  Pretty good breakfast place...clean and decent service.  Ample parking available -- will be back to try something else (prob lunch items and the crock of French onion soup)!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot O&#39; Bread

Mw--fkIF4owlmOazimB3Mg.text: A friend from our church (The Rock A Christian Church) recommended this place and he highly recommended the fried chicken and waffles. The first chance I got, my brother-in-law and I both order the chicken and waffles. Let me tell ya...It's REALLY (No! It's REALLY Good.) The spice in the batter and the tender chicken breast (boneless) on top of melting butter and old fashion maple syrup and powdered sugar...It's heaven with every bite.  The chicken breast covered the entire waffle, so every bite you take has a piece of chicken and a piece of waffle. It's uber good stuff! And the portions were massive. I should have cut the portion in half and saved it for later. Because when I finished the entire plate, I was feeling the food coma effect. To top it off, our server Christine from Chicago was amazing. She was fun loving and had a great sense of humor. By the way, don't let their dress code (PJ) fool ya, they are very professional and serious about what they serve. I will definitely return here for another fix of Chicken and waffles and maybe try something else too. If you are in the area, you gotta stop by and try it.

fiqHMl0nRkGlpswwwFYEnw.text: Found this place a few weeks ago. We've been here EVERY weekend since.  Everything we've had has been absolutely amazing. Chicken fried steak is out of this world. Pancakes are to die for! Word to wise... Each pancake is huge, south short stack will likely be more than enough. :) Don't even get me started on the hash browns! Without a doubt, the best I've had!  Well be back again next weekend! :)

5qjZYdcaMJUJnqtK0d-4nw.text: This is my new favorite breakfast place! I've been here several times, and the food is consistently amazing. The biscuits and sausage gravy is excellent; finally, a place that serves country gravy properly! The hash browns are slightly spicy and super savory. There is a side of "pot of bread", which is a miniature cinnamon roll-like piece of amazingness served in a tiny mug with whipped butter on the side. Their pancakes are perfectly fluffy, and the syrup their place on the table has cinnamon barks floating inside. The steak eggs benedict is a feast for at least two people, and well worth the wait; the hollandaise sauce is creamy and rich, and the steak is tender and juicy. The atmosphere is also lovely. Flowery umbrellas are hung upside down, spinning above you as you dine. All is the servers are in pajamas, aiding to the comfortable, easy-going ambiance. You *need* to eat here!

iIMvj9BuN2rHozLOsEzVrw.text: One of the best places I've been to in Nevada. Hands down. I love everything about it, the service is great, the food is amazing. Don't even get me started on the bread! I will definitely recommend this place to all my friends before they go to Vegas.

B-sXTztob06erdxm6EzWWA.text: From the flowers hanging from the ceiling, to the wait staff in pjs, to the cutest little pot of bread, everything here is perfect! Haven't had a bad thing on the menu yet! Once you walk in the smell alone will make you want to order everything on the menu! Great breakfast place!

d7XkPHJwpBQwudYybAy_oA.text: Great breakfast place. A wide selection of food and everything is cooked to order.  Highly recommended

fu4NwR7AKJOQQTwmCquPiw.text: Great breakfast spot steak n eggs are a must the manager is really nice and the service was great they catered to my entire family and this place is great I'll definitely be back soon !

Yk19XltWWTXi-9tqKCFpMQ.text: So the first thing you notice are the floral umbrellas on the ceilings. The servers uniforms are unique are wearing Pajamas. The staff is friendly.   The "must try pot of bread" was alright. It was a little hard. The presentation was cute. However, it is messy to eat because of the sprinkles of powder. I got a biscuits instead it was a little crispy and toasted too much.   The ultimate steak and eggs was good.  The side of bacon was too crispy.  Overall this place is alright.

y47mllxGAmptG8-RFvJ1fA.text: This place is excellent for Breakfast. I'm so glad we stopped by on our way back home to LA. I ordered the Eggs Benedict. My fiance ordered the Steak Chillaquiles. Everything tasted delicious! I will definitely go back when visiting Las Vegas in the future.

N0pa1GvqHtl6qkbW7q8s-Q.text: Loved this place, food is delicious and everyone so attentive. Will definitely stop by when I am in Las Vegas again. The steak is a must!!!!

Nothing too special about this place. Definitely a great breakfast spot to check out. They have a wide array of different coffee options. I will definitely return if I am in the mood for a breakfast spot.

7dlHYV3Z4sLb-TXWrZN9ow.text: The server was the best part of our meal. She was very friendly and helpful!  We ordered the chiliquilles and the eggs and corn beef hash.  The chiliquilles are basically a small doll up of vegetarian beans (which I had to dig for) and two eggs with a plate of cheese nachos for $10.95 and the hash was basically 3 eggs over a little bit of corn beef mixed into shoe string potatoes($12.95) and then I asked for jalapenos on the side. Which when we got to the front to pay the cashier said your check is wrong because  the jalapenos we're not on your check. And added $1.00.  So basically 2 breakfast with water to drink was $25.50. I think for what you got here that was steep. But no need to go back and find out.

yTj3nFtuTEGF_mvfVbqhrA.text: Just had a great breakfast at Rise & Shine and it was amazing! Not from the area and we found it on Yelp and it was a great choice. The service from our waitress Amber was so gracious and knew how to make us feel right at home. Ordered the Bread-o-cup and it was delicious, a must try. Had a plate of the Chicken Fried Steak, by the end of breakfast my plate was practically cleaned! I got to drizzle my pancakes with warm maple syrup... delicious again. Also go to try the Avo Chicken Omelet and another great plate! Lastly we also ate the Chilaquiles which was so tasty. Very crispy and flavor-able and topped with an avocado. Great food and great service! Definitely going to have come back again! Amber was an amazing waitress, can't wait to see her again.

8KicyE1UFEDEd5M_J-EX_g.text: Delicious! They have fresh squeezed juices. I got orange juice and my boyfriend got a healthy kale and spinach one. The breakfast rolls are a fresh baked cinnamon roll in a cup and my meal didn't come with one so the waitress grabbed me one complimentary! We also got a coupon to come back again.

_1vNh3Zp8kPA7gV8wfeiuQ.text: The chilaquiles are by far one of the best items on the menu. Everything is made fresh and has been consistent every time we stop by.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilaquiles are awesome
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waiters and waitresses where pajamas.

BP_TmofgKm5zgUIK7CQhtA.text: It had been over a year since our last foray to Southern Highlands to dine at Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place.  Unfortunately, we experienced the same issues that had kept us away for so long; the ineptitude of the hostess staff.  We added our name to the list when we arrived and were given a 30 minute wait time.  At the 45 minute mark, I asked about our table and was told that there were still 8 parties ahead of us and that they were seating the larger parties first.  uh, okay...  I asked if we could sit at the counter and was told that the counter was part of the wait list, but it was empty.  At the 1 hour mark, I inquired again and was told that there were 4 parties ahead of us.  I asked again about the counter (now with one patron sitting there) and was told that it was closed today.  Weird    Even though I was annoyed, I felt committed to stick it out after waiting so long.  We were finally seated after waiting an hour and 20 minutes, but only because two parties of 2 in front of us gave up and left.  Maybe they did not appreciate being told that larger parties were more important than they were.   On to happier subjects:  The food!    I ordered the Ultimate steak & egg breakfast: $12.95 for an 8oz Rib Eye, two eggs, and hash browns with the pot of bread.  The steak was cooked perfectly medium rare, the eggs and hash browns standard, and the pot of bread (basically a cinnamon roll) was good. solid 4/5    The BF had the Fried Chicken & Waffle: $11.95 for a boneless chicken breast coated in buttermilk and fried sitting on top of a Belgian waffle.   I didn't try this, but was told that it was just okay. 3/5    I also used the Chamucos Jalapeno Hot Sauce on my eggs and saw that it was made in Henderson.  The waitress noticed that I was reading the bottle and advised that they had bottles for sale for $6, so I scooped one of those up for home use!  I can't really say for sure if we'll ever go back, but I hope they work out their front of house issues.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chamucos Jalapeño Hot Sauce - local company, bottles for sale.
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ultimate steak and eggs

fX8RtBpFONVg_r5CerauXQ.text: Friendly staff, great service.  Nice choices on the menu.   Very good breakfast burrito and must try the cup o bread.  Relatively short drive from the strip if you have a car.  Worth the trip.  Servers wear pajamas.

d_0Dy1MshK618WTaBnkZYQ.text: What a fun place! Instead of toast or English muffin, you HAVE to have the "Bowl of Bread", a yummy cinnamon roll baked in an espresso cup served with cream cheese topping on the side. Then came my breakfast with perfectly cooked over-medium eggs. I don't get them perfectly cooked very often but this place is meticulous. My husband ordered the Asada Burrito which was perfect! The homemade refried beans are yummy as well. Writing this review...I want to go again but I'm 5 hours away. Next time I'm in Las Vegas...

S5aA74PPDADz9pdwhECgkA.text: The food at this place was delicious! The portions were huge and the price was reasonable. Our server, Ashley (look for the girl with the pancake printed pajamas) was super friendly and very attentive. It was our first time there and she answered all of our questions and made recommendations. She made conversation with everyone at the table and made sure we had what we needed. I recommend coming here. Friendly staff and delicious food. Plus they have a variety of freshly squeezed juices.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ny steak Benedict on an everything bagel! Amazing!

XBigZXImAiJju2SlLZ_WEw.text: I can't say anything bad about this place, a little pricey for breakfast. Was pretty average.

6cGTocIFBtZsuQw-J86X3Q.text: Food and service is good. I always get their chilaquiles, they're really good. Could be a long wait but worth it.

3jho-wwtVXVC46pBQuf3Sw.text: Well what can I say I went to rise and shine this morning for breakfast maybe five people in the entire restaurant ordered the chicken fried steak eggs scrambled after waiting 20 minutes my order came eggs Over easy and running yolks everywhere and that grosses me out. Told the girl take it back I don't have time to remake it went to the cashier to pay for my coffee that should be free since they screwed up my order and the kid charges me nine dollars I was like nine dollars for a cup of coffee when I should be free he says oh I thought you ate the bacon seriously dude. Avoid this dump of the restaurant

RbQdOLDXShy9CqoYfjjuVg.text: Ate here on 4th of July and the food was amazing! Staff was super friendly and the decor on the inside was simple and pretty. I think it's super cute that the uniforms are all pajamas. I definitely plan on coming back we here since it's so close to home! Our waiter was quick and on top of everything! Thanks for a great experience.

sugj2N4qHxNAnQNehx8Vtg.text: I absolutely love this breakfast place. They have the best food and I enjoy the nice vibe. I highly recommend if you're looking for a spot.

336H3tFnrxC7NWMtt5jVVQ.text: Been here twice, my girlfriends been there about 4 or 5 times now.  This place is awesome.  If you haven't eaten here, do yourself a favor and go get some breakfast right now.  Their biscuits and gravy is addicting.  That along with some fresh squeezed orange juice (with lots of pulp) is a winner in my book.  My girlfriend is more adventurous when it comes to food, so she's tried more meals than I have.  She's liked everything she's ordered as well.  She loves the french press coffee.  I'm not a coffee guy so I figured I'd take her word for it.  Also, the staff is very friendly.  It's in a good area, not too far away from where I live, and the prices are great.  The prices for the meals are only slightly higher than what you'd pay at an IHOP or a Denny's, but the food is soooo much better.  You just really can't beat this place.  The only suggestion I have for this place is that they offer Gluten Free bread products.    A+++ in my book.

VcjCcse_WP0QGCW329W4Sw.text: I heard about this place from a friend and decided to try it. I am glad I did because my fiance and I both agree-that Rise & Shine is outstanding! The staff is very friendly and the food is excellent! We ordered the chilequiles and cinnamon raisin French toast. It was incredible! The chilequiles were very flavorful and the chips were still a little crispy-which we loved! The french toast is huge and sweet, but not overwhelmingly sweet-the perfect amount of cinnamon, crunch, and soft on the inside. Yum!  Can't wait to go back next Sunday! And every Sunday for that matter!

CtXOYP7OrYMc0PKGRnqsQg.text: Great food & servers but I'm only giving 3 stars because EVERYTIME we come there is a long wait only because they don't have a bus boy & the hostess just stands around looking around

LpsXjwR5Qfdc-fGUsrXf2g.text: This place is rad... Their steak omelet is on point. Also try the jalapeno hot sauce on the rack it's so good.

saC5Y0_c-ZyiZVSQQkpnZg.text: This is place is soo good! Best breakfast place in town!  Their bread in a pot is to die for!

5Xp_Jb9iG9La_FYS6YMV-w.text: A little overpriced but the food is definitely good. I had the hams teak and eggs with hash browns. Nothing left on the plate but the gam bone.

ceYRt4H8ziolPF4lzV-Qgg.text: Absolutely one of the best breakfast places! Delicious food and fun atmosphere. Servers in pj's and "pot of bread" cinnamon rolls are a great touch. Try the "cinnamon toast crunch French toast"!

8NdvCoEaXBUcAJm4mi2x2Q.text: Piss poor management when you only have TWO servers on a national holiday...line out the door...and you tell us its only a 20 minute wait.  Crock o shit

ZZJR7P2Tp5cndO3mEuKA9Q.text: Outstanding omelet, hash browns, coffee and service.  One of the best breakfasts I have had.

GBc0PBSstLjjdppm_wXj_Q.text: I've been here at least 5 times since my first review. It's still my favorite breakfast spot in South Las Vegas. The coffee is really good and the steak and chilaquiles is still my favorite dish. I've since tried the corned beef hash among other dishes and was quite impressed.   I think the potted bread as a side should be a little cheaper. I also think the wait staff is better than before but still needs a sense of urgency when moving around the restaurant. There's one brunette woman who I like a lot but some of the other servers seem less than alert. I'd like to see a bigger team effort when it comes to the service. There's nothing more frustrating when you see other servers standing around and my coffee cup is empty.

N3Ck9KkWD654p8F4bO-O8g.text: Visiting friends in vegas from Sydney, and have been blown away by the service and food here.  Have been back multiple times and tried various omelettes and other sweet breakfast items and would highly recommend this place ^_^

302cy98A-9THpPvcgB5MoQ.text: The ribeye is great. We ate there this morning right when they opened and everything is fresh. The waitress was pleasant and I will definitely be coming back!

pYoX5QBg0UYRHdlCaNtpjg.text: ambiance//**** what cute decor! this upside down dangling & swirling umbrellas from the high ceilings transform the place! there's also outdoor seating available to enjoy the nevada heat  everyone works in jammies~~ as in the server uniforms are pajamas! except for the one kid that wore a "YELP US!" shirt ;p  service//***** arriving at the end of first seating for breakfast, we had the luxury of eating at our own pace! the line was LOOOOOONG by the time we left; early bird gets the worm!  our server was this lovely lady that kept checking on us and brought us some biscuits to compensate the for "pot of bread" not being available when we ordered then she brought us another round of "pot of bread" once it became available!  food//**** everyone seemed to enjoy their orders eggs benedict  steak & eggs eggs & pancake  and my CHICKEN & WAFFLES! =9 deliciousness! i normally don't like white meat but they fry it well! PLUS their maple syrup is legit, as in the maple stick is no joke be careful because the WHOLE GLASS bottle is hot syrup  and what about that pot of bread? it's a cinnamon bread served within a cup while the concept is cute, it's a bit dry for my taste ~*~ if you're in vegas and don't mind going off the beaten path for some normal breakfast at normal prices, this is your stop!

jwsj5bIFwbBCQtNIooe2bw.text: Went for the first time this weekend with some friends and loved it. I had the Loco Moco and it was terrific. The gravy tasted like a brown gravy/teriyaki sauce and it was delicious. Eggs were cooked perfectly, the ribeye beef patty was tasty on it's own and combined with the rest of the dish it was perfect. I ate everything on my plate. I also added a cup of bread, which was basically a cinnamon roll in a mug with a sweet and tangy cream cheese frosting served on the side. I left full and happy. I want to go back and try the S'mores Waffles. This place is kind of far from where we live, but I will make the drive to go back again.

Nd_hHE64fGCucGGUj-g_9w.text: I had the chicken and waffle and it did not disappoint! My only regret is not being able to finish it all. I also had the bread in a bowl and it was to die for. Like monkey bread but not as sweet and gooey and just as good.

5pQ4LtTuEptpoaLwqyo_IQ.text: Every time we're in Vegas we eat breakfast here on our way home. The service is heat, the food is amazing. The bread in a cup is unique and so good! Love this place!!

AT8O2W9523i5QMFAz6j68Q.text: I heard great things about this place and went a few weeks ago and was disappointed to say the least. I thought I ordered the wrong thing and tried it again today and it was worse then before. The service and environment is nice, however the food is subpar at best. Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else.  PS 3 hours after eating there I feel sick!

rCmcbvSVSE8IjkzhEIm0gA.text: This place was so delicious! I had the omelet and my boyfriend had the chicken and waffles! Both so good. We loved our server Amber! She was so sweet :)

HpYKmYJfXNYwrOxWPI2umQ.text: Best Breakfest Joint in Southern Nevada!   The Breakfest Checklist:  Corned Beef and Hash: Check! Homemade and you can  tell! There are nice big pieces of meat and potatoes and a great helping on your plate!  Baccon: Check! Crispy and never overdone!   Pancakes and Waffles: Check! Big and Fluffy served with warm maple surup!  Pot of Bread: Never in my life have I seen this! absolutely delish! It is a must get when you go here, and it usually comes with your meal!   The atmosphere in a nutshell: Breakfest in Bed! The waitresses wear pj's and are so friendly! The ceiling is decorated with sunflower umbrellas, tres chic!   There are day's when it's super busy, and there are days when you're the only table in the restaurant! But that would be the norm with all restaurants. I'm just saying don't get upset when it's jammed pack on a sunday... because it almost always is!

UhR8-h3SQ8mrWpboZECFMA.text: I used to love this place and the service. I come in here this morning the manager or owner is arguing with a couple. We finally get seated and the server is rude and they don't have what I want on the menu. I'll never come here again. Worst breakfast place ever I'd rather go to egg and I there service and food their is great. And they actually do have coffee cake unlike the pot of bread here.

pF6jIyhEEe1QGrI1XJYraA.text: I love this place! The servers Cary, Amber, Desiree, Raven and Gabe are fantastic and the food is amazing. The owner is wonderful as well, always look forward to a chance to eat here! I had the ham steak & eggs, and it was delicious!! The vibe is awesome with all the servers in pj's, and super helpful.

6bYgc4jYDncQcpAkBDDDvw.text: Horrible horrible I sat there with my kids for almost 20 minutes without anyone helping us, two servers were talking in the corner, another just walking around looking bored.

b0Oy9-ciuV1Gaf5EnBocMg.text: Quick Sunday Brunch! The concept of the restaurant is cool. I really like that the waiters were in pajamas and twirling umbrellas on the ceiling. I ordered the steak and eggs medium rare with the bread in a cup. The bread in a cup was the best part for me. It was sweet and the bread soft.  Unfortunately my steak left much to desire. The steak was well done instead of medium rare. I told the waitress and they fixed it immediately. The meal for me was nothing special. My friends on the other hand enjoyed their food very much. They ordered the chicken steak and Hash. I also ordered their Kale and apple drink it was really good! I just chopped it up that I picked the wrong thing on the menu. Also their cutlery and cups were dirty. The good out weighed the bad so I will probably try it again.

KvAaWXKgTeADnBHjJawkqA.text: Food was great. I had the avocado eggs beagle that was delicious (I love that there are options for vegetarians). Serving was very big, I could only finish half my sandwich. My fiance had the ultimate breakfast that he enjoyed. Staff are very friendly and attentive. 5 Stars!!!!

zZ8KF93C88-TatNb63tfzA.text: Just got the cup of bread and it was amazing . The coffee is so smooth and the waitress Gelato was friendly. It was busy Sunday morning and they sold out of the pumpkin pancakes which was slightly disappointing but we were able to substitute something else for the same price. I ordered the rose and shine chiquilles which were great. Love this place so far. Can't wait to come back and try everything on the menu

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

M1RCn_Sr75v14UlZFwKIpA.text: Food is bomb! Always fresh and always fire! Been eating here for 4 years now and never disappoints! Def try the fresh made juices strawberry watermelon is just like biting into a sweet watermelon.  Something for any and every diet and now serve alcohol!

rAIDnimy-WAe8jeAQuGs3A.text: Highly recommend after being in Vegas for the weekend on our way home we definitely wanted to try something away from the strip & definitely this place meet my needs! I had the carne asada chilaquiles & will recommend !

ern0phOptCr7pMby3tnAwA.text: Oh my goodness, SO. GOOD.  Last weekend we went hiking, really wore ourselves out and ended the day with me craving some red meat (mmm protein and iron right?).  Since we had plans to hike all day Sunday as well, we started with breakfast here.  We were not disappointed.  I got a country fried NY strip steak as big as my head and it was tasty.  I was even more impressed with my boyfriend's ribeye.  He ordered it medium well and it came out cooked beautifully to his liking and yet still as tender as the best medium and medium rare steaks I've had.  I am excited for my grandmother to come into town, as I am going to bring her her to try some of their vegetarian options (and selfishly so I can get that ribeye!)  They are a little pricey but I'd say worth it! (Side note for the restaurant owner should they see this -  I would love to rock one of your shirts because I tell everyone how good your food is and your shirt are cute, but $25 for a mass printed tee or tank feels much higher than necessary. I was ready to pay up to $15.)

flTI3ok3k0U-6d_3yNLSEw.text: If you don't order the chicken fried steak, you are definitely in the wrong. I swear the steak took up atleast one whole plate it self. This was huge and delicious. Definitely a place to stop when in Vegas.

nHxw_G6QZnaFSOKPG7OLvw.text: Found this away from the strip spot,so worth the drive!  With three in my group we enjoyed the decor and friendly helpful service. The coffee was best so far, since being in Vegas   The waffle combo was absolutely delicious,  fluffy and great flavor. Strawberries on the side and crispy perfect bacon!  We didn't get to try the bread in a cup but it looked amazing, a must revisit spot!

gZWfxNFWR38mMLgLzTh46Q.text: Have been here a few times now and always impressed with the service and come back for the food. Everything is huge so bring friends or an appetite. The wait staff runs around in pajamas and is always friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. While they are know for the steak and eggs I enjoy the fresh juices and absolutely recommend the pancakes.

GRCvoggNyAe3ydQN8NQqfw.text: This was an excellent breakfast place. Food was delicious and Kim was fantastic. Highly recommend!

XsswWBPoylZrlc8DxPf35A.text: Gelato was the best waitress, ever!! She was so friendly and efficient! The cup of bread is to die for, delicious, soft and the right amount of sweetness! If you want a refreshing drink try the watermelon strawberry juice. The Carne Asada Chilaquiles were on point as well!! The ambiance is such a cute, homey feel. The waiters and waitresses come to work in their pajamas. All in all, everyone here were very friendly! I definitely will be coming back here!
