xDVr7LWluSFDESxx1Yc8qg.text: This is a great little breakfast place.  Food is really good quality, generous portion sizes, their little bread in a cup is quite a treat (a lightly sweetened cinnamon bun w/ a delicious side of frosting served in a tea cup) and service is exceptional by the servers, not so much w/ the hostesses.  Wait time on a Sunday 10:30-11:00am has been around 15-20mins   Downsides are their drinks are a little over priced, a cup of regular drip coffee is $3.25 so my husband & I usually just grab a Starbucks.  Another downer is their kid's menu doesn't include a kid's drink.  $3.15 for a glass of milk for my 5yr old is just highway robbery, lol.    Just a side note, their table w/ two single chairs & a bench, closer to the backend of the restaurant is one to avoid.  You can feel every little movement from the people sitting behind you when you're sitting on the bench side which gets to be rather annoying quite fast, totally need to fix that!

I5DV1k13mZCUMD4iumyx8Q.text: Nice decor. Great staff. Gelato was our waitress. She took great care of us. The chicken and waffles are great an filling! Can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

C-DN9RDTOmu2ALa81f1TrA.text: GREAT FIND while visiting Vegas....good rib eye and eggs specialty of the house.  We will be back for sure...the young lady from New Mexico who was our waitress was very attentive and helped us find the place as GPS was not friendly with their address.  Thank you.   Felt like more of a mom and pop than a chain - always a good thang!

TFYzCaZbvmK3873erA-3tw.text: You must get the cinnamon bread in a cup. Hot and fresh.  I believe it comes with a meal. Very busy place, come very early on weekends as wait tend to be very long.

y6n7_ugRgDRB2K4TvmRFMA.text: A cute place to grab breakfast. Service was quick & everyone was very nice. I had the red velvet pancakes & boy that could've easily fed 2-3 people. Pancakes were very delicious & moist.  I didn't even need the cream cheese frosting that was served on the side. Also got the cup o bread which was recommended by many yelpers, another yummy choice if you are a fan of cinnamon rolls. The orange juice is freshly squeezed which they mention you can tell by tasting it.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Velvet Pancakes- Easily Feeds at least 2 people! So yummy!

_Qxa7iOM99o5cdhi8fKlwA.text: The food was delicious and the juices were freshly squeezed. Initially it seemed as if the staff couldn't handle the amount of customers that were coming in. Eventually it seemed that the staff got a hang of it. It did take a while for us to actually place our order and for the food to come out. But the food was delicious. Considering the foot traffic vs the staff they were short staffed and did their best to accommodate. Did I mention the food was great?! I had chilaquiles and I had plenty!

nGjjVIGEc5QvjVSAILLolA.text: We decided to go here for brunch time. They said it was going to be a little bit of a wait but to our surprise it wasn't that long at all. However, when we were seated the service took a little while to get our food out and once our food did arrive, they delivered it to the wrong table, realized it a minute later and took it from that table and tried to deliver it to us which we refused. So we had to wait for everything to be made again. The staff was apologetic but did not offer any discount due to the issue.  Also the table that we sat at was half booth and half table and on the booth side it was very wobbly.  Whenever the people moved who were behind us it shook us which was quite annoying. We brought it to the staffs attention but they didn't do anything about it. They even sat another family behind us after the first one left when there was other seating available and after we informed them of the issue. You would think they wouldn't seat someone that would cause both parties issues. I feel like there was a lot of issues which they apologized for but they should've done one step closer by discounting our food.

RkiEqjC-yNk--xqPjfLlcQ.text: Had Breakfast there this morning.  By the way we've been going there since it opened and still like their food.  Husband ordered Chicken Fried Steak and I had Biscuits and Gravy.  Tasty as always, but as always I had to send it back because it comes out Luke Warm.   We were disappointed to find out that when my husband asked for additional gravy because the gravy that comes with Chicken Fried Steak does not cover it.  To get more it costs $3.95 for that small small bowl.    Not good to start charging for something you didn't charge for before.  Give enough to cover the dish that is ordered so that you customers don't feel slighted.

vdwpDB5InbnJuMRWwV7fqg.text: This place is my favorite restaurant in all of Nevada. If you want sweet, get their cinnamon French toast. If you want savory, get their crispy fried chicken wrap. You won't regret it! My mouth is watering just thinking of this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best cinnamon French toast crunch there ever was!
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy fried chicken wrap with buffalo sauce on the side! THE BEST THING ON THE MENU!

LrSxA6Zc2WcRG7EqsS4N9A.text: Everything was so yummy!!!! French toast was to die for!!!! I also had the Lox and Cream cheese omelette omg I was in heaven. This place was so good we went twice during our Las Vegas 5 day trip.

knaIeXq8s22BFfZmRHib3A.text: Great place for breakfast.  My husband loved his pancakes.  The coffee was exceptional.

TDxJh3JY7Lzw6d8er3Q5JA.text: This place is on my go-to list for breakfast and brunch any day. After a few times here, I have come to find their service is plenty attentive and their food is always tasty and fresh.  Absolutely love seeing servers dressed in pajamas. The wall/ceiling decorations are also fantastic and add to the overall inviting feel of the restaurant. I love the fresh squeezed orange juice. Not to mention their french press coffee and their super delicious hash browns. I have had the chicken and waffles, eggs benedict, and french toast for breakfast so far and have nothing but good things to say about all of it.  There is a unique and charming flare to this restaurant that we don't see much of in Vegas and it's that rare quality that keeps me going back. Thinking about it, there is really no breakfast joint here that I can even compare this place to and that says quite a lot to me. They may get a little busy at times, but Rise & Shine is certainly worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. sweet deco
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. french press
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. ham and eggs benedict

pAaMAG4P-oIgtC1c4pMPFw.text: Our family came here for the first time today and seriously can't see us going anywhere else in the valley for affordable and delicious breakfast/brunch/lunch. The food was flavorful, well-made, and the pot of bread will literally melt in your mouth. We ordered:  Rib Eye Steak and Chilaquiles: I have never had chilaquiles before and I seriously feel like i have been deprived my entire life. My steak was cooked perfectly the way I liked and the tortilla chips that were bathing in refried beans, scallions, and cotija cheese were the perfect accompaniment.   Chicken and Waffles: savory & sweet at its finest! The chicken was not dry at all, it was not overly battered and the waffles had a slight crunch on the outside but soooo soft and perfect on the inside. The maple syrup that they served with them was warm and had sticks of cinnamon in them! YUM.   Silver Dollar Pancakes with Strawberries: Our little guy devoured these. He especially loved the sprinkling of powdered sugar over top! I had a bite, and I must say, they are some of the best pancakes I have had. Perfectly light with a little bit of crispness around the edges.   Our food was absolutely perfect and if they only served these three things, we would STILL come back on a regular basis. Although the food was delicious, our absolute favorite part of this place was our server, RYLEY!!! She has such an amazingly genuine and kind energy about her. She complimented us on our parenting and how well behaved our four year old was. (she is a nanny herself, so knows a thing or two about kiddos) In a world where there is so much negative criticism, she is such a breath of fresh air! Our food came out in a timely manner and i LOVED that she brought out our little guy's food first, which in the parenting world is a God-send. Even our little guy liked her. He drew her little hearts on the comment card that we turned in! We left there feeling so lighthearted and truly lucky to have been helped by such an awesome person. We CANNOT wait to come back!!!

Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken &amp; Waffles.
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot of Bread. (if you skip this and order toast instead, you&#39;ll regret it.)

k-luPOQmfQYtUTAKvPIKzQ.text: My kids and I enjoyed our breakfast very much at the Southern Highlands location. Portion sizes are great and we loved the fresh squeezed oj. Ashley was our server and took great care of us. The kids are already asking if we can come back again soon!

n6MAeX-EIMLRI4TtPb7CDQ.text: Best Corned Beef Hash I've ever had. Soooo good. Also, the eggs were cooked perfectly. The French press coffee was really nice. The bread in a cup was better than I thought it would be. Perfect portion sizes. Off the strip, so not crazy busy, which translated to virtually no wait time. Now I know why this place has so many good reviews.

QKxITR4KoacG5p9w-AMdFg.text: There isn't a better place in town for Ham and Eggs Benedict. Staff is always friendly and the food just delivers every time.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. As good as it looks! Get here and ask for Gee. She&#39;s awesome!

qJv3uHTMhyxv82wNqyPJ9w.text: Today was a disappointment. I come to this from time to time that I almost know what's on the menu without looking at it. As today is the their time in a year that I've ordered corned beef, I've noticed how very different it is now. There is hardly any corned beef I see in my plate . It's probably just this meal that they have changed but breakfast being the first meal of the day, this really made me lose my appetite. I didn't even touch the meal anymore . They showed me a side order of it and it's the same. I guess they don't understand, people expect breakfast from restaurants to be better than what we could make at home. This one is worst corned beef hash meal served to me in all the restaurants I've ever been to here and abroad.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Do you see the corn beef? I see potatoes and bacon bits. I was really disappointed

OfjHb_Qw_F4gdb5w8E0KHQ.text: My wife and I are creatures of comfort.  Our breakfast options usually consist of either Egg Works, Babystacks, or burritos at Roberto's.  We were out and about last weekend and had a hankering for some waffles.  Straight-forward enough, but surprisingly hard to find.  This place pops up on Yelp so we give it a go.  Daaaang.  The service was phenomenal.  Our waitress was on the ball, making sure our coffee was topped off and that we had anything we could possibly want.  The Lavazza coffee was ok, though not as mind-blowing as I would have thought from hearing people talk about it.  It's no Douwe Egberts, that's for sure.  My wife got the Nutella latte, which was ludicrously delicious.  The waffle and cinnamon french toast were fantastic.  Do not miss out on the pot of bread with a side of some outrageously addicting sugary dipping substance that should probably be outlawed.  I sure wish this place wasn't so far from where we are in Henderson.  It's a heck of a trek.  Also, be aware that this location does not feature all of the items pictured on the menu.  I would have loved to have tried the Oreo Butterscotch Pancakes, but that will require a trip to the other location.

bnaC3wL_HsfIXuRWJxa7LA.text: On your way back to LA from Vegas, get away from the city and head into this charmer! They truly know how to do breakfast, and even serve you in full pajamas! This restaurant had the most charm with their open kitchen and umbrella lights hanging from the ceiling. Riley was our server, who was so unbelievably kind and attentive to our half full coffees and waters. She was fast too!   We ordered up a two egg breakfast with bacon and potatoes ($9) and the corned beef hash and eggs ($10.50) PLUS a short stack of pancakes with warm cinnamon maple syrup. I know it sounds beyond basic, but this is the ultimate American breakfast at its best!  The corned beef was hearty, more on the beef side than the potato and the pancakes were light and fluffy. The bacon was just right, a crunch with a chewy middle.   This cute restaurant really seems to be a favorite around town and we will definitely stop by again after a weekend in sin city.

9ULLSJKjbaTQXPkCxOtjtg.text: This used to be good. Even worth the drive.  They raised the price, changed the menu, and took out items that used to be free.  During our numerous prior visits, we would always get the Country Fried Steak and Chicken & Waffles whenever we go. This most recent visit however, we noticed they changed the look of the menu and the price, it was $13 per entree (I believe it used to be around $10), it didn't come with sides anymore. I remember we would always get the side of biscuits to go with the Country Fried Steak and the famous Pot of Bread to go with the Chicken & Waffles. When I asked about it, she said said the portions are so large so you don't need the sides. If we want we could order them as extras.(what the??)  The food quality has gone downhill. We went around 2 pm on a Friday and there were only about 4 tables in there. And our food was over cooked and greasy.  Very unfortunate. This will not be our brunch place anymore!

OLpefGiObM5d4PS5i1HYVg.text: This place is amazing! Our server Gilbert was very informative and helpful! We would definitely come back! The food was YUMMY GOOD!

x38Sz0QtQ3Hvula9fjeB_A.text: I found this place on yelp last year and couldn't wait to come back. The cup o' bread is awesome! Great breakfast and very nice staff.

B3IYN-jPqwwws-WOEhTvvg.text: Great bfast spot!  Typical American style menu with some added variety. Smoothies are awesome!

to3NiC4D75E4i_GSEdG34g.text: Soooo good! The hype everyone is making about their chicken and waffles and pot of bread is definitely valid. Their chicken and waffles is nowhere near Roscoe's quality, but it's a close second. Definitely the best in Vegas. Can't complain about the portion size either. The pot of bread is definitely not what I expected. I thought it'd just be a roll type of bread but I was wrong. To my surprise, it was more like a Cinnabon! And it looks small but it's still pretty filling.   The servers and hostesses were extremely friendly as well. Our server was sweet and gladly answered any questions I had about the menu. Not to mention, they're all dressed in pajamas which makes the place even better lol.  The reason why I have this place 4 out of 5 starts is because of the steak and eggs I ordered, which were also talked highly about on Yelp reviews. Personally I didn't see what the big deal was. I've had better tasting steak and eggs at Southpoint during their late night specials. The size of the steak was decent but the flavor was eh.   Other than that, I'd highly recommend this place for a staple breakfast spot.

tHtXSQXAaVbs2f7CH0uveg.text: A Great Morning Spot! Great service from Amber & Ryley, both were very attentive and helpful! Food came out fast and correct!! Presentation was excellent as well! Delicious food at a decent price.

W5x3m6jTx0uzizXOxg9V1w.text: Holy Moly Drop your forks, we all know there's only a few breakfast restaurants in Mountains Edge / Southern Highlands. Don't waste your time at any other than Rise & Shine! The food is Phenomenal! Seriously staff usually doesn't make or break a place for me but this staff was sooo on point! Including their adorable pajamas. The chefs were voice full which made that busy kitchen run smooth.But the food the food was the knockout!! Rubbed steak & chilaquiles was Masterful!! The flavor was bursting the authentic flavors I haven't had since being in Mexico! Great Job guys! You have a weekly guest now and I couldn't be more ecstatic about Breakfast Time!!

CWZRCIHteR5l5Guy6hQMpg.text: Great service and good food. One of my favorite places to eat breakfast. Welcoming restaurant and great culture.

64TwsCxfx4n90Pw0odfCXg.text: The breakfast was excellent! The service was awesome, Vanessa is the best! We always request her to be our server.   Our favorites are the country fried steak and 2/3 egg breakfast but can literally recommend any of it!

faHdLzASV3n8TfG4zxhQXA.text: I think this is one of the best restaurants that I've eaten at. The steak is great, the eggs are exactly what I want, it's perfect! I'm also not surprised that it is packed with even more people that want a great breakfast. The best part is that it's a breakfast place, so when I wake up and get ready for a great day, I know exactly where to go for my breakfast. My server was also very nice, I had no problems with them, and my food was done in a quick matter of time. Even though the wait time for a seat is a bit longer than expected, the food was really great and worth it.

wYa-lZUeDLNfGoybEKk51Q.text: Great breakfast place. Delicious food.  Fresh juices are excellent. We usually take family here when they visit us.

eG-w1DJxpASicgICis8odw.text: Wonderful place with amazing food. Bright and airy atmosphere and sevice was terrific. We will be adding to our favorites!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Casual attire welcome!

936UvnAx_oZaPfirAL7A1A.text: Love the chilaquiles from here! I've always had a good experience when I've dined in. It does tend to get busy in the mornings (like all breakfast places), but the wait is worth it. Portions are pretty large, too -- I usually end up splitting an entree with the hubby and that's plenty for the two of us.

TfWwt8lUWd7M3MmLZSvbSQ.text: Though there isn't many choices, this place does not need a ton of entrees to be a great place for breakfast/brunch.   The food was really tasty and flavorful. I never expected it to taste so good! I ordered the Homemade Cornbeef & Hash with eggs with the Pot Bread, my other half ordered the Buffalo Chicken Breast with Eggs and Hash browns and a side of Pot Bread, and then we had a side of the Original Pancakes.   The corn beef hash was different from what most places offer, and was not heavy or bland. The dish was light and included a perfect amount and my eggs were cooked exactly as I had ordered.   My other half's plate, the Buffalo Chicken... Was excellent. The checkin breast was super moist, easy to cut (even with a fork), tender, juicy and definitely delicious. Side note, the buffalo sauce that's drenched on the chicken is a bit spicy but it does add a great kick to the chicken. The hash browns were great as well.   The pancakes, so soft and not mushy.   The pot bread was very light and not too sweet. Best dipped in the sauce that accompanies the dish.   I definitely recommend coming here if you want something a little different than your usual breakfast place.

zzzuOUz7Owtf4EEHvX0m0g.text: This is a really nice place to go for breakfast . The food is great , people there r very nice and friendly. I went to breakfast with 2 of my friend there ,for one of their birthday and we really enjoy it.

zdyMNUNrFYShE5w6-sq7eg.text: Called for a carry out and waited on hold for over 15 min, hung up, tried to call back and the line was busy for over 30 min. Would love to try the place but as of now can't get through.

IA6EJTARqnYdkIx2kTNnsw.text: We have been here a few times and feel the service is getting worst each time. Slow service and the orders were wrong. The menu is great and the food just ok.

ywl4KZv_xFURKmXIpbifUg.text: They always have fast service and amazing food. They are always friendly and give suggestions.

QWC3U2I8hQi3OOyUK1VWGA.text: Ashley is the greatest waitress of all time! This place is pretty amazing! Since this WAS a steak and egg place my boyfriend and I ordered the country fried steak and egg. It came with hash browns, which are probably the best hash browns I have ever tasted in my life. They gravy that came with the steak also worked both as a dipping for the hash brown and steak. I also ordered the Nutella latte, which you will not go wrong with. I saw this place through my friend's Snapchat, and decided to try it out. Best decision I made.

WZlWyU6h9aCrhrdeMGbuRA.text: I decided to try the chicken & waffles.   Jennifer was our waitress again.  This was only our 2nd visit.  She remembered what we ordered last time.  She's funny and professional.  When we we're getting our check, my husband asked her, so since your so good.....then she butted in and said, military discount.   (ohhhh snap)  she's good, and my chic and waffles were delicious.  I think that's my favorite there now.

h3WS2lsExQzFlxPRaJ_Sfg.text: Tried this place based on their reviews and glad I did. The portions were generous, the food was tasty, and the waitress kept my coffee cup filled and was great about offering pointers on what to order.  Did I mention they have real maple syrup?  Bread in a cup and red velvet chocolate chip pancakes are a must.

BQsjr7-eGCrmgs8gxIN_xA.text: Made it in for breakfast today and it was awesome. My servers name was Bruce, he was great and always there when we needed him. I had a waffle and a side of biscuits and gravy, both were delicious. Next time I'm going to try the buffalo chicken dish it sounded amazing. Thanks for everything Bruce we will definitely be back!

gONC7WaLBl2A80OmT_zK4Q.text: I don't hate it but I don't love it. Their coffee is awesome, and they have a French press as well that can be done at the table, it's amazing.  Their juice is fresh squeezed and brought promptly to the table. They have this bread in a pot.  So good! I HAVE to have one every time I go! Now the bad stuff... Occasionally my steak is over cooked and it doesn't taste right, and personally I don't like sending things back.  We did that once and didn't see it for another 15-20 min.  By then our whole party was done.  It has its good days and bad days but the good overweigh the bad.  Definitely worth a try, but at least you get a heads up.

46H1FIzWSvZrWUstcStylw.text: Great breakfast joint that doesn't just do a solid steak and egg plate, they also approach common breakfast items with a different style meaning you are just eating the same hash browns you could get at a million breakfast joints.

ulUswG6tKD32Fe8AallCug.text: Food is delicious. I have never been disappointed. The waitresses are super friendly and personable. Even the young lady at the register was very social. Great atmosphere and good off the strip location.

ZHY3iByv6q5YEneG9GtU7g.text: Love this place. We live in Henderson and make the drive over to Southern Highlands to have breakfast here on Sunday's. I love the Cinnamon French Toast.  Be ready to wait a few minutes when you come if it's on the weekend -- it's very popular.

72hG60V68-ONoEO7bg479w.text: Perfect for when you're hungover and probably just as good when you aren't. I hardly had any money so I just got toast and peanut butter because I was in dire need of carbs in my system and it made me feel 100 x better. Can't wait to actually try the real things on the menu next time!

VZy4L2dWifceiH7hxYiL-A.text: This is one of my favorite spots to go to when Im in vegas. Their bkfast is great, and its really filling. The waitresses are in pj's and the place is pretty lit up with decor. Its a great place away from the strip.

8VbIAXBgf3JX-HaB_Tyc3g.text: I found this wonderful spot using yelp. The high stars are not deceiving.  The place is not to big and not to small. It's conducive to large groups as well as like myself a party of 1. They have bar seating if your a party of 1 or 2 and dont want wait for a both or table. The waitress staff works really hard and fast to make sure your experience is a good one. Ask to be seated in vanessa's area. She is, fun, attentive and empathetic to your dining experience.  She gives you options along with your order that might not be on the menu or something you just didnt think of.  I ordered the ultimate steak breakfast.  It came with an 8 oz. Steak, 2 or 3 scrambled eggs, hashbrowns and your choice of bread. One of the bread options is called a pot of bread.  The title is deceiving because it comes in a little cup. But if you like a warm ooey gooey cinnamon roll, then you'll love this. I like to judge a breakfast establishment also by their hash browns.  this place to me has great fresh hash browns.  The steak was medium and was tasty. Not too much pink and still pleasantly juicy. You will not be disappointed.  I ate every bite. -- jeryl, aka Randy

wpyKX6eqh_PP1u7Yuh7DJg.text: Great place a little off the beaten path.  All of the servers are in their pajamas, which is kind of unique.  The red velvet pancakes are decadent and very rich.  I had the steak and eggs which was a nice piece of meat cooked properly.  I'd return!  Excellent coffee as well!

8Vp-4hrTqfdOuadiPXYeVA.text: Concept is cute.  Decor is fun and waitresses uniforms consist of pajamas and slippers.  The food was pretty good, but prices seemed a bit expensive.  I do like that they offer French press coffee, it was a nice surprise.  I have been there a few times and the service differs every time.  The waitresses are always very nice but it seems as though they are taking their time.... This morning we were sitting at the table waiting to put in our order for 15 minutes or so while the waitress was rolling silverware.  Menu was kind of small but they have a few fun surprises such as chicken and waffles and pretty yummy oatmeal.  I'll go again because it's close... But wouldn't venture out of my way to dine here.

ElOHkdlV0gAN1kry_RgTIA.text: The waitstaff was incredible. Our waitress, Lisa, had a sweet and positive energy that made our experience truly phenomenal. The food was also amazing. I definitely recommend the bread in the pot and the steak and chilaquiles. Great coffee, too! This place is a breakfast gem!

ERN2bDZAcjRGpNZ_zHLQHQ.text: This place is something special. My family and I had breakfast here on our way back home from Las Vegas and the food was absolutely incredible. I even told my wife that I would drive here from the Inland Empire in California just to have breakfast and drive back. The food is that good! I ordered scrambled eggs, bacon and waffles with hash browns on the side. The eggs were perfect, bacon was crispy, waffle was melt in your mouth and the hash browns were the best tasting I've had the pleasure to eat anywhere. My oldest son had the red velvet pancakes and the order was extremely generous. The cream cheese syrup that came with it was exquisite. The wife and my youngest son shared corned beef hash, eggs and bacon and the order was so big, the both of them could not finish it. My wife also had the french press coffee with her meal and that was incredible as well. The decor is original and the wait staff all wear pajamas as their uniforms which I thought was really cool.  Speaking of the wait staff, our server Riley was awesome, very attentive and made sure our beverages were never empty. The place was clean and you can tell the staff go the extra mile to make your meal very pleasurable. I can't wait to go back to this place when I get a chance.

BLE57GCabLEXvfEWrnOyHw.text: I absolutely loved this place. We went there for lunch. The food was delicious. I had the best Tuna sandwhich of my life! Hubby ordered steak and was pretty happy with it as he is usually picky with steaks. The servers were in their PJ's, not sure if it's their standard dressing or just for the weekend. Very nice servers, super friendly. And the deco was so creative, they have umbrellas hanging of the ceiling which look like big sunflowers. Price is ok, it's not too cheap and not to expensive. I would go again.

NKJaFwykv90TS54XxB937g.text: Finally I got to try this place. We walked in and the friendly service sat us down to enjoy the the beautifully decorated place. Everything from the pot of bread to my own customized omelet was amazing. I would highly recommend Rise & Shine to anyone who likes quality food and great service. Now I need to go back to try lunch!;)

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pretty

NQ8c_tm8L6Mfvdun6LQM3Q.text: it was alright, no booze so its no longer my go to place but the food was alright and the staff was nice, the smoothies are great.

Xxx_WqKtWNlCMt5cfOSH9g.text: This was literally one of the best breakfast places I've had in a long time!! My brother took met for my birthday and wow..We went HAM!! Had the crunchy cinnamon french toast, which was ridiculous!! Then the chicken and waffles, Spectacular!! Then the burrito, I don't even know what it was called, but it was super tasty!! I think that was a good 15lbs of greatness added to my buns hahaha!

4hFbHn_4XdYAjqc7FT3qkA.text: Just great steak and eggs in a cute lil breakfast joint. Enjoy!

EVv4K-qNbU1Bj62OT6BZow.text: Wow I can't believe all these good reviews for this place! I was so excited when this place opened cause I love breakfast spots and this is literally a block away from my house. Went about six months ago and had the worst experience. There was only two other tables occupied and couldn't believe how slow the service was. ordered basic breakfast of eggs over bacon home fries and toast plus fresh orange juice. The eggs were overdone and the potatoes were so strange. Consistency and texture of glue! Yuck!!! The only thing good was the fresh squeezed juice. Was so damn dissapointed. Chalked it up to another crappy place in Southern Highlands. Wonder if something has changed in the last 6 months... Maybe I will try it one more time. Did I catch it on a VERY off day?? Hmm

H7jIOakq6_I7zhWFYBagIQ.text: We really wanted to like this place after seeing all the good reviews, but sadly this was not the case. 3 of us went today for breakfast-1 got the Cinnamon crusted french toast,which was gross tasting-1-got the Red Velvet pancakes-those were okay, had better- and 1 got the NY strip steak and eggs, the steak looked more like a rib eye that was super thin. If your going to say your a "steak & egg" place your meat should be better quality especially when you are charging $13.25. The first 2 cups of coffee were warm. The pot of bread was okay-too much of a yeast taste for me. Service was okay, even though our waitress got our order mixed up with the table next to us-which might explain why the steak was not right. For 3 of us it cost over $40 for breakfast-definitely was not worth it. Save your money and go elsewhere.

QnDvVlfwOx1uNEJo6z3TWQ.text: This was my first time eating at this  establishment and I was very pleased with the staff and the level of service. The menu could be a bit more diverse but nonetheless the food was great. I had the chicken and waffles and was blown away. The portion was huge it actually made 2 meals for me. I would definitely eat here again.

rwIQ4r9gg9NEoiyBg0Er7Q.text: Phenomenal service, delicious food and great prices! Everything on the menu looked so good, I can't wait to be back in the area to eat here again! It was nice to have normal sized portions as well.

yX10COWrUoVYK7quMEfnZQ.text: Always solid. Big portions. Best restaurant in SoHi. On weekends the wait can be excessive.

Ku2XYFsuUZfcsjHHwtnboQ.text: 5 stars is not enough for this place. Food is amazing, service was excellent and a very relaxed atmosphere. Place was very busy wait was about 20 min. The eggs benedict and the kitchen and waffels were great they are a must have. If your in the south valley this is best breakfast place.

vIP8lv853JDjARy10epYnA.text: Good neighborhood breakfast place. Cute staff dressed in PJs. Heard they are expanding which is good because there's always a big line...

smGvhxAZaT3hq2Z2zJ4Ezg.text: So this is my second visit.  Had the corned beef hash both times, first time service was ok, not the most attentive but adequate.  This time around the corned beef was not as good as the first time: this time it seemed like more potato than meat which is disappointing.  So may not come back for corned beef next time.  My party seemed to enjoy their food the most part, the chicken fried steak my sister in law had was very fatty and far too breaded.  Service this time was pretty bad, never checked how our food was, never bothered to see if we needed more beverages till we had to ask.  I asked for more water and only half the table got water...  So service is really lacking.  We were also very bothered that not just w our table but the table next to us when we were still eating or had food on our plate.  It was a clear ploy to get us going since they are backed up on a wait, but never rush your guests... Bad form.  Sure other people are giving 5 stars but I'm wondering they are being objective.  This place has some improvements to had if we are to come back.

paWMNsk4VUfkFQXl-Fnq1w.text: We were so lucky to have Halle as our server.  Total sweetheart!  She recommended the country fried steak which was perfectly fried.  We also loved the Nutella coffee and had room for a blueberry pancake stack.  This is definitely my new weekend brunch place!

TwxljgHxrGOeNyGgEqzMUw.text: First time in this place, the atmosphere is family friendly. I had Buffalo boneless chicken  and eggs and pot of bread, my wife had the rib eye steak and eggs. They were both cooked to perfection, very tasty and we loved that they give you big portion. Definitely coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

a34pcUwiKFKDlOmvaTpI6A.text: - excellent place to stop for breakfast if you are passing through Vegas  - located off the strip so easily accessible without dealing with any of the madness of LV Blvd  - freshly made OJ - I ordered the chilaquiles which were delicious and a great value at $10.95 - ample variety of hot sauces available at every table including chipotle cholula. - charming PJ style waiter / waitress apparel  - very friendly and competent service staff  Came back again on our way to Lake Powell.  This place is 3 for 3.  Tried a three item omelette (avocado, cheddar and jalapeno) with the toast and hash browns.  Was delicious; huge portion could not finish.  Manuel ordered the bone in ham steak which was massive and very good.  Keep up the great work team.

BtIUmaSF5nGr55o5RYq7wQ.text: The place is yummy! Only bad thing is that it was so cold it made our food cold instantly. Try the watermelon and strawberry juice. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4_per2QkD3r3eSh9Pg-ksA.text: We came back here because we loved the food the first time around. Unfortunately our second experience included an array of issues that really weren't handled with the appropriate level of care from the staff. Our waitress, when taking our orders, did not write any of it down. There were 4 people in our party and we had a good amount of substitutions/additions to our orders. When she quickly repeated our order back to us before putting it in, she made atleast two mistakes. Not surprising, our food arrived and 3/4 people's orders were wrong in some type of way. They were corrected in a relatively timely fashion besides one friend who waited too long for her order to be corrected. Throughout the order corrections, the waitress did not express any sort of apologies to us. Good food, but a poor experience due to how the staff handled our orders.

c2KO0tPkmK8BYkSZ7mv47Q.text: First time here but we loved the breakfast. This restaurant is just a little cheaper than eating on the Vegas  strip but the food quality was better than some of the strip options so it was worth the 3 mile drive out on our way back to LA. There wasn't a long wait for a party of two but the place did look a little busy but this was okay for a Saturday morning.

Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and chilaquiles

iL4mm431Ih9NEvLsDtX33A.text: The servings are huge. Prices are little high, but you can feed two people with one dish if you like, so that helps. Service is really good. Last time we were there they had changed their menu and added way too many things, keep it short and simple I say. Worth checking out for sure.

WRP3jpenfF8InQAtUkv_7w.text: We stopped by Rise & Shine for our last meal before heading back from our Vegas trip.   The food is standard breakfast food but it's really good here. I loved the Chicken & Waffle! The chicken was moist and tender and had a really nice crispy texture on the outside. Too bad this was my sister and her husband's dish or else I'd eat the whole thing! The steak & eggs dish was good and came with toast and hash browns. I shared this dish and it was a perfect amount for the two of us. The steak had a nice char but wasn't as juicy as I'd hope. I loved the side of bacon we had. Can't go wrong with bacon!  Service was good but they forgot a couple of items and we had to remind them.

l-KZ2lx8TsXPvv-CC3VCYA.text: Wow!!! Everything was amazing. We had a big group and got some breakfast and lunch plates.  Everything was bomb from soup to pancakes....staff was friendly and helpful.... thank god I live close so I can be a regular from now on. Ps try the chicken wrap

kX2s1ApHHo2ueHea0HmuJw.text: I'm not sure what's going on with this place. I used to love it. Becoming complacent perhaps? 2 attempts at a ribeye to make it rare and it was well done every time. Then I was still charged almost the same when they added the eggs and hash browns a la Then the audacity to charge me $3 for gravy too. Very disappointed here..

ciJ_NZGcgd25MQIsxVP4wQ.text: We had a great experience at this restaurant on July 4th.  The food was fabulous.   We loved the bread in a cup and the creamy  sauce that came with it.  I had the Eggs Benedict which was outstanding.   The crunchy waffle was also very good.   Our waitress Ashley was very attentive.  We had some questions for the Manager Vanessa  and she was so nice!  Great customer service from the waitress and the Manager!   There was four of us and the bill was very reasonable at just under $40.   Everybody liked what they ordered.  I do definitely recommend this restaurant!!

sQ_e0PuM6T-KSc36WMdATw.text: Pretty Good palace . My plate was $15 . Only down fall is they charge $1 for cheese on both my eggs & hash browns  .  But they everything about the meal was really good .

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tEi1nq4OBLDF_4d0Wjpx4g.text: Very delicious. Breakfast sandwich was huge. I hope to return. Staff shirts were funny.

ZpBOYT9ty9qQnNE2xA0yjg.text: What a CUTE little breakfast spot in a suburban area right outside of the Strip.   Here are some fun things to know about Rise & Shine: 1. All the waiters/waitresses are dressed in their PJ's (lucky them!). 2. Their menu is quite extensive but not to the point where it's an encyclopedia. 3. Order the chicken and waffles (it's what they're known for). 4. The Red Velvet Chocolate Chip pancakes were the best I've had and their maple syrup is legit, and legit meaning it's not some cheapy syrup straight out of a plastic bottle. 5. Service is friendly and efficient here. They are very accommodating. 6. While you're enjoying your meal, look up at the ceiling and admire the fun umbrellas turned into flowers just spinning about. Felt like I was Alice in Wonderland. :)

3F0P9ZhpxswudE1AO8P4sQ.text: I picked up take-out to go and the food was pretty good I had the steak and eggs while I was waiting for my food the staff was very friendly and helpful offered me a free refill on my drink without even asking. It was a surprisingly short wait time and the food was just as delicious when I took it home.

R4Ki0r5U_cP7-Am8SB27Kg.text: Hands down the best breakfast place I've ever eaten at plus great coffee and add-ins as well as a pot of French press! Their steak is cooked perfectly and the bread in a cup is to die for or so I've told.

Ng5sdwH2F1Lf99jZlAoT6A.text: Sometimes after a weekend in Vegas, you just want to get out ASAP especially if you have a long drive home. We all have our exodus go to spots. Many of us want to cure our hang-overs so we head to Chinatown for Pho. Some want to get that steak and eggs for under $10 at smaller hotels. Few of us want to load up at a buffet before having to sit in that strenuous car ride and hoping that we can make it home before we have to drop the kiddies off at the pool. On the most previous occasion out to Sin City, I suggested something a little different to the crew. Let's check out this place called Rise & Shine, a Steak & Egg Place which is kind of south of the strip and sort of in the path back to LA. It seemed like the majority of the people who dined here were regulars and/or locals.   This little restaurant is open daily from 7am-3pm only. They serve breakfast items the entire time during their hours of operation and lunch menu kicks in at 11:30am. We arrived right before noon on Sunday. For our party of seven, it took nearly 20 minutes for them to get us a table. The place isn't really big to begin with. I would say that 4-5 people max per table is ideal. There is a dining counter and you can also eat outside if the weather permits. Take notice of the waitresses' uniform; they're catchy because they are wearing pajamas. An awesome concept and it looks very comfortable. The bus boys have black tee shirts on that say something along the lines of help them by visiting Yelp.  We all ended up ordering hefty breakfast dishes on this morning because we were all mc-fatties ready to go to town. I went with the Crunchy Cinnamon Raisin French Toast - cinnamon crunch coasted, served with a warm glass bottle of maple syrup ($8.95). I made it a platter by adding two eggs and a turkey kielbasa (bacon or sausage is also avail) for an extra $3.50. It was a big meal indeed. The French toast was soft but not mushy and full of flavors from the cinnamon and tang of the raisins. The big turkey kielbasa was a nice compliment with the eggs. Surely French toast by itself isn't sufficient. I was definitely a happy camper.  A couple of my friends got the Crispy Fried Chicken Breast & Waffle ($11.95) which was a hit on the table. A thick piece of battered chicken breast sitting on top a fluffy waffle. Juicy white meat and far from dry. It's nothing like Roscoe's Carol C. Special but it should deserve recognition of its own. Before you start bashing me by saying, "I've had better fried chicken Smitcha!" All I'm saying is that it's pretty good and never did I claim it was the best I've had.   Another friend ordered the Southern Style Chicken Fried Steak but from what I heard, he wasn't too impressed and felt like he should've went with the fried chicken and waffles.  Service was on point and like an oldskool coffee shop, I took my tab and paid at the register. I regret not trying pot of bread that everyone seems to be rave about on Yelp. Bring your appetite to this place because after this meal, I was seriously full until later that night. Plus, there are many options to choose from their menu. I will say that it was a great meal but it also made me feel like I was good on a typical American breakfast for some time. Once in a while a 1500+ calorie, single serving meal is okay but just not too often or else Dr. Chen will start chewing me out about my weight and high blood pressure.

Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Southern Style Chicken Fried Steak

Flk8nQ2qxKtwunXC2hrWXw.text: Great breakfast place while in Vegas, very cute and comfortable. The staff wears pjs so you don't feel underdressed when rolling out of bed to get some steak and eggs.

vLpjNzux6qwK2SlqMy5t6g.text: What a gem of a place we stumbled upon by accident. From our (very little) experience in Vegas, there are so many dining options and many places you can go wrong. It was a Thursday morning, and we were seated immediately. The whole staff was chipper, and helpful. My husband and I both ordered build your own omelettes with hash browns and a side of toast or pot of bread.  Order the pot of bread!! It sounds strange and we almost didn't try it but it was delicious! It is half cinnamon roll, half bread roll, all baked and served in a petite mug with cream cheese frosting.  Our omelettes were cooked perfectly, the hash browns were thick and hearty and weren't too greasy, and although we didn't get any this trip they have a full juice bar running in the corner! We will be back again!

IHaMVbut-5JXbTwSloZsQQ.text: I live right off of Valle Verde, so on my morning drive to get Starbucks, I noticed that this place had opened up. I decided to take the time out to stop in since I'm always on the lookout for good places close by.   As I walked in I immediately noticed the decor, which is very bright and colorful, with pretty patterned umbrellas hanging from the ceiling, which I found to be a nice atmosphere to start my day in.  The two women at the front counter greeted me warmly and sat me immediately, and told me my server would be Maria.   Maria asked if I'd been there before, then explained the menu to me when I said I had not. I decided to go with a ham steak breakfast with a pot of French press and some OJ.  Maria brought me my cup of bread, which comes with the breakfast and is apparently a specialty of theirs. I was a bit skeptical as to whether it would be any good, but it was basically like an extremely fluffy cinnamon roll inside of a cup, with the sauce/icing on the side, and I enjoyed it a lot.   When the ham steak came out I was also surprised, as I was expecting a normal sized, 6-8 inch around, half an inch thick steak. The steak they brought out was at least an inch thick, and probably a foot or so around, a good pound or more of meat. I wasn't sure if I'd even be able to finish it, but it was so juicy, tender, and smoky that I managed to eventually, although I sat there for a good hour or so.   The eggs and hashbrowns were a bit above average, tasty with a kick of seasoning that isn't usually included, and added some extra interest to the dish.   The French press is touted as Lavazza, which I've had before at other restaurants. Although as a coffee snob I'll say it isn't the best cup of coffee I've ever had, it is better than the coffee at 90% of other restaurants in Las Vegas, and having a good cup of French press to go with the steak made it much easier to digest.   The OJ tasted fresh squeezed and had a slice of orange as a garnish, which I was happy about as concentrate at restaurants bothers me.   The entire time I was there Maria was very attentive to me, always making sure my water was full, if I needed anything else, asking if I liked everything, and joking about being proud of me being able to finish the ham steak.   As I left I asked for the manager, Gilberto, who I met just so I could tell him that Maria and the front and back end staff were all great. He was very polite to me, asked me what I had, introduced himself, and made me feel like a valued customer.  All in all this seems like it will be my new favorite local breakfast place, and I'm glad they opened up right across the street. The one qualm I have is they need beds in the back, because after you finish one of their steaks you really feel like rolling back into bed and not getting out till after 12 or 1.

rFK2yXQaq-poEOYj0Mz_dA.text: NOTE: This is a long review but they deserve all the attention. BELIEVE ME. If you are in Vegas, it is worth the drive off the strip to eat here. You will probably be stuck in line at those buffets anyways so use that time to drive here. First of all I want to thank, April, our waitress. She was great! Also, I wanted to thank Yelp for helping me find this place. It is a hidden Gem outside the Vegas Strip. This place IS the BEST breakfast place in Vegas. Customer Service: 5 stars - everyone is super friendly with big smiles. The manager does come around and sees how everyone is doing. Atmosphere/decor: cute and very clean. Also in the back of everyone's T-shirts except the waitresses, its say, "help us by Yelping us" or something like that. I thought that was really cute and they found out I was a Yelp Elite. LOL Food: 1000 STARS!! I really love this place. We called ahead to see if they take reservations but they don't. But I understood when I got there. Luckily when we went on Sunday morning, it wasn't packed and we got seated right away. The prices is decent for what you get. It was $50 for a group of 4. If you went to IHOP you would have paid MORE and got crappy food. I saw some reviews saying how it is a bit expensive, when you think about it, Denny's and IHOP is about the same if not more. For steak at those places it would be MINIMUM $20 per place. Here - LESS then $15! that is a STEAL! Okay, since I got all that out of my way, here is what we ordered: -Chicken and Waffles with Pot of Bread - yelp.com/biz_photos/C9Im... yelp.com/biz_photos/C9Im... The Pot of Bread was AMAZING! MUST ORDER!! Honestly, it was the best bread I ever had. It came out piping hot and just perfect. It wasn't too sweet but wasn't plain. The bread was very fresh and soft. The chicken and Waffles was very yummy! The portion was REALLY big and enough to share. I was very impressed with the chicken. It wasn't dry at all and was perfectly crispy. It had a small kick of spice in it and it was perfect. The Waffles was nice and fluffy. I am not a Waffle fan but I LOVED IT! honestly fell in love with this place. -The ULTIMATE Steak and Egg Breakfast: the steak came out perfectly well seasoned and very tender. I loved it. It was just delicious. The Hash browns potatoes that came with it was a bit soggy. We thought it would come out more crispy then soft. -New York Steak, Spinach & Benedict-Bagel - I didn't order it but I had a piece. It was delicious also! The Spinach went really well with the steak. Thank you Rise and Shine for the great experience. I will be back every time I go to Vegas. I just wished you opened up another one over here in Southern California. That would be a GREAT investment.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9I1mSf1DrSWk70TlKXty2A.text: On this visit I came alone and a bit later than I would have liked. There is no denying that the food is great... but I am back to concerned about the service. My waitress who I have had several times was awesome. But the bar was empty,  several empty tables and I was told a 10 to 15 minute wait. It took the hostess a very long time to seat the empty tables and my wait was closer to 25 mins... bar was still empty when she took me there. I was served quickly. However the plate looked like a train wreck. No grapes as I have come to expect here, they obviously haven't scrubbed the grill between orders as there was much grainy char on the plate. The servers seem to use the bar area to drop stuff on (menus, unwanted table items etc) and the buckets that have silverware and napkins at the back of the bar had a layer of dust on the back edge. Seems like a loss of revenue to not have the bar full of payomg customers instead of empty and full of mislaid items. My suggestion... either a) assign a waitress to the bar that can handle it and a table or two or b) maybe get a bus boy or hostess who is maybe interested in becoming a server to take just the bar. You lost 4 tables of 2 to 3 people while I waited and probably more as I ate. Again food is really tasty but the inconsistencies will lose customers.  Cary runs her butt off to make sure customers are taken care of.

73__AiIfXfXtAP7GmvmJmg.text: My new favorite breakfast spot.  No joke, it literally blows all others that even attempt to serve breakfast out of the water.  The best part is, I don't have to wait forever to get a table like those dumb suckers that wait for an hour at Babycakes for crappy food.  Every time I have been there, on a weekend, I have always gotten a table very quickly.  The reason why I love this spot is that they have totally focused only on breakfast, and with a carefully crafted menu, in executing it flawlessly.  You can tell with every dish, that much thought went into how to prepare it.  And the waitresses in pajamas, how awesome is that?     I really appreciate the love that went into this place, so much that I want to give the owner a hug.  The first time we went, my husband ordered the steak and eggs.  While this is not kobe beef steak, it is cooked extraordinarily well, especially for a breakfast joint.  The steak is juicy and flavorful and contrasts perfectly with the eggs.  He has also ordered the chicken fried steak and while that was extremely heavy, he loved it and said it was the best he's had since he was a kid in Montana, where apparently that type of dish is extremely common.  I have tried the chicken and waffles and a veggie omelet.  The chicken, just like the steak, was cooked perfectly.  And even more impressive than the steak, they managed to keep the chicken completely juicy, warm, and flavorful.  But the waffles were even better.  They were completely soft and almost pancake-like, and extremely fluffy.  I normally don't like waffles because they tend to be so heavy, but they managed to capture the flavor of waffles in a way that did not make me want to sleep for the next 10 days.  They also were topped with a cinnamon maple syrup which was totally memorable.  So if you are looking for the best breakfast in Las Vegas, look no further than Rise & Shine.  They may not be open the entire day, and their menu may be limited in scope, but what they do they do extremely well, and every time I go I am even more impressed with their consistent quality of food and service.

mOBN3RYVikdjMws3ZzcCiw.text: Sometimes I think I shouldn't write reviews about the places I like because I'd rather keep it a secret.  But in these hard times I'd like the places I love to stay busy enough to survive.  Finally a breakfast spot for Southern highlanders.  I'm tired of having to drive miles just for a decent breakfast.  I can't say that I am blown away by the decor or the service.  Heck, there was even a 30 minute wait to get in.  If I were rating on that alone I'd give out an average score of three stars.  The saving grace of this place live behind the counter.  Those cooks are doing a great job and I hope they get paid well.  My girlfriends french toast was the best she's had in Vegas so far.  It didn't even need any syrup on it.  It was just delicious.    My steak looked like your average steak, but let me tell you, it is hard to find a place that can cook a steak just right.  Normally, you go into a busy restaurant and the steak comes out either over cooked or damn near raw; however, this place was jam packed with people and my steak came out cooked just how I ordered it.  It was even seasoned well.  No A1 required.  I haven't had a steak this good at a restaurant in years!  So go check this place out.  It has all the normal favorites made better then most places you'll eat at.

EsDCR2t8JpV9xoWvipslmA.text: We just moved to southern highlands and decided to give this place a try. The food was excellent, but two out of the three times we were there we had really slow service by the same server. If we return, we will make sure that we don't have her again. It really gives this restaurant a bad name.

HfJ9qUf65N0yuno6YtFMLg.text: Refreshing change of pace over all the other local breakfast spots!  The decor, atmosphere, service, and food are all top notch.  You'll read many reviews raving about the flower pots of bread and their Chilaquiles and Steak and you definitely won't be dissapointed.  This is definitely my new favorite breakfast spot and you just get a much more alive vibe than the Egg Works, Egg and I, Pancake House, and other breakfast competitors.  These reviews are spot on about the quality of service and food.  This place is truly a gem and you should definiltely check it out!

pwUySPV9G6KQY_WDoAT6Ag.text: We had breakfast here this morning. It was difficult to choose from their large menu. I had an omelette with a side of corned beef hash and my wife had the Benedict. The food was amazing. Best hash I've ever had. Add the table side French press coffee and the kids pancakes and waffle and we have a new favorite breakfast spot in Vegas must check it out.

HQkG4BeqeAYaRL7Az5Depw.text: A little bit out of the way but worth the drive.  Slight wait due to the cozy size.  Phenomenal servers dressed in pajamas; awesome French Pressed coffee and the food exceeded expectations.  Bucket list material!

9rydjOp7NAzlOS9aGCPEuA.text: This is the 2nd attempt to try this restaurant,...and the last!  Standing in front of the hostess stand for 10 minutes,...with hostess on other side of stand,...empty tables available, and hostess never once looked up!  When I asked how long of a wait,... She still basically ignored us.  There was at least 2-3 additional parties forming A line, waiting to be acknowledged!  Another waitress. Also came by and returned menus, but also ignored everyone!  Horrible customer service!

-OC9zGLoun2ZcVxiixstFA.text: Not great, but not horrible. It's a small restaurant with only a few staff at a time. The wait staff is awesome. Quick with refills and to clean off tables. They make them wear pajamas which I thought was a little weird... I ordered a country fried steak and egg breakfast. This thing was enormous and I was excited, but when I cut into it I realized that it was WAY over breaded and didn't really taste like much. It didn't come with gravy which is my fault for not asking but that would have helped. The hash browns were pretty good and the egg was fine. They brought me this thing called a "pot of bread" it was just a roll in a coffee mug. I would have rather had some toast or a pancake or something besides a plain roll. I give it a 3 because of how hard I see the wait staff working but the kids working in the back may need some more experience on preparing the food. I probably won't come back.

ZnjsnQ0DRRGGiK5nlMma0A.text: This place was such a delight, from the decor, food, and the service. Lisa was awesome. I felt like I was eating in her kitchen. The bread pot was delicious. They have the cutest lights that were daisy umbrellas. I would definitely come back. It was a lot of food I'm sad I didn't have a place to store and reheat my chilaquiles because I was staying in a hotel.

3FW-apNrIREiTzget4npnw.text: 4.5 stars!  This place is off the beaten path...  no where near the strip and thats a good thing.  The food is very very good, we ordered the chilaquiles, eggs benedict and a waffle.  The minus half star is for the waffle, too doughy and the temperature in the restaurant (on the warm side).  Aside of those minor glitches everything was great, the chilaquiles were perfection from the beans, cheese, homemade tortilla chips and salsa.  My husband raved about the eggs benedict too.  Definitely try the french press coffee, so good.  We will be back next time we visit LV because this place is legit.

hcse_w8KPmQpKHYd7bQLGA.text: Their service absolutely stinks.. Food is always brought out cold. The Biscuits that come with gravy were HARD as a rock. I love eggs benedict and their steak and eggs benedict is delicious!  Don't forget to get the pot of bread with your entree.

LUQODAaBA6wpS650LJPF4Q.text: I LOVE breakfast! And Rise & Shine far exceeded my expectations that fellow yelpers have laid out for me. Thank you once again Yelp for showing me a True gem in this hot, chain ridden unforgiving desert. Now on to the details...  At first glance Rise & Shine looks to be a very small nook of a restaurant at the corner of a nice new strip mall in Southern Highlands. And that's pretty much what it is. But don't let looks deceive you! This small nook has so much to offer.   We were greeted by a tall gentleman in a blue striped shirt who sat us promptly at a booth facing the open kitchen. It almost seemed as if he was welcoming us into his home, so I assumed it was his establishment in some form or another.   Our server followed to take our drink order, and say hi to the little mama, and we decided on the French Press Illy coffee (do not pass this up!) and some waters. She returned very quickly with our own personal French press, two mugs, a sand timer with three strengths, and some real cream (hallelujah). She explained the timer, took our order of Steak Chilaquiles, a Spinach Swiss Avocado Omelet, and two pots of bread, and whisked away in her cute paisley pjs.   The coffee was divine after letting steep until just after the yellow timer ran out, then pressing with much anticipation... fresh, aromatic, strong!, and ours to pour as we wished.   The pots of bread came out first as little mama was hungy, and was getting antsy, and the three of us shared in a blissful pulling and devouring of the light fluffy just barely there cinnamon bread with fresh jam and real butter. I could have eaten five of those pots by myself!  Then came our meals. I wish I could have taken pictures, but they lasted a whole millisecond after our server set them down before we dove in like hungry hyenas. The smell of fresh ingredients was overwhelming, and we were all foaming at the mouth!  Hubby's Steak Chilaquiles were unreal. Fresh tortilla chips smothered in refried beans and a slightly spicy sauce, with cheddar and cotija cheeses, then topped with two over medium eggs and avocado, and a whole dinner sized rib eye steak that was PERFECTLY seasoned, with a side of salsa and sour cream. Heaven!   My omelet, while simple and unassuming, was perfection. Not too overly huge as some omelets in this town can be, not too overloaded with cheese, or grease from cheap cheese (uck!), but beautifully fluffy and balanced, topped with creamy green avocado. Fabulous! The potatoes were fantastic, and again perfectly seasoned, and didn't even need ketchup or hot sauce (as I usually drench restaurant taters in).   Each plate was accompanied by a fresh fruit stack of strawberries pineapple and oranges, which little mama enjoyed so much, the tall man in the blue striped shirt came by and offered her more of, which she gleefully took and crammed more in her sweet face.   All in all, this place was so pleasing, it is now our favorite breakfast joint in town hands down. We will be returning (more than likely next weekend!), often! Hurray YELP!

2OJexznkvgt_tGVtvpCheg.text: Surprised the hubby to a Vegas trip for his birthday and of course he wanted to find a steak and egg spot. Naturally we would've gone somewhere on the strip but being the yelpers we are we found this spot and content with the results. I'm such a foodie but since I'm also trying to watch my portions I was hesitant on what I would order. I ended up ordering the steak omelette (egg whites only) which came with the sauce and hash browns. Went with the bread in pot as my side bread option which was PERFECT for me since I'm watching my food portions. I enjoyed every bite of the perfectly cooked steak and the omelette was fluffy. I will say that they put a little too much cheese in it but overall great flavor. I was full and didn't even touch the hash browns but my hubby said they were yummy. He ordered the bacon wrapped tenderloin which he said was just perfect. This will be a must breakfast spot next time were in Vegas.

61XSg938Suzn1iwBkYwY9A.text: Husband had the steal and eggs. The steal was delicious, very well cooked and seasoned. I had the carnitas child quilts they were good. We also shared the oven baked cup bread, yum  so soft and the dip soo good! Fast service! Definitely will try to stop by again when come back in town.

_yo_Dg1C4WjwXZY61ekezg.text: Came here on a whim, as I was leaving Vegas, I wanted to eat at a place outside the busy strip. This little corner spot is awesome. Desirae was our server and she was great and made sure we had everything we needed. The Chiliquiles here are fucking amazing!! I live in LA area and these are the best I've ever had!

95Qh8WXoYNtGQN3WzdE0eA.text: A nice little breakfast joint! A bit off the Strip (this is for people that have cars). The staff dress in pajamas, so needless to say the dress here is casual! Lots of 80's music during your visit to clear your head. Condiments on the table include a variety of Cholula sauces instead of just Tobasco. A new thing for us is the "cup of bread". Savory and sweet pop over in a teacup with powdered sugar and a glaze of cream cheese and sugar. So cute and tasty, we ordered an extra one! Coffee is Lavazza. Very good! There is a small 55+ menu and the steak and one egg is a winner. The steak is well-seasoned. I had the two egg breakfast with bangers. Super tasty! Portions are appropriate, not too much for one meal. This place is perfect for a nice, reasonably priced meal on your way out of Vegas and back to reality. This place deserves to be in your rotation!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Remnants of the &#34;cup of bread&#34;. With the Lavazza coffee, it was awesome! Check out my review for more info!

2XTu6ukMwD2kAhJwgqqnFg.text: This place was on my bookmark for a while so my sister and I wanted to try it. It was nearby and we were hungry for some good brunch so we decided to try this place! When we first came in we were waiting for quite a bit of time. The lady at the front did not bother to acknowledge us or maybe she did not see us. It took a while to get seated down, but it was packed so no biggie. We looked at the menu for a while and we found out what we wanted to get after a few minutes.   We waited for a long time for a server to come by after seating us down, but no one bothered to ask us for anything? A kind lady came by and apologize for the wait so we were cool and just ordered what we wanted. Got the food at a normal pace despite the fact that it is busy. Food was so good as we got the Philly-Style Cheese Steak & Eggs and Smoked Salmon-N-Eggs Benedict. Perfectly seasoned and so delicious! The Cup-o-bread is delicious and so unique.   However, service here is... not so good. From looking at other tables, they were taken care of quickly and treated well unlike how we were treated. We were sat down with no one coming by until 10-15 minutes later. No one came to check on us and we had to wave down a different server to get utensils after our food arrived. It felt like we were cast aside and no one wanted to bother our table. My sister's water cup was empty and we had to get a server to help refill it, but she never came back so I gave my water cup to my sister. It made my sister and I feel out of place and it left a bad taste after we left the place.   Was planning to come back here, but after how we were treated and cast aside, probably not going back if it makes us feel bad.   Food: 4.8/5 Service: 2/5

jS6FdLXvDgyKIH4El6Hg1A.text: I love Rise & Shine -- delicious food, fast service, and quick turnaround time.  Came here on Easter Sunday so it was packed af, but the service was still attentive and friendly. As for the food, after trying it on that fateful Easter Sunday, we promptly returned the following week. I cannot praise their signature Cup-O-Bread, Chilaquiles, and orange juice enough.  The Cup-O-Bread is a warm, gooey, sweet cinnamon roll. It's perfection served up in a cute lil' cup.  The Chilaquiles is basically a plate of hearty breakfast nachos and a great vegetarian option. The serving size is so huge, it makes me cry that I can never finish it in one go since I know they won't warm up well. It feels criminal to let something so good go to waste.  Lastly, the orange juice is delicious. Even at the steep price of $4.50 per glass, I highly recommend it (and I'm not even a big fan of juice)!   Overall, great breakfast option. The staff knows how to hustle plus breakfast is gloriously indulgent, unique, and delicious.

sPNKWPaNTL5HZnhoeJaG8w.text: Excellent. I've been eating here for awhile now and every time I come it's great. I can't remember her name but the server with the reddish hair is my favorite, I'm in the buisness too and you can tell she really does it all around there.   They just recently added some alcohol too which is great definitely worth it. Now I can have a Bloody Mary with my favorite steak and eggs in town. My girlfriend is addicted to the pot of bread sooooo yummy.

M0Ah0znEc8tyQVrJiFH1iA.text: At first we were sat down and greeted properly our waitress takes our order (we have a party of 5) one of the members in our party ordered chilaquiles the waitress then asked how he wanted his eggs he wanted them scrambled the she replied with it's an extra charge to get the eggs scrambled with the tortillas well after receiving our dishes the eggs were scrambled but on top of the tortillas so when we asked her about that she started stating that it was extra scrambling the eggs with the her words co-tie-chaa cheese (cotija) when we corrected her on the proper way of saying the word co-tea-haa she looked at us like if we were the ones pronouncing it wrong and saying she doesn't understand. We then asked her you are charging us extra for just scrambling the eggs when she stated it was going to be mix with the tortillas and she replied there is no tortillas on this dish we then pointed to the tortillas and she said oh the CHIPS  I wonder as to  how she thinks chips are made. We kept explaining that she has said the extra charge ment scrambled eggs with the tortillas not placed on top she kept saying how can I fix this I don't understand over and over after we had thoroughly explained various times. Overall the food was decent not something I would crave or revisit. Oh one last note there was a state mandated health warning you know the one that says drinking alcoholic beverages can cause birth defects and cancer in the restroom because that's where everyone will see it lol.

i36jzPQSt2Rw9oZvntBhoA.text: Saw the reviews and decided to take the wife out for a nice breakfast. Don't know what was going on with the waitress but when we got our coffee she slammed it on the table. Shrugged it off thinking maybe she had hard day. Coffee wasn't fresh tasted a bit sour. That's fine not here for the coffee.         Ordered omelette with hashbrowns and toast on the side. Omelette was ok, burned toast and burned hashbrowns. They messed up my wife's biscuit by pouring on gravy over it, which she didn't order. The waitress pointed it out and asked if she would like another but we waited for so long we didn't bother.         Just little things that shouldn't be blown out of proportion but I can honestly do better food at home. Its too bad, I was hoping this would a nice place to go every weekend. Sorry won't be coming back

YNY040uvsE7J27y-m32-bg.text: It was my guy's turn to choose a place to eat (yes, he gets a turn ). Intrigued by the name, he chose Rise & Shine - A Steak & Eggs Place. Two of his most favorite things! Score!  I couldn't decide what I wanted & 'everything' wasn't an option, so I let him choose our meals! Haha. We usually end up sharing, anyway   We got the steak and eggs with hash browns and the breakfast burrito, which was sooooo huge & came with rice, beans, avocado, salsa, & both green and red sauce.   Everything was absolutely amazing! I want to emphasize again that the burrito was massive. Definitely enough to share. It was also very delicious. The steak was cooked as we asked (medium rare) & it was seasoned very nicely too. As a side, we got the cup-o-bread (I think that's what it's called) & it was warm & fresh. That cream cheese dipping sauce was so yum, I wanted more!   Food was amazing, service friendly & prompt (love that they're in their pj's too!). Would recommend to friends & visit again when we come back from Hawaii!

eUkTLzxhPIjAPDrZE-H5Lw.text: We were on our way out of Vegas and I was looking for a good breakfast spot. I found this on yelp and decided to try it. I ordered the ribeye steak and it was delicious! The options are so great, so diverse for everyone's needs. Your steak eaters, yogurt parfaits for your health nuts. I loved the coffee and the bread in a cup. The decor is so cute and unique. The waiters wear pajamas, which I thought was a very unique touch. It felt homey and I can't wait to go again when I'm in town! The only downside is that I felt it was expensive. I didn't pay attention and let my 5 yr old order OJ. Well it's fresh squeezed so it ended up costing more than my coffee! The bill was over $60 for a family of 5 and that's after two kids shared a plate and my oldest daughter and I shared a plate. Just come prepared to drop a nice dollar. The kids waffle was delicious but not fluffy enough and very small portion. It was hard and crispy.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread in a cup and regular coffee, so good!

NGdprkjVSQrgqPqIee3T6Q.text: WOW!  What an awesome breakfast/lunch/brunch place!  They're only open for these three meals and close pretty early in the day (I think they close at 3:00pm).  Inside this simple exterior tucked in a strip mall you'll find some excellent food.  The inside is similarly simple but with a warm, comfortable feel.  There is a small outside patio area with tables they will setup for you with an umbrella to shield you from the desert sun.  This is ideal if you want to dine with your four legged friend.  The servers wear pajamas!  It's True!  What a fun little touch.  They seemed very friendly as well, and drinks were kept topped up.  The food was awesome.  I recommend their ultimate steak and eggs featuring two or three eggs, hash browns, steak, and a bread choice.  I went for scrambled eggs.  These were just OK; the consistency was kind of... solid.  Sort of like when you scoop them out of a hot tray at a buffet.  The hash browns were very good.  Crispy, crunchy, and actually seasoned instead of just salty.  The steak... wow!  I did not expect it to be such good quality.  It was marbled but not overly fatty, and it was tender and tasty.  I ate the whole thing, and I'm not even a huge steak fan!  Do yourself a favor and try the pot of bread choice.  Think of a small cinnamon roll served in a teacup and you'll get the idea.  It's just enough for a bit of sweetness without eating a huge cinnamon roll.  Given the quality and quantity of food it's a bargain at $14.95 ($16.95 with three eggs).  Rise and Shine was awesome!  Give it a try!

h03RHehdesPmwpMidAHguQ.text: Wow the chicken here is good, I totally wasn't expecting that at all as this was a totally random stop that I just went with even though it wouldn't have been my first choice. That being said, after eating here, yeah, I'd totally recommend it and go back!   Here's what I ordered: - Grilled Chicken - Tomato - Lettuce - Fried Egg - Double Avocado - Grilled Onions   This combo was BOMB and the chicken was seasoned so dang perfectly I would have loved to have a few more breasts!!   While a few components of my meal were missing when first delivered, our server rushed back to get them- and added extra to the mix! Breakfast/lunch turned out to be delicious and the perfect portion size for my hunger levels!
