ev7_IlcI5gwO9jG6xtJfmQ.text: Just so so, overall. It's a cute little place with hanging flowers made from umbrellas, which gives you a comfy, garden type of vibe. Ordered a build your own omelet but I didn't realize I literally had to build it lol! My point being that I ordered one with American cheese, cheddar cheese and salsa. It came out with the cheese in it but the salsa was off to the side in a little bowl which I actually at first just thought it was extra or something. When I cut into it, it was clear that the salsa was for me to open up the omelette and put the salsa in myself which seems to completely defeat the purpose of an omelette.... in my opinion. Who orders an omelette to open it up and butcher it? Then we had to wait for two orders of toast to come out and the waitress seemed annoyed at the fact that we had even let her know we didn't get it. I can't say I enjoyed it much overall as far as experience goes.   FOOD: Build your own omelette is a not what it's all "cracked up to be"  :) The food is tasty but I think I was a bit salty that I had to build my own omelette.   AMBIANCE: Very comfortable and welcoming interior. The staff get to wear their pajamas to work which makes it an even more comfortable and relaxing feel.   SERVICE: Sub-par at best. I didn't like that our waitress seemed annoyed that we were asking for the rest of our order that we were entitled to and paid for..... how is the customer to blame for that?She have off the vibe of a nice/nasty attitude, that needs to be adjusted. I would give this place a second chance though.   DRESS CODE: Very casual (The staff gets to wear pajamas to work, need I say more?)

tE3VTTJWD8ljFUa4idWriw.text: Thirty Dollars for two people for breakfast is god dam ridiculous. I guess it is my fault for not looking at the menu price. I just never expected the amount to be that high for something we order all over the West coast for usually $9-11. My wife had Corn Beef Hash. Very small amount that was decent tasting but nothing to let your mom know about. My Chicken Fried Steak was tender but very greasy. The gravy was your basic gravy. My hash browns tasted like they were old and had been sitting on the grill too long.  Now what REALLY pissed me off was when I was placing my order I asked for Rye toast and was told that I had to pay extra for that. WHAT? My dam order costs $16 and I have to pay extra for toast. What a load of crap. Of course my for some lame reason my wife whose order came with toast.  I will never set foot in this place again.

opmDnkx0Hp-V7rwyV5yMQQ.text: Yummy yummy food but wayyy over priced for something I can make at home! Cafe is cute, the servers wear pjs(must be nice ha) but again, the price is what gets me!

p8UHfHiGiCFYN0IxeYDd8A.text: Customer service, food, drinks, music, & the vibe was GREAT !!! Hope they open one in LA with those same qualities

gMStrMWJFz1XwQZICArK-A.text: Suuuuuuuper fucking great. Delicious food, obviously a great atmosphere, and very friendly and efficient staff. Our server, Desiree provided incredible service. She was so so so nice and easy going and got us all the items we asked for, perfect service pretty much. And most importantly, she got our drinks refilled like super speedy, which really means a lot bc no meal can be enjoyed when you're thirsty. So thanks again, Desiree (hope I spelled your name correctly) and I 100% reccomend this place to any and everyone.

77TASUnESkjzghfB508i2A.text: Went to breakfast here with a friend, as everyone raves about the food I was excited to try the place while I was in town. My complaint was that I ordered corned beef hash and it had more potatoes ( 95% )than I have ever seen in hash and you needed a magnifying glass and tweezers to find the corned beef. When I asked the waitress she apologized and said it is portioned out and pre made. My advice is if you are going to serve corned beef hash make sure there is corned beef in it after all it is called CORNED BEEF hash not Potatoes with a sprinkling of corned beef, I had ordered it as I have to eat low carb high protein. I ended up with bangers and bacon and high was good but not what I really wanted. I am willing to try this again I just hope they fix the corned beef issue

ySbeypd4eNJGBUE-EVjkFA.text: Horrible food today.  Daughter and I ordered  Ribeye and eggs and got two totally burnt un edible pieces of meat.  The manager refused to do anything about.  What a waste of money.  Over priced and bad service.  Terrible experience!

izFB1IKI8e68dUR66lNMxA.text: i am a regular here at Rise & Shine. Every weekend i come in to see emily and she is the sweetest girl. she was on top of her job and was able to split the check for me and my friends. definitely recommend coming here.

htTefavI766--bMGePXW3A.text: This place is bomb !!! The food is great for the price. On arrival the place was packed. Luckily the host was able to sit us a party of six in 10 minutes. I definitely don't regret taking my husband for breakfast in celebration of his birthday.

jnSwoFXYaCHzzjSSPY47PA.text: I know this place does well and they have good food because I go there often but, just had the worst experience!!!!!! Called in my order they said be ready in 10min so I waited 10min and drove over. The girl at the host stand said my order was not ready I said okay. So I sat down and I'am the only customer there at 2:30. I'm watching the girl tell me that my food not ready go sit down and eat and then I see the cooks take the pancake batter and barely start to make my pancakes. It's been 20 min and you just now start my order!!!!!             Can't wait for Denny's to open up at least the stoner cooks will have my food ready !!! wfzinP6Hh5qKHJU9EvGkZQ.text: Yesterday, my family and I went to "Rise and Shine" It was packed with people the entire time we were there therefore we had to wait for 25-30 minutes We enjoyed the food overall and left after a hour or two. The only thing that they ate that we didn't was the watermelon mixed with strawberry "fresh juice" drink. Obviously this juice wasn't as fresh as they said it was. Definitely will not be going to this place again.

y4ncPYswXX27N4ok3oJa1w.text: Less than one star if I could. How's the food? Couldn't tell ya, mainly cuz we never saw our server. Got seated...and waited....and waited...and waited. Nl1B0i3mFuuEi9O65mFNlA.text: If you're into the iHop/Denny's style breakfast you will love this place. Imagine a full breakfast at one of cheap diners and the turn up the quality a few notches and you have Rise and Shine.   I'm not much a steak person for breakfast so I can't comment there, but I did have the biscuits and gravy, bacon, eggs over easy and scrambled, and crunchy French toast. I regret not snapping a photo of the spread. Everything came out hot and fresh at the same time. Oh, also make sure to get the fresh squeezed orange juice, you won't regret it.   Rise and Shine doesn't have the flashy-ness of anything on the strip but the quality is 100% there. I will definitely be coming here again on my next trip to Vegas.

coYgGVROnU1j04HFaVGAGg.text: My Family has been coming to this Restaurant for years now. The chicken and waffles and bacon stuffed French toast are my favorite.  I love the new juice station with fresh pressed juices. Great idea. The carrot one is delicious. Rae'ven has helped us the last couple of times we have been there and has done a great job.

Fq-l3qoK4A2yC6dQN34LlA.text: This place has never done me wrong. Staff is friendly. It's a chillax vibe with the pajamas. Good good. It's Beene great experience! I've taken my friends here and multiple occasions and always recommend getting the cup o bread no matter   Second review! Had to just share my second experience here! This plAce is just amazing. It's high quality food and the portions are huge. It's a country fried New York steak and eggs, not that bottom round shizz. Gabe has coincidentally has been our server both times at the same table. The dude definitely puts the word shine in the restaurants name! Keep killin it Gabe

r1rVWsvIYm_PiVEZEgORiw.text: Very cute breakfast place. Amazing food!  I'm sitting here drafting this review as I watch my son finishing our breakfast. It makes me a bit sad that this place is so far from my home. I drove here from Henderson, its located on Southern Highlands Pkwy & Cactus. If it was close, I'd be the Duchess...fast! And weigh much more, probably...  I was a waitress back in the day at locally owned restaurants like Rise & Shine, and as I giggle watching these ladies serve food dressed in flannel pajamas, all I wondered was "Why didn't I work at a place where pjs were the uniform?!?!" How much more comfortable can you make it, right?! So you can imagine, it definitely has a warm feeling. The smell of French toast and coffee and cinnamon gets your nose up as you walk in the door.   The menu - you can order your standards. Omelets, pancakes, bacon & eggs. Then you see Crunch Cinnamon Raisin French Toast and Spiced Rubbed Rib Eye Chilaquiles, Fried Chicken and Waffles, and homemade Corned Beef Hash.   What else? Most egg plates come with your choice of toast, biscuit, or the ever popular pot of bread. Very adorable little round loaf of slightly cinnamon gooey deliciousness seem to be on many tables during my visits.   The drinks - freshly squeezed orange juice is always a favorite of mine I share with my son. But I had to try their French press coffee after reading about it. A generous serving is brought to your table, accompanied by a sand hourglass, with three separate colored sands. You decide which sand to follow to determine how strong you want your coffee. Love it!! (see photo if you can't picture what I'm saying)  I haven't dined here for lunch, but I slightly glanced at it while drooling over the breakfast choices. If you're not in the mood for breakfast, like their current special, Baked Blueberry Pecan French Toast Casserole or my personal favorite, Make-Your-Own Yogurt Parfait, you can choose from burgers, salads, panini sandwiches, and daily specials like meatloaf, fish & chips, and chicken broccoli pot pie, served until they run out. They also offer a few kid's plates, however, if you have a toddler like me, the generous portions they serve is more than enough to share! Prices are decent, the service I've received have been warm, inviting, and prompt.   I think if the next few visits are as awesome as my previous ones, they definitely warrant a 5-star review. For now, it is far to drive to, and I do wish they offered lighter healthier options, too. Do I end up ordering them? Not much. But I like having the choice when I'm feeling weight-conscious on those rare occasions. Nonetheless, I'm a big fan of Rise & Shine's yummy breakfasts!

G6I3jjuGxKkwQSlfc7jdoA.text: My husband and I always comes here for breakfast when we are in town we always seat by the counter and watch the cooks prepare the awesome meals. Service is excellent the staff are friendly and very attentive. Food is served large portions we always spit the Steak  and Eggs Which is perfect and delicious. Can't go to any other breakfast place except here has variety of plates to choose from the menu don't forget to try the Biscuits n Gravy and pressed coffee excellent.

ss0dgpoyKPLvZPcnXc5xgw.text: Been here twice.  Both times were excellent and we recommend this place to anyone in the south point area.

n4zDzy0pnQzmZUU8hLftyQ.text: I like to give some credit where credit is due. But, there's not one thing that impressed me or even remotely satisfied me about this place.   To say that I'll never come back is an understatement. I want the 2.5 hours of my life back with it. We arrived at 950 and were given a 15 minutes wait time, we were sat at 1041. That's right,  almost 50 minutes later. The only reason we waited was because of the great reviews. I'm willing to give some time for something delicious without a problem. Again, it was a Sunday, so a wait is expected, but I counted 3 groups before us who I overheard complain of the wait. ..one waited close to an hour! If my meal had been mildly satisfying I wouldn't be giving 1 star.  By the time we were sat, we were crazy hungry. So, you would think that because we were starving ANYTHING would taste like heaven!  There were 5 of us, and 2 ordered two meal options to share, so we ordered 7 different things. I don't even remember how long the food took, but it definitely wasn't a reasonable amount. I'll start by saying 2 ordered ribeye option and we left half of it on our plate.  I've never had such disappointing ribeye in my life. And my father who never complains, commented on the quality. I don't remember what came on the side with it because everything on that plate was a total dissapointment. The burrito my boyfriend ordered was pretty to look at, but even with the handful of ingredients was nothing but a bland mess. We get a "dessert" pancake that we had one bite of and didn't take home, which we always do because I hate wasting food but there was no saving that thing to eat later.   Considering you pay about $11-16 per dish, I would think you get something well worth your money. I'm thinking now, their hope is to starve people with the wait in hopes they're so hungry at the end they just inhale everything and say it tasted delicious.   Either way, don't take my word, eat here then drive down a bit further and try something else. There's a plethora of restaurants within a couple miles, some good, this one terrible. Also, please stop with the pajama uniform. It's not cute. I couldn't tell which waitress was awake and which rolled right out of bed. Some of those pajamas looked pretty gross. The staff looked more disheveled than the customers.

fY8XaTQpOL_CTRsgqmDopg.text: First time here, it's busy but food is good.  They are not stingy, food portion is a good size and not like other places where you only see your food in the middle of the plate.  Staffs are friendly, they all wear PJ, makes you feel warmth and cozy.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. First time here, this place is busy but good is good. They are not stingy with their portion like other places, it&#39;s worth the wait!

Qd_oHseqHrDCuzL1l3mn4w.text: Stop by on the way home from Las Vegas. Everything looked amazing and what we ordered was excellent. Our service from Gilbert was fantastic, he made sure that our experience was pleasant and enjoyable. The food was delicious and very flavorful without being overpowering.  I will definitely be stopping by my next trip through.

DPQ-MZ-rdDmDVklsyZLlUw.text: Yelp- you once again helped me find my new favorite breakfast place (in Las Vegas anyway)!  I found this place using my mobile search app, and I must say I am damn glad I did.  First of all, the atmosphere is darling- bright sunny yellow walls, cute parasol light fixtures hanging from the ceiling, it just made you feel more cheerful walking through the door.   The servers were all on point, and maybe that is because they are extra comfy- all of the servers are working in their PJ's.    Now for the important part- the food.    I ordered the chilaquiles and eggs. They didn't dissapoint.  Eggs cooked perfectly atop perfectly cooked tortilla chips softened in a tangy but not too spicy tomato sauce.   My Son put the hurt on a huge portion of chicken and waffles.  He was also impressed that they did little things like warming the syrup.   My daughter ordered a spinach/mushroom/swiss omelette.  She said it was delicious and not "too" cheesy.  My husband ordered the english banger sausage and eggs.  He said that the sausage was a bit too mild, and could have been a little more savory.   If there was anything that I could say could improve is explaining to the customers the unique things that the restaurant offers-  The server asked us if we wanted toast, muffin or what sounded like "powder bread" .  None of us knew what the hell that was, so nobody ordered it.   It was only later that I noticed these cute little individual breads baked in tiny little terra cotta pots sitting in the pass.   I would have definitely ordered this just to give something new a try.  Something that could have been avoided with a little enunciation.

uIHeBkPpazsMAslqqnVDJA.text: We came here about a month ago based on ratings and were not disappointed. Staff was good and food was great. It's cool that they wear pajamas. Will come again for a third time next time we are in town.

2a7rEr0F3ARlzX6b7bOGyw.text: Found this breakfast spot on yelp based on the reviews. After waiting for an hour for a table, the waitress told us that they were out of pot of bread. The one reason I wanted to try the restaurant was for that bread. Disappointed, we ordered peanut butter and blueberry French toast and a steak Benedict. The food came out quickly and the steak was prepared pretty close to perfect. The food was amazing the coffee was quite delicious and the service was excellent. As we sat around chit chatting after our meal, the waitress brought out a fresh and hot pot of bread! She surprised us all and created a WOW moment! The bread was delicious and perfect even though we were stuffed, we made sure to eat it all up! I would definitely return and recommend this little gem of a breakfast place! There is no doubt why they were voted a best of the best!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot of bread! Best thing ever!

2vn9EG0p7K9nT7e6oILh4Q.text: Delicious food that is worth the long wait. We have tried everything from pancakes to biscuits and gravy and their dishes have all been winners.   Check out the cute little gift shop. Fun stuff!  Also, there is a fresh juice bar. Yum!

1ZdArPgwODnQTuEtHRXQjg.text: Spectacular!  Everything we ordered was incredible and the service was outstanding!  We went on a Friday late morning had no wait at all.  But it was pretty full at that hour so I would imagine weekends would have a wait.  There was very little space to sit and wait inside, so I'm glad we didn't get stuck waiting out in the heat :)  First of all, you HAVE to get the pot of bread as your accompanying starch.  Holy crap, it is freaking awesome!  It's a biscuit and a cinnamon roll smashed together and then baked in a coffee cup.  Slather it with some butter and you're in heaven.  I ordered the chicken fried steak, which was a gamble since I'm from Texas and have a pretty high bar.  It was SO good!  Really tender with a delicious coating!  Only complaint is that the coating didn't adhere very well to the steak but that's really just a quibble :)  It came with eggs and cream pepper gravy, yum yum!  I also got one of their smoothies which took forever to come out, but it was really delicious.  My husband order the rib eye chilaquiles and it was just as good as some of the ones we've gotten in Mexico.  We were super impressed!  The decor was a bit hokey but cute.  They have flower umbrellas inverted and hanging from the ceiling.  It helped transform the location from a strip mall to something more inviting.    Finally, the service was super attentive and prompt.    Overall, we loved it and highly recommend it!  We definitely will be hitting this up next time we're in Vegas!

CG-RwEg0F2qZHm-vU-EScg.text: We came to this place with our son and d-in-law, and wow! The staff is so cool - friendly, helpful, offering suggestions to newcomers. When you come, ask for Lisa or Riley. But heck, all the staff seems great.   The decor is incredibly imaginative. The ceiling fans all have umbrella-like covers that are large flower prints - dahlias, chrysanthemums, others. The wall colors are vibrant. Located in a strip mall, the restaurant is modest size. It's also quite popular, so don't be surprised to wait for a table.  However long your wait, it's worth it. The food is sublime. Rise and Shine bills itself as a steak-and-eggs place, so I ordered steak and eggs. My half pound ribeye was perfectly done and just great flavor. I asked Lisa the secret. She said the steaks are seasoned with salt, pepper, garlic and coffee grounds. She said the delicious hash browns had the same seasonings except substitute shallots for coffee grounds.   Your order comes with a choice of breads: get the "pot of bread," as unique an offering as there is. It's a cinnamon roll baked in a coffee cup. Tip the cup and out comes the roll; apply butter and enjoy!  Chicken and waffles is also on the menu; the waffle is light and terrific with the cinnamon-infused syrup. The chicken breast is pounded thin, breaded and flash fried to a crispy delight, moist and tender and not greasy at all.   How about the coffee: choose from an Italian blend, or French press. The French press comes with a three-tube hourglass that allows you to gauge the strength of your coffee.   An important part of the dining experience is your server. He or she can make or break your meal. The servers here are clad in pajamas which are colorful and clearly comfortable. Lisa was an integral part of our experience. She engaged with us, laughed, joked, teased and was teased in return. She took excellent care of us.   In a city full of great restaurants and celebrity chefs, this small family owned and operated restaurant is a gem.

IuP2-3yBnhpFk-Vo7Z6qiw.text: This place is very spacious. Me and my aunt went on a Sunday and had a little bit of a wait but the food makes up for it. It's reasonably priced except for the drinks. The oj is about $5 a glass. My aunt had the French pressed coffee which she says is the best coffee she's had in her entire life. A must go

xnhYtWP3EDGuS60VoPps3g.text: We had to wait a while for our table, yuck...  But the food was top notch.  I had the chicken fried steak and egg breakfast, then skipped lunch!  Yum

70kp0Hb3nmhmSmeU7mEBTQ.text: I really want to give this place more stars but after two mediocre experiences, I have to settle at three. Both times the food has been good (the French press coffee is very nice), it's very cute inside and I love that the staff is wearing pajamas. It's the service that has been the disappointment. This last time we got in right after they opened and had zero wait getting seated. But then we had to wait more than 40 minutes for our food (a long time with a hungry 2 year old) our server didn't even make eye contact when she was talking or supposed to be listening, we had to consistently ask for refills, toast that was supposed to come with breakfast, creamer etc. and the bathroom was in a pretty dismal state. Also no biggie but would be nice if they would add non fat milk to the menu.   Lastly, we went on Mother's Day and they handed out roses to every mother but me! I didn't want to ask, "hey, can I have a flower too??" I had the damn baby and I want my rose! ;) I'm pretty sure our waitress just wasn't paying any attention but I felt like the black sheep, ha.  I might give it a third go to see if it's the charm but honestly, I left feeling like I'd have had a better experience at an IHOP and would have spent less.

0RKk5XcINTbP1vwp2EaTgA.text: Probably the best breakfast I had in Vegas. Unbelievable food with great prices. Such a refreshing break from the food on the strip. Definitely have to go back for more.

ofYOVlQk2Hr2g145KsHJ4g.text: I consider myself a connoisseur of corned beef hash, finding myself ordering it almost every breakfast restaurant I go, often being greatly disappointed with the dog food-like slop I am frequently served which is lacking in color, flavor, and texture.    However, my trip to Rise & Shine a steak and egg place provided me with one of the best corned beef hash entrees I've ever had. The pulled corned beef had a great sear on it with a nice malliard browning along with some caramelized onions, red skin potatoes, and two eggs over easy and I was in corned beef nirvana.  The owners really spent some time perfecting this simple yet amazing dish.  The place is quaint with a creative decor and spinning umbrellas line the ceiling, a friendly homey staff and lavazza coffee, fresh pressed orange juice made fresh daily make it a breakfast spot not to miss!  Rumor is they are opening up another one in summerlin.  Can't wait to try it!

_iWm4rUAvmSmS0_jf3s75g.text: Super yummy and they are willing to personalize their dishes for your taste. Super casual and the restaurant is really cute ! The servers also wear pajamas!:),

FX3MddOcs8-D5DVTltID3g.text: Wow.... The food here is AMAZING. I ordered the steak & chilaquiles to try it out and they give you a whole steak cooked/seasoned perfectly! Fresh watermelon& strawberry, orange, or green juice. Our waitress was really friendly as well. If you're in Vegas this is a MUST try. I look forward to coming back & im so excited I found my go to breakfast place in Vegas. You cannot beat the quality of this food.

wixtCzw9MGMFYfmjnUAdiA.text: Went here for a nice breakfast on our way out of Vegas. The ambiance is nice and relaxing.  Servers wear pajamas and invite the guests to do the same. The pot of bread was great as others have commented, but, the best offering, WARMED SYRUP. Such a sumple concept that so many get wrong.   Daughter had chcken and waffles, yum, tasted kinda like pancake batter on the chicken. Baby girl ordered chicken fried steak which did not disappoint.  The gravy is served in ramekins on the side. Hb had corn beef hash which was disappointing. Had a lemony taste to it. Unpleasant.  I had the crunchy french toast, wow! Never thought I'd enjoy it, but, it was great as well.   Overall, can only go four stars due to the lemony corn beef. Riley was a great server, best service we've had sine we've been in Vegas.

hzExGEOM5jBheweaEbF5SA.text: The food does not disappoint. The patty melt and fries with the added rosemary on the fries were delicious. The chicken and waffles were some of the best I have had and I go to roscoes chicken and waffles.

The girl up front seating people had to step up and ended up doing more than our waiter. On top of that, our food was sitting under the heater for so long that everything dried out and got hard. Never coming here again.

S5cVFzDpAubB5G-mXuHNpA.text: This is the 2nd review I've given to this cute and charming hideaway, and they certainly deserve it!    Their food is fantastic!!! I love the presentation, wait staff, hostesses, and their little clay pot of cinnamon bread is mouth watering! The last time I posted, the new girl Shannon has now settled right in, and we love her!   I would like to post a photo of one of my breakfast platters on here, but not sure how. The portions are generous, food is fresh, and their coffee is the bomb!!    When I see someone who writes a negative review for something so little like they had to "wait" oh my, have you ever been to Hash House A Go-Go? I mean come on folks, that's the reason why people wait because it's that freakin good! What what the heck do people expect? Restaurants have bad days once in a while too, sometimes things don't go perfect everyday, and NO, the breakfast doesn't come on a silver platter for all you snobs out there! This is the real deal, real food, real people, and it's a 10 Spot!! Just sayin... : )

Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I ate it All!
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fit for a KING!!

ba-98XKZqZTNf7wcXPRlQQ.text: In every way, this place is 5-star. The menu offers a wide variety of sweet (the cinnamon crunch French toast was the best French toast I've ever had-no exaggeration) and savory (country fried steak and eggs-yummmm!!!). Our waitress, Laurel, was friendly and informative without being intrusive. And the decor was well thought-out with plenty of room for each party (i.e., you're not elbow to elbow with the table next to you). Definitely coming back...and bringing friends and family with me!

jh42-ytkQdn96zSffv8doQ.text: I love this place for breakfasts. Expect a wait (20-30 minutes) on the weekend as there are only about 25 tables.   Best breakfast food in Southern Highlands. I especially like the omelets, and banger sausage. Lots of my friends like the pot of bread, but I'm not a big fan. I'd rather they go all the way and make it a cinnamon roll.   Coffee is excellent, they have French press along with drip. I prefer the press, but typical come with my 3 year old so I don't like the large pot of hot liquid.   Rise and Shine also has out door seating. It's on the west side of the building so early it gets shade. Nice in the summer. Also good for the morning health nuts who finish bicycle rides or runs here.

erqHXM1AT_r7j1ZXX7b_og.text: Eggs Benedict with balsamic is amaaaazing! Great customer service and low wait times for seating and food delivery. Check this place out for a great breakfast!

E5SX6iTMDnw2b9h7cmSTnQ.text: Wow! Talk about generous portions, this place was very good.  We found it on Yelp and the other reviews were right on. From the pajama clad servers, to the pleasant atmosphere, I'd return here again and again. The prices were not inexpensive, but the food was tasty and ample. From pancakes to French toast, OJ that tasted fresh squeezed (I don't know if it actually was) and coffee that was satisfying, the experience was good and worth going out of your way for.

8PS6pzNQDQsh9IoEpd1kpg.text: Decor is one of a kind just like the server attire Food is on point... Cooked in just the right amount of time. Coffee is great.. Staff friendly. In a location you wouldn't expect to find. All in all it's great. Definitely give the place a shot, it'll impress. The country fried steak is wonderful

WNjuimULzrug8Z2nU4no7w.text: Went in today,  the day before Thanksgiving, and the service was extremely slow.  In addition,  this place has an obsession with beans.  Beans in their breakfast burrito and an extra side of beans.  Country Cafe is 10x better than this place and I would never recommend it to anyone.   Sorry just NOT good at all.

_l_ZpitlPZzNeqh_5s7_Qw.text: What can I say great breakfast. Good lunch options.  Large portions and good coffee. Don't skip the pot o bread it is yummy.  Steak chiliquilles (sp?) Is very good. Breakfast burritos are large and tasty.  Why only four stars you ask.   Well the salsa looks feels and tastes like pace brand salsa The chicken fried steak.  Well this is hard for me because I am from Texas and have grown accustomed to good chicken fried steak.  The one served here looks like a chicken fried steak. The cream gravy is good but every time I've had it here they didn't trim the fat.  Nothing worse than cutting a piece off and the first bite bieng oddly chewie. All in all if you live nearby you must try the rise and shine.  Just stay aeay from the chicken fried steak.... unless you just don't know any better.

3S-jVPSzsddN1EzvsZlayg.text: We went here because Yelp told us it was the breakfast place closest to where we were staying.  Truth be told, I'd be willing to drive for hours to eat here. We came around 10 a.m. We waited about 30 minutes to be seated, but once we were seated, the service and fast and attentive. I ordered the chicken and waffles and oh my goodness. I've never had a better breakfast in my life. The breading on the chicken was light, crispy, and perfectly seasoned. The chicken was tender and juicy and a great contrast to the warm and fluffy waffle. The maple syrup was just buttery enough to tie it all together. I already want to go back for more. We will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and Waffles at Rise &amp; Shine. Probably the best breakfast meal I&#39;ve ever eaten in my life. Get it. You will not be sorry.

gLfix7k0KZdVjwTa9TIX6g.text: I wasnt impressed. Service was slow...like slooooooooow. I ask for medium steak it came out well done my hashbrowns were just soggy potatoes on my plate . Thw omelette was great ill give them that and the french pressed coffee was amazing also but I might not go back.

tfZlh_Ic_Q2f-3S_xgXJaQ.text: We are from chicago here in Vegas on vacation. This restaurant was suggested by the resort staff. We both had the ultimate steak. Coffee, pineapple banana smoothie, and the Orange juice. It was the best steak I've had yet. The food was excellent. Our server brode had the best service. I hope they franchise out to chicago

cvCJnph0ty9Pcr9sAsjx8Q.text: I really like this place since it's so close to my home.  The food is good, the people are friendly.  However, when you see all the servers handling dirty dishes and then grab the toast out of the toaster with their bare hands, that just won't work for me.  I quit going there about 2 years ago for this very reason.  Then a friend told me they had quit doing that so I went back about 2 weeks ago.  Unfortunately they're still doing it.  I brought it to my servers attention and he said "Oh yeah, we're not supposed to be doing that.  I'll get you some more and I'll use gloves this time." Obviously, what goes on behind the scenes is probably much worse that this, but when they do it in front of you, it just makes you wonder how bad it really is behind the counters.  I'm done.  I wonder how many others observe this activity and just don't come back rather than saying anything.

zX3mAO-Jb7EoZyUJkoUFxQ.text: This place was great. I ordered their steak and eggs breakfast combo. Their steak alone was 5 stars for sure. However the eggs didn't really have a taste and the hash browns were good...not great. I do recommend this place for their steak, it was incredibly delicious. Staff was great as well.

s_mGT8U4AkEpAz0rh-3GTw.text: I live right around the corner, and my son and I love coming to eat for brunches. He stares at the umbrella, colors with crayons, and eats tons of eggs and bacon. Bonus, you can build your own omelette so I stuff it with veggies. I'm not a big fan of sugary breakfast items, so I can't say anything about those, sorry.  I CAN say that despite the slightly pricey entrees, I still keep coming back. Always joyful service (and their uniforms are PJs!), delicious coffee press, unique dishware, and their hash browns are my favorite. You can try the other breakfast places people usually frequent, but I LOVE Rise and Shine.

ab_9trTk5P9gerZDI2QfrQ.text: Waitstaff...awesome.  Food...excellent. Great selection and all steak (even if you get steak in your burrito) is cooked to order.  Only downside...not a big enough place...if there were more tables, we wouldn't have to wait as long on weekend mornings!

LXRLFmn1Wpazuzyw20oRAQ.text: It's a wonderful place! Love the food and the staff are always warm and friendly! We try and make it once a week. The portions are large and delicious. Kinda pricey but that is because SH rent is so high. Two  thumbs up!!

IzrN30HLlrI22ConEms8MA.text: this place was great, everyone was super friendly, and I was a little jealous that the servers were running around in PJ's and I was wearing normal clothes.   the food was really good, I got the French Toast, it was super delicious. definitely want to go back and try the other stuff on the menu

cSAInmo9akp653Foh9nb3w.text: Huge breakfast portions but very good. You could easily split a dish with someone. We came during a weekday so it wasn't overly busy. Service was great.

PI4t11w59Gj5LAmx2RZcFA.text: This place is pretty good. The wait time to be seated is always long since the restaurant is so small but they do have good food. Southern Highlands needed a breakfast place in that shopping center and Im glad they opened it there. It beats driving all the way to go to Ihop or Dennys on Las Vegas Blvd.

n5s4-CAVbwRR39daFwJJrA.text: I have to say, it is nice to have a decent breakfast place in southern highlands finally. it is conveniently located in the middle of southern highlands in the smith's shopping center. it is a quaint little place, with giant sunflowers hanging from the ceiling. the owners of the place are always there and are very very friendly and personable.   They have a good size menu, lots to choose from. Mostly breakfast fares but there are some sandwiches and entree salads as well. The first time I was there i had the corned beef and hash with eggs. It was homemade corned beef hash with big chunks of beef and potatoes. it was seasoned well and was agood portion of food. i also have tried their egg and ham hollandaise. hand-cut ham on top of english muffin and perfectly poached eggs on top. the hollandaise sauce was a little tangy for my taste but was still excellent. I tried my boyfriend's steak and eggs and the steak was really good. very tender and well seasoned.  their food is really great and they have a special menu coming soon for daily specials like homemade meatloaf and braised short ribs, etc. overall a great cozy place to have breakfast with excellent service and good quality food.  p.s. the restaurant owners informed me that they chose not to put televisions in their restaurant wc is amazing.. so many places now have tvs and are so distracting. wout them at least u are able to really enjoy the food and company.

IfPANvjYU79e1oQhk0adNA.text: Damn! Really good. I had chicken waffles w/ eggs biscuit and gravy it was on point. Havent had chicken waffles in years. Will come back when i visit vegas. Ultimate steak and eggs was just as equally as good.

CcphwlioDEs6CbP7FDDUPg.text: Very good hidden gem for breakfast! Nice atmosphere and in the heart of Southern Highlands!

f3fjCxufU1QQXasdYqiq8Q.text: Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place fills the breakfast/brunch void in the Southern Highlands area. It is in the same shopping center as Off the Strip Just Real Food, which offers brunch but only on Sundays. It just opened yesterday and appears to already be a hit with the locals.  There is a wide selection of breakfast and lunch options but, as their name suggests, it is all about their steak and eggs. My husband ordered the Southern Style Chicken Fried Steak ($10.95), his usual order that is usually the determining factor in whether a breakfast joint is worth it. I ordered the Crispy Fried Chicken Breast and Waffles ($11.25).  Both dishes were huge and very filling. The chicken fried steak was good but, according to the husband, doesn't live up to his standards because the batter wasn't flavorful enough. I really enjoyed my chicken and waffles. The breast was moist and the batter was light and airy. The Belgian waffle was delicious as was the maple syrup.  The decor is nice with mosaic walls and flower umbrellas hanging from the ceiling. The service was prompt and decent considering they just opened the day before. I give this place a 3  1/2 stars because it is definitely worth trying but I still prefer other breakfast/brunch places such as The Original Pancake House and The Egg & I. I do see this restaurant thriving in this area because I predict there will be regulars that will patronize this place.

xMabXlUlIQkmNn2NjnIOlw.text: Food is delicious, price is kinda high for breakfast place but the service is excellent & the ambiance gives an uplifting mood.

M1Qw4V71--2MJ7tx0YzZmQ.text: Really long wait this morning. Orders were getting lost, customers were waiting a really long time, and there was lots of complaining from the cook. This is only my second chance to try this restaurant and will probably be the last. To start off my experience, my wife and I were asked to wait for a seat. Normally, this is no problem but I could see at least 4 tables that were clean and nobody sitting at them. Not a big deal as we were in no hurry.  We were seated and taken care of right away. We ordered coffee and water and needed a couple of minutes do decide on our food. My wife ordered the French toast and I ordered biscuits and gravy. For the next twenty minutes we listened to the cook argue with the waitresses and watched customers walk out the front door. Almost 30 ,minutes went by and our food finally arrived. I got scrambled eggs instead of over easy and the waitress fixed it right away. My wife's meal was warm but certainly not hot. As I dug into my biscuits and gravy, I was greeted by crunchy biscuits and a sad excuse for gravy. The biscuits tasted like the kind you would get in a tube of Pillsbury and I needed a knife to cut them. The gravy was clumpy and tasteless. I have been cooking gravy for many years and it looked like the flour, or mix, in this case was thrown in and not blended very well. This was, by far, the worst plate of biscuits and gravy I have every eaten. Biscuits and gravy is a relatively easy dish to do well and it says volumes when a breakfast restaurant cannot do it right. I did let the girl at the register know how disappointed I was with my breakfast and she took it off my bill. That was very cool. My first time to Rise and Shine was pretty good and the second was less than impressive. I was told that the reason the prices were a little high is because of the quality ingredients that were used. I would disagree. It seems like either corners are being cut or the cooks are not happy with their jobs. Either way, this will probably be my last adventure out of the way to come to Rise and Shine..

xnX49dhQJQ4VHpqsydrBig.text: OH LORD!!!! THIS IS THE BOMB PLACE EVER!! I was walkin with my friends to find somethin good and we ended up Rise & Shine! but it was around 2ish almost 3 but the waitress they are so nice to us, no pressure to eat we are chillin and she was so friendly to us! not just service otherwise the food! YUM same price as Ihop, Denny's but the taste and the size are way more taster way more bigger! Definitely recommend this place!!!

SJbNNQFFpM9QJ-BB-qyuQA.text: OMG!!!  Found my fav breakfast place in LV.  Their breakfast is so good you'll want to slap yo.... Someone. Bacon wrapped steak with eggs and truly home made tasting hush browns. Mmmmm good. Than I dug into my wife's order: velvet chocolate pancakes... One bite and I couldn't stop smiling, I forgot 5 bills I lost earlier gambling. World seemed brighter, there was childhood music playing somewhere in a background all of a sudden. It took me whole 5 minutes to come back to reality. Yes, this place will be our regular stop from now on!!

yaICk7r8TegDYDGKtiXVBQ.text: Attendant is very unfriendly.  Her demeanor and attitude she showed when we walked in made us walked out and choose another place to eat.

BJtPCk83aEWKe3EiSStmYQ.text: The ultimate place for comfort food, especially when nursing a hangover or leaving Las Vegas. Off the beaten path but not inconveniently located far off the 15. Worth it.  Come here. Excellent service, very reasonable prices. Oh, and bring your jammies. Totally okay here.

y1bdVQKS61kO-dphEKD5jA.text: Been to this place several times already. Food and service is really good. One thing that disappoints me every time is that they always run out of the "pot of bread" which is what they are known for.

p32lIovLFvm8OgZzeA8L1w.text: This is hands down my favorite place to go for breakfast. Everything is flawless. From the adorable bright, comfy, clean decor to the friendly staff and you guessed it amazing food!   I am an eggs benedict fan - and they most certainly take the cake with their selections of eggs benedict and NY steak.   I have dined at Rise and Shine about 3 times, usually after the morning rush and was always pleased with the service.   Did I mention the fresh homemade lemonade!? GO!

yEPFmnWN6SFfM8ieJe2M6w.text: Found this place on Yelp on our way home from Vegas.  So cute, great service and delicious food. Super fun menu.

WggsXoE5wq45OkfO4s3diA.text: NEVER EVER EVER GO HERE! This place is ridiculous I am not sure if it is bad management or greedy owners, but the service here is awful. There are only a handful of employees which equals a long wait for expensive mediocre food.  The first time I came here was on a Sunday morning so I chalked up the wait and the mediocre food to the fact it was Sunday morning. Today I arrived at 12:00 and waited for 20 minutes to be sat. I was rushed to order as soon as I sat down so I ordered and after an hour of waiting for our food I left the money for my drink on the table and left. I will not be returning and will stick to blueberry hill when  I'm craving breakfast food. If you have two hours to wait then go here but if not I suggest you go SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!!!!!!

LlFgMATyfOJ8Mfo7CAZKpg.text: This place is cute and the staff are friendly!   The food is fine but nothing special really. My husband and I went in yesterday and ordered 2 french press coffees, one orange juice, and 2 omelets. $38 dollars. This place is way over priced. Also it would be great if they had some more healthy options too.   Ive been here about 4 times before and will probably end up here again at some point. The things is for the area they really have no competition.   I want this place to do well but it needs some improving. Either up portions or lower prices. Also sat down at 11:15am and food got to us at 11:55, seriously!! 40 min for an omelette. They also used to have fresh jam but yesterday it was regular plastic containers.

i9j4sMrVjoQJlzZROIssNg.text: Fabulous food, generous portions, and friendly service. The decor and personality of this place is refreshing. A place I'd visit again and again.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum! Crunchy cinnamon French toast!

kdyYfhDqpNlS8Fa5d1aamA.text: Loved this place. Food was good and plentiful and the staff were great. Loved the PJs each one wore and the t-shirts worn by the bus people ("spooning leads to forking") were fun!  I had the breakfast burrito and my husband had the stack of 4 pancakes - both were excellent. Always had hot coffee and wait staff seemed to really like their job. Made me happy to be there.

KEGgdUv781En7jv7vYMI0g.text: A breakfast and brunch cafe that has a family-owned feel to it. That's why I prefer going here as opposed to large chain restaurants. The waiters wear pajamas and are super casual. My wait for Sunday at 10am was 15 minutes, so definitely not bad. Menu is extensive, and they're known for their bread in a cup which is essentially a mini cinnamon roll with the sauce on the side for dipping.

vAddweCdDYywEhQhs85--A.text: I'm usually hesitant about restaurants with a gimmick, as well as those that I've never been to. Finally decided to go there for breakfast with the family and glad I did.  Portions are HUGE!!  Service is a bit understaffed it looked like but they made up for it in attentiveness.  The food tastes absolutely delicious and as if it was homemade.  The aroma of the place was very pleasing and welcoming. It's very spacious clean. Every staff member was always moving about to take care of something or someone.  I recommend this place for anyone who loves big breakfast/brunch and flavorful food.  5 stars all the way.

QPZX-RXkKg0IdnLgnuGyAQ.text: I am so happy that a valet guy from the M hotel in Vegas told me about this great place to eat had a orange and carrot  juice so yummy and the best chilaquiles and steak that I  ever had I am definitely coming back next time. When I came to Vegas again I am my family I am a picky eater so that's why I loved this establishment thanks everyone you are doing a awesome job keep it up

When it's too loud, the patrons get louder to talk over it... it's a never ending cycle. But it's very RARELY too loud, maybe 1 in 20 visits :P Only brought this up after going through the survey questions.  Also, would love to see them move the checkout register over to the door in the new wing to keep the Check-in crowd and check out crowd sperate. But it's worth the line, even if they don't. :)

Our waitress wasn't the most friendly person but she was reliable and efficient. The menu is huge, however everything was a bit more expensive than I expected. For example, a plain waffle was like $9 but one with fruit was like $11. Considering it wasn't a specialty waffle or novel in any way, that seemed a bit much to me. Overall, everything was good, but not as over-the-top as the yelp reviews made it sound.

It gets your senses going. It came with biscuit but I got charged the gravy on the side and I was not told. If you want a satisfying breakfast, you cannot go wrong with this place.

GT1Sf-1W_eVCQPfnreRPGg.text: We come to rise and shine every Sunday most servers know us by name. After today I don't think we will be back. The server forgot to put the order in for one of the people in my party. We got lousy sorry from the waitress no manager approached our table and no one even offered to take it off the check we had to tell the cashier to take it off cause we never relieved it. Not the way to treat loyal customers we had to go to Ikea so my husband could get something to eat   Update:  We returned to our usual schedule and had breakfast this morning. We love Annalisa the manager and our server Sara as well.   They made us feel welcome again and gave impeccable service.  Food was amazing.  Thank you for having us back again.  We will be back next Sunday.

EtvZyAxHKcRqQjqvIfAcmQ.text: WORTH THE TRIP. My favorite breakfast place, awesome ambiance, AMAZING food, always amazing service. If you're thinking IHOP, spend the same amount of money for an experience and meal that's 10x better! 10/10 would eat again, recommend to everyone I know, always

1uQIs9RYQGrp7DM9QnlbQw.text: this is my favorite place to eat breakfast,the service is exellent, the food is fresh and juicy and perfectly cooked. I recommend that they will not repent of this wonderful place. the pancakes and waffles are the best i have ever eaten, the menu of the lunch time it is very healthy, don't forget this place to share with your family a good breakfast and a good lunch.

JgZDNOPENvVI4kHd-4vXDA.text: First time here everything was delicious. My 10 year ate a big burrito filled with steak and chorizo. The service was also great!

9pvksub_y6NlcVrrR7s2hg.text: Avocado Benedict with crispy muffin probably the best I've had. Fresh OJ and decent coffee however they don't have any milk alternative, no almond milk coconut or even soy. Pancakes were pretty good not great. Pretty busy but the waiter kept his cool was friendly and considerate . The layout of the restaurant wasn't well planned and they sat a family with two newborns in two carriers on the end where the waiters all entered their orders in an iPad on the wall so it was impossible for guests or staff to get through lol. The line to check out starts getting in the way of those waiting for a table and the staff and guests sitting  The cashier was barely alive lol and the host was frazzled. Hectic though so I feel bad for them. They should model after the busiest breakfast restaurant The Egg & I to better systemize everything.

ccXBSp0N0zqWbnUqZYzyWw.text: This place is a must when visiting Vegas! It is a bit of a drive away from the strip but I heard there is a closer location near the strip! Just the ambiance of this restaurant is awesome! I love the interior, the cute flowers in the ceiling and the servers wearing pajamas. It really does give it a unique vibe!   Food was DELICIOUS and  really big portions! Our family ordered the chicken and waffles, pancakes, country fried steak, steak and eggs and honestly, you cannot go wrong with any order!   Oh and you cannot leave without trying the bread pot! It certainly is a MUST!   I can't wait to go back to this restaurant! Great service and awesome staff! :)

YlJr-tlIk0pAN9zMnjdgog.text: This place is perfect for brunch and you seriously do not have to worry if you just rolled out of bed, even the servers are in pajamas! They have cute overhead umbrella flowers, and the rest of the decor is really homefeel like.   Our server was really friendly, but a tad slow on bringing back our drinks when the restaurant was not busy. She asked to refill coffee a few times and checked back with us with a smile on.   I ordered the Ham N Eggs Benedict which was very appetizing to look at, who doesn't eat with their eyes first? The ham to English muffin ratio was perfect and the hollandaise sauce was smooth and rich. The hash browns were more on the crispy side,which I prefer. Overall it was a great tasting meal. I would definitely order it again.   I recommend to definitely get the pot of bread, if your meal does not come with it. It's like a less sweeter version of a cinnamon bun in a cup. It was delicious. Just thinking about it makes me salivate. Honestly this bread along with another side choice, & a cup of coffee would be a perfect light breakfast.  It's a little ways out of the main city/strip but definitely worth it for some good old comfort food.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot of bread! Sweet enough without the butter.
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ham N Eggs Benedict.

MFbP1MLkdLwnz5PI0NujGw.text: KIRA KIRA KIRA! This review is for her because she totally put on her A game com for our table! She was so pleasant and so hospitable! She made sure everything was going well with our food. I accidentally dropped my glass and it broke on the table and she came by in a heartbeat to clean it all up! So glad we got her as a server :)  can't wait to come back!

FH3bXEGWkB9qEF1Nmjy_qw.text: This place is the best breakfast spot in Las Vegas! They are known for their steak and eggs and chicken and waffles with cinnamon syrup. Delicious!   On the weekends expect a short wait to get in as this place is always jamming with locals and visitors. Usually 25-30 minutes.   The service is some of the best in Las Vegas with an extremely friendly and accommodating staff.   Make sure to check this place out when having a craving for breakfast. May be the best breakfast spot in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Busy morning at rise and shine! Best coffee ever!

VqIMjDqwPjOsH6M6DMmfrQ.text: This place is now my absolute favorite place. I went there this morning with my daughter and my best friend for the first time. We were greeted and sat immediately. We were served by Ashley who was amazing and went over the menu with us and recommended some delicious dishes. We ordered the chiliqulies ,red velvet pancakes, avocado and egg bagel sandwich and a omelette. The food was so delicious and so was the "go go" drink. I would definitely recommend this place and will for sure be going back frequently. I give this place and our server Ashley a 5 star review!!!! I also need to add I drove from Aliante to Southern Highlights and it was soooo worth the drive!

0RmH1uJdJM9gkKDMcC72jg.text: A bit salty for my liking...but portions are huge and tried their chilequilles...it was good.  The pot of bread was aeesome.  The only odd experience was, our waitress served us caffeinated coffee when i specifically asked her for decaf. And the only reason we found out it was caffeinated was because I had asked for another cup since the coffee was lukewarm!! Lukewarm at 730am?! I've never been served lukewarm coffee!  When i questioned the coffee and asked her if it was decaf for sure,  she was hesitant and had to ask her manager...So this 3 star review is more for the experience with the waitress and coffee fiasco rather than the food...i will not be returning.

qixS2BbUS8nrcb4hRVj4Lw.text: First impressions lasting impressions. The place is decorated whimsically with soothing colors and hanging umbrellas.  The wait staff are wearing pajamas! ...very clever. The wait on this particular Sunday morning was reasonable with a sunny outside patio.  The menu choices were abundant and varietal.  I'm having pancakes "plattered" which adds 2 eggs, meat, and something else.  This place specializes in steak and eggs by the way, which my three companions ordered and took great delight in. I ran an obstacle marathon (Spartan Race) and am craving carbs something terrible.  Side note: this neighborhood is gorgeous, you'll notice all of the trees as soon as you are here; very beautiful.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Servers wear pajamas as their work uniforms.
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A real stack of pancakes.
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chorizo burrito is LARGE!

D6nq6wAhmI3MArL1eKKIUw.text: Ok so if you go here you have to ask for Riley because her service is awesome.  The food is absolutely amazing. Everything from scratch and just good clean food.  The pot of bread... oh my goodness. Not overwhelmingly sweet so you can enjoy the uniqueness of the cinnamon roll baked in a espresso cup  This is definitely my new favorite spot for breakfast when I'm in town.  Been twice already and want to go back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot of bread

UXy-vvi2HbCd30xyHlLu_g.text: I've been here many times I feel as if the quality wasn't there this time. I wasn't satisfied all the way with the dish. (Chilaquiles) it wasn't bad either. Not sure how to really explain everything else was good.

yTZmR-ZchsUAGfUGHPAokg.text: This place is legit, if you are super hungry this is the place, food is hughe, very tasty, the service is great and right on time. Definetely a place to go and spend some time.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Serious breakfast...

36JgODoBdT5RJdddt1ukXw.text: Ambiance: We walked in and were immediately seated by the very friendly host. My husband and I both immediately loved the decor and the color scheme. We especially appreciated that it didn't smell rank and was nice and clean. My 2 year old did his part to rest the patience is staff by throwing his silver dollar pancakes and breaking the plate. The server assured us that it was ok and without our asking, brought us a fresh serving in a kid friendly dish.   Food:  I had the Ultimate Steak and Eggs. My husband had waffles. Everything was seasoned to perfection, tender, fresh, and wrapped in the taste of home. The Green Go Go fresh juice drink was delicious and didn't taste like grass like one would assume. Don't visit Vegas without leaving the strip to visit Rise and Shine!

YOaghGGhCV6JGELjaz1uNg.text: Our new favorite place to eat breakfast!!!! The food was delious and such amazing customer service Venessa was a great server! The pot of bread is a must try along with the Ultimate Steak & Eggs.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love the decorations here super cute!!

PeKvbkPWbjbxtwrXDT3EXQ.text: Amazing experience and the absolute best breakfast we have have ever had! My daughter Paris says they should put a Rise & Shine in EVERY city; then she said every corner.  I had a bacon, egg and ham omelet with hash browns and a bread cup (espresso cup filled with warm cinnamon bread). The omelet was perfect and the hash browns had this amazing taste where you knew spices were involved.   Paris had bacon wrapped steak. Also amazing. We'll be back on every trip!

Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Omelet and hash browns
