ifWe-HjaoBAdSc-Cc1VbGw.text: Love this place!! Absolutely amazing food and service! Always a good experience and a great time for my family and I to come have a delicious meal together. Place is deforested sooo cute also, looks like they put a lot of time and effort in to making it the way it is! Keep it up rise and shine!

Q5mj8gtSTIFfnsxmjSHS-w.text: I heard about this place from a customer. And on fathers day my wife gave me a choice and I decided to try something new and I'm glad I tried rise n shine.  I ordered the chicken n waffles and my wife ordered the rib eye steak n eggs. Both were very delicious! The food alone was 5 stars. The service was exceptional.   I love Roscoe's chicken and waffles in la but we hardly ever go there and I found a chicken n waffles place that rivals Roscoe's!

3zt-7uj-VBiMWulpMDRGDw.text: Well executed food for adults in the vein of "MTO" downtown.  Not the MTO/Hashhouse experience, but somewhat that style. Rather underwhelming for children though! A five and two year old and we had to share the adults' food to satisfy them?  And they normally leave food on the plate. The five dollar half waffle (not Belgian/huge/pick your adjective) was the biggest head scratcher. So much so that we asked the server if it came with anything else to which the answer was an apologetic "no". So either keep the kids at home (if able) or have them split an adult entree (which is well executed). Will we come back now that we know this?  That is a head scratcher too.

psZU63xTkE_Jn6bHU11QdQ.text: Came here as we were searching for a place to eat in Southern Highlands and did a search on Yelp. Ultimate Steak & Eggs is the best breakfast I have had in Vegas for the price. Corned beef hash is amazing and service was friendly. Breakfast seem like it would just be breakfast and you can't make it any better than what it already is but these guys prove that wrong. I have now been here 3 times and everything I have ordered has been top Notch!! Thanks Rise & Shine!!

Q_Sbiy34mdoBAZQPKQYGkw.text: Cute place, great food and descent prices.  I had the chicken fried steak and it was one of the best I've had in Vegas.  The pot of bread was amazing.  Staff is very friendly and place is very clean. Will definitely come back.

0W2anWENoF224Xcl42MCHA.text: I have to say I love this place...breakfast is always wonderful...and best part is everyone is so friendly. I had breakfast here this morning and had to sit outside cause I had my pup...and I have to say they were accommodating to us...and even brought out water for my pup....and even with sitting outside they still took care of us promptly.  We will be here all the time

oYdRsJY3tUeUMapFOBQxXA.text: I should have written this review a long time ago. We HAD been customers of this establishment from the day they opened their doors.  In the beginning, it was great! Great service, Great food, etc... slowly it all started to diminish.  Our last visit was HORRIBLE, we waited forever for the not so busy waitress to take our order, then waited even longer for our food. Never received a refill of coffee the entire time we were there.  I asked the manager when we were leaving if it had changed hands, and he said no.  I wrote a comment card requesting the owner call me. never received a call. When I received their monthly email, I replied to it asking that someone contact me about the HORRIBLE service we received and still never received a call.. Instead they removed me from the email list, because that was the last time I received an email from them  There are MUCH better options in Southern Highlands, this place is WAY WAY overpriced for what you receive... Take your money some place else!

Pp0EjjOBAOqDM8OT-4u3yQ.text: Ooh! I love this place! My husband just discovered it and we've been twice so far. We went to both locations. Great food! Steak & eggs are delicious!! Fresh squeezed orange juice! I also tried the omelette and my daughter had a waffle one time and pancakes the next time. Everything tastes delish! My daughter is super picky but she loves this place, especially because one of the food servers gave her a nice side of whipped cream. Oh and the style inside is really cute. Big flowers hang from the ceiling. Very colorful.

7WnSDL6NVFeEg42iez7puA.text: I have been here 3 times in the last year.  All times it always seems that the waitress I get has the, "hurry up and take your order and I hate my job attitude and never smiles."  Food is great, steak and eggs and pot of gold are my fav.  Eggs benedict are delish too.    Definitely enough food to fill you up for lunch too.

Nrc-RGkdxcMUcHwO58oreg.text: This place is amazing!! The service is great and the food is delicious. I had the Chilaquiles, which truly exceeded my expectations. My mom used to make the dish for me as a kid so I am really happy to find a place that makes them and they're tasty!!   I can't wait to go back and try new stuff!

qXH5aEp-Smxojfp3ddfQgg.text: This place is fantastic!  We ordered the New York Steak Benedict Bagel and the Crunchy Raisin French Toast. What an amazing breakfast. It was delicious! We also had the pressed coffee pot and we were coffee buzzed all day! Go check this place out. It's awesome. They even have cute umbrellas hanging from the ceiling and the servers are wearing pajamas! So adorable!!

GEMZ1vX3O6p4MopcOMO2OA.text: Everything was really great! The peanut butter French toast is a pb&j sandwich, dipped in eggs and cooked up French toast style. Absolutely brilliant! The corned beef hash was made with real beef that did not come out of a can and the pot of bread was just fresh and warm and squishy and wonderful. We sprung for the French press coffee, which was fun, but then we followed up with just some of their regular house brew and it was just as good, if not better than the French press. We waited for over 40 mins on a Saturday morning, so be prepared. I think it was worth the wait though.

iI8T_Uwnzvhlp3HtqSblVw.text: Food and service was awesome.  Highly recommend.  We will return during our next trip to Vegas.

b9u21aeCCWHyzUUbenB_-w.text: Unfortunately we won't be returning until their health grade improves from a C, if at all. We love this place but their cleanliness and food handling demerits are a deal breaker.

YFFyrvW6QdfevfF81PFbQw.text: The place has an amazing menu. My friends and I each order different things and share. The chicken and waffles has to be my favorite. I also enjoyed the french toast. I think we ate here atleast three times while we were in Vegas. Large portions and the prices were decent.

6m71-v24MFqR-2aAqGntlA.text: I've been to this restaurant on a couple of occasions and it's never disappointed me. It has a neat decor and the staff all wear their pajamas.   I ordered the Country Fried Steak and eggs and it's amazing! The steak is cooked perfectly and has a great tasty crunch. I got the hashbrowns on the side along with the "pot of bread". The hashbrowns were good, but nothing too special. The pot of bread was awesome though! It was incredibly fluffy with cinnamon baked in. They put some butter on top and it's perfect!  This is the best breakfast place I've been to in Las Vegas and I will definitely be returning!

jKbemPWg97BwXW_1aKMCew.text: I have eaten here about 15 times in the past 4 months and I have to say this is the very best place I have ever ate breakfast. Everything on the menu is great with plentiful servings, the place is super clean, the waitresses are all very friendly they make you feel good as soon as you walk in the door and their dress code is pajamas "how cool", this place also has a very nice decor.   Highly recommended !

CC4SALuKggsK5x_LUSvF3g.text: All I got to say is the red velvet pancakes are the best pancakes I ever had. Heavenly is the one word i would use to describe them. I rarely write reviews and just wanted share.

uNBadiXEQ0tQm0q757RsSA.text: Best breakfast brunch place!  Their chicken and waffles is to die for, and I love decor and service (who wear cute pajama uniforms). It's like a modern diner feel, and everyone is so friendly. Get their early because by 8:30am it starts getting pack!

Ab8EYtN9phQXHugxXRhmaw.text: My husband and I checked this place out for breakfast last weekend. You will immediately notice that it is super fun and cute inside. There are upside down umbrellas and flowers hanging from the ceiling and the waitresses are dressed in pajamas. The entrance is a bit awkward, as you are greeted there and it is also where you pay so it can get a bit congested. We were greeted and seated within a few minutes.   We quickly decided on food and it was out within no time. My husband indulged in the chicken and waffles. The chicken was cooked perfectly and looked really good. I settled on the Spice Rubbed Rib Eye Steak Chilaquiles. I was envisioning sliced steak on top of my Chiaquiles, as that would be the easiest way to incorporate steak into the dish. Imagine my surprise when I was served an entire steak on the side. However, the steak was a bit fatty and I didn't taste much spice or seasoning. The Chilaquiles were actually pretty good, but there was nothing special or exciting about the flavors. I thought it was a little weird that they served the salsa and sour cream in tiny dishes on the side. I would have liked those to be more incorporated in the dish. But, it was a large portion and I took half of it home. I also chose the Pot of Bread as my side and it was delightful. I loved the look of it when it came to the table. It is a little Terra Cotta pot with a nice fluffy piece of bread rising from it. This was probably the highlight of the meal. The bread had a nice streak of cinnamon flowing through it and was served warm with butter.   Rise & Shine is good and they do have some unique dishes on the menu, but there is nothing mind blowing or innovative about the flavors.

d3guQJ5IEPhWifJgeydxAA.text: First time here and it was awesome. Laurel, our server, is a doll. She was sweet and kind. She made me and my friend feel right at home. My friend had an omelet and a side of pancakes. He ate everything. I ordered fried steak, egg whites, and hash browns. This is my first time having red meat in about three years. The steak was the best I've ever had in Las Vegas. Everything was fresh. Will definitely come back.

DvckaGBJze0bZt2A3iT1RA.text: I would have given this place a 4 1/2 star if possible, but gave it the bump to 5 stars based on location. The menu had enough options, but was not overwhelming like some breakfast places. I went with a basic 2 egg meal and was not disappointed. The sausage was great quality, eggs cooked perfect, and hash browns very tasty. The bread bowl was a nice touch and service excellent. I will be returning to this location frequently...

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread Bowl
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs, Hash Browns, and Sausage.

pCnd81r_f-2r5FxdA2sTiA.text: First of all, I think it's important to say I have been a customer here since the restaurant opened. I am glad it is in our neighborhood, and I think it has the potential to be a cornerstone business in our area of Southern Highlands. I typically order breakfast to go for my family...the same things each time, as we aren't to adventurous in the morning. I really enjoy the selection, location, customer service, and portion sizes, but I have had problems with the consistency in the preparation of dishes from day one.  Some times, our meals are spot on, and other times they are a complete miss. It is a mystery ever time I open the containers as to what we will get. Don't get me wrong...if I order biscuits and gravy, that's what will be in the box. I just don't know if I will have three-day-old microwaved biscuits or fresh. Also, tossing 4 slices of banger sausage into gravy does not a sausage gravy make. Southerners beware, this is pretty far from authentic. Chicken fried steak is pretty awesome every time. Good crunch and spice...huge portion!  I will continue to eat here, because let's be honest...my hangover is not going to feed itself.

KchllnnDZBG3g5LpVzyLqQ.text: I got the chilaquiles. It was good. I love the decor and the concept. Will be back again -after playing at south point :)

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and chilaquiles, pot of bread &amp; steak eggs Benedict
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So cute

VhbZsukcJMbfyUoQr08vjA.text: First time here. It did not disappoint. Great service and I love that the waitstaff wear pajamas. The menu has everything you can imagine for breakfast, and Some unusual ones as well. I will definitely come here again. If you're in or around Southern Highlands I highly recommend this restaurant.

nGheCKdj2l8Bd3StYMjHdA.text: Get some grub. They do get busy at times. Feel a part of the family and fill you stomachs. Nuff sed!

lEP4utTJkSycPjb6Tk6fBg.text: I live a few minutes from restaurant so is convenient but it's really overpriced. The food doesn't impress me but we usually meet with family so it makes it better I guess. Last time I went the workers were not having a good day. There's no manager walking around to make sure everything is fine.  Based on last time I went I will not be going back at least for a long time. Hopefully they improve their food and service. I don't mind paying more for good taste and great service. Good luck if you like your steak medium rare.  I like their fresh juices.

JwgYN0Dr_D_6DQ4XFuiiEw.text: I love right by this place so I come here at least once or twice a week and I can safely say I have experienced the worst as well as the best. They revamped the menu so there are more food choices than there previously were. I love the steak and eggs but sometimes the steak will be over cooked or under cooked depending on the day who is making it. I would stay away from the poached eggs as they are normally undercooked as well. All in all if your meal is prepared right it is a great spot to grab a bite at. The manager doesn't share the wifi password which I find kind of odd, but to each their own. All the good servers usually get better jobs and move on so this place is usually stuck with the bottom of the barrel so to speak. Don't have high expectations coming here and you won't be disappointed, unfortunately I am stuck with this breakfast place until we get some competition on this side of town!

BcTiv1KyRab-_h0ggtL5TA.text: First time at Rise and Shine. The whole family LOVED it!  Lorell is a fabulous server. SO nice and efficient. A definite asset to Rise and Shine. Love the Bangers. We will be back!!

g8NxIeq1y5T6GwOMEffKfQ.text: Thank you to Laurel for taking excellent care of us again. Tried the steak omelette and it was perfectly cooked, steak seasoned great and biscuit was probably one of the best I've had. If you can, go on a weekday, when it is more mellow. Love how everything comes to the table quick and fresh. Definitely a great way to start the day!

T3kV-vS2x_ub2U65vlcOBg.text: Amazing! First time there today and I will definitely be coming back. It's delicious, and yummy. Definitely recommend this place!

ixC_qxRu-RhYIeUnSaCm9A.text: Really good food. Coffee presses available but poured coffee is also good. Quick service and very interesting menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great food.

EOJHoKg1rUFVzpQ9qH0X2g.text: The food there is OK but overpriced. No matter what I seem to order my breakfast always seems to come out to $25. A little high for three cent egg.

Sd4hfWRSLipyMXcf52Dn5w.text: The cinnamon french toast is great. The red velvet chocolate chip pancakes are excellent! Best red velvet pancakes I've had. The 3 little pigs breakfast sandwich is also excellent. And of course, there's the pot-o-bread which is very good. Always good service. Do not waste your time with places like Denny's and IHop. This is a real breakfast place.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red velvet pancakes, turkey kielbasa, egg whites cooked with spray and not oil upon request. Delicious.

4xfiWfHncXv_BBWip8wiOg.text: You just lost a regular customer. Come every week. Bring every visitor I have. Came today with my dog, on a gorgeous 70 degree day,  but today I am informed  you aren't serving outside. I won't be coming back.

mnDcuVH95UbxB35MBnF4vQ.text: This place is pretty awesome! The service is great and the food is amazing with generous portions. Definitely a go-to spot for breakfast/brunch.

T7drGScljaVzSnt27O0j1w.text: Food is great! Customer service every time I come is okay. Not the friendliest. But I got APOLLO this time and he is AWESOME. I will defenitly be requesting him as my  main server from now on. You rock!

NuX-VL3Xl5ROq-rKumqufA.text: Its a really busy place which is good because the food is awesome! Big portions and great service. Definitely coming back. The red velvet pancakes were oh so goooood

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Velvet Pancakes
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Fried Steak
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread in a pot

qdai9g1SMNwBISjfjfcDkg.text: the food is good but they haven't dusted the ceiling for what looks like 2 years. seriously, look at the umbrella lights, they are furry with dust along with everything else up there.  the pajamas idea is neat but the everything below the knee is filthy, the pants drag on the floor and look horrible. I like this place, but they need to clean it up.

d69uXeG8ZbF8Jf3hByxxqg.text: I spend a week each summer in Las Vegas.  This year, I googled "best breakfast in Las Vegas" and discovered this gem which was only about two miles from my hotel (South Point Resort and Casino).  All the superlatives you've read in the other reviews are absolutely on the spot True.  The decor is cheerful, the service is absolutely wonderful, and the food is very, very good.  I agree with Google that this is one of the best breakfast (and lunch) places in Las Vegas.  Twice I had the rib eye steak and eggs plus the "pot of bread".  Once I tried the chicken fried steak and eggs.  Both were great but I liked the rib eye even better.  I always order my steak medium rare and I was pleasantly surprised to find it was perfectly cooked to my liking.    Playing on the name of the restaurant, all the waitresses wear (modest) pajamas and each one is cheerful, knowledgeable, and attentive to your morning repast needs.  My friend and I ate here three mornings in a row and each time we were seated in Callie's section.  Waitress Callie is a sweet young darling who knows how to keep all her customers content.  Each time I visit Las Vegas, I will make a point to start my day at Rise & Shine - A steak & egg place.

vRU9lVkQ_Fi4VVlxke0iZA.text: This was an excellent brunch place. Good portions of hashbrowns, eggs, and ribeye steak. I asked for the eggs over medium and the ribeye steak medium rare and they came out perfectly. The biscuits were good and the coffee was refilled often.

eii5fCWlrsoSlAPVw651xg.text: Another great meal! Never disappoints! Was craving some Biscuits and gravy and it totally hit the spot! Cooks behind the glass were nice to talk to especially since I was dining solo. Cannot wait for their second location to open so I don't have to drive quite so far!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy Biscuits and Gravy!

1IWxGABGuhxuNZM6tZKEGA.text: Went back gave them another shot after the gm responded to my post. They did not know I was coming in and the service was great food was good again.   This place does care!

OLEG6be_0XGzRAZsP3PuiA.text: Just due to the cleanliness could be better come on this place rocks breakfast and service but if that Fifth star I know breakfast places are busy, we've owned one but first impressions??? Ya know, defiantly a staple morning spot and I love the service and speed. Just buss a little betters all I'm saying

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh French roast umm

mVaLqeN6Id7k0JKaxX3fRQ.text: Delicious.  Once you have delicious rib-eye instead of a crappy sirloin or eggs with herbs instead of just cooked in oil or a crispy chicken cutlet with real buffalo sauce (which tastes delicious with all kinds of things on the plate), it'll be hard to be happy with the typical Valley breakfasts.

gERNt7YmdyFEcMLhSfNAKQ.text: Used to have great pancake before I think but now it's way too sweet. Portions are great but I don't think anyone can finish entire plate.

xFLzJaEf_QrPX2lub1JdIg.text: I'm not quite sure what the rave is about with this place!  Average seat time was 20 minutes, we we're sat in 30. The set up is totally disorganized, tables sitting dirty, 1 bus boy carrying dirty dishes from one table to the other to consolidate the dirty tables .  The pajama appearance accompanied by a dirty floor, booths, table almost give the place an unhygienic feel.  The food was ok, nothing to rave about. We have had better coffee and breakfast at sunrise cafe, brio, I hop! The oj was fantastic. We would not return. It's actually a shame considering how convenient the location is to our home.

CQaZsu3LfzTOFwQWHH5gUg.text: Generous prorations, great atmosphere and kid friendly. The plates where huge and delicious, recommend the cinnamon French toast or the chicken and waffles.

Y0ryJK-tgO0XfUsl4hMRVw.text: Breakfast is hard to screw up but also hard to make really great.  Rise and shine has done just that.  Taken breakfast to a whole new level.   Steak and eggs seems to be their signature dish and it is excellent.  The steak is as well done as the eggs and the hash potatoes are like nothing else you have ever had. Even their bread choices are a step above the average breakfast place.  You can get a special bread they make in house that is soft, gooey and filled with cinnamon goodness. You must eat here.  You must eat here every chance you get. Also... Great service!

ir8rVGbk8WJlI_55j2NGPA.text: This place is nice. It doesn't feel like how you see it from the outside. When you get in you already feel comfortable. It is clean and most of all we had a very friendly server - Lisa. Each of us tried something different and everyone were pretty satisfied with what they had. Overall it was a great atmosphere, great food and great experience. We will definitely go back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interesting decor

e_Gcf-lXlmo7zQcrw2mTZw.text: I was very impressed at Rise & Shine! A cute place with indoor and outdoor seating. People bring their dogs too and the staff brought them water. The servers wear pajamas!   I ordered the NY Steak and spinach Benedict bagel. The bagel had everything on it and the steak was cooked to preference! When choosing your bread option, ask for the pot o bread! It's a little cinnamon bread in a flower pot and is yums with butter!  My friend ordered a breakfast sandwich and it looked really good!   Good sized portions here and good coffee. Friendly service and a perfect meal after a Vegas weekend!  I hope to find a place like this in SoCal!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. NY steak with spinach Benedict bagel

XZayl3p_xW1m8WZv4mSBVQ.text: We stop by every once in awhile when craving country fried steak. The food is good but in my opinion pricey. The staff is always very nice, my kids love that they wear pajamas. Of course we always get the flower pot bread, great flavor and reminds me of the home style restaurants from the south.   The place is usually super busy so be prepared to wait for awhile to be seated.

iLbUYdx8KJA3N5d6eshImg.text: I'm giving this two stars because the toast is good. The only constant about this place is the inconsistency of the food. The only people giving this the rating over two stars are either too lazy to cook or don't know how to cook.   We live in the neighborhood and have been frequenting this place for over a year now. First and foremost, I dare you to try and get an order of eggs over medium! It can't happen. Either the staff doesn't listen or the cooks just can't cook. On our last two and final visits, the steak on both occasions was cross contaminated with some sort of fish product, perhaps salmon or lox I don't know,  and tasted like a salt lick and if you're not familiar with that it's for farm animals.   On our very last visit I order the loco moco special. The hamburger patty was so undercooked it was completely raw and I don't know that i will ever be able to eat hamburger again. The eggs were so undercooked they were runny after being asked for over medium, which has happened time after time. Eating here has turned into a bad experience. Not to mention our breakfast was over $44 for two people; steak and eggs and loco moco. It's absurd. We don't intend to ever go back.  The reality is if an IHOP or dennys opened up in the neighborhood this place would be out of business in a week.

gAiGmU-OxULkjE9GU74tfg.text: Been here on 2 visits. The first one was 3 years ago or so and I recently came here because 2 of my friends raved about how good the chicken and waffles is. The first time I don't remember what I ordered but it was something from the steak and eggs side of the menu, wasn't really that good considering I can't remember what it was and it didn't bring me back. We had the pot of bread on both visits and yes it is good especially if you smother it with butter, but hey adding butter to anything makes it taste good. So the second visit my friend I shared the chicken and waffle. It was a huge piece of chicken breast on top of a waffle. The thing that stuck out to me was that the breading had a slight spice to it, very nice touch I must say.  I also like the fact they use a chicken breast which makes it easier to eat with a waffle and place both waffle and chicken on your fork. The is definitely a sharable portion as my friend and I were full afterwards.  It was pretty good, but nothing to make me drive all the way over here considering the location is all the way in Southern Highlands. One of my friend's who recommended it said it's better than Roscoe's chicken and waffles?! I've never had Roscoe's, but if Rise and Shine is a 3.5 in my book I can only wonder why people rave about Roscoe's?! If I wasn't too weight conscious I probably would of gotten a parfait as well. Our other friend ordered the red velvet pancakes and they said it was okay compared the pancakes at Baby Stacks.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffle
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot of bread with butter

YUNHruaML9_3i_Alzkf10w.text: Menu changed. Service is inconsistent. Some days are ok some days bad. Some servers there don't understand concept of service. Some are ok. Also tried to order pickup for the family (7 people) couldn't get through when I did I was hung up on 6 times. Oh well even if it is walking distance from me I won't be back. I shouldn't have to feel like a bother when I'm there or when trying to give my business away.

zvUQ1n-kQfbl35cwPb8yAg.text: This is my favorite breakfast place in the world. Their French toast with cinnamon toast crunch cereal on it is my favorite, along with the fried chicken and waffles. Good coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon toast crunch French toast

2jjd_RbAVLCr5-egt0jX1Q.text: This place is amazing!!  We live around the corner so it's very convenient to stop by anytime.  If you come to Vegas and want to get off the strip and enjoy good atmosphere and food, check this place out!!  I would say it's more of a breakfast place but they do serve lunch as well, I have tried many items on the menu and have yet to have a bad meal!  A must have is the pot of bread, even if you order it separate, delicious!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Fried Steak with extra eggs!!

9vYNcp7hSR-ds9WnFHuc2A.text: Maybe it's because I was at the tale-end of a weekend in Vegas, but this was not the best way to cap off the trip.  It has "Steak & Egg" in the title, I so of course I got steak and eggs (specifically, the bacon wrapped tenderloin steak).  The bacon was very fatty, the steak was dry.  It came with an open-faced omelet which had way too much mustard on it (why put mustard on an omelet anyway?).    We also got the pot of bread, which was a gimmicky idea, but not really that special in the end.  The service was very nice and friendly (which is why I'm giving this place a 3 rather than a 2), but I wouldn't come back.

SfSZX-yl6CfGdueQHo13JQ.text: Service was GREAT! Food is delicious! This will be a go to place on our way out of Vegas. I wish this place was in California.  They have fresh squeezed juice(green go-go is delish), smoothies, french pressed coffee.  We had steak and eggs, cooked to perfection. The pot bread(dinner roll and cinnamon roll in a little ceramic cup) is a must.  So glad we tried it.

qQbhW5jGoOBudPztwba9hw.text: One of the best places for steak and eggs. Depending on which server you get, the service is either real good or real slow. However, I did notice that when I went to the bathroom some peoples food was under the heat lamp and then after I came out from the bathroom it was still there waiting for someone to pick it up. I then sat at my table and the food was still under the heat lamp probably a total of 10 minutes which is long in food time to be fresh.

pCVLc-bGy7nJoc0oeJ-jaA.text: I LOVE THE FOOD HERE!! The service is slow every time, they take forever to seat you but its worth it. I love the chilaquiles & the Salsa Verde burrito is good too. I try something new every time and never disappoints. Try the Bagel Egg & Steak sandwich!!

kyPaKeI_AJ2jtQVEtcnlnw.text: The food was pretty good but there wasn't much corned beef in the corned beef hash. The staff is very good. The pancakes were delicious

U_7MRFGD5Fe-QuhT7Qs7gw.text: Great food, coffee and service. It's mom and pop places like this that should be supported.

UgC3SuZo-Z629fx8u32qRA.text: The pot of bread was a really cool idea but wish it was a bit sweeter though. Also the steak omelet was the right size for me. Not too big that I would be blooded and not to small that I had to ask for seconds. Just big enough for me to be satisfied.

hQGa0YohSuoUosQh4RJRAw.text: Was passing through town, looked this place up on yelp. Much better than one of the buffets on the strip. A little out of the way in a drip mall set in a sleeping area , but work it. Service was good as was the food, will definitely stop again if given the chance

HBswx28wL4kmNkowejet3A.text: I love this place! My husband and I come every weekend :) good food, great servers, great atmosphere! I love the servers in pjs and the umbrellas on the ceiling.  restaurant with personality!

e0Bov-SPFCQsaV7yWjVhrA.text: As good as it gets in Vegas for breakfast!  Breakfast joints in Vegas are hard to find let alone good ones especially of the strip, so when I found this place a little over a year ago I was pleasantly surprised!  (They only serve breakfast and lunch here, by the way) Simply put, EVERYTHING is GREAT here!   I recommend this place all the time! Two thumbs up!

xwBRKQQsB1FuN_dkANybOg.text: This place is AWESOME! Great food, great service and the prices are very reasonable. It's pretty cool that all the waitresses wear pajamas.

PtOyLfVoxPvOx-W0q2DN4A.text: Got here at 9:30 am on a Sunday morning and this place was packed!   Service was good since we got a table right away. The waitress in her PJs was pretty attentive too.  I ordered a ham egg Benedict and it was good! The hash browns just needed a tad more seasoning. My bf ordered a ham steak that came with a strand of HAIR! I immediately noticed it while the waitress was serving it. I mentioned it to her right away and took the plate back and replaced it with a fresh new plate. The ham was pretty good too. It was not dry and you can taste a bit of the char from the grill.   I especially loved their pot of bread. The presentation was something different (bread in a plant pot). The bread was so soft with a hint of cinnamon. Delish!   All in all even with the hair experience, it was not bad and will be back here.

AB2yC2VT5nY0GmnfaeZCvA.text: I'm not a fan of breakfast but this place has me sold on it!!  My very first time giving a breakfast place a 5 stars review! The pots of bread are THE most moist bread I've ever eaten!  The chiliquilies were absolutely delicious with just the right amount of flavor.  My husband has been on the hunt for chicken fried steak for years and he says his hunt is over!  The kids enjoyed the steak and eggs and the 123.  The service is phenomenal and I love what they are wearing!  As of today we will become regulars here!

K3tUvofya0_gJu2I5RRjiQ.text: The 25 minute wait was so worth it! The food was amazing and we will make stopping here on our way out of Vegas a tradition;)

mo4gD4LcctzhIDtsCXVLtQ.text: Absolutely love this place. Today was my first time and I don't know how I never knew about it! The atmosphere is very welcoming and the waiters/waitresses are extremely nice as well! Must try the chicken and waffles.... Country fries steak... And the pancakes(flakey and fluffy!!!) !  So good!!

cqDx27DIfsSBLfmL_QWVJA.text: Crunchy Cinnamon Raisin French Toast - DELICIOUS. Coated in Cinnamon Toast Crunch, this was the best breakfast item out of all the things I ordered. They gave you a good hefty serving too.  The steak - really quite terrible. My medium-rare steak was super thin, dried out, under-seasoned, medium-well, and tasted mostly like char. It was super disappointing.  At least they had real fresh squeezed orange juice, a staple of any brunch place. Too bad it wasn't good enough to wash away the taste of burned steak from my mouth. For a place that has "steak" in the name, they sure know how to serve a half-disappointing brunch.

u7kDMnqWO0R7iIE2ExNfiA.text: Tried the Tench Press coffee on reommendation and it was so good. The atmosphere is great with a friendly presence.  The service was slow, so don't go if you'really in a rush. Four tables sat after us and received their food before us.   I had the Steakhouse Omelet. It was very delicious. The steak was cooked perfectly, but a bit cold. It came with a Pot of Bread. The bread, mixed with cinnamon, was cooked in a small flower pot. It was excellent but also a bit cold.

As6G2yUdwR-qLZhxMY5n4w.text: For a great place to go the morning after a late night of fun, Rise & Shine is the best little secret in South LV.  The ribeye chilaquiles is the perfect cure to that hangover!    As soon as you walk-in, the air is filled with cinnamon-spiced potted bread that smells and tastes delicious!  The staff is friendly, attentive and will serve you in their PJ's.  If you're coming to visit Vegas and want to take a trip into town, I highly recommend to get yourself down to Rise & Shine!   Absolutely yummy!

IOOVQ1QGADkZM4zKdpQ5oA.text: The Chicken and waffles were surprisingly very good. I was against the whole chicken/waffle thing, but I finally decided to try. And I'm happy to say I was able to try them here for the first time. Theirs so many flavors while chewing it in your mouth. Well done! The coffee was also delicious. The only down fall to this place is that it's so hot inside the restaurant! I was sweating and not just because I was having a coffee, but seriously hot in there from the minute I entered.

_Olh5V2bP5cj7hHhtxzLsA.text: My husband and I were highly recommended to Rise and Shine, and were excited to try it. We went today at 12:30, after a short wait we were seated. Waited 10 minutes or so to be acknowledged by waitress, then ordered....45 minutes later my husband called over the waitress and asked about our food. She keep apologizing but no food. I ordered a smoothie and my husband ordered a wrap. FINALLY, it arrived...wrong side for my husband and a lumpy smoothie. Highly disappointed and can not recommend. Will not be back!

IlWBOUKKlZycOxXPGHUzwg.text: Best place to come when you are visiting Vegas cheap great service and very very amazing food

KYBUQxyI1E5hlWrZgfPoew.text: Everything was cold , we won't be back. The service was just as bad. This was very disappointing because there were some good reviews.

qDyrNJ8sFyQsMtXCtB3SRA.text: Great food, a little pricey for breakfast but the food is truly amazing. Have had everything from chicken & waffles to simple eggs over easy with a pancake. Let me tell you their waffles are to die for, and they bring you warm syrup with cinnamon sticks in it. YUMMY!!! Plus they have French pressed coffee. If you want to treat yourself to an amazing meal for breakfast and don't mind a little higher price tag- go here! Also be prepared for a wait when you head here in the morning, they are usually packed.

CkOO97DBC5oJp9WYJoVF1Q.text: The spinach benny was absolutely phenomenal!!! And the hostess was absolutely amazing!  our sever Ashley gelato was so awesome!!

u90WgcpMMNEglMRjD1YEGw.text: Been here three times. First time was perfect. Our server was fast and effecient. Food was hot and delicious. The last two visits have been mediocre. Todays visit specifically was the worst. It wasn't nearly as busy as we have seen but we still had to wait to be sat when the host could've easily put some pep in his step to get us sat sooner. Once he was done forcing small talk in the patrons who were paying he sat us and the waitress who we've had previously  (and was fine) didn't acknowledge us just keep looking extremely busy. I don't mind waiting but at least touch the table so it is not awkward when you finally do stroll up and act like we were just sat and hadn't been waiting for an extreme amount of time.   Now for the food part....each time I have tried something different. This time the steak was over done and the bermais (sp) sauce was sour. The woman next to me ordered the same thing and got salsa with her steak omelet and I am not saying it is the waitresses fault but I would've enjoyed it with mine but its my fault for not paying attention. My husband's chicken fried steak was burnt. Everything else like i said previously was just mediocre.   All in all good place. Just inconsistent.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious, chill place to grab breakfast.  Servers are in their pjs so no need to get dolled up

3CVEN3nltLS34zBCgxJAKA.text: Pot of bread is yummy could have eaten 3 or 4. Lol Corned beef hash good. Eggs done perfect. French press coffee highly recommended. Bacon is thick sliced and smoked. Hash brown cut like flat noodles.  Hefty serving of pancakes. Love the casual attire-pjs.  Will come back want to try more.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Press and bread
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cute hanging umbrellas

zmWTTE07kFj9Yp7GtBhHHA.text: First visit and it was very good. Had the Chicken & Waffles and it was excellent. Chicken was tender and just a bit spicy.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Iced Mocha
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken &amp; Waffles

LFjNK09av74UP618AF4uqQ.text: I finally found a reputable breakfast place that I can be happy about in my neighborhood!!!    The quality of the food is fantastic!!!  It's very well prepared and done the right way usually I have to go to the Strip to find something like this.  It gets busy but not packed so you shouldn't have to wait long for seats.  The staff are super friendly and provide great customer service.  Here are the items that are my favorite!!!  The Red Velvet Chocolate Chip Pancakes. Southern Style Chicken Fried Steak. Buttermilk Biscuits and Gravy  Rise and Shine Chilaquiles  Ham & Eggs Benedict

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Velvet Chocolate Chip Pancakes with Cream Cheese syrup. Yum!!!

ozYgdDu9I74xvOFgzzqXhw.text: Seriously one of the best breakfast places we have ever been to, hands down and we don't live in this state. The restaurant environment is so welcoming and happy. The servers even wear pj's as their uniform! How cool is that! Also, you should definitely try the cup-o-bread and hash browns... You will not be disappointed :) So, so tasty!

utEVurBbhm4xKexQFNhejQ.text: We drove from Los Angeles and we were yelping for a good breakfast spot. We came across this place and it was delicious. Everything we had tasted great!! Will definitely come here again when in town.

nABRnJ8RchJiqT1PEggdkg.text: This is the second time my daughter and I have been to this restaurant and both experiences have been great. The food is good but the service is phenomenal! I love food but I'm a stickler for service. I don't care how great the food is if the service sucks I will not be going back! This place by far exceeded my standards of service , Emily and Riley rock!   They were very accommodating to my picky style of ordering and very patient with my 7 year old daughter, I always let her order for herself....  This place gets 2 thumbs up from me! We will definitely be returning!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Photobombed by one of our awesome servers!
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My daughter loves her steak!

aVzBSSfGoYODXcdTPSZ6jQ.text: Its not often I give 5 stars, but this place definitely deserves it.  Plus, I love breakfast.  If I'm paying for breakfast, it better knock my socks off.  This place does!    Its located in my neighborhood (Southern Highlands), WHoooo hooo for me.  Sometimes this place gets really busy, so there may be a bit of a wait.  When its nice outside, you can be seated in the outside area.    Great atmosphere &  friendly staff (dressed in PJ's).  I've been here a couple times and dishes with steak...super awesome.  I have yet to try waffles and pancakes.  But I've just been so successful with their steaks, I just order it every time.   Recently I realized that they had my ultimate favorite combo.  Ribeye steak & Chillequiles.  Wooo woot!  I like their bread in a pot & fresh squeezed orange juice to compliment my food.  I like to pull out the whole bread and pour the cream cheese frosting all over like a cinnamon roll.  Mmmm Mmmmm  Prices are major for breakfast, but their portions are rather generous.  So, yup, split the plate and bill with your breakfast/brunch date.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib Eye &amp; Chillaquiles

6L-9aodFLV3ficavxDKuYw.text: I had never been to Rise and Shine until I went with my co-worker for lunch.... and I am now a HUGE fan!   Since this was my first time visiting we decided to share two items so that I could try more than one thing.... so we got the Ham-N-Eggs Benedict and the Peanut Butter & Blueberry French Toast, what a great choice to split- we got the savory and sweet! And they were both great choices!  I am definitely a fan of Rise & Shine! Can't wait to go back!

jqytHN7pelSvOSLVAnBP8g.text: THIS PLACE NEVER EVER EVER EVER DISAPPOINTS! And I'm not even a big steak eater. The atmosphere is fun and friendly. The servers wear pajamas and it's super cute! The food is delicious. Definitely get "The Ultimate," it's a ribeye with two eggs, hash browns and your choice of bread. I come to this spot every time I'm in Vegas.

DoRxI08w0pAd45xdhGX6Tg.text: This place sucks. Food sucks. Service sucks. Drove all the way from aria for breakfast and I had to wait 35 mins for egg whites and avocados. Could have gotten a better deal at Mcdonald's which I should have gone in the 1st place. Horrible.

JjCtDk8jgi4yhpuxq81w3Q.text: We've been coming here for years. Although the food is good, the service has gotten worse and worse :(  I had to ask the server to pick up our food that had been sitting in the window, after she delivered it she never returned to our table. And it wasn't busy. I got my own to-go box and as we paid at the front I wanted to express how bad the service was, but the woman who rang our check was rude and didn't get eye contact with us once. No smile No thank you, nothing. So sad to see a great place go down hill

E2nY9nvFQpgg4NkcIaFqLQ.text: This is one of the best places we ate at on our trip to Las Vegas. The food was fresh and recipes well thought out. My family was extremely happy with the fun ambiance and great service from Laura our awesome waitress. Try the cup-o-bread!

ELs0YePjQKCkhfYu3rMiEw.text: Excellent and worth the drive to southern highlands. Comfy atmosphere, friendly staff, and love the PJs the servers get to wear.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. CRISPY BUFFALO CHICKEN AND EGGS(Poached) with sour dough toast

H4NydfK7hIayb2WE6s47aA.text: I love this place! Breakfast is my favorite meal of the day. They have EVERYTHING including GF stuff if someone in your party has dietary restrictions. Try the Green "Go Go" Juice.

BI_2ujOwE1sR3ngYp4_Puw.text: Great food, amazing service!  Our waitress, Kris, was attentive to every detail, friendly and outgoing.  And the food was awesome!  Kris recommended the Hazelnutnutella cappuccino--soooo yummy!  It's a bit of a drive from home, but well worth the trip.

DSeR-VpIBlvmuMDGgf8ymw.text: Such a cute spot for a nice breakfast/brunch! The servers are dressed in jammies and the ceiling is full of upside down umbrellas...I mean come on, how awesome is that? I can't even begin to suggest to you what to order since the menu is full of scrumptious bites. The one thing I do think you should order is the bread in a cup---YES.

6ddBMxNEe2AEz_YWPCWsxg.text: First time here for, Natasha (wife) and I. The place is very nicely decorated and the kitchen; which you can see into, is very clean. We sat at the bar and had a clear view of the action in the kitchen. The cooks were all in a good mood and suggested a couple of dishes. We ended up ordering the chilaquiles, and chicken and waffles.  They were big servings. The food was crafted with care and prepared fresh before us.  The kitchen staff was also very entertaining.  Overall the food is fresh and very tasty, it is prepared with care and attention to detail. The place offers a nice atmosphere for small and large groups. The wait staff was also attentive but never overbearing.    Great place, so don't be shy and give it a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles. Tasty stuff
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilaquiles, not very traditional, but great take on a classic Mexican dish.
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French press. Pretty legit coffee here...

428MKDynXFN1AHwG0qqOaw.text: This was our first time at Rise & Shine. The restaurant is beautifully decorated with vibrant colors, open windows, exposed brick, and high ceilings. Very clean and open + cute pajama uniforms for the staff that made it feel like you were having breakfast at home! Their menu was diverse, and they serve fresh juice. Upon arrival to our table, our server, Ashley was attentive, personable, intentional, and her customer service was A+. I got my go-to favorite kind of breakfast: rice, spam, and egg over medium. This wasn't offered on the menu, but I was comfortable enough to ask Ashley it was possible and without hesitation she said, "of course!" Overall extremely satisfied with my food, and will definitely come back.

JBQK67h_CLpjwORfQQlXSw.text: This was highly recommended by some friends. Our expectations were high. Everyone lived up to it! The food was excellent! Service friendly and professional. We were a group of 11. Everyone loves bed their food. I had steak and eggs. The GoGo juice. Steak was ordered MR they nailed it. The hash browns were crispy. Make sure you get the bread in a bowl. Yummy!

H3uil1lpnavkq6AsjuzyGw.text: This is a great way to end a crazy weekend in Vegas. Best hangover-prepare for normalacy food.   The food is great for the price too!  FOOD: Standard breakfast foods. It's better than Denny's/IHOP and such. I try to come here to have their breakfast meals. SO GOOD.   SERVICE: Great. The people are in jammies and are attentive!   DECOR:  Very cute! Umbrellas and pajamas.   WAIT: You will wait on Sunday mornings.  PARKING: Tons, free, lot  PRICE:  Like Denny's... you get your bang for your buck.

h3q9brWJMlGtQuC5XwmORg.text: I'm gunna give my first visit to this place 3 stars. Then again, we went on the most craziest day which was Mother's Day so it was complete chaos. We sat near where they toasted the bread. Here's my complaint... some of the girls that handled the toast did not use gloves, tongs or even paper while handling the bread. This visit I watched all the waitresses and waiter make their toast, there was 3 girls in particular that used their bare hands the entire time and served the bread straight to their tables that way.... uh... GROSS! But kudos to the ones that did use the tongs and didn't use their bare hands. I have been in the food industry for a while and cross contamination this is a big no no for me.   Here's my experience on the 2nd visit. Thank God It wasn't busy, we were seated right away. Our server was ON POINT this visit. Very friendly and thorough with our order, used tongs with our toast (5 stars for him!) and he checked on us every now and then if we needed anything without being annoying. Lol Before he served us our plates, he had gloves on putting all the finishing touches to our plate. He made this visit worth coming back. Thank you Gilbert for the excellent service!!! Hopefully we can ask for him all the time.   I love how the staff is dressed in their pajamas. It really does fit the name for Rise and Shine. Love the flower umbrellas hanging from the ceiling too! In my opinion, the price is a lil high for the food BUT.... you are paying for the experience and someone is cooking you a great meal. 5 stars to the Chefs for making me the steak, avocado and mushroom/spinach omelette. My food was cooked to perfection. The food actually tasted better since they weren't crazy busy. I don't even eat hash browns but man.... it was seasoned well and had the crisp to it, I ate it and that's rare! On yelp, I kept seeing everyone post the Cup of Bread and of course.... it was delicious! I think everyone should order that when they come to visit this place.  I will be back for sure! So glad it's close to my place too! Thank you Rise and Shine!

AqSB0HObnVf9ZM-_SDLvMQ.text: This is my second time here and I am still so amazed on everything about this location place. Amazing food and the staff is so friendly and you can really tell how well they all work together. I highly recommend this place! And the banana pineapple smoothies are the shizzz nizzz

okaHAfItHh9IJaYUUILasw.text: The food is great!!! Tried a lot on the menu. the best is probably the spice rubbed chilaquiles. It's out of this world! They have really good coffee and juice selections. It's a must try if your in the area. Oh and the wear their PJ's super comfy place.

DbqeRF8Zsg6FOE8iefbTkw.text: I came here this morning with my son to have breakfast because we had time to kill before his haircut appointment across the street. Glad I did.   Cheyenne was our server and she was so patient with me. I normally don't take my son out to eat without my boyfriend, so I was kind of nervous. But she let me take my time and always checked on us.  I'll def come back :)

McihuXO6TJHl9p85BhGEYQ.text: The first thing you notice about this place is probably the floral umbrellas on the ceiling. It's the first time I've seen a set up like that. It was pretty cool.  You can tell this restaurant is very laid back as the waitresses were all wearing PJs. It kind of threw me off when I first saw it but I suppose it's their uniform and it goes with the breakfast theme.  The service was okay nothing too impressive about it. The food was okay too.  I got a Belgian waffle and a side of fries. Yeah, very healthy breakfast. The waffle was the only thing on the menu that interest me. It was too soft for my liking. It just felt like I was eating a pancake but in a waffle shape. I did like that they put the butter on the side in a separate container and also asked me before hand if I wanted whipped cream. I order fries because there's this other brunch place my boyfriend and I like to go to and their fries are so amazing that whenever I visit I always eat there. Sadly, the place is on the other side of the town so I decided to curb my carvings by getting fries here. The fries here are very thin and didn't really impress me.

jrqD1y1gaBddjwZhL8mUUg.text: This is by far my fiance and i favorite place to get breakfast! Their rise and shine burrito is the best chorizo burrito that we've found in Vegas. The retried beans that come on the side are AMAZING!! The service is always fast and the staff is always friendly. This morning we had Desire and she was a rockstar, especially considering how busy it was in there!

BOoPv1gKUeutScfebLOYBg.text: I have only been to Rise & Shine once before. My boyfriend and I went here for brunch yesterday, and our experience was lovely!  I thought since it was a Sunday, there would be a whole lot more people, but we surprisingly got seated right away. We looked through pictures on their Yelp before we got here, so we already knew what to order.  I got the Fancy Steakhouse Omelette while my boyfriend got the Ultimate Steak & Eggs! Both came with a side of hash browns and your choice of pot of bread, toast or biscuit. Of course, we chose the pot of bread and as expected, it tasted heavenly! I could honestly keep eating their pot of bread forever!  As for our main meal, it definitely did not disappoint. I loved my omelette along with the strips of steaks on top; it was just a great combination overall! The only thing I would suggest is for them to go easy on the pepper.  Our server and the rest of their staff were very friendly. I'm actually jealous that their servers get to wear pajamas to work, so lucky! Anyway, I would highly recommend this place to everyone and we will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Top: The Ultimate Steak &amp; Eggs. Bottom: Fancy Steakhouse Omelette.
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their heavenly pot of bread!

8KfMIDaXB7iD6izMKTGoBA.text: First time visiting rise and shine and it was definitely a great experience. Great service, food and atmosphere; definitely will come again.

Ah_JSrLkZ6HNN4kffyjs1Q.text: I've been to both locations; both are a great way to start the morning! Today I ordered the fancy steak omelette and tried the Lox Bagel special. The steak was cooked Med-Rare. I was very impressed by the Lox bagel, which has capers and perfectly cooked bacon. I also ordered a side of fruit, which was probably the most disappointing part of my meal (only because Mr. Mamas and Egg Works have such a good portion with no up charge.) I left very full and satisfied.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lox Bagel and Fancy Steak omelette

QeHQWvih6vCh44pPLuJCIg.text: It was good but nothing to write home about.  I gave it 3 stars because everyone was very nice and they asked us to write a yelp review.

7uI21jI3RKaTjgvcucL8CQ.text: This place is super cute and definitely pleasing to the eye. The decor in there is so cute and the way the servers wear pajamas is adorable. They have an abundance of good breakfast items on the menu, even beyond their steak and eggs. I decided to try the red velvet pancakes because of my sweet tooth, and they came with a side of bacon and eggs. It was all good but nothing to write home about. I still enjoyed them tho and they were very fluffy. It was a giant serving tho with just two pancakes and my sister and friends helped me eat them.  I tried my sister's steak and it was delicious. If I ever decide to go again I'd probably get that instead. I guess that's what they're known for since it's in the name!  Besides the food that didn't really blow me away, the service is what is making me take away stars. Wow, our server was acting so strange in a way. I work in the food and beverage industry and hate saying things like that. But seriously in my 21 years of life I have never had such weird service...  One of our girls asked for butter for her waffle and our server (a girl, don't remember her name) looked disgusted and pointed to my other friend's butter and said "there's butter right there." Acting super confused. ew?? She wanted us to share butter? That's so gross...she had dipped her used knife in it obviously! Then my sister asked for water and once again the server pointed to someone else's water!! Is this like a communal place where we all share food? Then my sister orders salsa for her steak and eggs, and it's put on my plate of pancakes. Good combo. Also, my pancakes came with a special syrup, and it was delivered 10 minutes after my pancakes were. Oh, and that "fresh" butter my friend ordered? Came when she was halfway done with her meal. Okay so our server was very unfriendly and acting odd but once the bill came, she asked us how we were for the first time, asked if we were visiting, etc. I get it, you want a nice tip lol. After that experience I really have no desire to return.

lJSLsW4FNNMC-Nuv0aOcTA.text: Our last meal before we headed home from our week long stay in Las Vegas. After a week, we were looking for something other than a buffet. My wife found this place and wow, what a gem it was. It's way south of the Strip, but it's worth the drive.   Here's the rundown: French Pressed Coffee - it's a long drive, so I needed a good cup of Joe. What a cup!! First off, they use Illy coffee (Italian espresso coffee bean, my favorite) It comes in a big French press container (good for at least 3+ cups of coffee, good for at least 2 persons) and a sand glass timer to determine how strong you like it (cute touch). Talk about a good start to your meal, if you're a coffee drinker, you've got to try this. Great Coffee.   Pot of Bread - literally a bread baked in a small terre cotta pot (another cute touch). The top is brushed with cinnamon sugar and is very good. This is one of your bread choices w/ your breakfast meal (other choices are toast or biscuit) pot of bread would be my recommendation. It's unique and a good eats.   Ultimate Steak & Eggs - 8 oz ribeye steak and two eggs (there is an option for 3 eggs)  with hash brown. My steak was cooked medium rare (as requested). It's on the thin side but was very delicious.   Crispy Chicken Breast & Waffles - this was my wife's order. But this will be my order next time. OMG. The best chicken & waffles I've ever tasted. Yes, better than Roscoe's C & W. I prefer dark meat, but their crispy chicken breast was incredible. The chicken was indeed very crispy outside, but the breast was so moist and soft inside. Tons of flavor, delicious!!  And the waffle was so so good. Yum yum yum. The best period. A MUST ORDER.   Service was super friendly and helpful, thanks Lisa! On this day, all the waitresses were dressed in pajamas (yes another cute touch)  Info: they are only open for breakfast & lunch. They close at 3 pm.   If you're sick of the buffet and want something different and really good, come here. You won't regret it.   I'm rating this a 5 star plus I'll definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Chicken Breast &amp; Waffle, OMG. The best chicken &amp; waffles I&#39;ve tasted. Sorry Roscoe.
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ultimate Steak &amp; Egg
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot of Bread, you&#39;ve got to get this!!

VHg74NEVLcJ7SLGw7zzxFw.text: Beware of their egg breakfast burrito.  It is predominately jalapenos.  Everything else was fine.  Good service, pleasant waiters, wide variety, and cute atmosphere.  A bit pricey to be a regular.

uPTY0S6IMjuvdqzwdtbm7w.text: We had the homemade corned beef and hash, steak and eggs chilaquiles, the ultimate steak and eggs which came with cup of bread. Definitely come back again

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ihVigw4ZChcV1XCaGtEOZA.text: Steak isn't just a steak its rib eye.! Awesome. Service excellent  Coffee is pressed  Pancake red velvet. Amazing

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. legit steak and eggs
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wP5S-R3yPB1kY5b-TMS5xw.text: I'm so sad to give two stars :( the only reason I gave two stars is because some of the staff are really great (: but every time I order food from there they seem to get annoyed if it's over the phone, even sometimes in person. And I feel like something is always wrong with the order. For example, I don't understand how rare and well done can get confused. It's just a bunch of stuff that has added up that gets them a bad review from me. And some of the stuff scares me to know if it was True or not.  To add; The last order I got they didn't give us a receipt that told us the break down, but If the steak and eggs are really as much as they say on the menu, they charged us 15$ for a simple salad with lettuce, chicken and a poorly sliced tomato. :(

qBmKywRpAr0xiwDxr6R09w.text: I live in Southern Highlands and I've heard of this place and driven by it many times. A friend finally recommended it so we thought we would  try it out. It was everything I thought it would be;  overpriced the food was great and not good at the same time with the drink delicious but small and the service was fantastic.  The waitress was friendly, helpful, and had recommendations as we had never been there.  She was very nice throughout.  I had a GoGo drink that was fresh juice and id say about 8 oz for $5.  Way to small but delicious.   Then i ordered the corned beef hash with bacon.  It was nothing short of fantastic!  3 poached eggs that were cooked to perfection with this dish.  This came with 1 small biscuit.  It needed 2 at that size.  My friend ordered a steak breakfast burrito with the steak done medium.  The sauce (like an adobo) was aweful.   The meat was super well done.  And as a hole it was terrible.  (Hate to say that about any dish) but she had about 1/2 and was done.   1 coffee as well.  Couldn't tell you about that as i don't drink much coffee.    Bill was $35 and i feel it just wasn't worth that price.   I would order the corned beef hash again as it was just amazing.  But that's it!  Hope this was helpful for anyone wanting to come here.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 5 stars for this hash
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 5 stars for this corned beef hash
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and Chorizo burrito was seriously lacking all the way around.  Sauce was not good, meat was over cooked.

oYgkP2AjnLVGeioONXK0ig.text: The service was poor we Dist get coffee refill until we asked. It is on the expensive side. We had pancakes with bacon eggs and a bun in a pit one coffee and it was 19.62.  That is a lot the bun in a pot was small and 1 star to me I saw on yelp the rave and it was a disappointment both in size and taste.  They use Mott apple juice and pour it in a carafe. The syrup is log cabin I sat in the way back and saw the guy pouring this am.  They do make fresh squeeze orange juice though.  See my photos. We won't be back here.

Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Done and no refill of coffee still

eYJT4_rhlpj32UhWqdnVBg.text: We love to go to the Rise and Shine on Southern Highlands Pkwy. The restaurant has delicious food and great coffee and juices. The price is not super inexpensive but not too pricey either. There is coffee cake that comes in a little cup and it's really cute and very yummy. The restaurant has a nice, laid back atmosphere as well!

CvaNUWOwTINObIi5Ahn0UQ.text: I had the chicken and waffles and I loved the chicken but the waffles were doughy. My husband had the chillaquilles and that was really good and I think I'll try that next time. Service was nice too.

LwNy_5Fd-AhOUYWv8JSaMw.text: I found my new favorite breakfast place! I started with the yogurt parfait w/ honey, granola and bananas, loved it. I had a hard time deciding what to order because everything sounded amazing but after consulting with our server she suggested the eggs benedict and I was not disappointed. My boyfriend ordered the steak omelet and I made him get the pot of bread, so good!  Great food and service, check it out

9vY9XVzm8nA2LXqk5oxY9g.text: My husband, son and two friends flew into Vegas Sunday night.  We had a hard time trying to find food late and had to settle for a wing joint.  I opted not to have any food there and so by morning, I was starving.  Looked on Yelp and found this place.  Really cute decor and wait staff in PJ's,, very charming.  We had an excellent waitress that took very good care of us, always very attentive.  I would say the table ordered just about every type of breakfast for the table.  From pancakes, omelets, oatmeal, bacon/eggs and potatoes.  Everything was delicious and filling.  My meal came with the pot of bread which I loved.  Half cinnamon roll and half dinner roll.  Yummy, although is wish it was bigger.  My only negative is that I was a little pricey.  This place is in a shopping plaza not anywhere near the strip (which was our intention).  I felt I was a bit expensive for what I perceived to be a local place to dine.  Since we did eat late for breakfast we were good until, dinner, no lunch required!  Very filling!  If you want to splurge order the fresh squeezed OJ.  Pricey at $3.25 a glass but tasted fresh and it was fabulous!

xP7xlTzMKi_6zsyzQwzXaw.text: Nom. I love getting breakfast with the family there. I can always count on consistent and good. Plus the decor and uniforms are fun.

va1O73hUuF_d9vW1551Maw.text: Great food and service! Everyone is super friendly and the place is cute and clean. First time here but won't be our last. We were looking for a great breakfast place and found one!

E2D0awqmnGUcY88v0zK8Ig.text: Delicious!!!! Definitely a must when in Vegas! Big portions and great service. I highly recommend the rise n shine chilaquiles!!

fFW4BwC7DLGLcNH22Yj9Ig.text: My friend and I have visited this wonderful breakfast place several times and will be back several more. The waitstaff is wonderful always taking care of the customer. The food is excellent. I have nothing bad at all to say. Go visit and try it for yourself.

wDD9y5194Sv0mywIFD484w.text: First time here recommended by one of my friends great coffee great pancakes awesome biscuits and gravy worth the 15 minute drive from the strip

GabNu8xRtfri_Omi3sqwQQ.text: Reminds me of the downtown coffee shop. The staff was friendly, the service fast, and the food good.  I'm a waffle person so I don't have anything special to rave about. Next time I may venture out into the menu. There are lots of choices. We'll be back. It's in the corner of the shopping center, surrounded by Yogurt, Italian, and Japanese.

9XUSudK5bmwaNoN_bxlZ2g.text: The food was absolutely amazing here.  No wait, cute atmosphere and the prices were good.  Forget those high priced buffets when you can eat here!  Service was great!

rUj395obEnrYeVQK2ie-FA.text: it's not "Chicken & Waffles....", but it's "Chicken & Waffle"!  and oh my lord is it GREAT!  Freshly Squeezed OJ hit the spot too.. This place is so worth the drive to Southern Highlands.  We went on a Saturday just before noon, and a party of 5 of us only waited less than 10 minutes for a seat.  This is a must try!!

tR6pUlPZJ-bhDl-UlIOCow.text: I would give it five stars, but my husband's utensils and plate have arrived dirty, which was a turn off for him.   Overall, we love this place. Saturdays and Sundays are usually their busiest time, and weekdays are a breeze to get in. We live down the street, and so we go here frequently. They recently opened another location in Summerlin, but we haven't been there yet. They used Summerlin as sort of a "test" for their new menu, tweaked it there, and then changed their menu at this location. We've had everything there...and I mean that. We used to go there basically every weekend. The french toast and pancakes are to die for, according to the kids. My new "super bad" food addiction is their fried chicken breast and waffle. They bring their syrup out in a warmed bottle and you can see the fresh cinnamon inside. Yum. The servers are very kind and they all dress in pajamas, which is a neat vibe. They also have hanging flower/umbrella decorations, and the walls have neat colors and decor. Their portions are huge, so that accounts for the average $15/per plate (that is an estimate on my part), and you have plenty for leftovers.   Oh, and the part I wrote above about the dirty utensils/plate? It happened once, and has never happened since.   Like I wrote, this place is really worth a try. You'll be glad you made the trip.

21rhLFFYhf9FI5qyjA1PeA.text: Sadly what was once one of my favorite spots for breakfast and lunch has declined in service and food quality to the point where I'm unlikely to return. Since their expansion I have been in 3 times and each time the service was slow, our servers seemed distracted and sometimes downright rude in pushing us to order something from the new juice bar. The food portions have been reduced and the quality of ingredients seems to have declined as well. My last visit was not at a particularly busy time but multiple tables were left uncleared and dirty. All in all the charm of this place has gone and it's a shame because this was once a True gem of the southwest valley.

SaFUDBvE64AdAkdrWCTudg.text: It's the best kept secret in Vegas.  Located in the Southern Highlands area, a lot of locals end up here for breakfast on weekends.  Staff is friendly (dressed in pajamas) and service is quick.  I have liked everything I've had on the menu. Fun place to have breakfast and relax.

1ShXpW_7Orl-YQUoZM1d5A.text: Won't ever visit this place.  I ordered TO GO.  Yes, they were busy but after 25 minutes my food was not ready.   My daughter asked about our order and they had the nerve to try to give me my order that was sitting on the counter for at least 15 minutes. Made them give me a new order.  I will just eat on the northwest side of town from now on.

CoiQVHV1Wj1QkUx2lvZCJw.text: I would give the food a 5 star but our experience today wasn't the best. First, they told us there would be a 5-10 min wait but I counted at least 5 open tables plus the entire counter which was empty. Then, our waitress Cary (who obviously took her speed pill this morning) asked us for our drink order and before we even look at menu asked if we were ready to order???? (we've been sitting for maybe 1 minute) we told her we weren't ready and she said he'll give us another minute... No kidding! She came back maybe 40 seconds later... This went on through out the whole time we were there. Gave us the check when we were only half way through or meal, etc.  horrible, horrible service. She was not friendly, never asked how we were doing, just kept rushing us. I tipped anyway, only because I know the cooks and the busboy share it. P.S. the busboy was a new kid... Must be family related because he was SLOWER THAN MOLASSES!!!! No wonder they get behind even with half the tables open.   Been here many times before but this might just be our last :(

LAv_xx7Seh_8O_SC3Yiemg.text: Haven't been here in awhile because it's always just been ok. It's close to us, so thought we'd try it again. Went around 10am and it was busy. They told us it was a 15 minute wait but was less than 10. We both ordered omelets which were good, not great. One was fluffy and the other was almost too done, should have a little consistency. The breakfast potatoes are bland. The pot of bread is good, cute idea. Service is really good, servers wear pj's as their uniform and are all sweet. Two omelets, a hot tea, and oj was $34 before tip, seems a little high for what it is. I'd go back but mainly for the convenience that it's so close.

5ag9bOX0JEs9dZwR33p_-A.text: Food was ok but not the best.  I haven't gone there in almost a year and when I paid the bill I realized why I haven't. Almost $2.50 for a glass of OJ and they don't give free refills. Again, food was ok but there is definitely better.

VIWNLQbJN0wCQZVdLRbgOQ.text: Man this place has gone downhill fast! Last three experiences here were awful. I don't eat meat but found bacon in my omelette twice. Today I ordered my omelette to go.  When I get there she tells me it's $17+ for an omelette and ice tea???? This better be amazing! She brings me my tea and food and thankfully I checked it and oopps no toast. Then she hands me my shot of tea that cost $3 !!! It was tiny! So tiny i sent it back for a refund. I work hard for my money and that was simply a rip off! Too top it off When I get home to eat my food I find a hair in it! Yes a gross  tiny hair! Some $17 omelette ! Needless to say they have officially lost me, and anyone I can tell not to go there, as a customer! It's too bad I thought Vegas actually had an awesome breakfast place finally.

KaQZCtHPKKVrIuZz--GScg.text: It's a cute brunch place. The portion size is pretty big. The steak is a nice portion, very juicy n tender. I would also recommend the cup o bread.

Tk0dDicuM_OAr8bTUfS3xA.text: Amazing!!!! All I can say. For sure try their "bread in a cup". I will always make this a stop on my way out of Vegas. Love the staff wearing pj's.

EuCRa96B6Kp5rkHYL9rGow.text: The wait was 20-25 minutes when we came at 9:45 on a Sunday morning.  Well worth it.  We had chicken & waffles- very good, very crispy, and the syrup came warm.  Also country fried steak and eggs- excellent!  Huge, crispy, and with a little bit of a spicy kick.  I personally got the pancakes, and took the server's advice to ask for the blueberries cooked inside.  Loved!  It was fresh, flavorful berries, and a generous amount.  Best of all, everyone in my family loved breakfast, from baby to grandma.  Take it from me- this bunch is hard to please.

2ANww_8AEmzErPxAjUE2Gw.text: We ate here on our last day of our Vegas trip.  We ordered some of the Yelp favorites- disappointments were the pot of bread and the red velvet chocolate chip pancakes.  The pot of bread was tasteless.  And the pancakes were dry.  But we did enjoy the chicken and waffles.  The chicken was crispy and moist.  Overall, cute place with hanging umbrellas and staff wearing pajamas!

c0R6UqCfZwk7H0u0g5PQ6g.text: Holy cow, the chicken fried steak & eggs were huge and amazing, the pot of bread was delicious but a little soggy on the bottom, I should have went with the toast to sop up my yolk or maybe both would have been a good idea.  I needed a good steak and egg place to frequent and now I have found it. I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chechen fried steak &amp; eggs w/ a pot of bread and extra egg.

NDk6f24yD5kjwRubCz8mvw.text: This weekend was crazy!  Last night was a night full of libations and great friends.  This morning I woke up on my best friend's couch with an appetite.  I was told a little gem was right around the corner and that I really needed to try it out.  Why not?  It's time to grub!  The strip mall in Southern Highlands is such a wonderful mall with a lot of different businesses.  Restaurants, hair salons, gyms, you name it.  Very delightful.  Rise & Shine was located in the southwest corner of the strip mall next to Tropical Smoothie Cafe.  When we got out of the car, we saw a few families waiting outside, so I knew it was going to be good.  We ended up waiting about 20 minutes for our table.  When you walk into this place, you are instantly taken to a whimsical story book.  The exposed air ducts are distracted by hanging umbrellas shaped and pictured like spring flowers.  The subtle orange and lime green walls are decorated with huge cow pictures.  The floor to almost ceiling windows are bordered by decorated clay mosaic-type arrangement.  This place is cute!  Our server's name was Lisa.  From the moment she greeted us, she was nothing but amazing!  Such an inviting personality and she really took the time to make sure our experience was top notch.  I LOVED HER!!  For starters, I got the fresh squeezed orange juice for $3.25 and the cup of coffee for $2.85.  Coffee was standard, however the OJ was out of this world!  Fresh squeezed is the only way to go!  You could tell it was authentic.  Not only was there pulp, there were also seeds in my drink!  LOVED IT!  For my meal, it was such a hard decision, but I decided with the New York Steak, Spinach & Benedict-Bagel for $13.50.  NY steak done the way you like it, over butter toasted bagel, topped with two eggs any-style, fresh spinach between the steak and bagel, hollandaise all over the place and hash brown potatoes.  OH-EM-GEE!!  I got the steak medium rare (the ONLY way to get it) and the eggs poached (duh, it's a Benedict!).  The steak was cooked perfectly with nice char marks.  The bagel served multiple purposes.  Not only did it create the Benedict, it soaked up any juices from the steak and hollandaise.  The spinach offered a light, crisp texture to the dish.  The hash browns were cut in big strips and cooked amazingly.  Browned with a crunch, but not dark enough to be considered burnt.  You break the yolk from the egg and mix it with the hollandaise sauce and it completely ties the dish together.  Hollandaise is not too lemony and not to runny.  On the top, they drizzle a little balsamic glaze which offered a slightly sweet and tangy element.  This dish was AH-MAZE-ING and I will highly recommend it to anyone!    You guys, this place was out of this world!  So worth the wait, so worth the future drives (I live close to Boulder City).  I kept telling my best friends that this place was the perfect end to an epic weekend.  I truly believe it and think you need to stop reading this already and get your butt to Rise & Shine!
