-d-ab4DZ1HDkD5JVMCPkIg.text: Finally found a breakfast place that we love!! My husband and I just want to say that everything from the service to the food was amazing!! Laura our server took such great care of us! She was so funny and even though she seemed to have quite a few tables our food came out quick and she still made time to chat. We will definitely be back!

HcJ_ORQtdDOHxvj-Ed-xVQ.text: I just happened to be on this side of town running errands and the group was getting hungry.  Not wanting to hit any of mainstream eat spots in the area, we basically stumbled onto this place.  Upon entering Rise & Shine, one might think they have stepped through the looking glass.  There are upside down daisy light and daisy fans.  The windows are surrounded by mosaic tiles.  The smell of sweet cinnamon lays heavy in the air.  Everyone from the manager to our waitress, April were unbelievably pleasant.  The menu though basic in it's appearance contains some very interesting items.  Some of which we were able to sample today and look forward to sampling some others in the future.  The meals consisted of a Steak Benedict served on your choice of a plain or everything bagel.  Another plate of goodness was the French Toast coated with Cinnamon Crunch.  It normally comes on a raisin bread but we opted for Crunch coated Texas Toast...Awesome!  My only negative remark was that the poached egg on the Benedict was was not runny.  I addressed this with both the Manager and the Waitress who apologized and offered to make it right.  I chose not to make a big deal out of it and continued eating.  The steak by the way was Awesome!  I highly recommend the "Bread Pot" it was absolutely delicious and a fine addition to what ever you might order.  This is indeed a classy breakfast joint that I would not mind in the future making the drive to all they while passing about a dozen "greasy spoons" to get to.

SyDB4ztsO_ykU3Ge9p27dQ.text: steak was cooked perfectly, but was so overseasoned that it just blended with the plate.  the plate i ordered was the chilaquiles, which is basically a plate of savories.  the steak alone was probably the only saving grace.  the chilaquiles were ok.  the sauce was a little acidic but then again, it's chilaquiles.  i ordered my eggs poached, and they clearly were made with the kitchen trick of adding a drop of vinegar so the whites stay intact.  well, these eggs just tasted sour, like vinegar and SMELLED of vinegar too.    for the money (think, a whole 6 oz steak), the entire dish, and not just the steak should be amazing.

ik6h2bMpObRPvE7-D9yceg.text: Been to this spot twice and will be regulars soon enough!  Food is great, atmosphere and location is great, and you won't find another place like it in town. The servers dress in pajamas, which makes you feel relaxed. Each time I've come to eat here, my friends and I go in our pajamas as well. They fit groups of two to eight and more if needed. I've ordered the chicken and waffles, the french toast, the hash browns, and omelets, and everything is exactly what you expect it to be and then some. Food comes out fresh and hot, they work well with substituting items, the french press coffee is a must, and their prices reflect the quality of food.  First time I went there, it was with my boyfriend and we just wanted a nice breakfast spot nearby. We yelped this location, and gave it a try. We were greeted at the door, and were sat immediately. The place wasn't that busy a little after noon. The server was friendly and knowledgable. She explained certain items on the menu that we weren't familiar with, and gave our order. They brought us complimentary fresh cinnamon bread in clay flower pots that were amazing, and we ended up ordering another, which was a mistake because when our food came out, the portions were huge. We were so full, everything tasted wonderful, and the server didn't bother us too much but checked on us often enough. She gave us our check, and we paid when we were ready to leave. Between the two of us, the bill came out to about $30 not including tip. Which I think is fair for the amount and quality of food we had.  I definitely recommend this place.

YvjgLZ2QPNXOG9-Id4whaQ.text: I really want to love this place because it's within walking distance of my house. It would be so nice to walk to weekend brunch but can't say I'll do that because this place isn't that good. I'd rather drive somewhere with better prices and better food. The chilaqules were the best thing that we had. I ordered the chicken and waffles. The waffle was horrible. Cold, dry, thin and stale texture. The chicken was good but not great. I didn't like their maple syrup, it had cinnamon in it and with chicken? Yuck. I ended up pulling it off and eating it alone. I asked for blue cheese dressing so I could salvage my meal and dip the chicken in it and all they had was cheap bottles ranch style dressing. The service was the worst part of the whole experience. The server treated us like we were bothering her and she was missing half the time...like seriously missing like not in the room or the kitchen.

8pUMY34vHLUwDivAaAsvug.text: We make a point of coming here whenever we are in Vegas. Love the atmosphere and friendly staff. Food is always great -- their waffles are crispy and delicious and the menu is fun and inventive. Tried the chicken and waffle and banana frosted flake pancakes and we were not disappointed.

-fds8DJLTajPdhvquyt2FQ.text: Great food at a decent price but I did not feel like our waittress was very good. My table had empty drinks and for some reason she was outside the restuarant for a while. I plan on going back may have just been a fluke or she was having a bad day, which is understandable.

PaXTQdHB1zJuxejE9HhDGw.text: Went this morning for the very first time. Items ordered:  the ultimate (3 eggs and 8 oz ribeye), and the eggs Benedict. After learning what the "pot of bread" was, we ordered one of those as well. We also had the French press coffee. Love, love that they use Illy coffee. So good.  I admit to having been nervous about the eggs Benedict, because they use ham instead of Canadian bacon, and the menu also noted it had balsamic vinegar on it. Don't get me wrong, love balsamic, just never had it on eggs Benedict.  Food arrives. Yum!!  Best eggs Benedict I think I've ever eaten. The ham was very flavorful and tender, and the balsamic drizzle added just a little touch of flavor.   My hubby's steak tasted great and his eggs were cooked perfectly.   Hash browns were also very good. Nice potato flavor and not overly crispy.   The pot of bread was marvelous. It's described as a cross between a cinnamon roll and dinner roll. To the previous reviewer who complained that it tasted "yeasty"....um homemade bread is supposed to have a yeasty flavor.   Decor was nice and loved the servers wearing jammies.  They were all friendly and seemed happy to be there. Only complaint was it felt awfully warm in there, but maybe that was from all the yummy food being prepared.   Will be back, and definitely recommend!

y3Q8cdHe5MXocdVU6515vQ.text: First time eating here. Good food and excellent service. I'll be coming back and try other menus. Will recommend it.

ql7TzL528ZSfuK9gLgDd-g.text: Best breakfast in town! Great service too! Food always come out perfect! French press coffee is awesome! And you cant get enough of the pot of bread!

FfVliv-vfHnOlNd2bNojgQ.text: Wow, everything I want in a breakfast and more.  Staff was really friendly and fun.  Wish there was one of these back in LA!

qJGnJJIAgKPJNPRL-AETpw.text: Horrible! Service was terrible and the food was even worse. Ordered a steak dish with hollandaise sauce and potatoes. Steak was ordered medium rare, it can almost burnt. Eggs ordered over medium and it can with super runny whites. The potatoes tasted like they were cooked three times and put back into another container. I would of asked for a new breakfast but my server only came to my table twice, to take my order and to give me my check. She wasn't even the one to bring me my food. This was around 1pm or so and the place had two other tables occupied. Overpriced and definitely not worth going back

RY9QSu20e80yR5px7kh8sw.text: Great hospitality.  The wife and I had our 3yr old son with, who has a lot of energy and the waitress was great.   I had the 3 egg breakfast that I enjoyed. Hash browns a little dry but the eggs and Turkey kielbasa was great.  Wife had the chicken and waffles that she seemed to enjoy.

6CLfUeMiSfNIFC3iWMcE4Q.text: I drove over here from the southpoint so i didnt need to eat their nasty buffet, I was happy to see a regular restaurant without smoking or gambling... they also have these amazing cinnamon rolls that come in a cup. what a good idea they are delicious.

ISymkoDcLqg2w_e_Foz-mg.text: Ordered here through the phone app, Postmates (I live in the Southern Highlands area), so I can tell about the food but not so much the service/atmosphere, though the delivery was very quick! But the food was great, portion sizes were fantastic. Will be ordering again.

-IODdb0m49mVM9aKK6aTbw.text: Good food and nice seevice. The juices are great too. The chilaquiles are my favorite so far. Yum!

lxiIWRZ5TWixjx8b5Gg3-w.text: I hate writing a bad review because this place is consistently good, and because I myself work in the food and beverage industry. Unfortunately today we had a bad experience. We ordered to go over the phone. It was a corned beef hash, a salmon Benedict, and a bagel with cream cheese for my mother. So, now we're home with our food and the bagel we paid for isn't there. I guess that's our fault for not checking the bag. The corned beef hash is fine. The salmon Benedict is bad. Not that any particular ingredient is, just the dish as a whole was bad. I Never send food back but had I been in the restaurant I would have asked to change my meal. So I sit at home now with a dish I cannot eat and my mom doesn't have her breakfast. I guess we will just get dressed and go out to eat something :(

doAf_Fp12p_jqnYFrLzOug.text: Great local breakfast spot!! Staff is always friendly!! Love that they are all in pajamas! Food is great and I love their fresh juices!! Do yourself a favor and order fresh oj!!

X_DI1SNMcOPGjVUYaigYlg.text: Our second time here. We were satisfied with food and service. We ordered the buffalo fried chicken steak and eggs- the proportion was a good amount, the coating on the steak was well seasoned, the meat was tender and delicious. We also has the steak and chilaquiles- the chilaquiles topped with an egg had good salsa and was very good. To my surprise the steak was very good. It wasn't chewy or fatty. It was tender and well seasoned. The coffee was good too. We will be back.

vpaPyTnUDLV6Z2EWdouPsQ.text: May just be the best breakfast place in vegas! Highly recommend the chicken and waffles. Chicken was perfectly crisp on the outside, and juicy on the inside. Waffles may just give roscoe's a run for their money. Don't forget the little pot of bread! Baked fresh, and super scrumptious. We did have to wait for around 25-30 min, but it was during the weekend, so I bet most breakfast places would have been busy anyways. Would definitely come back again! :)

LBrGHkLXBJXArpTyE6NVGg.text: The food was great and I wish I could give them 5 stars.  Unfortunately the juice bar guy is enough reason to NEVER return. As I sat facing his direction, I observed him cleaning the oj machine with scrubbing pads and kitchen rags, WITH JUICE IN THE CONTAINER, that was being served in the process. I was appalled. Then he continued his health code violations by eating with latex gloves over the the prep area in view of the entire restaurant. This man should be fired!!!!!

nXNF7bge0evTXN23zFMDpg.text: Great place for a breakfast or brunch. Their bread is delicious and freshly baked.  The chicken and waffle is really crispy, soft and spot on. I'd go back here for a breakfast or brunch anytime!

13nx63l_kgOMf-QK1h0_7w.text: My husband and I have been going here for many years, basically since it opened.  Although a little pricey, it was always worth it b/c the quality. As of late, the quality of food isn't the same.  I've always replaced hashbrowns with fruit (strawberries, blueberries, and bananas), and the serving has always been generous.  The past 2 times they've put the fruit in the smallest dish, almost like a dish that you usually get syrup in.  It's been about 1/4 of what I used to get.  Then today, first thing this morning, they ran out of bananas.   I don't believe their eggs are organic anymore, they're just different!  I don't mind spending the extra money for quality, but it's just not quality.  Also, they recently changed the coffee, and my husband doesn't care for it at all. The service is still awesome, we love Riley!  Please stop cutting corners, we will go elsewhere if things don't improve

BzyxdMx17hg5pQnudQUX3g.text: I am so happy I found this breakfast spot. I always get their ultimate steak and eggs. I am really picky about how my steak is cooked. They make it perfect everytime! It's always so juicy and and soft, it just melts in your mouth. The servers are always nice, and they wear these cute pj's. Me and my husband come in often for Sunday brunch, there's always a little wait, as it's always packed. Great place, I recommend you try it!

Ashley was amazing and she actually made conversation which we both love since are both in the same industry. My steak and eggs were amazing and cooked perfectly and my wifes country fried steak and eggs was amazing too. Lots of flavor and cooked just right. We will definitely be back.

p4BdAVwh5et_sw6lRygCaA.text: Food in my party of 6 was okay except the homemade hash! Greasy and now appetizing. Must have been off the chorizo mixed in with beans, chips, eggs, avocado,  salsa, and sour cream.  They didn't charge me for it. I would go back. My group wore our pajama tops to fit right in withe wait staff. Outstanding service!!

sg9QEvf0CmHyMC1L9YFhPg.text: They serve you while in their pajamas!!!  One little quirk that I found endearing was the fact that the servers here run around in their pajamas while taking your order and serving you. Nice little gesture to make you feel at ease and that you don't have to take things too seriously.  We arrived and were told that the omelets are great, the Pot'o'Bread is THE BEST, and that the steak n eggs are pretty bomb.   Well, what was told is pretty much truth. I got a pretty hefty and filling omelet, the wife got the steak n eggs, and we all got Pots o Bread.  Now I have to say - the PoBs were a little underwhelming. Really cool concept, fun little quirk to have as a staple of your establishment... but too me, there wasn't enough cinnamon and there wasn't quite enough flavor. But still! The texture was great and it was really fun to enjoy.  The servings are all pretty big as both the lady and I had to take our food to go [and I'm a pretty hefty eater]. The steak that she got was more fatty than we'd prefer, but there was still a substantial enough amount of meat for us to enjoy.  The service here is great, everyone is friendly, and you feel very welcomed to enjoy a good time at Rise & Shine. Not bad, you guys, not bad at all.  Come here if you want something off the strip, not nearly as noisy, and a good time.

Y4qwcLH8n37OAXZrbDz8cw.text: Came here during our recent trip to LV.  We had to wait say 15 minutes for seating but it was totally worth it.  Portion sizes were huge. If you leave this place hungry something is wrong with you.  My husband had the steak and eggs  and I had just over easy eggs and some biscuits and gravy.  Before our breakfast we had the pot of bread cinnamon yumminess!  All I can say is who ever thought of that pot of bread is some kind of genius.  We watched the diners to the right IOC us order the breakfast burrito and waffles (1 person) and he ate it all!  When we come back to LV ...and we will come back, this place is definitely on our list of places to revisit.  Staff was super friendly and in the PJ's made it so cool.  Some how we managed to eat it all. We were not leaving one bite of that goodness behind.

eqV8ntf7nD3vAEowD_6YZA.text: I am a very happy customer.  I went with my daughter and she had the kids waffle and loved it.  I ordered the ribeye steak and eggs over medium and everything was perfect.  There were many large parties with lots of adults and kids and still the service was good.  I love the French press LaVazz coffee too.  The quality of the steak was good and had an excellent flavor.  Cute and clean place! We will be back soon!

Mbj46xnL5rdx_aCJRJQ2Jw.text: What a wonderful place to have a hearty breakfast.  Best diner coffee I've ever had!

DxCL4JHyN7kTKMogcYriuw.text: Absolutely delicious!!!! Great service and atmosphere. Will be back again. Everything is from scratch. Hash browns and chicken fried steak was ridiculously amazing! I had the bagel sandwich with bacon, avacado and turkey. The boyfriend and had chicken fried steak and in a content food coma!

1raQNxonje3BzJCJffLuuQ.text: Well we decided to eat here today after my daughters kindergarten graduation and take my brother who has never been since we have been a few times and the food and service before was good well today our server Sharon had an attitude from the moment we sat down I can tell she was pre judgmental because we have children I see this behavior from older servers all the time and lil does she know my husband and I both work in the same industry for higher end resturants we ordered a craft of watermelon strawberry juice that after one sip we could tell was bad so I asked someone else since our server wasnt around we switched it to oj and the girl who helped us said she checked date on watermelon juice and it was 2 days old not sure why they would seve us that when menu says fresh pressed juices so that was odd but whatever the server Sharon brought out oj and didnt say oh so sorry for that or anything but my daughter thanked her for the oj Sharon didnt even say ur welcome just replied oh ya with an attitude I ordered my younger daughter the ABC kids meal and asked for hashbrowns instead of eggs because she will not eat the eggs and Sharon said there's no substitution I'm like really? Then the kids meal didnt even included a drink which every other restuarant they do and other restaurants will accommodate children as well like why couldn't we switch out the egg for hashbrowns when we are paying 7 bucks for the meal plus another 3 for her drink seems ridiculous to me could barely get a refill of coffee and while I was still eating my eggs and hashbrown Sharon took my plate of food not even asking if I was finished I guess like her way of telling me I was done idk odd rude behavior my husband had the carne asada chilaquiles and it had half the amount of meat then the last time we went and chips were soggy my brother had a steak which was so over salted it was hard to eat he said my country fried steak was over cooked and lacking flavor so this was a horrible experience and ruined my daughters graduation breakfast we had hoped for an amazing time there and sadly service and food has gone downhill since our last visit our tip to the server dont pre judge someone who you clearly have no idea where they work. This place needs to get it together and actually make sure they have servers that are not acting like the one we had today it was absolutely horrible and we came to celebrate our daughters graduation. The cashier was friendly and did ask how things were I said ok and he did ask just ok and I told him bad service and some other things he did say he would note it all down but did nothing to try and make the situation better for us. Also make sure the food is consistent probably wont be back really did like this place before thou.

GCVjjk-VDE0a2cTdxQLXgg.text: I LOVE this breakfast spot!! Everything I've ate has been great but.... Crunch French Toast, Chicken & Waffle... get them! Love having the Turkey Kielbasa as option to pork. Fresh Juice combos are amazing.

E_jbdngE7vOjLl23af4GgA.text: The breakfast here is amazing and they have good coffee! The service was good and they had so many options. The only thing was the atmosphere was not that great. They try to make it nice with decor but you can see all the dirty plate on  arch next to a booth, little things like that. If you don't care about atmosphere go for the food!

ium6aAWkT0sBEsa4MYA9_w.text: This was a pretty good restaurant. Portions were very large and offered a good value. Everything tasted good, but not great. The waffle was the best thing we ordered. The chilaquiles were decent, but we've definitely had better.

3VY6N_OYF-jQTfj7GVsn7w.text: Fantastic breakfast every single time. The atmosphere and of course the best servers making you feel at home and welcome. Amber and Cary are the best, they always have the biggest smiles and make the room run so smooth. Worth the drive...

WyiUWdCzPfVLfQrb7rt9YQ.text: Rise & Shine! It's Breakfast Time!  You can't help but notice the adorable decor immediately when you walk in.  The colorful umbrellas hanging from the ceiling and the pj wearing waitresses give it such a fun vibe.  We were greeted and seated with our waitress over in a flash.  She was friendly and attentive.  My coffee was always full of their wonderful Lavazza.  Mmmmm. Coffee.  I felt I was a broken record always ordering the same thing.  So to change it up, Blueberry Pancakes it is!  Was it a good choice?  Absolutely.  The blueberries were sweet and abundant.   The pancakes were thick and huge.  I couldn't finish but about half of my plate.  They had a light dusting of powdered sugar with a dollop of whip cream on top.  My husband happily ate the cream for me.  I realize it is a steak & egg place but their pancakes are just as good.    My better half ordered the Grilled Steak & Chorizo Burrito.  Of course I had to try a bite.  It was really stuffed full of ingredients.  Along with the grilled onions, beans, egg and chorizo~ the jalapenos gave it a nice kick.  I love spicy so it works for me.     They have so much more on the menu that I would love to try.  Thanks for great start to my day!

IJv_bwlWNVHqJJcvAWIv_g.text: Any time we are in Vegas it is an absolute must to venture off the beaten path and enjoy some delicious breakfast. I can say I sampled the pancakes, omlett and the French toast an all were amazing. Don't forget to try the cup o' bread. It will change your life. It's usually pretty busy but the service is always great. Nick took great care of us.

Pwhff0g4b9wkcJbZRuPlBw.text: Sorry to say my you have lost my business and my 5 star review.  My husband and I went in for breakfast and was informed food would take a little longer as the health dept was in. Being in the business we understand this so we didnt think it was a big deal. Our server takes our order which was 2  med rare ribeye steaks with scrambled eggs.  We get our drinks and then we wait. And we wait. And we wait. Now we watch tables who have come in after us and order after us get food. Also to go orders are being sent out but still our food isnt out. Now at nearly 40 minutes I ask how many orders in front before we get ours, I get told there are still 2 more checks ahead of us as they are only working on one check at a time......  now I get being a bit more cautious and slow around the health dept. But one ticket at a time is a joke.  Finally our food arrives and the steaks are charred on the outside and tough as hell to cut. And my scrambled eggs are runny as hell. And I dont mean fluffy and soft I mean liquid runny. Gross! All I ate was my toast.  My husband ate his as he was starving. But I couldn't do it.  The server couldnt apologize more and it really wasn't her fault. She sent someone over with a 5 dollar coupon to apologize but sadly we wont be back, as this was the third time we had a food issue at this location, last 2 times it was our steaks had to be sent back because instead of mid rare we got well done, and on the second send back they were raw.   Its a real shame because this place was great but after multiple food issues and now I spent an hour there to have coffee and toast I feel the need to move in to a better breakfast place.

Yjqh6i91_KTf5Ck5HcRH5Q.text: Service was great, food was great!  We enjoyed all of our dishes we ordered. Great Nieghbor hood spot. We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The rib eye chlilaqueles were amazing!

cbnSK_eReFvTOo46dU8jFQ.text: Been to both locations several times and have never had a bad experience here. Ultimate steak and eggs breakfast is a timeless masterpiece. Cup of bread even more delicious than it looks. Wait staff is always polite, and the whole pajama thing is a cute feature that makes me smile everytime I come here. These people know how to have fun and I love having breakfast here whenever I'm in the area. Rise & Shine for life~

We had a sampling of the menu from the Burrito, a cup of bread, bananas Foster pancakes, and hashbrowns. We also tried the iced coffee. All the food was delicious I would recommend it to anyone.

mdRmlH7Cuq5GGEJIc3jcYg.text: Early breakfast to catch up with a girlfriend and this place did not disappoint. Will definitely be going back

WY9dIbSUgfOucG8Q3JUZjg.text: I absolutely love this place! Amber is my favorite server. She is full of positive energy that rubs off on you when you come in in the morning. Also I'm a picky eater and the cook always cooks everything perfectly.

Mgt8cjAFkO4Op9Y0E-tnQw.text: Unfortunately I found this on my last day visiting Vegas. Had I found it sooner, I probably would have eaten here every morning. I showed up around 11:00-12:00 and was seated within 4 minutes, including table clean up. The place is reminiscent of an old school eatery, yet still modern. The staff is dressed in pajamas, which sets a nice lazy easy going morning vibe. I ordered a fresh squeezed glass of OJ which was nice! Followed by my main order of the ULTIMATE steak & eggs with hash and a "Cup of Bread." I've never even heard of this sweet before, until the server described it to me. It was definitely one of the best treats I've ever eaten! (coming from a guy who doesn't usually order sweets) the steak was asked to be cooked medium rare and the chef did an AMAZING job at doing so. Hash had some nice little char to it, which I loved. Eggs cooked just right. I would highly recommend this place if you're in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cup of Bread and the ULTIMATE steak &amp; eggs.

owGSQ5rn7Qvfu5Gv2C6Brw.text: Rise & Shine has become our go-to breakfast/brunch spot for birthday celebrations.  The Husband celebrated his birthday last weekend and they brought out a chocolatey fudgey pancake topped with whipped cream and sprinkles and of course, a candle.  The Little Gal ended up eating just about the whole thing, which we were super pleased about.  And the Little Guy proclaimed we should celebrate all birthdays here! (This was actually the third time we've eaten here, but the second time we celebrated a birthday.)  On my last two visits, I ordered the Homemade Corned Beef Hash & Eggs.  It comes with three eggs your way and a pot of bread, toast or biscuit.  Their corned beef hash has quite a bit of potato in it, and it's pretty yummy.  I'm glad I ordered it again and ate it all up. I chose the pot of bread this time and it reminded me of a cinnamon roll with the frosting dip on the side.  The Husband ordered the Lox & Cream Cheese Omelette.  He was a bit surprised to see the lox just sitting on the top of the omelette when he expected it to be folded in somehow.  He liked the dijon-cream cheese that was on there and needed to request more though.  Service was good the last two times we went, especially when we had Christine.  I just remember her being an awesome waitress who was super attentive, personable and energetic.  She was also quite efficient too!     I will admit that our very first visit was years and years ago.  I don't remember how the service was then, but did remember (I started a review a long time ago.) what we ate then. We ordered the New York Steak, Spinach & Benedict-Bagel, Spice Rubbed Rib Eye Steak Chilaquiles, and Southern Style Chicken Fried Steak. The eggs were more medium when we ordered them over easy.  The steak wasn't very flavorful despite it being spice rubbed.  I realized I was looking for some kind of sauce to dip the steak in.  The chicken fried steak was also huge.  The pot of bread was good then, but a bit under baked since it was still doughy.  Our last two visits this year was a better experience than our very first time.  It wasn't necessarily bad then, it was just okay.  They are obviously doing well since it's busy and they have a second location.  There's usually a wait on the weekends, but we arrive later than most so it's not too long.  The decor is adorable inside.  I do tend to notice there are quite a few tables that need to be cleared and I think if they were cleaned up more efficiently, the wait could even be less.

oShTNE45yjTNTqFMW3BlWg.text: I am so happy we found this place!! We were leaving Vegas and wanted some breakfast outside of Vegas and on the way home to CA.  Found this cute place off Yelp.    Hubby ordered their Ultimate steak and eggs which comes with a ribeye, eggs, and hash browns.  I ordered their special which was Southern friend chicken breast and biscuits with eggs.  I was so happy when it came out, I couldn't wait to dig in.  I fell in love at first bite!    We definitely will be stopping by again whenever we make it out to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Ultimate
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Southern fried chicken breast and biscuit

nUFt9JK8eKtHhHmhGbGoNw.text: Great place for breakfast!  First time here trying this place. I had a Avo-Veggie Benedict with a hollandaise, burgundy sauce. Excellent! Definitely recommend it!

lt5HgH8fhhQ4fF0twDU3fw.text: I have been to a few locations of rise & shine and this is still my favorite one.... Desire is the most bubbly person ever. She was on top of my coffee and I drink a lot of coffee. The food was amazing. The steak was cooked perfect and the French toast was sweet but not candy sweet.

6ILtQi3etLopTGH-padLhA.text: This has turned into my absolute favorite breakfast spot! The service is great, I love the pj theme and how laid back yet respectful the employees are. The food never disappoints! The portions are great. I always get the chilaquiles w steak or without, either way they're scrumptious. They come with avocado, beans, sour cream. Sooo delicious. I've also tried the veggie egg Benedict with balsamic vinegar, overall it was good. The juices are fresh and amazing. I love waiting outside and the waiters never forget about you. I've been recommending this place to friends and family. Every time I post pics of the plates I get sooo many messages asking where it's from. You guys have a loyal customer here.
