-KvRRxJOwovrxGRDZgjNxg.text: Place, is close to my house. So I decided to give it a try.  At first from looking at the menu, it's seems like there portions are average size. I ordered, chicken & waffles. With an orange juice. When I got my plate I was impressed with the portion amount, it's a lot of food! Chicken & waffle was also tasty and tender. I also like the fact that's it's close to my house.

9Gh5IaR9XilK68FATthuQg.text: The chilaquiles might be the greatest breakfast I've ever had. I can't remember if it was just a special or if it was on the menu, but holy moly. There was a lot of food and I generally don't clear my plate at a breakfast place, but this was amazing. A must try!

Sa0h08EAIUs5uwsybkXR9g.text: Have become a regular here. Small wait times and big delicious plates. I have tried almost everything on the breakfast menu, can never go wrong.

FCbC2U1fI85OQeg-9kDbcg.text: This was the best breakfast I've had in quite awhile! I got the rib-eye with the chilaquiles and it was OUTSTANDING! The steak was cooked perfectly, the chilaquiles were cheesy, crunchy, ooey goodness! My mom had the NY strip benedict which was delicious and my grandma got the biscuits with gravy which she is extremely stingy about her biscuits and gravy and she loved it! The hash browns are soooo good to; super crisp and golden. We also got the french press, which was pricey but very good. The service was nice too, not anything outstanding, but a definite 8/10. Overall I loved it and will be returning to try the chicken and waffles!

-0p4Yey5Gf7C_t8Bsb8qeQ.text: Came in here on a Sunday morning for brunch. My bff Ame and I were able to walk in without any wait. This restaurant is located in Southern Highlands, a super nice, relatively new neighborhood in Vegas.   We each ordered the short stack of pancakes platter with the choice of bacon, banger sausages (what we both got), or turkey kielbasa and two eggs.   We decided to get a side of tomatoes to get some veggies, as well as a pot of bread to try. I also ordered a cup of coffee (they brew ILLY coffee - THE BEST!).  I had no idea what a pot of bread was, so this was the best way I could describe it: It's like a cinnamon bun, without being sweet, and served with preserves. I thought it was delicious and appreciated that it wasn't terribly sweet. Also, it comes in a little flower pot. SO adorable.   Also, our waitress was kinda amazing. One of the nicest servers I'd ever seen in Vegas. She kinda reminded me of Shania Twain (random I know). She seriously kicked ass, and did a great job of taking care of us.   Just a couple of minor things I would have Rise And Shine work on: -My banger sausages (DELISH) were warm but not hot -The prices here are a little more expensive   A few things on my list to try next time: -2 cup French Press Illy coffee -Steak and Eggs -- this is their signature dish -Hash Browns - seems like everyone had this and I had major food envy

j-cu1Lezvow6X4PEX6SLdQ.text: ill be honest this wasnt my first pick. the line at Southpoint breakfast buffet was ridiculously long.  and after eating here im glad it was. this place is off the hook. google drove me through some weird residential area so i was skeptical coming in. coming in the ambience is stylish and contemporary but not enough to snob me off because all the waitresses are dressed in their pajamas! our waitress was very friendly even though my son had a tantrum attack she was very helpful and didn't really give me any dirty looks like most people would. we ordered the country fried steak and the banana crunch pancakes and also create my own omelet with all veggies it was all super yummy. Even the hash browns which I'm really not normally a fan of....was so delicious that I almost finish the whole thing!  I have a rule of generally not visiting the same place twice in a trip I would stop here again and have order the same exact items again and stuff my face! love this place but it gets busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HNJCkVGEk4VA4jzF7i83XA.text: Hands down the worst breakfast place in Las Vegas, the food is disgusting and the service is horrible. I tried it twice due to living only a mile or less away, and I have to say that the second time was even worse than the first. This is perhaps the slowest, rudest, and most offensive place to a foodie palate. If you want a good bite in the morning check out DW Bistro or even EggWorks.

t3ms5DVbvYZnYjAaCm0aTQ.text: Really liked it alot.  Lots of interesting things on the menu.  Steak chilaquiles.

EnEg91d1e6xf0C7DNzis0w.text: First time eating here..we've lived here for 3 years. Our little hood..lol. Super crowded on Saturday morning, we didn't wait long. We were gonna leave, but the aroma was so good, smell of waffles and bacon..We had to wait. It was worth it..Ed had spinach, Avocado, and swiss Omelette, with home potatoes. I had the fat kid breakfast..Pancakes..Real warm maple syrup. .Bomb!! Bomb!! Wait staff was super curtious, and in thier pj's. Lol..

IEZcneqcEzkTy4bCyghVqQ.text: I want to pick zero stars, but yelp made me pick something.   Went to breakfast this morning and I thought I saw something in the kitchen....sure enough, the bread was FULL of mold. Told a worker and they were mortified. I'm sure they were very sorry, but my question  is this.....with all the people working there, how come NONE OF THEM SAW IT? Why isnt the kitchen staff aware of the food they are serving? Was a nice place to go to, but knowing they are serving up any old thing, won't go any more!

IdiY4nBsJ3TVp97NXpq_yg.text: This place is so over-rated. The only reason we went there is for convenience three times since living in Southern Highlands.   It's amazing this place runs like it does considering its owner was a big strip vp of f and b with Caesars corp. There is zero leadership in this place. Absent owner.   Arrive. Dirty tables everywhere; but have to wait 15 minutes for a table. It's Sunday folks staff accordingly. Finally seated. Menus are laminated; all of the laminated corners are peeling back and dirty.   Server shows up after we sit for 10 minutes and says sorry I will be back. 5 minutes later takes a drink order. Cloudy old iced tea. Gross. No sweet and low on table. Had to ask for it.   We order our food. Takes 15 minutes. We watch as dirty tables around us sit dirty for up to 20 minutes as they have a wait list. What a shame.   Ordered chicken sandwiches. Comes out with what looks like a 3-4oz half chicken breast on a big bun. Hardly sized properly to fill the bun. Plate smoking hot with the lettuce and tomato sitting directly on the hot plate. Now cooked and wilted. Comes with nothing? No mayo? Nothing?? Fries cold and a very small portion. Embarrassing. Asked for mayo to put on the sandwich. Also ordered a French onion soup. Came out with our sandwiches rather than before. Soup had so much thyme in it......tasted like a beef broth thyme soup. Gross. Went to get ketchup from the condiment caddy and it was empty.   This place is dirty. Lacks the basics. Server was scatter-brained. No management presence. Bussers moving at a snails pace. Cooks eating behind the line. We rode our bikes to lunch. When leaving we saw two servers out back smoking. One was our server. Now I know why she was not around and why we waited so long. Wonder if she washed her hands.   I guess three times is a charm. We want this place to be great because it's so close. Not again. Shame on you owner; you know better.

T_E7e2Stt-KnYEzV0BMGgA.text: Not worth the price. Their food is good, but not great. Service was a little slow and I was sitting at the counter. This place seems to always be busy so maybe I was there on an off day or maybe I was just not feeling it. Suggestions to the owner: check your pricing. Your not on the strip.

rXAfijIgMH520T1ALQMLuA.text: First time visit and the food was great!!biscuits and gravy were so great! Hostess Jessica made sure everything was wonderful. She is very customer oriented. The waitress Cari was energetic & fun!

Xm3yxaNcyRiiLqX66rFBew.text: This place has jacked their prices up to where they are now just as expensive as the Peppermill. Unfortunately they don't even come close to the Peppermill in any area, from the quality of the food to the waitstaff to the overall ambiance. I hate driving to the strip but I hate being charged tourist prices when I'm off-strip even more. Bye-bye, little overpriced breakfast joint.

X9HrKC3APqi9Lpg-Ntv3bw.text: This place is so cute. The staff wears pajamas and the whole inside is decorated adorably. The food is pretty good and customer service is amazing ! I have been here about 4 times now, and am excited for them to open up their new location. I will definitely be returning to this place for breakfast!

MW57VWYjWQnuWHjaWYGlIA.text: This place is really convenient and nice to have around. If you have the time to actually go out for breakfast it satisfies. Its a small place though so going at peak times you can wait. The servers all wear pajamas, upside down umbellas hang from the ceiling and its very quirky in decorations.  The service was good with her continually asking if we need anything and bringing drinks. only issue was he ordered a biscuit and got served sourdough toast.  There aren't many healthy options on the menu so I got a cobb salad minus a few things. They were good about putting my bacon on the side for him.  It was very good with a nice balance of all the ingredients and not too heavy on the dressing.  It was huge though and I couldn't finish it all so we switched plates....lol.....he got the bacon wrapped steak and eggs and he enjoyed it, only thing left on his plate when he gave it to me were the hashbrowns.  The bread is simple bread as not a fan of the pot of bread as not enough cinnamon gooey-ness if I am going to splurge.  The guy who you go to in order to pay wasn't sure what to make of our sense of humor but he was very polite and efficient. Last time I was here I got the fruit which is nicely cut up and a nice size portion.  I would go back as convenient and good options for kids too.

R36pyfnWVrqwjrPEBto95A.text: A cute, locally owned brunch and lunch establishment that serves good food. Living in Southern Highlands is great, but I have to admit that the community is detached from many places. The area was in need of a brunch place and I'm glad Rise & Shine filled that void.   My family was immediately greeted and promptly seated. We got our orders and food quick. Selection and prices were reasonable. I ordered corned beef hash and eggs with a pot of bread. I've never heard of a pot of bread so I ordered it. What came was a dinner and cinnamon roll baked together served in a pot and it was served with jam and butter. Surprisingly good and I wanted more! Service was extremely friendly and attentive. Our waitress was clad in pjs and TOMS. Stylishly comfy and charitable. We left satisfied and will come back.,

Yilb01dGRUnUND-myEfjtw.text: This marks the 10th time I have been there and I leave with the same impression every time. That is for the very mediocre food they are sure expensive and service is just plain bad!  OK so what is the problem? well two people for breakfast one being oatmeal was $35!!! My bagel with steak was overcooked and soggy hash brown and overall tasteless. They had to come out 3 times for my wife's oatmeal cause first trip they forgot the milk and fruit, then came the milk and forgot the fruit...mind boggling incompetence and they did this every single time we have been there so she can't start her breakfast and just sit there sometimes for 5 minutes! oh I ask for a large orange juice with two straws so the waitress decided to change it to a carafe and charged us $8.8!!! We are not complainers but this time like one time a year ago we said something and did anyone did anything? NOPE! what they do is to hand you a discount coupon, not write off the juice or anything , so the moral of their customer service is  TOO BAD BUT UNLESS YOU COME BACK, YOU MEAN NOTHING TO US SO HERE IS A COUPON FOR NEXT VISIT AND IF YOU DON'T COME BACK, THEN WHO CARE! That is the message, perhaps I should have left a note for the waitress, and say SORRY FOR NOT TIPPING BUT IF YOU DO IT RIGHT NEXT TIME I WILL TIP YOU!  Wonder how they would like that. I handed back the $5 coupon and said we won't need this as we will NEVER be back. we left a tip anyway, not that she deserve it cause when you can't serve oatmeal, you really need to think about a different profession!

ZJggJZ3R2CKbzrSJ_mKnTw.text: I come here every year for my birthday. You can't go wrong with the breakfast menu. The only downside about this place is that it's far from my house.

hxgi1IXZWf-A2jfRiu_6Jg.text: Wonderful choice on our way into Vegas for the weekend. Wait was about 20 min, not too bad. We had Crispy Chicken Bagel, Chicken and Waffles, Chiliquiles and Chicken Fried Steak. Everything was great! Wish we had this back in San Diego! Can't wait to go back!  Customer service was outstanding!

L6j6dgz8eXtnkbunENeNzg.text: Fast service, delicious healthy food, and friendly staff! Waitresses are dressed in pj, which makes you feel like home. The design of the restaurant is cute too:)

mFLjsN4y-ZZ97XpcGafbRQ.text: I've been here several times in the past and the food and service was great. What happened? Ordered coffee and very strong and smelled burnt. Ordered a latte instead and it seemed as if they just added water to it and almond milk which was not enough to cover the watery side of the coffee. We sent it back. Granted we were not charged for it but at the same time we could not enjoy coffee with our breakfast. They definitely needed a barista in their restaurant. Very disappointing. Service was good as always but they must of had a turnover in chefs, or should I say kitchen help. Food was not what I expected. I ordered the regular chilaquilles with two eggs over medium. The order came and it was my two eggs As ordered and I was expecting some beans amidst all of the chips with very little cheese on them. Waitress came by and asked if we were OK I said I was hoping there would be some beans underneath all of the chips and she said yes they're usually beans at the bottom but my fork came up with a pureed red kind of sausage looking stuff. I said those were the beans? Not good in my book. The pancakes ordered by my wife and granddaughter were outstanding!  All in all the service was great, ambience was nice but I feel there should be someone overseeing the food coming out of the kitchen before it hits the table. And please hire a real barista. It would justify the high prices you're charging. Oh by the way, they wanted an extra $.65 for the almond milk in the latte. Really? Who nickel and dimes like that?

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Regular chilaquilles with puréed beans on the bottom.

jf7Nu4NbdTa59aPyudGcWA.text: We ordered delivery and the food arrived on time yet early. Estimated time was 12-12:45 and it got here at 12:06.   The Ultimate Steak & Egg Breakfast was okay and simple.  I never add salt to my food but I did have to use 2 packs of it for this meal, the meal didn't have any seasoning or flavor, the egg were plain, the hash brown were good great but not much flavor, but the biscuits were nice fluffy and soft and the gravy was amazing and now that did have flavor, personally the biscuits and gravy were our favorite part.   The pancakes were huge so the 2 stack is more then enough. They're as big as someone's face. Lol. Those were nice, fluffy and soft as well.   Overall the food did its job and got us full and it was a challenge trying to eat it either. I wouldn't say I would not eat here again, it's more of a last resort for me. The prices aren't bad either.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delivery order details

YV73tYQqfEzPJY7I8yZoOw.text: Love this little breakfast joint. It's right up the street from my place, so it makes it oh-so convenient for me.  The inside is very quaint and comfortable. The ceiling is covered with colorful flower umbrellas and broken pottery on the walls, which creates a whimsical garden atmosphere. The uniforms for servers are matching top and bottom pajamas. Very unexpected, but hey! It works. Sit inside for the fastest service; the patio tends to lack attention from my experience.  Instead of breakfast, I ordered the GO GO Green drink, it had a hint of sweetness, which gave it the perfect balance. Highly recommended for a boost of energy and something light! Oh and dont forget the infamous bread cup! It comes out hot and fresh. The cinnamon bread is so soft and to top it all off it comes w/a side of frosting!! Who can resist?   If your in the southern highlands area and craving breakfast, check out this spot! Great food and service. The only thing missing is mimosas and bloody mary's! Rooting for an all you can drink brunch some day!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pottery wall
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Umbrella flowers
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Go go green

ud4ZbkRfAfsn0dgH3MI7VA.text: Review #100 goes to Rise and Shine! Their website is called "bestbreakfastvegas.com" for a reason! After a stressful morning, we decided to try out Rise & Shine for a nice brunch away from the madness of the Strip. So glad I found Rise & Shine from all of the positive Yelp reviews! We were promptly greeted and shown to our table.    Based on the other diners' pictures, I knew I had to try their French Press coffee. I love when restaurants offer this! They brought out my coffee with a timer, showed me how to use it, and I waited for it to brew. The coffee was delicious and was about 3 cups of coffee!   For my meal, I ordered the Buffalo Chicken + Eggs, because buffalo chicken is my favorite food and who else puts buffalo chicken on a breakfast menu?! It did NOT disappoint. I was served two large, super crispy chicken breasts covered in delicious buffalo sauce, two eggs of my style, and freaking amazing hashbrowns. You know how lots of places give you bland, soggy hashbrowns? Not here. The hashbrowns are extra cripsy and loaded with flavor from the green onions. I also had my choice of toast, biscuit, or bread in a cup? Obviously I chose bread in a cup. The bread in a cup is basically an adorable little cinnamon roll baked in a coffee mug with a side of icing. How fun! This meal was seriously my brunch dream come True!   My boyfriend had the giant three little pigs bagel with bacon, ham, banger sausage, egg & cheese with hashbrowns. I didn't have a bite, but you can see from the photos that the bagel was massive! You certainly will not go hungry here.   Check out Rise & Shine ASAP for an amazing and affordable brunch in Vegas. This place was much better than any meal we had on the Strip in terms, of taste, price, and service. The staff was warm, inviting, and helpful. They also work in pajamas, which is adorable. One wish: I saw on Yelp they used to have a delicious looking buffalo chicken wrap, but it is no longer on the menu, so I think it may have been taken off. They should definitely bring it back if so! Thanks to Rise & Shine for a great meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Three little pigs bagel
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo chicken + eggs breakfast - amazing!
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Three little pigs bagel

hhPr7N1r7mMjnWhrTSM9MQ.text: I've been here multiple times than I have ever checked in,  so don't let my 5 check ins fool ya. I'm a semi regular.  Food is 4/5. There are times when they have their misses, but I still come back so it must say something about the food as well. My main go to is their steak and eggs. Followed by their banana frosted flakes crusted french toast platter. Next is their country fried steak if I want to indulge l. Also, can't go wrong with their bacon, mushroom and swiss steak burger with shoestring fries. I hate shoestring fries normally but theirs comes out well seasoned and crispy. The missed part is their loco moco and eggs plate... that's the white washed version. It's basically teriyaki sauce mixed with brown gravy... no bueno. But major plus for them adding rice to their menu! I sometimes crave rice and before they didn't so I would make the trek to Egg and I, but now I don't have to as much.  Service would depend on the server. 3 to a certain server who always forgot my friends food orders while everyone else got theirs. She still works here so I won't mention her name as it was in the past, so I always avoid her if I can. I miss my other server, though it has been a while since I've seen her due to the fact she was going to be on maternity leave and that was months ago. I enjoyed her because she always remembered that I am a tea junky. She would have my iced tea ready the moment she sees me in her section without asking me for it. I miss that. Now my new favorite server is Jerry. His service alone is what brings me back all the time. Very personable and he always accommodates my requests. There are two types of servers I like, one that can upsell the shyt out of their menu and the ones that allow me to enjoy what I want to eat based on their available items. Like today he was very accommodating. I was in the mood for chicken and waffles (before I didn't care for their chicken and waffles because in the past though the size and portion was great, my friends always commented it was bland) I have not ordered chicken and waffles from here in a while and I was craving something spicy so I asked Jer to have the chicken tossed on their buffalo sauce. And I am not one of those customers who expects things for free with any modifications that I specifically request for. I know there's an upcharge, so no need to tell me. I will pay for what I asked for since you know it's not in their menu description. Very irritating to see and hear a guest (from previous dining experiences everywhere) that berate the server for not telling them that what they're requesting for that is NOT listed on the menu description that they would be CHARGED for it.   I am very happy to hear that they added mimosas and cocktails to their menu, finally... just disappointed it's not bottomless. Arrgh!  Technically with some of the misses I would say this review would be better as a 4.5 but as you know, Yelp! doesn't allow for half stars.

BdX2tEfWACX-LFTQNfbYfg.text: I went here again, creature of habit wanting to be tortured... well, the check in staff told me I needed to physically be there to get on their waitlist even though I called saying It was hot 100 degrees and I am in the parking lot in AC.  I asked to have my name on list and then I would come in.  No, she had me walk in, so I did while on phone with her and still she didn't put my name on list.  Sorry, but I then immediately searched for another breakfast place nearby and omg thanks to yelp found Newday cafe literally a block away, yelp cash back, no wait... bye bye ... take me off your waitlist and stop the bad beating... I found a place with better service.

3CBT-_qUQgqqa1fFzDP3sg.text: WORST EXPERIENCE I HAD WITH Rise & Shine! I usually get my usual steak avocado egg white omelette w my girlfriend. BOTH STEAK WAS BURNT! I never got burnt sides from the Flamingo location! I was super hungry and excited for breakfast and I was super disappointed. The first time the server took it back to "fix" BUT! What it seemed as if they just placed it back on the grill bec it looked even more DRY and more BURNT the steak SHRUNK! They NEED to clean their grill and not give customers burnt sides! Like who would want to eat burnt meat? NOT ME. I love steak so I know my steak. WE are never coming back here. That was times 2 and poor customer service and it happened to US. PLUS! They weren't that busy and it took so LONG. Smh! Didn't even try. WELL THEN SHOOT! I'm going to BabyStacks. Bye!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burnt and dry AF! If you love steak, you&#39;ll know.

e-gJYFCq3IsbMZlfi99G7Q.text: Big thanks to "Gelato" for the friendly/personable customer service!   I remember bookmarking this place for my hubby and I to try so here we are...  Apparently there are three different locations throughout the valley- with this location being the one that doesn't serve alcohol- so be aware.  We opted to sit outside since we had our fur baby with us. With that said, we were seated right away. Gelato was super attentive and made sure we were seated with the quickness. She was great at providing recommendations for both drinks and entrees. My husband went with her recommendation for The Chilaquiles with the rib eye along with the strawberry/watermelon lemonade. My hubby's breakfast was on point. The drink was super refreshing and the Chilaquiles?! Boyyyyy, this dish was cheesy and full of flavor! I ordered The Ultimate Rib Eye breakfast platter. This came with 2 eggs, hash browns and side of bread.  Here's the thing, customer service?! Great 5 out of 5 stars, the steaks on the other hand?? Hummmm...Questionable. We had ordered our steak medium-rare, butttttt they were totally over cooked. Be sure to order your steak one level less than what you want or else it'll be over cooked.   This is a place I will try once, then that's it.   Thanks again to Gelato for the great customer service, we may return just to visit her but otherwise....

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The bill
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Looks like medium-well, although my hubby originally  ordered medium :/
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Does this look like medium rare to you?...

DAyLw8cIpMjntCusXlqieg.text: Management really needs to look at both service and food quality. Both seem to be in steep decline.  Took a friend the other day, and got seated immediately.  Our server was not happy, and her bored/grumpy demeanor was a bummer. Maybe it's a good thing we hardly saw her.   I got the Chilaquiles, which were very very salty. My "over-easy" eggs were rock-hard, and the whole dish was room-temperature, not hot.  My friends basic egg dish came with a bread option, and this being her first time, chose the pot of bread. It never came out - even with several assurances that it would be out shortly.   There were no refills on coffee or soda.   I have had very good food and service here, but not in a while. I'm not particularly inspired to try anymore.

BLHjIhFGoFJpfv1e3J59MA.text: We are visiting from Orlando FL and found this place at yelp and believe it when I say it was the best place we had here, food was phenomenal! Awesome service, I wish we have this in my town! Definitely recommend to eat here.

5Z_o_dVNjQ0kpT-3Bd1TlA.text: Truly one of the best breakfast places in the Las Vegas valley.  The prices are reasonable and the food is always good.   The staff is outstanding.  Great service, always on top of things and make you feel like family.  Their steaks are seasoned perfectly and a nice compliment to the eggs.    Make sure you have a pot-of-bread when you're resented with your options.    We've been coming here for years and keep coming back (almost weekly) because it's just THAT good.  Keep up the good work, Rise & Shine team.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BmDfi0VdubObfJCOzZHzPQ.text: Wonderful and fair priced food! Exceptional service by Desirae and other hospitable staff:) Highly recommend for a superb breakfast and lunch restaurant just out of Vegas.

zu7r4y8KpmHTKZd_OSFklA.text: This place is tooooo cute.  The servers are wearing pajamas and my server was super friendly.  Service: You walk in and you are greeted immediately with a fun different atmosphere.  This is VEGAS, so they've got to be a bit different.  So, the staff is in pajamas, not Victoria Secrets but the real comfy stuff you'd typically wear on a laundry day.  The have umbrellas hanging from the sky/ceiling, which look like sun flowers and it is super open where you can see the staff cooking the food in the kitchen (the smells are so great too).  Food: You got to try the bread/cinnamon roll in a cup. Buttery yumminess!! The freshly squeezed orange juice is the best.  I enjoyed the rest of my meal but the hash browns were over done and the eggs could have been a bit fluffier.  I've had pancakes, waffles, grits, bacon, biscuits, sausage and omelets before which were all yummy as well.  Their menu is pretty big and it will satisfy most diets.  This place is a go to each time I'm in town and want to get away from the strip.  The price point for the food is fair and you will be satisfied.

a-sxDiEmwGNuQ_PssYWSrQ.text: When we first sat down, it was a bit questionable having to wait for our server for our specific area. I was thinking it being slow service already! But as soon as our server. She took our order in the best efficient friendly manner and brought drinks right away! The food came and was worth the wait. Huge plates.  The buffalo chicken is not a sandwich but a huge piece of chicken with buffalo sauce on it. Country style which means fried.  The steak chilaquiles is chilaquiles and a big piece of steak. The steak was cooked well and spiced delicious.  The burrito was delicious but very spicy so beware! There is jalapenos inside the burrito.   This place is very good and great place for breakfast! We were all full and worth the drive!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo chicken style
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot cocoa
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh orange Juice

jwp15akZw5g6JXWo-oXoqw.text: The most important part of the day is having a huge breakfast to hold you over for the day. My fiance and I have tried many places for breakfast and brunch. Normally they come out with being too little for a hefty price or not enough to fill our stomachs until the next meal.  Low and behold, Rise and Shine gets the award for good prices and ginormous everything. Being it was the first time here, but looking at the pictures on Yelp, everything looked delicious. We came in around 11 AM. There were only a few customers and we waited only a few minutes to be seated. This was ok with us as this place completely had a warm feel to it. From tables and booths to the uniquely hung flowers/umbrellas. It makes you feel at home.   After being seated we met our server Jerry. Looking through the menu, they are known for their steak and eggs. However, the menu goes from the classic section, pancakes, French toast, waffles, and more. They also specialize in pressed juices orange, strawberry and watermelon, apple to name a few. We finally decided what to order. I ordered the banana frosted flake pancakes (4) with plattering it (eggs your way, mine were sunny side up. With your choice of meat (chose the bacon of course)). Ordered the watermelon and strawberry, my two favorite fruits combined. My fiance decided to go with the pork carnitas chilaquiles with orange juice.   This gave us time to chat and not hurry as they did take their time to add love to their cooking. Our food finally came out, and let me tell you my jaw dropped literally to the table when they handed me my pancakes. I can say the pancakes were bigger than a human persons head. I thought to myself I should of stuck to two instead of 4. This all changed when I bit into the pancake. It was so fluffy soft, mixed in with the Frosted Flakes added a crunch to it. The best part of the pancake was the bananas were caramelized just like the plantains you get from most islands. Add the syrup, which is home made, I just was speechless. My fiance, liked the pork chilaquiles, but was lacking in the cheese, Rojo sauce, and needed more scrambled eggs. He finished his, and I finished half of mine. Another bonus factor, the pancakes were still good and lasted two additional days. The only thing was, I took away one start has the server was not as attentive to other places we have gone to.  Overall we left on a good note and will soon be back to try all the other delicious things on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilaquiles
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Platter it
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Literally the inside

sIW8_eELVtqNYtU8B4ODUA.text: So many good things to say about these guys... right off the bat, if you love coffee, you will appreciate a nice french press. It is delivered piping hot with a cool three hourglass set: denoting three, four or five minutes. You get to choose the time. Also, they delivered the mug pre-warmed!  Little details like that make the coffee better.   Service was outstanding. A perfect amount of checking in and keeping the water glasses full. Very nice people.   I went a little crazy with my order... and I may have over indulged with the bagel, steak and poached eggs, but it was worth it. There was some spinach involved, so I was a little healthy.  These guys are definitely worth visiting!

IhyhlOyVxcvEnXLVyxZQBg.text: Where should I start? Service and food is impeccable. They quickly sat us down (we waited maybe 10 minutes) and the place was packed! The waitress was attentive. Food was hot and fresh. The orange juice was freshly squeezed. I got the crunchy cinnamon French toast platter with bacon. The bacon was crisp the way I like. I thought I wouldn't finish my French toast, but I ate every bite. The French toast and syrup isn't too sweet(which is a problem sometime at places). The French toast wasn't too doughy. The cinnamon crunch gave it an extra touch. I wanna go back to try more food and drinks! I give this place a thumbs up.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon crunch French toast

pUP7Hp2u22QPAfNYF_wQ2g.text: Had a breakfast meeting this morning and was a bit disappointed in the service. The slow service was a team effort, the waiter was on the slower end to get drinks out. Then the kitchen had a major role in us waiting 30 minutes after we ordered for the food to come out. It was not very busy, but they didn't seem to have enough wait staff on the floor to begin with. When our order was making our way to the table we could hear someone speaking very loudly to the kitchen about needing several egg orders. Lead me to believe the kitchen was backed up. The food looked great when it came out, the only sad thing was the eggs were over poached, so much so that it was just balls of hard yolk with some whites. I didn't send it back because we had already waited so long to begin with. I probably would think twice about going back to this location. The interior was cute and it was clean, the service and food is what was the most disappointing here. Kind of important to make sure those two things are lacking.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New York Steak Spinach &amp; Benedict Bagel ... without the bagel.

Zpvqrf3LAh2rGAZMLTvGdg.text: This place has so much charm! Flowered umbrellas are suspended from the ceiling and the wait staff wear pajamas. The shirts are really funny too, but I won't ruin it for you! I ordered the scrambled eggs and hash browns and the bread in the cup! The  service was slow, but that gave my friend and I plenty of time to catch up. The air freshener they pump into the atmosphere is a bit strong, and made my stomach nauseous.  I would go back again, and hope the air freshener scent is not as strong, or I won't go back because of it.

MP1N2TUEq-HcMcJ4yv0eDA.text: Good food ! Very good service the waitress was awesome ! The chilaquiles was very good ! Must try the bread cup !! My husband got the phily steak and eggs ! He loved it !!! Definitely a must try place

It1BxUoFSZqk_XbvQv9v6A.text: If you don't mind posting $27 for an omelet and 2 eggs and bacon with burnt hash browns you might think the place doesn't suck. WAY over priced!

xsEl_RCHaykf0bxgNCbp3A.text: Woke up Easter morning a little late and was a little frantic to find a place to eat. Luckily, we found Rise & Shine. The atmosphere was light and happy, especially with the waitresses in their pajamas! The food was just as enjoyable as the experience. The food presentation was incredible and the service felt more than just a generic "nice to meet you" vibe. Overall, I'd recommend this restaurant to anyone that wants to have a fantastic breakfast experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ham and Eggs Benedict! Amazing with the balsamic vinegar glaze.

nrqw75f_xvaJC7FxscxfcA.text: Delicious food and top notch costumer service.,Amberly was our waitress and she was exceptional , we are currently in our way to Vegas and already talking about what we are gonna have this time around .:') .. Give it a try ,you won't regret it .

clLAny25DGWl5QFYkvpFHQ.text: Seated immediately but you could tell they had been busy up until we got there.  Three of us, coming back from a hike in Red Rock Canyon, hungry as... One ordered simple scrambled eggs and side of hash browns.  One got the Burrito Ole with chicken and an iced mocha.  I got the egg white and chicken omelet with cup o bread!  The cup o bread was served piping hot immediately.  The iced mocha came with more whipped cream than mocha and was not well received.  Scrambled eggs served dead last, almost as an afterthought and they were stone cold.  We did send them back and quickly got a really hot plate of scrambled eggs!  The omelet was delicious, the burrito's chorizo had a different flavor than we expected but was nice and spicy.  Overall, we'd come back, maybe just to see the servers in their pjs.  The food was actually very good except the tiny missteps of eggs and mocha and that didn't really have anything to do with taste in the long run.

9yaVzXA-8vVk4gMvN1yqtQ.text: EXCELLENT .  The flavors were AMAZING & I'm picky because I cook a lot . Our waitress Vanessa was great . She's very sweet and bright .  I am impressed , we aren't locals and I really chose the best place on yelp. Yummy yummy .  I got the waffle and chicken . The chicken was JUICY and moist!!! I was skeptical because I hate dry meat but this was SO PERFECT !!!!  The pancakes were SO good too

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-P7YwUJuHHxk9rzRjDefkw.text: I think the egg and I have some competition when it comes to breakfast. I love trying brand new restaurants and just having so much anticipation on how the place will turn out.  Located in the southern highlands neighborhood in the smiths grocery plaza. We had a 15 min wait, pretty packed obviously this was brunch for us, got there at 1pm on a Saturday. Friendly staff and excellent food! Hugh portions, food came in hot. We started with the "bread in a cup" that was so yummy it had a cinnamon roll like texture! I had the steak and eggs chilaquiles, steak was a pretty good size and a perfect medium rare. Chicken and waffles were yummy too! Best piece of chicken I've tasted in awhile. Large piece deep fried crunchy coated chicken breast. This place does breakfast right. I'm assuming this is family owned which is great because they really care about the quality of the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffle!!
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken n waffles huge piece of chicken! Moist and crunchy batter. Side of country gravy
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak medium rare, country scramble chilaquiles. So good, big portions!

1BlG6Qiw13qOFSPxDQUTLg.text: I ordered the steak "medium" and it definitely wasn't close to medium.  It was brown (no pink at all).  I can't stand well done meat.  The eggs and hash browns were delicious! The bread in a bowl was incredible as well.

AZdaFSwf6Xl6eTjjHHDtow.text: Once again, they never disappoint. Vanessa, the manager, stopped by our table and we chatted about our love (maybe obsession is a better word) for this place. This is our first stop here of two for our trip this time around. Thank you Rise & Shine for making us wonderful food again. You've got costumers for life

X0c6Ue15Rl9xUcL9UORsCA.text: Wow, everything was so delicious!   We got a short stack of pancakes with eggs and sausage, biscuits & gravy, chicken and waffles, and a pot of bread.   The yelp reviews all mention the pot of bread and honesty it was the most underwhelming thing we were served.   The biscuits and gravy were easily the most delicious we have ever eaten! Try them.   I have a mild allergy to eggs so breakfast places are always a hard place for me to try but when I saw the chicken & waffles on the menu I knew that I could check rise & shine out!  They were absolutely delicious. The chicken was crispy and everything you'd want in a piece of fried chicken. The waffle with the infused cinnamon syrup was out of this world yummy.   My husband loved his pancakes. I did take a bite and they were nice and fluffy and the cinnamon syrup just adds an extra layer of flavor to make them that much more delicious.   Service was great, wait was about 15 min on a Sunday morning at 10:30.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Before &amp; after///so full, everything was delicious!
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken &amp; waffles
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Must try!!! Biscuits &amp; gravy

qeB5YGy9YhUYEGJvAwRWNg.text: The food was good but not the server! Yes she refilled our coffee, My husband and I were waiting if she will give us a glass of water! She didn't even bother to asked us! Poor service!

ex-QqjtTYK3-VipEkxM-aQ.text: This place is awesome! The chicken fried chicken & biscuts with sasage gravy was amazing! The wait staff is too cute in their "PJs" and everyone was super friendly and interested in our opinions if the food. My hundband loved the crunchy French toast. A definite must when we come to Vegas.

NFbiMjnYuh2YcX-qdlyVsA.text: I love everything about this place! From the umbrellas hanging from the ceiling to the servers in pajamas. The coffees were yummy and they have a juice bar!  Between the six of us we had practically everything on the menu, and everyone loved their food. Chicken & waffles, biscuits & gravy, Crunchy Cinnamon French Toast, and Bananas Frosted Flake Pancakes were all totally over-the-top good! It was one of my daughters birthdays and they brought her a "pot of bread" with whipped cream, sprinkles, and a pink candle. She said that, and the servers in jammies made it her favorite  Wonderful food & great service. We will definitely be back any time we are in town!

6dT2LAMdMDz1aI2m7VPLeQ.text: My husband and I decided to go out to breakfast this morning, after reviewing several restaurant's in the area on google we choose - Rise and Shine in Southern Highlands. Our server Gelato was absolutely wonderful! She promptly came to our table and took our drink order answered any questions we had and was very attentive filling our coffee and water glasses throughout our meal. We will definitely be back and request to sit in her section! The food was excellent too.

KAVaNGM0eMuKbbEJ3NSL2w.text: Wow! I live in NYC and have had 50 dollar steaks not taste as good as this place! Super impressed with the quality vs the low price, totally worth skipping the normal ihop, Denny's, etc and trying something new and delicious. Get the spice rubbed rib eye steak chilaquiles!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4q9UP6-sSi3cMS5jrbl3Ug.text: Red Velvet Pancakes?! How original, I've never seen those on a menu until I dined at Rise & Shine. Unfortunately due to the 24 hour buffet pass I was only looking for a salad or something green. I'll have to try the red velvet realness on my next visit. I ended up getting a most delicious grilled chicken cobb salad. It was HUGE! It was one of the best cobb salads I've ever had it comes with ranch dressing and I did SOS sauce on side. Usually cobb salad comes with blue cheese which I thought was good until I had R&S grilled chicken cobb. My friend devoured the chicken wrap. He said it was very similar to McDonald's chicken wrap, which is discontinued, but better. Wish I had taken photos but we were all super hungry and had to eat and go quick.   Rise & Shine is a local breakfast joint where waiters and waitresses get on with their day in PAJAMAS! Wild. It's very family friendly, reasonably priced, and best of all the menu has a little something for everyone. There's a large variety of breakfast items as well as "afternoon items" which we had at 11:30am so I guess it's just what they call that section but doesn't mean you have to wait until noon. The interior is big and cool with a fun surprise on the ceiling. Everyone here has a great attitude, very friendly and attentive even when they're busy. You can call ahead of time and check out the wait time, it'll most likely be 5-10 minutes.   Parking is plentiful, but not really shaded... there are tons of other stores located in this shopping center such as a grocery store and other restaurants. Will definitely be returning next time I'm headed to Las Vegas!

XdU9sIcrTlfgiElb8XBbuA.text: This place has the best breakfast I've had in Vegas so far! The orange juice is freshly squeezed, not diluted at all. There is a lot to choose from too, which I love! My family and I have been here about three times, and more to come!

fiwN28nzHbh5oxiA-UX9-w.text: Tried to place a to go order this morning. First the girl who answered kept saying Sienna Heights which was really confusing. She apparently is from a different location. When I tried to order they apparently need a cc on file. I don't want my cc on file. That's how people get scammed. I tried to get them to wave it so I can order a to go order, but they refused. They just lost a customer due to this. Either I pay $5 to deliver this or I have to risk the chance of them getting hacked and my cc gets stolen. Tacky way to handle business. Will not be coming back. Rise and shine prices are high as it is. I don't like to deal with places that refuse to service their customers. Wow.

ZEjdUHhrKsq__hbUb3L2iA.text: Crunchy French toast is amazing. I also like their green go juice. I eat here on every trip to Vegas.

EkDrk5mkIp2vxZ22hIgUog.text: Called from work asking for a menu since the online has no pricing. The employee who answered informed me the online menu was outdated and transferred me to Katherine.  I asked Katherine to email, fax, or whatever was easiest, a menu.  Katherine informed me the online menu was a couple years old and for another location.  She also let me know she had no way to send a current menu and apologized.  Katherine was very polite, however, the restaurant lost my business.  Don't have an outdated menu online, especially when it doesn't pertain to that location.  Publish prices, or are you to expensive?

xrryfrQTSw0th-t-3N3UOw.text: Bad service     Hostess sat us at a booth that had just been wiped down.... very wet bench!!!    Server was not at all attentive     Other servers were openly griping about other         patrons and coworkers within earshot  Bad food    Eggs over cooked     Steak over cooked    Bad atmosphere      Music was way too loud    Did not like the debit card reader/tip machine.   I WILL NOT BE BACK!!

iZ8d0QL0QhtJIPXx9q5Wug.text: Was kind of disappointed that they had run out of corn beef hash at 10:15 so I had to order something else. But I ordered the build your own omelet and it was great! Also their old fashioned pancakes were great. Very family-oriented. The wait for my food felt like forever though, but it was probably because I was really hungry haha. I got my food like 30mins later so idk if that's typical.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SjnZWepwdn3gT5L_mM1VqQ.text: Ok so I should have waited to give a review until after we had finished eating. Our server was not very attentive at all, we had to flag her down to ask for refills, the food was just ok but they do give hefty portions. The decor of the place was pretty cool but we  will not be returning here as the overall dining experience was just ok.

Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Really unique and everyone is dressed in there pajamas atmosphere is really cool.

2h4VceWnLnd5tLmcgC8ScA.text: Really great neighborhood spot. Cool joint good home cooking food. Just get there early to get good seating or the pot of bread "Yum" it gets pretty busy on the weekends! Must try plenary of options and ok price.

Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot of bread and amazing butter!
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outdoor patio dining

utj5Aj1HR1Fs4drwrkD0GA.text: Looking for a small mom and pop shop for breakfast with amazing food come here you need to try their food I come here for the steak and eggs they are so good and their red velvet chocolate chip pancakes a must try item here this is a place to go to for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red velvet chocolate chip pancakes
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and eggs

a4Cfi29bnSBFokxGkDYJaA.text: Talk about big portions.  I couldn't even eat half of my plate.  I ordered the biscuits and gravy.  It was delicious!  If you love coffee you must try the french pressed coffee!! The service was okay, the women was really nice, but we felt a little rushed.  Other than that I would recommended trying this place out for breakfast.

bACgE_f0JlUnA4bErhGEPQ.text: The food is adequate for the price, not worth waiting more than four minutes for a table though.  GIven the service, you might be better off grabbing grub from the supermarket and/or starbucks across the parking lot.  The service falls squarely in the I-have-more-important-things-to-do-so-just-deal-with-waiting-and-be-happy-when-I-eventually-pay-enough-attention-to-you-to-drop-the-check category.  Three visits: cumulative duration of 90 minutes  - I ordered coffee immediately each time when the waitress finally found a moment to greet me, total pricetag: $8  - I drain my mug immediately - in 3-5 minutes.  - I spent a total of 70 minutes with a totally empty mug on my table  - to make a point on the final visit, I left the mug overhanging the far/waitresss-side of the table  - On 2/3 visits the mug finally got refilled when they dropped the check - the definition of a minimal effort at service  - On the final visit, no refill at all.

qjuWQKLjh0Ad-mc9FvuJfQ.text: Four weary adults were leaving Las Vegas, in search of breakfast.  We found this place on Yelp, read the reviews, and figured it was worth a try.  We were not disappointed.  A variety of food filled our table, from omelets, to pancakes, bacon, eggs over-easy, hashbrowns and sausages.  Everything was fresh, HOT and delicious.  The coffee was exceptional, and the pot of bread and biscuits were warm and satisfying.  Service was extremely friendly, without being overbearing, and there is no doubt that we will return to Rise & Shine!  One important thing to add.  There were no TV's in the place, which is such a welcome thing in any restaurant these days, but especially after the sensory overload of Las Vegas.

lthvPkhyz5NOUTUqJxlpJA.text: This is an amazing place for breakfast and brunch! Everything was wonderful, food, service, cleanliness and decor! Little busy but hey it was a Sunday AM in Las Vegas and busy means great place!! We will be back and glad it's a neighborhood locale not on the strip!

BnmhRmFeTuIBe39cQa77Vg.text: Wanted to find a nice, quiet breakfast house off the strip. We found Rise and Shine purely by accident but we were impressed as soon as we walked in. Bright, cheery and clean. We were sorted very fast and had our coffee immediately. Our waiter was Gilbert in his cute checker board jammies who was always willing to make our meal a success. Very attentive and obviously has many years of experience. Food....OMGOSH! You don't need to add salt, pepper, ketchup or anything. All the food has good flavor. We will definitely hit this establishment again the next time we're in Vegas

ed_SHB3ImrSnp2QZ59-1Og.text: I've been here a few times and loved the first two times. It's a cute atmosphere and friendly staff. However, the third time they ran out of pot-of-bread, which was one of the things that made this place special. The fourth time, they had pot-of-bread but were no longer offering the awesome homemade jam that used to come with it (another thing that made them special). All in all, the food is pretty good, but nothing different from the other tons of breakfast places in Vegas. They do have warm maple syrup, but I wouldn't be surprised if they soon got rid of that too. It's the little touches that can make places like these successful, but is seems they are moving in the wrong direction.  Note to the owner(s): bring back the homemade jam!!!

dlMbRKRsw9oXQ7llHgD2CA.text: We're STILL regulars thanks to Analise. She is amazing! Always very courteous, so accommodating! Also, Desiree is amazing as always.

bQVzM_iGqgZ2D-foXeUPnQ.text: Great coffee, Good Food and Friendly wait staff. Solid all around off strip dining.

_INaYKUE1_iY70ZsGf45Uw.text: I had to give at least one star,,,  deserves a quarter of a star!  Apparently you can just seat yourself if you don't want to wait...  Service already is stressful.  Our service was extremely slow.....our server actually walked away in the middle of ordering and then came back.... WHO DOES THAT!???  Had to flag waitress down for more coffee and creamer.  Took forever - 30 minutes to get our food... Eggs, pancakes and waffles should not take that long!  After I received my waffle I realized it tasted just like bisquik... So did the pancakes.  Food was below average ... Service sucked!!! But the syrup was good. That's it... Good syrup!   This restaurant's management needs to step up and manage... Total chaos..will not be back here!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pw2PPGKffl23C8IxX4OJrw.text: Customer Service=Excellent  Food: AMAZING Cleanliness: Flawless  What I recommend: The red velvet chocolate chip pancake... and try the bread in the pot.

InB1Uo9xxn7Sh0MynknUbw.text: Was in on September 1st and had server Ashley Silva, the service was excellent and so was the food.  We were visiting from Arizona and she was very polite, helpful and talkative with my guest and I (she at first said she was afraid of my shoulders haha) but she was a great server and started our trip off well.  I would highly recommend this breakfast establishment and A+ service to any local or out of town guest.

BVc-6R_jesYfvS94WBI1LA.text: The restaurant was cute with colorful umbrellas hanging down from the ceiling.  There was a short line upon entering, but it took us an unusually long time to be seated though we could see a few tables that had been prepped and empty.   We decided to share a full stack of pancakes plus strawberries. The sliced strawberries were served on the side and our 5 medium sized pancakes were nothing to write home about.  Overall we were underwhelmed by this dining experience.    A rating of 2.5 would be most appropriate.

FfScN3ajpQnCCG2Wk4u-mA.text: Without fail when you walk in the door there are smiles all around. Right away an experience begins with all the cute decor on through out the restaurant all the way down to the servers uniforms! PJ's! So very cute!!  Food!! I've had a few different items here but down to it all the crunchy French toast as a platter is the best thing every with banger sausage!! Mmmm!  Not only was the food amazing at each visit. But you can see it all being made in an open view to the kitchen! Nice and fresh no sitting in the window for 10min! From griddle to plate to my table. Yum!  I drive out of the way past eggworks and all that to go here simply for service and over all quality of their food(:  See in about an hour Rise & Shine.  P.s. Coffee is so yummi and strong definitely my morning pick me up.

OF9ZRlEgMTYV-JoCrRha5A.text: First off, the main reason I took away one star was because it took 20-30 min to get seated. When I walked in there were so many empty tables. If anyone can justify the long wait, I will change my rating, but I don't understand why it would take this long.  BUT, I love how the waitresses are all in their pjs, and there are spinning flower umbrellas hanging from the ceiling. The food was good, I ordered the "spice rubbed rib eye steak chilaquiles" which came with a "pot of bread" which is similar to a brioche with cinnamon lining the creases. Think cinnabon without being really sweet. The steak was flavorful and tender, eggs were well seasoned and cooked just the way I ordered (over-medium).  I also stole a few bites from my sister's orders - the "baked blueberry croissant French toast" was pretty good. It reminded me of bread pudding slathered with super sweet blueberry compote on top, and it comes with extra compote on the side in case it isn't sweet enough for you. My sister gave up after a few bites because of its sweetness and large, overwhelming size.  As for the "two fisted crispy chicken bagel and egg sandwich".. it was really large and bland. Needs more seasoning. It came with half a plate of fries which were really good though!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Umbrella/floral lighting fixtures - some of them even spin!
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spice rubbed rib eye steak chilaquiles
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot of bread - kind of like a cinnamon brioche or ensaymada for all you pinoys out there!

tsippxn4TKuTOhLaJ1fVcQ.text: Great place for traditional breakfast before hitting the road from Las Vegas! Yummy food fast and friendly service. Waitress in Pj's, cute flowery ceilings and broken plates designed walls, superb place!

wvVg4Rmf3xBYAiugu6A48A.text: Good breakfast place, really cute atmosphere! 3 stars because service is hit and miss & food inconsistent.

MoAz7ON15gAmZEOoLw47gg.text: Found this place close to home --- thanks to YELP. ::claps hands::  The flowers from the ceiling is really quaint and cute. Open lay out to where you can see into the kitchen. The servers are in jammies - which just makes you feel a tad comfortable.   The potted cinnamon bread was a little cold - if it was warm, I would think they would be amazing.   Cup of Illy coffee was ok.   I had the steak and eggs while my partner in crime had the chicken fried steak (she fancies Crack'n Barrell - but it is 2 hours away!)  The steak was ok - it was moist not dry. It was good with its side kick A1.  The chicken fried steak had a piece of hair or nylon in the breading which we made sure the waitress know, but we said its ok we just wanted to bring it to your attention. Five minutes later, the server brought her a new freshly cooked chicken fried steak as a courtesy @ no charge. Well... since she was halfway through her meal we decided to take it with us.   Overall good experience. There was a tad wait for the food, but kind of expected it in a full FOH, but we didn't mind as we were catching up on our current events. And no... that doesn't mean facebook. News!  Til next time.

tb2VNIDb1hc9slZicgqyUQ.text: Really good food service  Very good very impressed with the whole experience Awesome will be back very soon Found my new normal place for breakfast

X2fztS7gxc4EkGOh1sc7kg.text: Came in with a party of 8, our waitress Kris was extremely friendly and very helpful with menu options. Food was great, and I highly recommend for big groups. Ask for Kris if she's available!

t6TIoUWx2c0YiCVAxEi3bQ.text: Not sure if I already reviewed this place already not, but I stumbled across this location because my navigation system gave me the wrong directions to go pick up a friend early in the morning... And I thought it was funny how the everyone who works at this location wears pajamas and I think it's adorable! Our food came out quick and our server had so much personality... Needless to say it was a great experience as a whole. The food was mouth-watering and I'm definitely coming back next time I get the chance, and the money for it. The menu is great with SO much to choose from. I highly recommend this joint if you want to start your day out with something awesome!

fOudlvQvcbXwYpis0qz0-A.text: This used to be my favorite breakfast place.  However since the expansion the prices went up and the portions got smaller.  They're trying to be more fancy with slimmer cups so the milk you get is half of a regular glass.   I had a 3 egg meal and I know what I was served was not 3 eggs.   It's sad because we came here frequently but now I think we'll find somewhere else.

1jUY5Tq_mxojwKFKHtzP4Q.text: One of our absolute favorite places to get breakfast. We always split the French toast with the eggs and bacon on the inside. And with the fresh squeezed orange juice? Hands down a place you have to check out.

OK5plGOjC_Pzh-CqDKvDjA.text: Love every bite! Chicken and waffles melt in your mouth and they even keep the maple syrup warm for you! Hash brown are so tasty!!! You gotta go!

KGy3TOmDI2ORUdatAnqWtA.text: In Vegas for a week vacation and went to Rise & Shine for breakfast.  I have been to many great breakfast locations in the U.S.; this is truly one of the best and they have reasonable prices.  I had the Chicken and Waffles...the chicken was battered prefectly, it was juicy and tasty.  The waffle was delicious and they used real maple syrup with cinnamon sticks inside the bottle.  I also had an excellent banana smoothie.  The service was fast and delivered with a smile.  Overall, very satisfying.  A must when visiting Las Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken &amp; Waffles!  The chicken is juicy!

u24sq4ea_EvtufS1tGtrQA.text: Love the openness of this place. Their exchange is very high for the price and their coffee (Lavazza) is delicious!!  Service is excellent and the food is a notch above due to the spices they use. At least I think that's why. I'm not a chef.

p4KQztrkGnuOH5m1TtuEBg.text: I joined a friend here for a late breakfast while visiting Las Vegas and it will now be one of my regular stops when I am in town.  The staff here wear pajamas.  So cute! Very cozy and unique.  Pros:  great location, near South Point Casino, delicious omelette, great coffee, excellent service.  Cons:  Located in Vegas and I live in San Antonio.

cN5LZR2tAWbYBQEJBtGDVA.text: In Vegas, visiting family down here and so glad I picked to come here for breakfast. First of all the decor in the restaurant was so cute. We came here around 11am and didn't have to wait too long. The service was so nice. I decided to get the crispy chicken breast and waffle. It was soo delicious. The crispy chicken was just so perfect. With this meal, I had the option to pick toast, biscuit, or the pot of bread. I decided to get the biscuit because my cousin got the pot of bread for her breakfast. I would definitely come here again! Our server was really nice and gave us great service.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Fried Chicken and Waffle

zO2Iq_pdtk-biO7M-yCHSw.text: Great food and great service! Will be coming back before we leave Vegas.  The iced mocha was yum! Waffle platter and French toast platter were also very yummy and filling! They give you fresh whip cream, sweet butter, and warm maple syrup that just melts in your mouth!! If you want to try something off the strip then check out this place.   Our server Amber was very friendly, fast but not pushy, and she just made the experience that much better!

LtgWxGs58bcTJ5jglEo8Bw.text: While I gather their food is good it is still just breakfast. You can make most of what they sell in your own kitchen for a 10th of the cost.   Nice restaurant decent food but the prices are way too high.   Me my wife and 2 boys. Almost $70!!

rGZu1D6zee5P40GXldpd5g.text: It's my second time here, and I think everything is delicious. The blueberry pancakes are fluffy and buttery to perfection, and the eggs Benedict is absolutely divine.   The service is good, but it's definitely an area for improvement. They're quick, but a few times the waitress forgot my order and didn't refill our drinks. Overall, I'd say this place is a thumbs up.

V5hjG38zlT-zEq8RJI-OpQ.text: Found this place on yelp while leaving las Vegas. It was out of the way but seemed worth it. The wait was 45 minutes which was kind of long but it was fine. The decor is so cute in this place very sunshiney and bright. I loved it. The staff wore pajamas and was very friendly! I ordered red velvet pancakes which was delicious! I loves this place!

d03ojJBQot7KRBXb7vYgcg.text: once again.. satisfaction! if y'all havent tried this place.. its a MUST! awesome food and awesome service.. i would totally recommend this place to everyone.   I tried the chicken and waffle today and i must say, the best i ever had. better than Roscoe chicken and waffle in hollywood. kudos to the chef!

dbBayADjzmYeu00hrH0vng.text: A breakfast place where the waitresses dress in pajamas is sort of neat. A breakfast place with no Wi-Fi? That ain't good...

rV5gKR2VT3-LhCgBYIhySQ.text: Cute breakfast spot in Southern Highlands in Las Vegas!  Ham steak and eggs were good!  Had to order new eggs because the first set weren't over medium.  Corned beef hash n eggs were excellent!  LavAzza coffee was delicious!  The cup o bread was very tasty!  Great find here in Vegas!  We will definitely be back!  Our waitress Kim M. made our dining experience incredibly wonderful!    My only complaint is their loco moco is topped with a sweet gravy....a sweet gravy!   I asked if they could make a plain brown gravy and they wouldn't.  For this reason I didn't order.    Otherwise a great dining experience and we will return!

6wSgs39XyAQP5tigWlzY4g.text: In the week we've been Vegas, it was the best meal we've had. Well, except for the pasta my husband made in the frying pan in the hotel. The cup o' bread was divine. Eggs cooked just the way we like them, runny yokes. Hash browns were crispy. The butter for the toast comes on the side as did the gravy for the country fried steak. Very nice touch. Staff was great. Kimberly was really nice and friendly. And I have to say that about the pasta in the frying pan.

0jbUZWSiYu7aNQuocml_9g.text: I must say, this is my favorite breakfast place. Laid back atmosphere. Fresh squeeze juice. Great quality in meats. The service has always been great, everyone is always so nice. My kids get very excited when I tell them we are going there.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Xtra protein egg white omelet with steak &amp; fruit on the side. I was so satisfied with this meal. I&#39;ll be ordering it more often.

B-yNrSjw_A_-Y5rkkKf1Vw.text: Who said size doesn't matter?!   Even if I don't finish it, I still like em big!   Frosted banana pancakes full order is immense! Too much pancake for my tummy. But nothing that I couldn't wrap up for later. Super fluffy and moist! I probably put down one piece and became wayyy too full! Haha  Decided to try something out of my usual brunch order also and went for the biscuits and gravy! Boy was I stoked on this! The Gravy was muy delicioso. I didn't hold back on the carb intake this morning at all. The more the merrier.   On  to other means, service was great, price was a bIt pricey but worth it. The servers wear pajamas to work. I thought it was a joke at first. But super cool touch! It makes me want to work here.   Extra bonus Points for being a really well kept, and clean restaurant. Would return and would recommend

y7Hj3PZ2cUKLFsPdTGpEBw.text: Wonderful customer service. An upbeat atmosphere, groovy. Large menu and yummy fresh juice. Highly recommend.

-5812ZIU1MYpIE1fMg2LsQ.text: This is a great breakfast and brunch place, with cool decor and friendly staff. On Sunday afternoon around 1pm, my fiance and I were in the mood for some breakfast, so we decided to try this place.  The food was delicious and it didn't take long after we ordered to receive our food. We both ordered the massive chicken and waffle. I also ordered a side of potatoes and he had a side of biscuits and gravy.  I liked how the maple syrup had two or three sticks of cinnamon inside, and the great choices to choose from on the menu.  When I have visitors in town, I am defiantly bringing them here for breakfast.

7YeNDDRATQqa3ty3eb4QBw.text: Stumbled upon this diner for breakfast and so glad we did!  The breakfast was delicious and portions were great.  Average breakfast is $12-15 per person which is fantastic for the area.  Will def come back when I'm in Vegas again!!!

s9NZnMLR6owKWpIfUTZz-Q.text: This is our favorite breakfast joint! We're always greeted with good mornings and smiles no matter how busy they are. The food is consistently delicious as well as the juice bar. Amber and Cary are our absolute favorites! We love seeing their bright smiley faces every visit!

ZnyWn4h8Qaso9vf-o8Hcuw.text: I've tried two Rise & Shine locations and both times I've had issues.  Southern Highlands location - Once seated, it took close to more that 15 mins to get our water,  30 mins for the server to take our order and another hour to get our food. We've seen people get seated, eat and leave while we were seated. Totally unacceptable.  We spoke with the manager but did nothing about it.  Henderson Location - Thought I'd try this new location out. I ordered for pickup. Low and behold, I had a very long piece of hair in my food. We called and spoke with the manager and requested for a refund but we needed to go back to the location. Once at the location, the manager was no where to be found.  Got the refund from the host but WHAT A WASTE OF TIME.  I DO NOT RECOMMMEND GOING TO THIS PLACE. THIS PLACE IS A JOKE. I HAVE HAD BETTER SERVICE AT DENNY'S.

o5hl0ZxD1HwJdOzw-5oy0w.text: Great food! I got the rise & shine breakfast burrito without the tortilla (a scramble!) and it was delish! My son got the s'mores waffle and orange juice and everything tasted great. Service was excellent even though they were very busy! We had zero wait time.

WhkGb0tJBRfIPSgZ-R32_w.text: Amazing food, great staff, and perfect music selection.  If you're in town, make sure to stop by!

SPBJBnsRKEKC406If6OFJg.text: Dirty water and soda glasses, a mediocre waitress that didn't have drive to take orders and the food was alright. If the dishes were clean and the waitress was pleasant, we'd come again... until then.... #cascade

TBz1czwRvzYqFrbQDX4vmQ.text: The staff here are so sweet. First time coming here and even though it was loud & busy, I still got seated & my food fast. Definitely a home feel to it. Love it.

axDi7d1SWIknazywAIKXcQ.text: When I arrived it looked as if nothing or no one was their, but once you walk in the restaurant you quickly see that business is booming and the host are ready to seat and serve you. Great Sunday Vibes and the food is awesome l. If you wanna be a show off when your friends or family comes to town take them here for breakfast

ZBaYvf-o27x56NvfEOorCg.text: This was our second time coming here. It is a bit unique as everyone knows that the wait staff wears pajamas. Okay, that is cute. The upside down umbrellas hanging from the ceiling are cute and colorful.   We decided to split a Steak and Chorizo burrito and Corned Beef Hash. Our waitress was really nice, and brought waters to the table before we even placed our order.   The burrito was huge and looked amazing. We cut into it and began eating. The steak was perfectly cooked at medium-rare. The more we ate though, we did not find any chorizo. There were eggs, but no chorizo. We figured that maybe we got the wrong order, but I didn't see any other steak breakfast burrito on the menu. So that was a bummer. it was still tasty, but not what we were looking forward to having. The Corned Beef Hash was good. It was seasoned differently than any other we have had up to this point, and because of this it kind of threw us off somehow.   It was very loud in here for breakfast. The entrance is very awkward and cramped as well. Immediately inside the door there are benches on either side. There is nowhere to stand, only to sit. While paying, people are coming in and being led to their seats. I went to wait outside because I was constantly having to move out the way of incoming customers and the wait staff. Behind the register is the door that leads out to the patio. It is just a very small area, with a lot going on all at once.  Although the food was decent, the experience itself was just okay.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side of Corned Beef Hash
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak Burrito

ntV2tnEN5LwlzwNVhAFebw.text: Absolutely Amazing Food. Gelato our waitress was amamzing. Definitely a Must go to for breakfast when in Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vgpdxVQFC6bhaPXFhlNO3A.text: Rise and Shine is fun, friendly and amazingly good. The crunchy french toast is amazing and if you make it a platter it's plenty of food for two. The red velvet pancakes have a cream cheese syrup like nothing else I've had. The service is so friendly and they all wear pajamas making it feel homey and welcoming. It's a must try!

fWJe_Lfb8LtNvU39aD3kxg.text: Everything about this gem is amazing. On the outside there's nothing special as it is located in a small shopping center but as soon as you enter you will be delighted with the unique ceiling decor.  All the staff are friendly and courteous. The server staff all wear pajamas which is a nice warm, welcoming touch.  Our server was great with suggestions of his personal favorites as well customer faves too.  We ordered the Avo-egg Benedict and s'mores waffles. Wow both amazing. If you enjoy s'mores this is a must. Definitely not too sweet and the marshmallow cooked perfectly for that camping s'mores feel.   Overall we had a great experience and suggest you do the same.

sKFmT_w35ieIJod_kYKQ0w.text: Stoped at this little gem on our way home from Vegas. The food was amazing and service was great. Cute deco. This will be my go to breakfast spot whenever I'm in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smores waffle
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork carnitas chilaquiles

rH2utYo_v1HA8tRyR_o_7Q.text: This place is awesome great food!!!! You won't be disappointed   Kim was the best so nice and great service 10 out 10 perfecto   Looking forward to going back and getting some more great Chilaquis and Rib Eye

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZnYvXcPpEBTEPCmwajwu4A.text: Mediocre. Decided after reading some reviews to play it safe and order bacon and eggs, so my food was just ok. My husband ordered chilaquiles. Maybe it was our fault for ordering a Mexican dish in an American breakfast joint but maybe it was just the lack of customer service skills of our waitress. When asked how he liked his eggs over the chilaquiles he said He would like them scrambled with the tortillas. She let him know there was going to be an Extra charge for it which he agreed.  When the order came. It was all wrong. There was cotija cheese scambled into the eggs and the eggs were just laying on top of the chilaquiles. When she came by again we told her that we had been charged extra for mixing the tortillas with the eggs, but the eggs were just laid on top. This is how the conversation played out afterward:  Waitress: "there is no tortillas in chilaquiles" Us: "Ummm yes, yes there is, that's exactly what chilaquiles are" Waitress: "those are chips" Us: "yeah tortillas" Waitress: "Ok I'm confused" Us: "you said there would be a charge to scramble the eggs with the chilaquiles but they are just laying on top" Waitress: "You said you wanted Quote eye Ja mixed into the eggs" Us: no, what's that? You asked is how we wanted the eggs. Waitress: cheese Us: You mean Cotija (Co-tee-haa) cheese? Waitress: no, quote eye ja Us: no that's not what we said. Waitress: I'm so confused, what can I do? Us: nevermind  Well first of all my family was born in Cotija so we know how it's pronounced and what it is. We are also very aware of what comes in chilaquiles and how they are prepared. Unfortunately the waitress does not.  As far as what they tasted like, they tasted like chips with store bought salsa. Definitely the worst we have ever had. Sad thing is I have actually made chilaquiles at home with store bought green salsa and they come out pretty decent....these not so much. We should have stuck with panera breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. .95 cents to add cheese to eggs which is not what we wanted.

IBqZQJ1T7y6J0O0Xq7zaWA.text: Ordered this from postmates at 10am September 8, 2019. We ordered two things: steak and eggs kids size and a biscuits and gravy. I got notified that the biscuit and gravy had an issue with something, so I switched to a corn beef and hash. How long did it take to complete the order? TWO HOURS. TWO. It got here at 12:10pm and we were trying to cancel our order and they marked the food as being prepared already so we couldn't even get a refund.   And the food? Horrible. We waited two hours for badly prepared food? The steak was charred and it wasn't even medium rare when I asked, and it just looks like someone threw up on my corn beef. I can't believe we can't even get a refund for this crappy food.
