A6ASIsHwAuYndsATocdCJA.text: First time here visiting my dad and this is his go to breakfast spot right down the street from his house in Southern Highlands. I ordered the carne asada chilaquiles and it was good but next time I would like for there to be more sauce on the chips. The chips were still a bit crunchy. Everything that was on the plate went well Together. I got the eggs over easy and overall a good dish just needed more sauce for the chips and then it would have been perfect. My husband and dad got the BYO omelettes and they were very pleased. The restaurant atmosphere is very nice, the employees wear pajamas and that's really cute. I would definitely go Back there again. They have a very vast Menu with alot of choices from salads to sandwiches etc.

h46eekv6Lt53dxbsEA15_w.text: The food was great as well as service. We came in for late lunch around 2pm. To be honest, we expected mediocre service because from experience when a restaurant is slow or about to close, service isn't great. We were pleasantly surprised when we received great service from EVERYONE!   The only thing they got wrong was my husband's steak temperature which they fixed right away. The server even insisted that he take a piece while he waited for the right steak!  The Pot Of Bread is a MUST TRY!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DXj7f6y_D6a_h3crouiRkg.text: Absolutely outstanding food.... The customer service was great and we will definitely be coming back very soon. When you come in ask for Lisa.... Very polite and helpful. Customer service e is just as important as the food and both were great!!!!

-XsTquw19T2xV23jvfFOTA.text: Was visiting Vegas this weekend from LA. On the way home we decided to stop by and try this place out. The inside of the store is so unique. They have different flower umbrellas hanging across the ceiling. Also all the waiters are wearing pajamas haha.   Our waiter, Vanessa (purple hair), was amazing. She was energetic and so helpful. We were unable to get our cup of bread because of complications but she made up for it by offering something else and taking some things off of our bill. That to me is the definition of customer service.   The food was delicious. I ordered the steak and eggs and that steak was magical. So tender and juicy. I haven't had a good steak like that in a while. I also ordered the caramel iced coffee, that was amazing as well.   All in all this place is definitely a 5 star. If you have the time to wait about 30 mins for a table then this is the place to dine at. Next time I am in Vegas I will definitely make a stop here.   Quick Update 5/21/19: THIS PLACE STILL ROCKSSSS! Came twice this time while we were in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

s2Fj3qZMkryb7yx4qmOIVA.text: Not only is the food amazing every time we dine with Rise and Shine, the staff is so friendly and caring. Gabe was our server and was very attentive to our needs. Thank you for making our breakfast experience here a great one!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken egg white omelette and steak and egg dish

rDMCoS2E4vv2hHxwPumQEQ.text: Just wanted to comment on wonderful this place is. The people, the service, the ambiance... super cute!!! I forgot to post on my girl Amanda the other day but I hope you her if you go. She's so attentive, smiley, beautiful, and she will always make sure your coffee is always topped-off :). Today I had Jerry! Super cool, super sweet and always made sure everything was okay. No matter how slow or how a busy this place is there always seems to be exceptional service around the corner. Now my #1 breakfast spot xoxox

Kzk8Dqd3Lt4rFWiAx2f0tA.text: When in Vegas I normally sleep in and enjoy the hotel suite until late checkout... for some reason my wife wanted me to rise and shine super early to grab some brunch.   We made the short drive from the strip to this local spot and was glad we did.  The place is busy and unique.  Tucked in a small strip mall it shares a parking lot with other establishments including a small casino lounge.  The wait wasn't long at all.  We were seated and ordered our food within minutes.  Our food and drink came out rather quickly.  All of the staff was dressed in pajamas, wish I knew so that I could have worn mine to be more comfortable too lol.  The decor is cool and funny.  They sell custom shirts and socks here too!    The food was excellent and the juice was fresh squeezed.   Service was excellent and prompt!  I'll probably be back again when visiting Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. so good
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. menu of goodness
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. decor

4iw39WsVrigEuifFhgY0qg.text: Came twice in a week. First time on fourth of July and another time Sunday morning. Both times wait was about 20-30 minutes. Although the second time they never called me and crossed my name out while I stood directly outside the door. When I came in they said someone else claimed my name?  Food is overpriced. First time I got chilaquiles which equates to dry chips with a dry seasoning on them, covered in cheese, eggs, and whatever meat you chose. Think nachos with shredded cheese. Definitely not chilaquiles which are wet and swimming in salsa. I didn't even mind that the server got my order wrong and came back with the same chips and the correct meat afterwards. Although the different proteins shouldn't be advertised with either red or green salsa if it's all interchangeable.  Second visit I got eggs benedict. Hollandaise was not from a can but absolutely curdled and for some reason, drizzled with a balsamic vinegar sauce?! Why? WHY? Eggs were totally hard poached. No breakable yolks which I suppose I should've asked for instead of expecting it. My dining companion got the loco moco. They were out of gravy and instead of comping his extra egg to make up for it, it was $2. I tried his sirloin burger, it was supposed to be medium and came out as such, but also incredibly dry. Like, it was a mistake not to have a LOT of gravy, dry. Not to mention we could taste the dirty grill all over the burger.  I hear the fresh squeezed orange juice is good but I didn't feel like paying the $5 for myself. All fixable mistakes but coupled with average to below average service too I'm unlikely to go for a third try.

TSIq5wl81rfk9jY_sy4VlA.text: So disappointed with this place. I'm sure if I ordered in my order would not be like this. I had a really good experience dining in but for take out, not so much.  My only refeed for 6 weeks and it sucked! She wanted to replace my burrito, but I did eat it. I ate it why she asked, because I wasn't about to drive another 20 minutes to pick another burrito like this one.   The cuts of steak in burrito was not that great either. There was a lot of chewy parts on the meat that I cut and put aside not to mention the crusty burnt outside of the steak. I was better off going to Fausto's or Roberto's. This wasn't worth the drive or my business. I don't plan on coming back here anymore. The manager thought it was funny I ate the burrito and wanted my money back. I had no choice but to eat it and as funny as it sounds, I'm a body builder and competing in a few weeks and have no time to waste when feeding my muscles so she can laugh all she wants but I have pictures and videos to prove that my food was over cooked. I've ordered hash browns from them before and it wasn't like this.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Don&#39;t order the burrito or make sure you open it up before you pick it up and make sure it&#39;s not burnt.
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The steak in my burrito was burnt. It tasted burnt. The shredded potatoes was like eating burnt potato chips.
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love the theme here

-0dh3LJytu31gRknOvbkjw.text: Well let me talk about the food first, I would give it 5 stars. Breakfast is very tasty and I love bread in a cup tastes like cinnamon roll and is something that you must try it out. I had omelet, with hash browns no complaints very good breakfast. For the drink I ordered watermelon and strawberry juice. I waited about 15 minutes to get seated and the place was crowded. Then one of the servers got down to wipe something of the floor and at the same time in another hand was carrying food on a tray to serve it. That was discussing and they need to change that practice asap. So I don't know will I go back to that place again, its just one of those cravings I had and happened to be nearby.

Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Omelet

pwnZcT3Bl0rsDYGSxfPA6w.text: Our family & friends rave about this place & for good reason. Balsamic on eggs Benedict, brilliant! Best hollandaise sauce in Vegas! Servers were all friendly & hard workers, got us everything we needed. The fresh juice is the best I have ever had :)  I'm a cappuccino snob, so I had to take away a star because it wasn't made correctly...no foam, however, had it been a caramel mocha it'd be great! Next time no whip on a cappuccino please :)   Also I would love to see country style potatoes as a side option.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing Avo-Benedict w/perfect portion of hash browns

KQ_ecuV2FDYzBu6eKxcpzw.text: This was a disaster!  After craving their steak for so long, we finally made it back ! I came with my husband and my mom around 11.30am ,we got seated right away .. but boy ! 3 more tables got seated few minutes after us and they all got greeted and their drinks while we were still being ignored . Until i waved down the waitress ,nobody seemed to acknowledge us .  After that, my husband ordered steak medium rare while i ordered medium ... they messed up our plates and we had to switch plates between us after we realized . But my mom's steak and my husband's were burnt way too much for a steak. Mine too,but i dealt with it.  All of this takes your appetite away and makes you not come back again .  I have told everybody i know about your place and how good it is . But i will take that back and recommend them to maybe try a different location !  I'm very disappointed !  Thought it's funny and unique to have servers wearing pajamas,but didn't think they are actually still sleepy .

f3yPSPmJkrx910KxB-ggHA.text: Wow...wow wow wow.  This was, for lack of a better word, a...painful experience.   Came in for the first time with my mom after reading the enticing Yelp reviews.   Everything started off well.  Staff was friendly upon entrance, and we were seated relatively immediately.  It's a cute, welcoming interior.  The umbrellas from the ceiling and the waitstaff in pajamas were a homely touch.    Before delving into the meat (this pun will make sense later) of the review, I would like to disclaim that our server Kim was absolutely lovely.  Zero complaints.   Here we go:  I ordered the corned beef hash, eggs over medium with a kids order or dollar sized pancakes.   My mom ordered the little steak and egg breakfast, steak medium well.   My eggs needed to be sent back because the yolks came over-hard, and I sent back the steak due to it being a medium rare.    The eggs came back perfect, the steak did not.  It was like they threw the piece of meat on an overly-hot grill enough to burn the outside to pieces, leaving the interior still underdone.    My mom couldn't finish her breakfast due to the odor and temperature of the steak.  Our breakfast was spent tag teaming eating our food due to the items that needed to be redone.    Ultimately as a place that boasts the name "steak" in the moniker, I was misled into high expectations.  The manager was gracious enough to come over, apologize for the error, and remove the dish from the bill however even this couldn't wash out the bad taste this steak and experience left in my mouth.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burnt on the outside.
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Re-fire on the under-done steak
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Over medium&#34; eggs

Sx0l9IYvAu2Td_JJ_OEpkQ.text: This review is not for the food but for the manager named Amber.  My wife and I came there for breakfast on July 22.  As usual the food was great.  We both wanted iced coffee.  The waiter asked what kind of coffee; latte, etc.  I was VERY clear all we wanted was coffee poured over ice.  When I was given the bill I saw it was $8.70 for two coffees.  I questioned the waiter who said it was "italian roast."  When I asked what the hot coffee was he said "italian roast."  I then asked for the manager, who said she was the "GM."  Amber couldn't have been less helpful.  "This is what we charge because the coffee is in these special glasses."  I then asked, "Really?  I'm paying an extra $1 each for a special glass?  Why couldn't you just put in a water glass?"  She then told me I should have ordered hot coffee and a cup of ice.  I told her to reduce the bill by the difference between hot coffee and the same coffee poured over ice.  She kept refusing until I threatened to stiff the waiter to make up for the $2.  I then received another bill and paid.  On the way out the waiter made a somewhat nasty remark to me.  I asked Amber for the contact of the owner.  She refused for quite awhile but then gave me an email address.  I have now been waiting for about 2 weeks for a reply to my email.  After I called the other store I was told that manager would call me.  Still crickets.  As I wrote, the food is excellent.  Until Amber is fired we won't return.

H899JX9vnLNzkdX4aaSmWQ.text: This is a MUST EAT HERE!!!!  Even if you have to make a long drive it's worth it!  We had rib eye steak & eggs and an oatmeal. Everything was amazing!  If you like oranges, ask for some orange juice. It's obviously fresh squeezed but the definitely use top quality oranges!  The hostess was a great start of our experience! Was extremely nice and pick up on me being a smart a#*  and played along great!  Deidre was who waited on us.  She was super sweet and did a great job.  We were lucky enough to watch the head chef work the server side of the kitchen. His attention to detail making sure everything was amazing.  But what really impressed me was the respectful way that he communicated with the kitchen staff if there was anything that needed to be adjusted.  We walked out of there telling people it was the best breakfast we've had in a long time!  This is our new regular breakfast place.  DO NOT PASS THIS PLACE UP!

4oPOtOP-wRx7kKJ0rpY48A.text: Delicious for breakfast & lunch. I've had the chicken & waffles, the carne asada breakfast burrito, the loco moco and even good ole eggs over easy with hasbrowns. Everything I've had has been delicious. Frankie, our server this last visit was awesome. The servers wear their pjs. It's really a cute establishment.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne Asade Breakfast Burrito

UyN36Xsuupa3BxxV04DTVA.text: I've always heard such great reviews from friends, and decided to give this breakfast joint a try. The staff is welcoming and for such a busy place, we were seated pretty quick. The food is affordable and is a little hefty on the servings, which means more of an excuse to take it home. I ordered the Egg Benedict and a cup of their oj. Service is alright and see all staff tending to their busy rush hour, our waitress checked up on us multiple times, and the atmosphere is relaxing for an early morning;  But with only have eating the egg Benedict as my first meal (and last meal of the day) I felt sick afterwards and knew right away that I had food poisoning; im not sure what exactly it was, but with this unpleasant experience after...it's gonna take me awhile to return to this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BmI6QMQcLg2DFGi7lWliWg.text: Stunned. So good. Tried the chilaqilues, b & g, and cinnamon crumble French toast. French press coffee: do it. My favorite thing though? Probably the hash browns. Best I've ever had.

qDOeZUHyPSGmlPsgb03Bqg.text: Chilaquiles were amazing! I have to respond to some of the Yelp reviews, first of all the one customer that was complaining about the Chilaquiles, do you even know what they are? The tortilla chips are supposed to be soft, they are soaked in enchilada sauce before making, and are made with eggs, it's a mexican breakfast dish. I thought they were so good. Next, the complaint about the chicken and waffles, my friend had them & they were equally good, the breast was tender and flavorful. I've been here a couple times and had a couple different items on the menu, I have never had anything disappointing. Customer service has always been top notch. Love the French press coffee and the pot of bread & fresh jam. They also have a patio, people bring their dogs, comfy table & chairs with umbrellas.

NI_CIozpMWBQqKFGxgvFrA.text: I love this place. It's easily my favorite breakfast place in town.  The service is always good. The fact that everyone is wearing pajamas gives the place a nice feel. A man who I believe is the owner interacts with customers on a regular basis in a very friendly way.  Now, the food. Admittedly, I haven't had a huge sampling of the menu. The reason for this is that once I tried the fried chicken and waffles, there was really no reason to do much in the way of exploring. The chicken is pounded before it's fried so it fits perfectly on top of the waffle. It also has a nice peppery thing going on. Not only is it delicious but it's more "convenient" to eat than chicken and waffles where the chicken still has the bone in it.  Also, they have some kind of English sausages there. Those things are also awesome.

r0JUwUMgGf0ZtElFdq8ktA.text: I have been going there for 4 yrs and its been real good.  This past year it has gone down hill.  The waitresses have all left and the new ones are rude and unfriendly.  It takes forever for our food to arrive at our table after its been sitting on the counter waiting to be delivered.  The food is drowning in butter and the bacon is swimming in grease.  I will never go back.

2i8Vs-7ILiviDEX8A0k3NQ.text: Amazing food!  The service was top notch and the food was great!  Loved the pot bread among everything else we tried.  We loved this place so much that we had to repeat!

Xr_rEUITkNtkFLJYPs1h2Q.text: Great little find on the way out of town, I will definitely put this on the rotation when I'm in Vegas. I had the eggs benadict and it was amazing best part was the hash Browns, perfectly seasoned with the right amount of crisp. Waitress was great also.

V0yjGgl58mlnENln6MyVLA.text: Some of our friends said this place was really good so we decided to give it a go; it also had good Yelp reviews and, being the Yelper I am, I try and put faith in my fellow Yelpians (is that what we're called?  I dunno).  Unfortunately, it was a little less than what I was hoping for.  We arrived and were seated immediately.  The restaurant was maybe half-full and it looked like most people were eating or had already finished, enjoying cups of coffee and talking amongst their parties.  We expected pretty quick, efficient service due to this, and did not receive it.  Everything was slow: ordering, getting things to our table, the check - it was really disappointing since it was obvious we missed the "big rush."  The hash browns were definitely nothing to write home about and tasted starchy - I tried some of my fiance's.  And their coffee was like watery mud oil.  I ordered a signature dish because I really like to try those from places.  So, I got the blueberry and cream cheese stuffed french toast (I believe this was the name).  It came out and was HUGE!  They definitely don't skimp on portions, hence the extra star.  When I tried it, though, it was way too processed sugary.  I picked at the blueberries and the french toast for awhile but got full super fast and ended up sharing it with the rest of the table.  French toast doesn't really make good leftovers.  Pretty sure I should have gotten a heart attack from that, but the overall taste WAS decent.  Another downer was they didn't have low-fat cream cheese as an alternative, which is probably why I felt so full so fast as well.  Overall, definitely not impressed.  Perhaps everyone else just got lucky and had better food / service than I did.  Considering the above plus the prices, I'd rather just go to IHOP.

17SfuKsUER0cE0hzxAyDTg.text: I went here for the first time the other day and I was really disappointed. I had the steak and eggs and French press coffee. The steak I ordered medium plus it was the worst cut of a ribeye I have ever had, all fat and tissue, no meat. The eggs I ordered over medium they came out over hard and the service was uninspired and slow the silverware was dirty. I don't think I will be back.

nPzaIhHpsOS9GHbcVqFkbQ.text: Rise and Shine people....there is a new breakfast place in town!  We arrived late for breakfast here a couple weeks back and had such a great time! The place itself is very family friendly looking, giggets on the walls and waitresses dressed in pjs. MY FAVORITE!  They had really nice outdoor seating which is where we sat. Our group had already ordered but our waitress took our order promptly and was able to bring it out with our friends. AWESOME!  We shared the corn beef hash and scrambled eggs but shared everyone elses food too. The food was good....not amazing...not to die for....but definitively worth our drive. Everything tasted good. I particularly liked the pancakes. Yum!  Overall a great sunrise stop to fill your bellies before starting your day. Good service, good food and good prices. You should not leave unsatisfied.   Rise and Shine....I sure did after eating my breakfast. YUM!

D7Sh8139jIqJUri46mf1NA.text: This place was an absolute disgrace to breakfast places everywhere! My husband and kids ate there for my husbands birthday breakfast and the food was just awful .i got the eggs Benedict which used to be my favorite dish until this place singlehandedly ruined it , it was a tough English muffin and the hollandaise was super sour and had way too much lemon in it, not to mention the hash browns we're basically raw and had freezer burn taste to it , they tried to cover it up with an excessive amount of butter . My husband got the country fried steak which was just a piece of thin meat with breading and the breading was very chalky, to call it a country fried steak is giving it too much credit for whatever that mistake was . My kids however liked their food because they are 2 and 3 and giving sugar and pancakes to children is always a success . Long story short , you're over paying for shit food! NEVER AGAIN!

KamHwwmBZmMpnJqGE02sVg.text: I work in the "industry" and I would've gave a higher rating but service is major and thus we lacked. Food and portions are great but service sucked, well OUR server anyway.(For her sake I won't mention her name). She was really nice though, just lacked in customer needs. We were there a little over an hour and WE had to ask to refill our coffee, came to checkup on us once. While she stand at the prep area talking stories and just hanging out. Would eat there again, just hope we have a different sever.

WNnxQPTDcdBCUOQf6Xqw9w.text: Cute breakfast spot.  The food quality and taste here is excellent.  The chicken and waffle is awesome, fried chicken - juicy on the inside and perfectly crispy outside.  Can't go wrong with anything here.  The potted bread is so also a must, so yummy.  Wish they have a place like this in LA.  Definitely a must stop when I'm in Vegas.

BsWEYknC4ql7WY1yC5It6w.text: We live about 4 blocks from this restaurant. Over the last 3 months this place has fallen a part! We waited about 25 min to be seated, the fat boy seating people appeared to be more interested in making sure his friends sat down before the customers.  We are huge small business supporters but in this case we spoke to the ladies at the register, expressed our frustration and walked out.  The attitude at this place really sucks! We weren't even acknowledged , no apology, no can we fix it for you.  The only thing they had was a dumb look on their face.  To the business owner: your poor trained, unprofessional  staff is driving out your local client! You will need to hire a professional to manage the staff.  While at the restaurant about 6 tables where dirty with dishes and about 3 parties waiting for a table! Finally people started leaving. We did the same and went to the M casino hash house a go go. This restaurant is now our replacement.

nCTIlpFFBIx_omzzWyhX6w.text: Our server was great! The wait was supposed to be a half hour; the wait was 15 minutes until we were seated. That was a pleasant surprise! The girls at the front were lovely as well. Unfortunately, that is where it all the positive points end for me. I was given a napkin with a fork and knife rolled inside, which is standard for most breakfast spots. When I picked the bundle up to unroll it I SEE AN OBVIOUS SMEAR OF BLOOD ACROSS THE NAPKIN!!! I quietly alert our waitress and she says "OHH!! OPPS!! WOW!! Let me take that." She brought me a new set and nothing else was said or mentioned again. No manager, shift supervisor, janitor - ZERO. Blood on a napkin served to a patron is pretty serious if I remember correctly, like a health code violation serious. I try to move on with my meal, I personally only ordered a yogurt parfait. When it arrives I notice it was made upside-down. Yes, that sounds silly and petty but when you have a slender glass making it upside-down gives you about 1 or 2 strawberries max and 3 thin slices of a banana. Then the entire thing was soaked in honey (my fault, I should have asked for that on the side.). We also ordered an egg white omelette. They didn't make it with egg whites. The pancakes were overly sweet, like they added something to the batter. BUT... The juices and little cinnamon rolls were delicious. Sadly, the negatives FAR outweighed the positives in this experience. Bummer.

ttchUZ9Si2jpysFoM4vYWA.text: I ordered the N.Y. Steak and Eggs it was tough and dry.  The eggs were under cooked and the cook took away part of my eggs. Our server never checked back with us to see if everything was ok or to see if we needed refills drinks or coffee.

i9sMFx9iCb5LlgpIuKDK9w.text: Really cute place but it's a little small. We waited about 25 minutes for a table. The waiters wear pajamas which is kinda cool. I will come back when I'm in the neighborhood.

iok3VEFyJQyleOSKkWLdBA.text: The servers wearing pajamas is original and the french press coffee is a refreshing option for this side of town.  We had high hopes for this restaurant, but unfortunately the menu serves up cheap ingredients to its patrons (for the exception of the Illy coffee) and the cooks fall short on preparing food properly.    At a price point of $10-$15 for breakfast, they should know how to cook eggs properly.  Nothing irritates us more than when a cook makes two cheap/small eggs (over medium)  together on an extremely high heat using a bright yellow colored fat  (margarine?).  The plate was loaded with what appeared to be nasty refined margarine or oil.  I soaked up two napkins full of this nasty stuff.  We were delivered two rounds of this type of cooking and just gave up.  The hash browns that we ordered as golden (as opposed to raw in oil) were flash fried.  Disgusting and half hearted presentation.  Seriously, Robert Irvine would have hit the roof if he was ever served this food.    We also ordered  pancakes that were loaded with artificial vanilla extract.  I've tasted better frozen pancakes than the chemical cakes cakes served at this restaurant. Sorry but it's True. Very disappointing.  If money is no object and you don't care about what's in the food that you put into your body, this is your place.  If you really want to have a top shelf breakfast with amazing ingredients, visit EAT downtown.  It is so worth the drive and your body will thank you for it.

svWukGJNMs3b5bBRNmLYsg.text: I enjoy coming here for breakfast when I'm in town.   The food is always good and the price is decent.   I'm not as big of a fan of their lunch menu but I could eat their breakfast for lunch and dinner (if they were opened for dinner).  My favorite is the Corned Beef Hash and Eggs and also the Ribeye and Eggs.   Both are cooked well and very tasty.     I also like the hash browns here,  they have a nice crisp to them.   They used to give you little pots of bread but stopped doing that.  That was a nice touch I wish they would bring back.  Service from the waitresses is typically very good and service prompt even when busy.     Seems like the primary hostess is not always happy to be working early in the morning.  She rarely has a smile on her face.

_S6sTBiohgqaQQwZBc0mSA.text: LOVE this place!  We go almost every weekend, the best pancakes I have had in town.  The staff is always friendly, and the service is good.  My husband and I share the little "pot of bread" which is fluffy bread w/ a hint of cinnamon and sugar mixed in.

Ba4Pv0o9chRcl3XEKjxNig.text: Great breakfast place.  Everything I've had has the little touches that makes it better.  The oj is fresh squeezed and the coffee is good.  I've had the steak chilaquila a couple of times and I think that's the best thing.   The cinnamon raisin French toast is also a winner.  Only thing this place lacks is a bar. I really like a bloody mary. Another minus is the wait sometimes an be quite long.

fgACQz12jlLizCYQ19rHqQ.text: Pro's Wait for a group of 20: only 15-20 mins! Service: far superior than some fine dining places! Staff actually looked like they enjoyed working there. Food: Cinnamon french toast was perfectly crisped, sweet, & fresh. Steak Chilaquiles got high marks from our group as well.  Meh: Toast in a cup: though you'd think otherwise.

Fzbsu_RjliYdD5E6ks5Gvw.text: Ex and I went Dicing 2 Eat (Dice Living).     I chose the restaurant because I had heard that they wear their Pajamas when serving and it sounded neat.    I was right!    They do and it is neat!  Once there we were seated in the nearest booth to the door because I walk on a cane from a broken ankle I sustained in December, no fun!    but that was very nice of the waitress to do for me.  The restaurant was clean and surprisingly empty-very few people were there and i had heard to come early and be prepared to stand in line so that made me wonder....  I had to try an item off the menu from a section chosen by The Die.   ~The Classics done better~ was chosen for me and then my Ex Don got to choose an item for me to try from that section (want to go Dicing with us yet?    we need a 3rd  :D )    Chilaquiles was chosen for me (that may be the incorrect spelling though)   It was basically fried Tortilla chips covered with Refried beans, cheese, sour cream, salsa, avocado and topped with 2 eggs.   YUM!!      I chose the section for my partner and I chose beverages and then I was to choose his item and chose a Mocha Iced Coffee.   He did not like it, he said it was watery and weak, I decided to order the Vanilla Mocha and had the same results and we love Iced coffee, Ihop seems to make the best from what we have had so far and this is the ONLY reason I have to give this place a 4 instead of a 5 star review.  The service was excellent and because I told the waitress that we were new, she brought me a Pot O Bread for Free, its a cinnamon roll in a cup served with a kind of sweet and not sweet dipping sauce-It was excellent.  Highly recommend this place!       They even have spinning umbrella lamps!       We will be going back next time The Dice chooses it of course!

zthyLZwJE3BkQrBYN-HyCQ.text: We've lived down the street from here for three years now and finally decided to have breakfast here. I don't know why we waited so long! We came early enough, so there was no large crowd. We were greeted by our server Krys who was nice enough to go over the menu with us and she recommended the Country fried steak and the Red Velvet pancakes. First off, the pancakes were so good. Light and super savory. It was like eating cake. Cake that had an awesome cream cheese syrup!   Krys also mentioned that the Country Fried Steak was life changing, she was right! The Country Fried Steak is the best I've ever had hands down! I'm a big fan of Cracker Barrel and Rise and Shine just blew it out of the water! The steak was so tender with a light coat of breading that has a hint of spice. My wife had order envy and vowed to get it next time. Next time may be coming up very soon! Excellent breakfast spot in Southern Highlands that has a nice warming atmosphere with a great staff that truly love being there. Highly recommended!

Pkd9-rg2IG0_tklFIWVdfQ.text: Staff is friendly and helpful. Fresh juices and smoothies are delicious. Food is good - sometimes items might come out incorrect but they are always quick to fix the problem! Large portions so I normally order from the children's menu !

Kzpi9VcaGeEBwKZFnaCk3w.text: We have been coming to rise and shine for about 3 years, for a while it was our Sunday breakfast spot and we would go every Sunday. We always get the same thing, country fried steak, the Texas French toast and a side of bacon. Slowly the service and "friendly" atmosphere turned to crabby and sloppy. I understand that breakfast places are usually packed on the weekends but that is no excuse for the lack of customer service. When I say "thank you" as you put down my food I don't expect a lot but maybe a "you're welcome". Last week we went to the newer location on Valle Verde and because the food has always been Phenomenal we will take the drive and go to that one. We will miss our regular servers but the new staff that has been hired needs to be trained in basic manners at the Southern Highlands location.

DiQ8edKJfIqZNvqqfUxpDw.text: Delicious!! I recommend the buffalo chicken & eggs or chicken & waffle. The chicken is so light and crispy.. it's like nothing I've ever eaten..so yummy..and a lot of food!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My son loved his breakfast....chicken and waffles. It&#39;s enough for two, but he ate it all.

LQ3rrmaiLKZTdhNVaJ-NGQ.text: I came in for breakfast around 9am and the place was already busy! However, I had a party of 4 people and we didn't wait for long at all to be seated. As we got seated we were greeted by a nice sever who gave us as much time as we needed and since it was our first time there I have to admit we took about 15-20 minutes before deciding what we wanted. I ordered the Ultimate Steak and Eggs w/ the "bread-o-cup." After waiting for about 15-20 minutes our food came out and their portioning was big! My favorite part was the bread-o-cup, it's a bread with cinnamon and they give you a side of glaze to dip your bread. The total for my plate alone was $18 including tax. Our server was amazing she always checked up on us and always had a positive attitude, she recommended the bread-o-cup to me and she was excited for me to try it. Also, their employee's here wear pajamas, it's so cute! This breakfast restaurant's work attire is so unique and creative, the environment is filled with families and happy morning people in my opinion haha. I recommend you come in to this place right when they open or between 7am and 9am because anytime after that they have a long wait. When we were done eating there were people waiting inside to be seated as well as groups outside to be seated. This is a great breakfast spot.

91e8zUUpSlnIW2E6kXwoQg.text: OMG!  So good. Pot of bread is fresh, hot, yeasty and cinnamony.  Chicken and waffles are huge. The cinnamon sticks in the warm syrup bottle are a great touch.  Hash browns are wonderful. Very different.  Waitstaff is friendly, attentive and fast.  Hubby had chicken fried steak and eggs. It was a huge plate of food and he said it was great. We are from CA and just passing thru and saw this on yelp and it was so worth the stop.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was the chicken and waffle.  It was so good I couldn&#39;t wait. Ha

0Egr1UowfkvmTFRwwlWlPg.text: Location was on the noisy side. The food was ok nothing to rave about. The servers were nice and pleasant... but a bit slow.

8WlzfDr_JDsyhQIzL5cjcQ.text: This is a really good place for breakfast brunch. It gets busy in the morning and they don't take reservations so make sure to get there early.   We went around 9:40am and waited twenty minutes for a table.   I came for steak and eggs so that is what I ordered. They have a little spin to it. They put steak and poached egg on a bagel like an eggs Benedict. This was creative and so delicious. It was called NY steak, spinach and Benedict bagel. This also comes with a pot of bread that everyone on yelp was raving about. Unfortunately, they were already out of this pot of bread so they gave a choice of bread for toast instead. I still would like to see what this pot of bread tastes like. :(   My sister got the red velvet pancakes. She stated that they were really rich.   Another one of my sisters got the Fancy Steakhouse Omelet. She claims this was delicious.   One more of my other sisters got the Three Little Pigs Two Fisted Bagel and Egg Sandwich. She said it was good but she didn't enjoy the sausage.   Lastly, service here was excellent. I didn't catch our servers name but she was really friendly and she seemed to really enjoy her time. All the servers wear pajamas. Maybe it's due to the comfort of the uniform or the people she works with, but either way, she seemed to have gotten up on the right side of the bed. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New York Steak, Spinach and Bagel Benedict

bZrTCTK_t2ATlt6qBcuOag.text: Rise & Shine is a local breakfast place by our neighborhood.  We've frequented it a few times and the service and food has always been on point. Yesterday they really showed their 5+ star service.  My family had our reunion this weekend and we had trouble finding a place that could accommodate our large party.   At last minute i thought of Rise & Shine and Liam the manager was able to book us @ 9:30am (busiest time on Sunday morning) As we filtered in more and more of my family showed that we hadn't expected. never did it throw them off.  We were a total of 52 people.  Our server Vanessa and the rest of the staff rocked it.   There was a couple of missed orders but to be expected.  Overall all 52 people enjoyed and were happy (hard feat to accomplish) Wanted to give the last shout out to the gal that passsed tickets out and made paying easy (sorry didn't catch your name).   Thank you again for such awesome service and ending our reunion with delicious food.

YeI9IIEuHMA6A_cJu7ksTA.text: The food was delicious! This was our first visit to this place. They have a very open atmosphere that is pretty welcoming. Our server, Vanessa, was very nice and accommodating. I easily will travel across the city from centennial to come here again.   The menu itself has plenty of options, so naturally i ordered more than one thing The NY Steak, Spinach and Benedict-Bagel, which was amazing, i finished the whole thing, along with a side order of there Crunchy Cinnamon French Toast. I am basically in a food coma while writing this review. I generally don't eat this much, but i traveled quite a bit just to check out the place so i said what the heck. It was worth the drive. I'll be back again to try more food out.

pEGtJXh-FTVASFTgIe6Dnw.text: This place was recommended to me by a friend and I'm glad he did. This place is about 8 miles from the strip but we'll worth getting out of the hustle and bustle of the Vegas Strip. Once there you're greeted by servers in PJs. The stay open only until 3 so go early. I had the chilaquiles and rib eye. Amazingly good and affordable.

_Urow_wq6PFGkuxeYGJYmw.text: Not going back. My family checked out the menu online and ordered take out. It was their online menu. When the food got home it wasn't what we ordered. I called the restaurant to let them know and the female who answered told me what I saw online wasn't correct. When I let her know they should probably fix that she stated they don't even have prices online. Umm??? Sorry. Not lying, lady. When I pay as much as we did and we overpay and get shorted on the items I expect better customer service. The short stack platter online should come with 4 hotcakes and 2 eggs and bacon. I got 2 cakes and 1 egg and barely cooked bacon. The fullstack online comes with 5 hotcakes for $0.70 more. If they've changed their menu fine. What about that other egg? Why are the pancakes in various sizes and falling apart?Sorry you were busy but if you guys can't provide quality every time why put anything out? So upset we paid so much for what we got.

DYB_nfGxDQ8yQsXvHEeTmQ.text: My family loves this place. This is our go to place for breakfast. Best pancakes in town. I would have given this place five stars, but sometimes customer services isn't always the best.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thank you so much for he surprise birthday pancakes. This is my families favorite place for breakfast!!!!

-DYA2yBOl32p9o7DRQexQA.text: I went here last week for the first time. There were a couple of parties ahead of us but we were seated within 10 minutes of arrival.  The restaurant is clean and spacey. The staff is friendly and definitely acknowledges youe presence. Some of the waiters and waitresses wears pajamas to stick with the rise and shine theme.   The decor of the place is very appealing as well. They used umbrellas as lamp covers hanging from the ceiling. They also have mosaic art along the walls, making this place very comfortable and homey. They also have an open kitchen, where you can actually see them cooking and preparing meals.  I did not get steak and eggs but I did get the a classic egg, sausage, hash brown platter. Everything was well done, the sausage was juicy. The eggs were perfectly over easy, and the hash browns were crispy and moist in the inside.   They have a pretty intensive menu full of good food with reasonable pricing! I will definitely come back here again.  Great job Rise & Shine and staff!

XZEGwCCVLJYGAJZk-dZsIQ.text: Love this place!!! Yelped and found this gem. It's a cute little cafe with daisy umbrellas hanging down from each light fixture. Servers wear pajamas!! It was just a little hot because it's 100 degrees outside and we were sitting on the window table, and drinking strong hot coffee with my fav French vanilla creamer.   I ordered the ham n eggs Benedict with spinach. Delicious! Hollandaise sauce was on point, better than most other breakfast places and it's also drizzled with balsamic. ;) The BF ordered the roasted turkey, bacon, egg, Swiss, tomato on an "everything" bagel. Wow is all I have to say!!! Super huge with lots of cheese and delicious. We will definitely be here on the regular!!

1tfnnmp1Y5Whiz06aWPDQg.text: We had breakfast here this morning and our experience here was not that great. We were a party of five and when we sat down, we asked for water and coffee. We waited for our beverages for more than fifteen minutes. While waiting, we start seeing other parties being seated. They were getting drinks... Where the hell was ours? We couldn't even find our server and we were getting agitated and hungry.   Finally, our server comes out of the woodwork and gives us our beverages. We gave our order and that too, took forever and a day! They were out of peanut butter and blueberry French toast that we ordered, but didn't tell us until ten minutes later. While waiting, we watch getting more and more pissed with every person on the same row as us get their food while we did not - and we arrived before ALL of them!   Our server was not attentive, never apologized, and we just felt like they could of cared less if we got up and left. After feeling like we've been there for thirty minutes, we finally get our food. I shared the corn beef hash with my sister. It was ok - I've had better corn beef hash elsewhere. The only reason I give this place two stars instead of one was their Belgian waffle. It was pretty yummy.

8t4r5lm4vaE7F6NcUKIQgw.text: Ordered food for pick up and once I got there I had to wait 20 minutes to get my food. The service was slow, the manager was rude. I guess people that eat there are more important. I walk in and there's only 1 person at the cashier. I politely wait but the cashier was trying to save all the papers from flying(the workers would open the side door and the receipts would fly everywhere) then 3 people get in line and the manger tell me to go behind them. But I got there before them?!! That's not fair. I pay and the cashier says have a nice day. I tell him, "where's my food?" I loved waiting 20 extra minutes to get my foodlol...just kidding. Oh and you should see the $2.50 I got charged for a side of strawberries. If you don't believe me, look at the picture I posted on yelp. The service gets worse every time I come.  Not coming back.

sgHe8Pl1AzVXwWGhQdl1VA.text: This place has amazing food and we are regular customers here (who isn't)  Do not plan to bring parties larger than 4 or else expect to wait longer than one hour. The restaurant had poor table management. The employees know people are waiting but don't show sense of urgency to get the tables moving. It seems that they are expanding as well, but a better table management system would be beneficial for this business. Using a marker and paper to manage tables is not effective. It's 2015! There is still no adaptation of Apple Pay acceptance.

VCsGClp8FaNSISZ3p93pGw.text: **Updated Review ** This was my first time back here in years, and my rating sadly has tanked.  Came in on a Monday morning and the place was pretty empty (to be expected for a weekday).  We sat at the counter.  I had some questions to make a veg or vegan breakfast, and the waitress was not helpful in the least. Okay, I get it, the name may say it all..but you can be helpful ...right??? Wrong.  I asked about the breakfast potatoes being cooked in oil or butter and she said it was butter... imitation butter. Wow, a place that charges $10-$15 per plate and you're serving fake butter? Regardless I wanted my potatoes cooked in oil. It was a no go. So I ordered a juice... sucked it down...and will not return.

P4lGeNVpc4xAgCCSCpjpxQ.text: This place is so over rated that it's not even funny.. the people rating this are not foodies just locals living in the area with nowhere else to really eat. Don't expect the staff to be all happy, coz no smile ont their place... most especially the person, that stays by the door.... Poor customer service.

p9gMPlhm_KitLLYdLQfm0Q.text: How can I start with greatness and delight in the morning?  Let's go to Rise and Shine in the Southern Highlands Marketplace!   The wait was a short 10 min followed by overly cheerful pajama wearing ladies that would be a colorful start to any day. It was for us.   Sat down and was immediately greeted by our bubbly waitress and my husband and I knew from the menu description that we wanted to share an omelette and picked the FANCY Steakhouse Omelette packed with juicy steak, mushrooms, onion, cheese, spinach and bearnaise. Can we just say ABSOLUTELY YUM!!  Besides the pot of bread (extra yum) and the potatoes filled with onions (that were perfect)...Rise and Shine is the place to be. They do serve breakfast as well as lunch. Simply Wonderful!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shot from our booth

cXnBTqUWJptEeyUJeS95tQ.text: Very mediocre. The prices are high and the food is just...meh. The service was terrible, our server never refilled our drinks and didn't follow up. Next time I would rather go to McDonalds. At least they have portions that match the price.

TdbwoEJ_BohMl2p4nOzxVQ.text: I told our waitress, Christine, that based on the reviews, we had high expectations, and that they had exceeded them. Chicken fried steak: a New York strip. Unheard of, and I've seen a lot of chicken fried steak. Perfectly done, with just the right spice in the accompanying gravy, which came in two side porcelain cups. I'm happy with my fried steak covered & smothered but it made my wife and son happy as they are not into their food touching, and the serving size definitely is share-worthy. The bacon: perfectly finished, with a unique, slightly smoky flavor, and a side is 4 pieces, not 2 or 3. Cinnamon French toast: one of about 8 carb-centric breakfast options, each of which sounded incredible, but again, better than described or expected. My wife's favorite part was friendly Christine whose bright and positive attitude left us with all feeling happier about the day.  We will make a point to return!

ZCqskv_uEYc500LPNdQFUg.text: Too good! I tryed the bacon wraped steak medalions the steak was top notch and I must admit so were the eggs and potatoes..the only bummer is that this place did not serve beer...I love steak eggs and beer!...MUST TRY THIS PLACE PPL..DO IT!

KFWFY7nn9iFc2QYYFjFTsQ.text: One of my favorite breakfast spots the have pot of bread that you can get instead of toast get it ! So amazing it's like a cinnamon bun without the frosting soft melts in your mouth. My family enjoys the red velvet pancakes intense chocolate flavor almost don't even need syrup. The omelets are so fluffy and packed with flavor and the crispy hash browns will knock your socks off. I would recommend anyone to come here bring the family and a plus the service is wonderful Amanda I believe is her name pretty girl with green eyes very attentive our drinks where always full

vafAnGTQcZl2_L9SnZRd6g.text: Being a huge fan of breakfast food, I wish that I could say I loved this place and that I'm excited to go back, especially since it's locally owned. But, unfortunately that isn't the case.   he service was great. We were greeted right away and seated. Soon after someone took our drink orders [they serve illy coffee!]. Soon after, our waitress came up to see if we had any questions.   I'm on a mission to find the best chicken fried steak in Las Vegas, so it was an easy choice when I saw it on their menu. I'll admit, once the food came out and I saw my order, I wanted to drool a little bit. It was a nice big portion of the chicken, scrambled eggs, gravy, & hash browns.   The eggs were cooked well enough, but lacked any taste whatsoever. A little salt would've gone a long way. The hash browns seemed a little undercooked. Potato was still kind of starchy, and they were missing that nice golden brown color on top. The gravy was actually quite good, and was probably the highlight of the dish. Moving on to the main item, the steak. I liked the fact that it was a thick steak with a thin batter on it. Unlike the eggs, it did not lack in flavor whatsoever. Unfortunately, the ONLY flavor it had was of black pepper. Apparently what they lacked in salt in the eggs, they made up for with an excessive amount of black pepper on the coating of the steak and on the steak.   One of my fellow diners ordered the chicken & waffles. His chicken had the same exact problem as my steak. All we could taste was the black pepper. It's unfortunate really, because both the chicken and steak were tender and cooked well.   The pot of bread that came with my order was sub-par. Like the eggs, it lacked taste. I don't usually like to but butter on my rolls, but this bread definitely needed it to get some flavor.   So, all in all - great service but lacked a bit in the food department. The food was cooked well, but needed better execution in my opinion. Hopefully, I just went on an off day. Maybe next time, if I so happen to be on that side of town during breakfast hours I might give it another chance. But it's definitely not worth another 20 minute drive for the sole purpose of eating there.

JhX0kmor_N5msFlg2RfJ5g.text: This place was good! Very crowded but the wait wasn't too bad. Our waitress Rylee was amazing and always around if we needed something. The pot of bread is to die for and a must order. I want to go back just for 5 orders of that. The only thing that wasn't amazing was the steak, it was dry and tough. However it could have been an off day. We will definitely be going back.

U6GR-M318M-l_l23TH5qjg.text: Arrived at 10:45 on Sunday for breakfast with my gal pal.  Surprised by the short wait.  We got a junky table right next to the open door with frigid gusts coming through.  We asked to be moved and were reseated in a nice booth within 5 minutes. Crisis averted.  Good coffee.  We just got the plain ole, plain ole instead of the french press, and it was good.  I decided, since the name says "a steak and egg place," I should probably order steak and eggs.  So, I ordered the "ultimate," a ribeye (my fave cut), 2 eggs, hashbrowns, and sourdough. $12.95.  The steak was cooked perfectly and nicely seasoned.   The hashbrowns were good.  A nice rustic style different from your average frozen shredded hashbrown.  Eggs were cooked perfect as well, just needed salt and pepper.  Easy to add. No complaints.  My gal pal ordered the steak and chilaquiles.  They were very tasty, and quite a portion! I cleverly coerced her into ordering the cinnamon bread so we could share.  It was good.  However; not sweet like I had anticipated.    The restaurant is super cute.  Decor is charming.  Menu is cluttered and overwhelming.  The service was excellent.  Offered to refill our coffee 3-4 times, allowed us planty of time to chat.  Didn't rush us.  We had a lovely breakfast and I would go back anytime!  I would give it five stars if they had additional offerings such as lattes, cappucinos, bloody mary's and mimosas.  Necessary breakfast beverages in my book.  $33 for two coffees and 2two breakfasts.  $19 each with tip.

pYdQNk_yXbqDnlG0KgdnTQ.text: I visited for Sunday brunch and the place was slammed.  During my fifteen minute wait I watched various delicious looking meals go by, and noted the satisfied bliss of those receiving them.  I was seated at the countermand was attended to promptly my one of the many pajama clad waitresses.  My bacon wrapped pork tenderloin and egg breakfast was awesome!  I shall return to try more of their delights!

d8-vE_0Saj7v-72UB-n7Zw.text: We came here for Sunday brunch and had to wait about 30 minutes to be seated, but it was well worth the wait. The French press coffee is AH-MAZING!  The chicken and waffles, Chilaquiles, and bacon wrapped filet with eggs were so good!  Service was great too. We will definitely be back!

pe2erieQkY6semzENn9Ohg.text: Went for the first time for Valentines day breakfast at 10am and as expected had to wait 35 minutes for a table, but they had enough chairs outside to accommodate the waiting. I ordered the Belgian waffle which was nothing special, but they made the best overhard eggs I've ever had and the thick, crispy bacon was amazing. My husband got the best omelet he has ever had, with a side of hashed browns that we ended up sharing and I wish I could have more of! The ambiance is cute and we will definitely be eating here again!

ynO0pLuJJxctrc6RGzEzbQ.text: I would like to start off saying that me and my roomie showed up in onesies. This place is adorable and probably the best place in town to eat breakfast hands down.

zIppuiPA_hDg3qK_Yg4p1Q.text: Coffee, amazing. Red velvet pancakes with cream cheese syrup, bomb. Burritos, huge.

pdwq-zLdob3k_Qu4_camjg.text: The management is the best advertisement because he is friendly, humorous, and attentive. Another place were listening to someone speak about food with excitement. I love a place that does that, then genuinely seeks out customers opinion. I admire when people refuse to allow themselves to become complacent with a good menu. Besides the gentleman that greeted and seated us, the rest of the staff were also pleasant.   Today was my birthday and it was a fitting place to celebrate. Although most of the festivities will be tomorrow, this relaxing brunch made my day. When I think of festive eats, I go all out. I had ordered the chicken and waffle. When I first cut into the waffle, I was a bit disappointed. It lacked the crunch that I normally love, but after thinking it over, I can understand why they lean towards this style. The chicken is moist, crispy and seasoned to perfection. Having a more cake like waffle gives contrast in texture and soaks up the maple syrup better. You will be dousing your dish in this warm condiment. It is outstanding. The maple syrup alone deserves five stars. The steak and eggs are also delectable. The 8oz cut is marbled well with just enough fat to keep the meat moist and tender. The eggs have a clean flavor that does not need any salt. The potatoes were soft like mashed potatoes on the inside, but had a crunchy outer layer that was nice. Nothing on this plate needed ketchup or steak sauce. We ordered the pot of bread with this meal and it was gone just as soon as it hit the table. The jam was filled with huge chunks of strawberries, but was quite sweet.  Rise and Shine would be perfect if only it offered some lighter fares. On special occasions, like today, I am willing to go crazy on my caloric intake.  Yet a part of my subconscious will not let this go without guilt. I am not even Catholic, so what's with this overbearing feeling? It might be some time before I visit again.

Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles
