BumUTEM_Zz6o6Wbj3uqAEg.text: My new favorite place to eat breakfast.  My girlfriend and I just moved near here.  We've stopped by about 3 times since.  Haven't had a bad meal yet.  The service has been good and friendly each time.

6pn75GOfwRtY1wuSQOrXkg.text: We were staying at the M resort and wanted a local breakfast spot. We yelped and found this place. Chicken and waffles were fantastic, service was impeccable... A great break from the crazy of Las Vegas. It's worth leaving the hotel for this place.

wW6xIF5eXHhM_7OjqfG2mw.text: After reading about the wait most people have at Babycakes Cafe I decided to give another breakfast place a try (I'll try Babycakes one day...). So I Yelped a spot and was instantly intrigued by Rise and Shine. It was the location-not far from where I live- and those darn cute flower umbrellas that they have hanging from their ceiling. It was busy but with a ten minute wait on a Sunday Morning I'm not complaining....The flower umbrellas were so cute and everytime the door opened the air spinned some of them around-Whimsical I tell ya!!! Anyways, I did also enjoy all the mosaics on the walls as well-Artsie!!!  The food= An option for bread is a cinnamon bread baked in a flower pot with a knife stabbed in the top served with butter and strawberry jam. Let me tell ya one is not enough- It was so good but I wish those flower pots were fatter for more darn warm yummy bread. Cute idea though... I loved reading that the Chicken in the Chicken and Waffles was a chicken breast-YAY!!!!!! So I picked that and it was really good. The breading was pretty tasty and spicy as well and the chicken breast was pounded flat so you got a pretty big piece. My daughter got a short stack of pancakes-So fluffy and good too...Now on to the grumpy BF who already was having attitude-He got eggs,hash browns and bacon-He was not impressed and hated his bacon-Oh well, so sad....I tried his food and it was fine he is just too particular about his bacon but like I told him thats why you have a voice use it and request what you like!!! I will be back and the BF can wait in the car....

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oh so yummy bread-One Flower pot is not enough...
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oh so yummy bread-One Flower pot is not enough...
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cEZ1fkuZSgUcVhQa1B2QyQ.text: First time here was a decent experience. Service was great. And food was good. I had the classic steak and eggs. Steak was pretty flavorful. Only complaint is that the steak was overcooked. I ordered medium rare and it came out well done. The rarest part of the steak looked medium well. Although it was over cooked. It was a pretty tender piece of steak. But if the steak is the main part of the meal, the cooks need to be more attentive to that. Selling point is the steak. Not the hash browns, biscuits, eggs, etc.... service wasn't too bad either. Although they could've done a bit more than walk away after I let them know about the steak.

Mw2PbPvPL4BWnGBSAiZSJQ.text: My husband and I just moved in to this part of town and when going shopping to Smith's saw this place and have been wanting to try it. We finally went this morning and it was reaaaally good! My husband got some eggs and steak and he inhaled the plate in no time! I got a classic eggs, bacon, hash b. Potato and there was nothing left on that plate! Both dishes came with option of biscuit, french toast or a bread roll in a cup, since my husband and I could not decide which one to choose, the lady that helped us just got them all for us! They also have fresh squeezed OJ. I asked if it was really fresh OJ or the tropicana (bottled one) and she told me she squeezes the oranges herself! Too bad they run out of it! I'm definitely coming back and getting it!.

QUan3oJQUNEl69ClLsY72A.text: Horrible service by the hostess my party as well as another just stormed out. There was a large party of 7 in front of us and it took a while to get that set up which is fine. The problem came after that when all the parties that waited for the 7top to be seated were completely ignored so the hostess could go bag up a to go order who just walked in. We brought it to her attention (there are empty tables and people waiting to be seated for a very long time maybe you could sit us then help the to go order) her respinse was ummmmm yeah uhhhh. We wont be back

cfBkh48slaoG-ZRtDvWQyw.text: This was by far one of the best restaurants in Las Vegas.  I own a concierge business in Henderson and went there with one of my clients.  It was excellent!  Try it out, you will be pleased.  C Hubel

rDqtwLAEnEvh4TRbXqCkKQ.text: Took my wife here for Mother's day brunch. We didnt have a reservation, but the wait wasn't too long(considering it was mothers day). The food was really good too. I had the ham steak and eggs with hash browns and my wife had the Texas French toast. Prices were reasonable and the staff was very friendly and attentive.

oNAyAziFMEBd4H4hFbZbCQ.text: This place is so cute. I love the umbrella flowers spinning about the ceiling. I love how the servers wear pajamas! Super cute. The service was great. I ordered the country fried steak it was pretty good with the gravy on the side. Only downside it was breaded a little too much to my liking. I also tried a side of the red velvet pancakes to compare with the ones at BabyStacks Cafe. I'm sorry it just doesn't cut it. These pancakes did not even look RED, it looked more like a burned pancake. It was also too chocolatey inside. The cream cheese syrup was too thick and too sweet. I guess I'll have to go to BabyStacks for my red velvet fix. Other than that I enjoyed my main dish. I also ordered the steak chilaquiles for my boyfriend togo and that looked delicious. He enjoyed it! I would like to come back and try their other breakfast items.

wc9aR8CueA1Ideq57M24Cg.text: Great steak eggs  combo with egg whites nice decor friendly staff as well I'll be back soon !! The spot!!

JFQbutzKZPLmsyIUzGcmnQ.text: Great because it's close, food is good and prices are fair. They serve Illy coffee(yay), I get the chicken and waffles or rib eye chiliquilles. By 9am is busy and wait is 30-45 min on weekends, we usually go past brunch time. Thats when i wake up anyway on weekends.So it works out perfectly....hehe

0Ic8roGZ7gxJvHu-3lIO3A.text: Cute room with a bunch of umbrellas hanging from the ceiling and pajammied waitrons.  Good breakfast joints are few and far between in Vegas.  In LA every neighborhood has a cool little local breakfast place.  Vegas has Mimi's Cafe and Hash House a NoNo (aka the worst restaurant on earth).  Blecch.  Anways, the food was hit or miss, mostly hit.  My eggs and potatoes were great, seasoned well, fresh and not greasy.  The chicken fried steak was gnarly, however.  They've got their fryer turned up to high.  It was greasy and overcooked and the breading looked like dogfood.  Overall this place is a 3.5.  We'll round up to 4 for the good service and cool concept...

3vj24m7BBW_QvRQP-Dok-Q.text: We have eaten here twice so far and both times our meals were excellent. The staff is super friendly and the service is top notch.   The first time I was there I got the steak and eggs with the pot of bread. I absolutely loved the hash browns.   The second time I got an egg white omelette with spinach, avocado and salsa.  The salsa is delicious.   Overall, this place is a great value with delicious food and wonderful service. A++

FXf-_GRS_7twcfUBgiL3Mg.text: Excellent food, great service, a very nice and come little place. Everything on the menu has been wonderful. I try something new every time and am never disappointed. They're coffee is fantastic too!

c1W16eRuhWpByamREdiQ0Q.text: No complaints what so ever!   Staff is amazing and very friendly.  Food is very new & refreshing.  the ' pot-o-bread' is adorable & very delish.  Great place for families!

gkFXi0E2mVQTfZx6ydUjxQ.text: The decor was bright and wonderful.  Our server looked totally comfortable in her pajama uniform which reflected in her excellent service.  The French pressed coffee was delicious especially next to the yummy pot of bread.  The place misses the mark in the steak and eggs.  They were just not cooked to the way I ordered but still good.   I will totally come back try more on the menu.

aVvg4MSYS6eaMeZiSD0w7g.text: I always ate here. Every time! We found a plastic piece from a bread bag in our butter and no one came over and apologized or offered anything. It was very matter of fact and no importance to customer service or value at all. It's sad because we will now need to find a new breakfast place to eat. Wish their customer service was a bit better. When we left the server didn't even look us in the face when she nonchalantly said "thank you have a nice day" like it was pulling teeth. We are going back to the Griddle or New Day.

yXALfLqEmCi7O_JU3zBEVQ.text: This place used to be great.  It has really gone down hill. We waited 15 minutes to get a table and the. And hour and a half for breakfast. 2 hours for breakfast is crazy. The food finally came out and it was cold and terrible.  Won't be going back there anymore.

x6eJyX5HcsxKueXWpgY8yA.text: I came here about a year ago and the food and service were great. Stopped by for breakfast today and was instantly brought to a table. Sat there for over 15 minutes without anyone coming over, even to get a drink order. The two tables next to us had waitresses constantly checking on them. We got up and left, won't be coming back here. Customer service goes a long way.

B5141VLlRPql9OJtg6o3oQ.text: Went a group of 11 for breakfast. Every member happy + service great prices reasonable. Would return.

Mu_QHjvZfKKKtvlS81b0Zw.text: Unbeknownst to us, we walked in 15 min before closing.  I asked when they were shutting down because it was late afternoon and was informed that the doors closed at 3 BUT they were insistent that we please come in and enjoy ourselves.  We even heard shouts from the kitchen for us to come in and sit down.  Our server told us to take all the time we need and we never once felt like we were keeping anyone from going home.  Our experience was super relaxed.  The management was incredibly accommodating and pleasant.  The food we delicious and very much to our liking.  The only reason I didn't not give a 5 out of 5 stars was because I thought the portion for my corned beef hash and eggs was a little light for the price.  Other than that we were extremely happy with the food and will be coming back again!

Cngst6r9-GY01bHPrCPWpg.text: My husband and I were looking for a breakfast place close to our house one Sunday morning. I suggested Rise and Shine after reading other Yelp reviews. Boy am I glad we did! We have been there a few times and we haven't been disappointed! My favorite so far is the Chicken and Waffles. The fried chicken is AMAZING!!! The batter is super crunchy and the chicken breast is super juicy and tender. I highly recommend coming here for breakfast on the weekends.

ci3kukn8TqlHFFoCrKHCog.text: So good! Waitress was awesome! Food was out fast and eggs, steak and everything was cooked to perfection! Best breakfast I've had in a while too bad we're not from Vegas or else we'd be a regulars!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing ribeye and chilaquiles! Boyfriend loved the corned beef hash and eggs and he is very picky!

EVzRfey3F-yaLmFv70yAGw.text: Fun restaurant with waitresses dressed in pjs. They have a great smoothie and coffee bar. My eggs Benedict and kids' pancakes were slightly over cooked, but the ambiance and experience were great. Thank you.

aFt4kv4D4L4iLosQKVygvw.text: Horrible. From the price of juice and milk for kids to the moldy grapes that laid on my food and I mean white mold. Disgusting. Lost my appetite. Service is very very slow and there was only 5 tables. For a place that had steak in their name my daughter did not eat her steak and eggs as it was a horrible peace of cheap sirloin. We live a block a way and will never go back again.

LMXggXVVAuNHpdduqclFFA.text: Very cute place. The staff is always very fiendly. The food is delicious and a little different than regular breakfast places. It's always a treat for my spouse and I to go. Always left satisfied.

-WQ8t-8enlRmnrYtYsFmRw.text: Great breakfast spot. Every time we visit Vegas and stay off the strip, we have to eat here. Chilequiles are very good, and the chorizo burritos are good/filling. The portions are large though prices have gone up more than 15% this year.

KzTgFS2HHAFzmuPGw_NE3w.text: SUPER cute place, staff was friendly, food, Ultimate Steak and Eggs, fantastic!  Can't ask for anything else except delivery in bed!

fCTTUDOH__ObZ-s7iEh3Jg.text: This is a popular breakfast spot in a suburban part of las vegas. I was excited to try this place because my boyfriend has been raving about the red velvet pancakes ever since he came here with a group of friends a while back. We finally made it to Vegas together and made this one of our foodie destination. My boyfriend got the steak and eggs which were very salty. I got the biscuits and gravy which were good but not the best I've ever had. We also got a stack of the red velvet pancakes. Now those were great especially with the cream cheese icing. The service however was very subpar. We only got our drinks refilled one time as we were leaving and our plates had already been cleared away. Additionally many of the staff were complaining about job related issues within earshot of the customers.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and eggs, red velvet pancakes, and biscuits and gravy xoxo

QoU2md4-uyHaHu-P5B0NSw.text: WTF. Seriously. This is the fourth time I've come here. And only ONE time was I treated nicely and fairly. Hence this review. Hoping a MANAGER OR OWNER MIGHT SEE IT!!! I'll just discuss today's debacle.  It started off great. No wait!! Even got a booth!! Waitress shows up... looking annoyed, disinterested in general. I felt like my entire visit went downhill from here....  I asked her for a large OJ... and I get a CARAFE.... is that large? Um. Ok. I asked for for a 1/2 order of French toast... which I got, yet... they were "less fluffy" and basically looked like I got the welfare white bread version instead of the Texas toast version. My 12 year old daughter asked for chocolate chip pancakes and eggs/bacon....this is where it gets "interesting". She's 12... not 15 or 20... ya think the waitress bothered to ask me 1 question? Or tell me sizes or maybe whether we want the adult or child or just completely ala carte? Nope not a word. (Let's "pad the check"...huh). So when she brought out my 12 year olds breakfast... you might has well thought she's a LUMBERJACK!!! Because that's what the waitress ordered for her. 4 supercalifragilistic ginormous god damn pancakes. And a small side of some crappy tiny eggs and burnt bacon. I sat there dumbfounded. When she finally came back around, I had already finished my "French toast" and asked her what this was... POINTING to my daughters meal. I asked her why she didn't tell us it was for a lumberjack. Why didn't she steer us to something more HER SIZE?? Basically she was speechless... then with an attitude she said "I can take off 2 pancakes"... but the look on her face was right out of the movie "waiting"... (ummm... ya know...yikes... like I'll take the food back and spit on it.) So I declined. Of course my daughter didn't finish the Paul Bunyan meal. So we go to leave to pay the check. She rushes up to hand me the check and says nothing. The cashier asks me how everything was. I complained. Did anyone get a manager. Did the cashier apologize or offer any assistance. NO. NO. NO. NADA. NYET. NOTHING. It's not like I'm looking for a free meal. I paid the whole $35 god damn dollars for a senior size French toast, a lumberjack meal and 1 "large" OJ. $35 dollars. THIRTY-FIVE FRICKING DOLLARS FOR BREAKFAST. Way to pad the check. I am so aggravated at the bullshit. At the LACK of assistance and LACK of service, as well as the LACK of common decency. Yeah I said that. Because who in their right mind gives a child a big ass ala carte sized meal. That's completely ridiculous. And I even gave that jerk waitress a tip. I do plan on calling and "trying" to speak to a manager or owner. I just don't know if they will have the same attitude as their employees. Ugh.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is 3 of the 4 ginormous pancakes. She was barely able to eat 2...  Next time you might want to give patrons a heads up.

ZXV_7icQkMLBSNom1-8BVQ.text: Well, I used to think highly about this place until this morning. I placed a to go order and they said 20-30 minutes like always, cool. I get there after the time they tell me and they told me another ten minutes, another ten minutes goes by I noticed I've been sitting for 30 minutes. So I waited about an hour for my food, when asked when my food was coming they said another 5 mins and that everything has been done and they were just waiting on one more thing. So that meant my other items have been just sitting there while waiting for one more item. I live literally 4 mins away from this place so when I get home my food shouldn't be this cold. The only thing that was fresh was the one item I was waiting on. Everything else was soggy, dry, and unpleasant. I've had the corned beef hash before but today the corn beef hash tasted like it was sitting out too long, it tasted very old. Very very very disappointed.

_R91wNuYqz4QxhDvgxiLLw.text: Made this choice because of other Yelp reviews and to get OFF THE STRIP ITS ABOUT A 15 minute drive huge portions fun atmosphere wait staff wear pajamas and the ceiling has colorful umbrellas hanging from ceiling

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Umbrellas hanging from ceiling
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RRObvXbuWRusccQLo9OcJA.text: Rise & Shine is one of my staple breakfast places, if I had to guess how many times I've been here I'd say 50+. Unfortunately, I have recently had to start eating gluten free and when I went to Rise & Shine yesterday I was super disappointed to learn that the chips they use in the chilaquiles are not gluten free! This would be a very easy fix for them. And as they do not have anything else gluten free friendly if you want a "bread product" with your meal it would expand their menu a bit. Also, the beans they use are not vegetarian (they have lard in them) another easy fix but not something I would complain about alone, I could just leave them off, but since I can't even eat the chips....   I will update my rating if they ever decide to update their menu with chips that are gluten free!

Igxo_pG7lYFM1b7mDADLvw.text: What happened?? I've been here about 3 or 4 times in the past and it was my favorite breakfast place. My last visit made me realize that I am no longer a fan.   My favorite breakfast dishes of all time would have to be chicken n' waffles and corn beef n' hash with eggs. And by far the best place I've had them was at Bouchon inside the Venetian. I know I can't compare a local place like this to an upscale fancy casino spot. However, I've had those two dishes at other places that were by no means fancy and it was still delicious. So I know I'm not being picky. But I was truly disappointed with what I was served on my last visit.   The corn beef n' hash I ordered was a total disappointment. First I ordered the eggs medium. When my food arrived, they weren't yolky at all. It was cooked completely through. The hash was complete mush and the corn beef was sparse. I hate wasting food, so I ate as much as I could, but I still left some on my plate. The cinnamon bread they serve in the pot was my fave.   My bf ordered the chicken n' waffles. This was a lot better than my dish. The chicken was crisp and the waffle warm. The chicken was a bit on the dry side so I just smothered it with syrup even more. I love that the syrup is served warm with a cinnamon stick inside the bottle.   My bf is a huge coffee drinker during breakfast. He will probably go through 3-5 cups. He said that the coffee tasted like the coffee you get at a hospital, so when he only had about 1.5 cups, I knew there was something off.   3 stars for being seated quickly, our super friendly waitress Shannon and the cute decor. I was really excited to bring the bf to a new breakfast spot, but I'm sad to say that I will not be returning. I will miss the pot of bread though.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot of bread
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. There&#39;s a cinnamon stick in the warm syrup
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn beef N&#39; hash

OFTLDLW89BPAYN_ulAPM9A.text: Gonna be coming here again next time we're in town for sure!!! Pancakes were nice and fluffy. Chicken fried steak had a nice thin crunchy batter! And our server Laura was super sweet! Nice little set up inside and the servers and in pajamas... loved it!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best pancakes I&#39;ve ever had. Added chocolate chips!

odV0LSAYyZzoucIth0Bhmg.text: My fiance came here about a month ago and could not stop raving about it.  So today we tried it with some friends visiting from out of town.  For starters, service was great!  Most of the employees looked happy and comfortable in their pj's. Which is a great concept accept when you can see lint balls on the fabric.  Not very visually appealing.   So, 3 of us ordered some kind of steak and asked for it to be cooked either medium or medium-rare. They all came out well. For a place that is advertised as a "steak and eggs" restaurant one would think they can cook steaks correctly.    My friend did say this place is a "hit or miss" place.  Today was a miss.

EmfFlrA1XCCcsslvmPJP4A.text: I've been meaning to try this place since our family live close by but it was always so packed that we did not get to try it until today. We wanted to see what the fuss is all about.   If you go here on the weekends, expect a longer wait time. We waited for a table for around 45 minutes even though we were advised that it will only be a 20-minute wait. When we were finally seated, we were attended to right away. I liked the motif of the interior especially the spinning umbrellas on the ceilings. Our food came out right away, which was great. I ordered the corned beef hash - a classic, how can you mess that up. The flavor is better than most breakfast places that I have tried but I do not like the texture. It was chopped ham with onions and mashed potatoes (supposedly hash brown). It was a little disappointing. Everything else that we ordered were meh. Nothing really stands out. The waffle was too doughy. The orange juice tasted like it was not freshly juiced and it was a little sweet like it was mixed with concentrate (this is just my guess).   I would still recommend this place. I might come back and give it a second opinion, maybe try their steak and eggs or their pancakes. I think since Rise and Shine is really the ONLY breakfast place in the area (I mean you can get breakfast food at The Lodge except it's a bar), a lot of people would be willing to wait for a table here. I personally think it was not worth the wait. They need to open more breakfast places in this side of town.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Iron Baked Belgian Waffle with strawberries - Made it a platter added eggs and sausages.
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot of Bread - basically, a cinnamon bun in a tiny pot.
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned Beef Hash - flavor is the best I&#39;ve had so far.

-tsnKey3LWgGMCY6UGF8zA.text: Food is good. Service is average. Went to exit out a door and was told "that door is always locked."  Sign on the door says "this door must remain open during business hours. Not sure how I feel taking my son somewhere where safety of customers is ranked below convenience of the staff.

g1ucmf7JJDzYyz6Rr0LNbA.text: Delicious!  Steak an Eggs were the best we ever had.  Our  picky 9 year old son ate his whole plate and half of mine.

sm3uZRTxfNLdPLj52rISvg.text: Love it here !! You guys are excellent with service ! Extremely friendly, feels like home !!  Everyone keeps a smile on their face and that's what I love to see !

Nopn8IudMwYcmXAuxNpXKw.text: So disappointed. Horrible service and the glasses were extremely dirty asked for new ones and the second time around the glasses were even dirtier and this with food stains. Can't even imagine how that kitchen looks

Kpzwn4A5ayikVQBZqUARHg.text: The food and the reviews are what pulled me into this place. My husband ordered soda to drink and it tasted very flat ordered a second choice and that too was flat, thinking the food was going to taste better we went for the rise and shine chilaquiles and steak burrito. Not only did 5 customers that came after us got their food before us but the food was okay, I really wanted to like this place but the food was a 5 out 10 just like the customer service.

Q28RXzWeW-45p8-aX3bN-A.text: VERY DISAPPOINTED!!! The service was one of the worst ...our server  brought out toast 20 minutes before our meals.....We where a party of 6, she brought out 3 breakfasts 10 minutes later 2 more and a few later mine..... but yet I counted 16 employees they have more employees than customers no excuse.... the food was greasy and the Chicken fried steak was spicy hot ,the only thing we liked was the cup-of-bread . The glasses were they serve the fresh juices were dirty . July1st at 1:40 Don't know servers name they don't wear name tags.

NC31ilqOxywKDwEfSKmbGA.text: Very disappointed with this restaurant.   Breakfast very overpriced.   Coffee $3.25 for 8oz cup (yes refills are included, but still overpriced.   Only wanted an omelette per my diet.   Was told that I couldn't get a la carte, that it comes with hash browns and toast.   I said fine, however they are still required to put it on the plate even though I requested that i did not want the those items understanding that I still was going to have to pay for it.    Yes the food portions are large, but who needs to eat that much for breakfast.   How about reducing your food portions, and lowering the prices for the healthy minded consumers.    Only bright spot was that the service was great.

_ZHJH45K1EauEliB7XUJxg.text: Without a doubt , the worst breakfast experience I have EVER had .. All started with flat Pepsi , staring at our food under the lights for 15 minutes , bringing us liquid butter,toast that could've broken a window , my wife's omelette brought 10-12 minutes after mine, and the refusal to bring the manager over, and then charging us like everything was normal. I'll make sure that all of my friends that frequent this place are well aware of the utmost lack of compassion that was displayed today..

365cyec4Z3wvjM55gHOq8g.text: Having been here before we expected a MUCH better experience: both our eggs were almost cold, my steak almost inedibly overdone despite me asking for medium, coffee lukewarm. With so many other good breakfast choices around the Vegas Valley, there's no reason to "experiment" with this place again (once you've seen the interior and that some of the staff wears pajamas, the show is over and it's just a higher priced steak and eggs restaurant...)...bummer!

0tDKqjMXxzMC858bdJsx8A.text: Best breakfast spot! My siblings and I use to come here all the time.   Food is good. It's reasonably priced. The staff are friendly. Cute decor and the workers also wear pajamas lol. This place does get pretty busy tho.. considering they are only open until 3pm.

RIIz9v--sJR7ZJdPcZKsZA.text: Best breakfast place in Vegas! Great venue and amazing food. Came with a party of 6 and everyone loved their food. Ashley our host was amazing she was also very friendly and engaging.  Definitely will be coming back here again.

GI2D-zz9f4mS7EDj-KUA_A.text: Good breakfast.  I have been a few times and the space is nice, the pj's are cute and the food is good. It isn't my favorite breakfast place, but a good option. My only issue is it seems they are always a little unprepared. I have gone on weekdays and there are seats open but we have to wait for them to clean off the tables. Like they were short a staff member.    On another note the white chocolate coffee is DELICIOUS! !

_owR4V8WhzZSW0-Kkuk_SA.text: This place seems pretty great. By the name I expected a diner experience, but I am pleasantly surprised. We were in Vegas for a convention and needed breakfast before driving back to California.   The wait staff are really nice and efficient. The place is clean and decorated very colorfully.   They serve Lavazza coffee, which is my favorite! You can even get a French press of coffee if you so desire.   They have a "Pot of bread" which is a dinner roll mixed with cinnamon and sugar baked in a small pot. Not too sweet and quite delicious.   The portions of everything that I've seen come out are quite large. No way you can leave hungry. More likely you'll want to share.   They have non GMO organic hot sauce on the table, not sure if anything else on the menu is.   I had steak and eggs and it was very yummy. The steak tasted grilled, not chewy or anything. The eggs were perfectly cooked. I like my hash browns crispy and these were not but the were still good.   My husband had corned beef hash and really liked his too. Overall a great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak, eggs and hash browns.
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef hash (1/2 eaten, sorry :/ )

sArTo-W_1fKjAYMmkF1C3g.text: I was on my way out of town and I wanted that last great meal before I was subjected yet again to horrors of the menu my trainer has had us on for the past 2 months.  This spot is tucked away in a residential neighborhood and if it wasn't for Yelp, I would have missed this breakfast gem.  By the looks of it, it's a locals favorite and a great family restaurant.   While I waited 20 minutes I reviewed the menu via this wonderful app. The consistent review was the Chilaquiles (Chi-la-key-less) for those non latin tongues. Equally for those who know what traditional Chilaquiles should taste like, these are not it. Although don't discount this dish out. This version is more of a Tex-Mex spin but it's worthy of my taste buds.  Before I started the meal I ordered a good ol' cup of Joe served generously in a large mug fit for the most caffeine frenzied freak. Trust me avoid all offers of carb delights and only order the pot of bread.  This simple but yet inventive cinnamon roll served in a juxtaposed mug of coffee is a must have. Paired with a cup of coffee it reminds you why you woke up this morning... to enjoy life with a slice of sunshine.  Just with this simple start, this establishment lives up to its glorious name.   Onto the main dish, spiced rubbed ribeye steak chilaquiles. I thought it was served with strips of steak. Oh no my friend, you get a grade cut of steak worthy of any red blooded carnivore. The Chilaquiles are more chips that True tortillas, again more of a Tex-Mex flair. They are layered with refried beans at the base, then layers of cheddar cheese, chips, topped with sour cream, pico de gallo and avocado. With a sprinkle of cotija cheese on it and you are in breakfast heaven.   The steak was phenomenal and I would gladly have a steak here over Gordon Ramsey's "Steak" located in Paris Hotel.  The steak is a fraction of the cost but more importantly it's better tasting. Granted it's not American Kobe beef but it doesn't have to be. The rib eye was seasoned to perfection.   This is not a light hearted breakfast and if you are like me, you won't have a need to have lunch.  The high ratings is not all hype and is definitely worth checking out. This joint has a cool and laid back atmosphere great for the family. If you want you day to start with a slice of sunshine make sure it starts here.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spiced Rubbed Rib Eye Chilaquiles
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot of bread

lsnnCjDEMGDVY2l41_wSUQ.text: After hearing from my sister that this place was good we decided to eat here while visiting Las Vegas. So glad we did. The quality and staff were soooo good. The prices were reasonable and felt like one of the highlights of our trip. Will be returning for sure.

ovibeRUtTDR-ItLIPIx89w.text: not what it used to be! if your vegan they will still give you chicken and get mad when you complain about it. terrible customer service, the owners don't like to cater to "ethnic" people whatsoever. owners are also very rude smh

KFreb35F3CI3C_5t9ni8wQ.text: We love this place. I've had the Steak and Eggs Chilaquiles breakfast and it was soooo good. Their steaks are so tender and juicy. They also make fresh juices which I love.

MSN91YtlM8vMXEHEmQIg4Q.text: This place is amazing! The food is outstanding and beyond flavorful! They have a wide variety on their menu to even include fresh made smoothies. No matter what you're craving I guarantee this place will have it. It's a weekly visit each day my husband and I have off together.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jHyABAcRTOZ4b1NZdA1HIA.text: hello LV Yelpers! Came here last week for breakfast the morning it poured/flooded. One of my coworkers love coming here so a group of us made our way through the rain and flooded streets to rise and shine. I was excited to try their pot of bread from reading all of the reviews. I don't live close to R&S so I really hoped for a good experience. It was mid morning and they already ran out of pot of bread! really?! :( I had the corn beef hash with biscuit which was really tasty. My coworker comes here for the steak and eggs. If you're in the area and looking for breakfast stop by here! I wouldn't drive out of the way for R&S. Casual dining. No frills.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn beef hash

QCpcy1YBVvNnNG8XZzigrg.text: Stopped here with the family yesterday and the food was pretty good until I got a hair in my pancakes. I told them I didn't want them any more and just ate part of my wife's food since I wouldn't be able to eat pancakes thinking about the hair after that. They took the pancakes off the bill but charged $4 for the sides. Seriously, you ruin my meal and the whole family's experience and then you don't even take my personal meal off the bill? Good food, weak customer service. If they had been reasonable I might be back but that's just too little to resolve a problem, especially when breakfast is $15 bucks a plate. Everyone knows you can get a hair anywhere but anyone who works in or owns a restaurant knows you can't charge for the plate that had the hair in it. I didn't expect anyone else's meal discounted but the one with the hair should have been taken off. Get real.  It seems they responded that sides weren't included in the price unless you made the meal a platter...which I did so their point is moot.

5JGpMmD__jsPOZWPGzLmFQ.text: Food was great, for the price it should be. The place is waaaay to busy for me, as I'm a night owl normally. There were at least 20 or more people waiting to be seated while I waited for my to go order. With at least 5-6 tables & a small breakfast bar to sit at open & cleaned. All of the waitresses were dressed in pajamas, & stayed attentive to their tables. Everyone was very polite including the waiting customers. Who all seemed to be accustomed to waiting 20-30 minutes for a table for breakfast. I ordered 2 custom omelets with a side of pancakes & turkey sausage. The turkey sausage was forgotten. But they were way to busy to go back or call. As the phone was ringing off the hook while I was waiting & the line stayed busy when I called from home.  If you don't mind the wait it's a great breakfast place. If you want a little peace I suggest Denny's.

Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The ceiling has upside down flowers that twirl. Very cute decor

7VYpk7wXVYGQtNvApt1wLA.text: Trust me when I say get the Chilaquiles! It's a side of sour cream ;) Nothing else even compares to how good things are. The oj and the green go-go juice are my fav drinks.

qpx3NsKe30fQtmJVGBWydw.text: I put in a pickup order for a spice rubbed steak chilaquiles and a chicken breast and waffle. Ariel on the phone did not go over pricing with me just told me my food would be done in 20 minutes. When I got to the register to pay, my bill including was $31.58. 15.25 for the chilaquiles and 13.95 for the waffles. The online menu for prices reflecting 12.95 and 11.95. I spoke with Vanessa the manager to see if she would honor the price but said the web designer hasn't updated it. I was told no discount would be given. I paid my tab and off I went. This is bad business. I won't be coming here again.

h7VfCMZt0fws-U-VKonm4g.text: This place is awesomeness in its entirety, minus it's tucked away. That could be a good thing though. The decor is delightful (pics to follow) and the staff is wonderful! Usually they have a wait but today people must be bbqing. One thing that stands out about this cafe as opposed to others is that it's family owned & run and they wear pajamas while serving you. Love it! Riley was a fantastic server. She was helpful with suggestions and a joy to have. I'm a fan, this place is consistently on point. If you're in the southwest side of town, you must give them a try. Definitely in Vegas' top brunch spots!

Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is their crafty, cute ceiling.

7t6rMEfwhA12wEV8D0lRQw.text: Came here on a Sunday around 1pm and it as packkkkked.   They served fresh squeezed orange juice.. but for $3.25 for a 6oz cup, I'll pass haha.   The food here is pretty pricey. The least expensive thing you'll find is the burger that is about $8 or $9. The rest, is $10 and up.  I think I speak for Bun and I, the hash browns were amazing. Thinly sliced potatoes with just the right amount of taste to it. The pot of bread, nomz, cinnamon bread rolled up into a cup -- it's popular and around 1pm, they were also gone!  However, the food, it was meh. And combined paying about $30 for just a brunch, we'll be back but not too frequently. My chicken fried steak, I've had better and would say Egg Works makes it more nomz.  Definitely worth a try if you're in the area but wouldn't be worth going out of your way for.

rEwJZzLvMvcS16pM40trtw.text: Just got done eating breakfast here with my boyfriend and must I say we are so obsessed with this place and will definitely be coming here for breakfast every time we visit Las Vegas. Our server was Ashley, whom was so friendly and accommodating. We ordered the ny steak with spinach eggs Benedict, and the buffalo chicken breast w/ eggs. And you must try their fresh juices!! It was so good I had to take one to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo chicken breast &amp; New York steak w/ eggs Benedict and fresh strawberry &amp; watermelon juice. Sooo good!

LymIdP0BSxXNJnL470faVg.text: Delicious!!! Found this gem on yelp and it did not disappoint! Excellent locals spot. Great customer service.  We will be back! Yum yum yum!

a6bukUcqWyI4f93ku8e5WA.text: I visited this spot after Yelping the highest-rated breakfast restaurants in Las Vegas.  I was really excited about the "bread in a pot" which was reason enough to visit.  The decor is cute, slightly weird, but cute.  The servers wear pajamas and it took me a minute to realize it!  As for food, it's pretty underwhelming.  It's not terrible, but I was not impressed- no bold flavors.  The "bread in a pot" was bland and the chicken and waffles were pretty bland, too.  I won't ever be returning because I like a little more excitement when eating carbs and other foods in general.    There are so many better breakfast places in Las Vegas, skip this one!

YZF3ChjEY1EFeHUWDtp_DA.text: An addendum:  I ate Pizza that night.  The next day I had vicious diarrhea and vomiting.  I can't say it was due to this place or the pizza...just thought you should know.

CE7zGB2JQUWA7lzjgcFRZA.text: Found this place via yelp reviews and tried for brunch... Not disappointed! Had to wait a bit but well worth it and it just reassured that we chose a good place.   Food is reasonably priced and tastes great! Service was also good- friendly staff and refilled our waters/coffee multiple times. Only thing I would say is that I got an omelette with steak and some of my steak pieces were fatty- therefore I was unable to eat all of it.  Will definitely come again though- and recommend for anyone looking for a cute, local and cheap breakfast place!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak omelette- yum!

x0NBVLn-OXP7oUXXaq2TVg.text: My favorite breakfast place! Not because it's close by but the service has always been wonderful and the servers very friendly. My daughters order was messed up one time and they immediately apologized and provided a corrected order promptly. Mistakes happen - but they will not argue with you and instead aim to get it right. Kudos!

n4GWpV_lI3XYmGOrNMRwZg.text: This restaurant has turned into my go to place on the weekends. The staff is friendly and the place has a good atmosphere. Food is all around great, pancakes are yummy, the chicken and waffles are delicious, and the side sausage is like crack for breakfast meat lovers.

WJ-lUTafNU0Voo3XiJql1g.text: This is the best breakfast place. Everything is really good. I love the eggs Benedict. Everyone is super friendly and we get great service. I also love the French press coffee!

AigiWVXkxzEKPih4SxPLXg.text: Fantastic family owned restaurant tucked away near the South Point casino. The breakfast was great, but the service was exceptional. Many restaurants in Vegas seem to rely on their name recognition or posh environment. This place though maintains it's charm while delivering a satisfying meal. I got the Chicken & Waffles and it was delicious. The Chicken was crispy but also very tender and juicy on the inside. Couldn't get any better than that. My mom got a panini and she said all the ingredients seemed very fresh. And the waiters/waitresses are constantly moving, working, providing exceptional service. Can't thank then enough for a wonderful meal.

wGKMpEA5Y5Apysq-PN4O0w.text: Food and service were awesome.   French press was to die for if you need something to kick start the day.   I ordered the chilequiles and steak. The chilequiles was topped with shredddd cheese, cheese cojito, beans and eggs. It was delicious! The steak was cooked and seasoned perfectly. It was very moist and tender. My hubby ordered the chicken and waffles. It's not often that restaurants know how to properly cook fried chicken but this place made the chicken very moist with the right amount of batter. I'd also recommend ordering the pot of bread as a side. It's yummy cinnamon bread.   Also our server was very friendly and attentive!  If you're looking for a quality restaurant I would definitely recommend coming here!

II0XcRmLPxD_VmOpy9tTzQ.text: Perfect friendly service, ideal breakfast spot with easy parking and an oasis for the steak and eggs crowd. Worth visiting to get away from the strip and casino crowd. Great coffee. Work of art ceiling. Five stars at this price point. Oh, get at least one buscuit to share.

k1hhI9EQt34hlqvbufGhJA.text: I love it when locally owned and operated restaurants survive in LV.   The place is absolutely cute with their huge flowers spinning from the ceiling and the servers in their pajamas.  This is one of my favorite spots to do breakfast on the weekends.   Everyone I bring here raves about the place too.    The food is really good.  Some of the notable things I've had here include:   - Chicken Fried Steak (Thick and delicious gravy.  Steak might be a little too thickly battered.  Feel a little guilty eating it =)  Tasty hash browns on the side)  - Two Egg Breakfast (Think grand slam, but much tastier!  Not crazy about the kielbasa, so I'll stick with the sausage or bacon next time)  - Corned Beef Hash (Not like the smushy corned beef - its "real"!)  - Southwest Turkey Panini (Panini's here seem like a good option for lunch!)  - And always get their cute little pot of bread! (A light and fluffy Cinnamon roll - Yum!)   Like everyone else says, the service here is good.  Always kind with a smile.  I wouldn't say the food is OMG, but its solid.  Prices might be a tiny bit on the more expensive side, but I think it's worth it for the lovely experience

dS973i3Rml0d_31xQElChg.text: The food was so fresh and delicious! The freshly squeezed juice was the best! I'll definitely go back!

zIfF13uHT5DOASmti52ssA.text: 4 stars for the food, 1 star for the coffee   This is an above average breakfast spot. I highly recommend trying their fresh-squeezed OJ and an omelette or the banana pancakes (although the pancake batter is noticeably sweeter than other breakfast spots).   My only complaint is the coffee! The regular coffee is weak, and the french press is barely drinkable. I always order OJ and then go to Starbucks after (located in the same plaza) for my coffee fix. Several other locals I've talked to do the same.

A7z625jecHmw6txwCiZ9Ag.text: I want to emphasize something, dear eateries--cuteness doesn't make up for okay food.  I wanted to like this place a lot, not just for the cow and egg canvas on the wall or the spinning and standstill flower lights overhead.  I wanted to like this place for the simple fact that local eateries should be supported and loved dearly.  Although I love my local places, this one just fell a bit short on taste and overwhelmed me with portion size.    When you walk in to this place, it's like walking in to a freaky garden turned upside down.  I almost felt like I walked in to the Bug's Life section of California Adventure with the oversizes flowers above my head.  It's cute, though, and has plenty of seating.  The servers are friendly, but they aren't as attentive as they should be.  Although checking on us regularly, when we did want to hail one down it took about three minutes.  My mother and I, after going through the sections of the menu--sandwiches, paninis, waffles, pancakes, specials, omelets, steak, etc.--We landed on two dishes that we felt were different-chilaquiles with salsa avocado and chicken with waffles.  We were excited and couldn't wait for the food to come over.  Thinking it was a regular portion size we even ordered a side of hash browns and bacon.  When the food arrived, however, it was unexpected.  The chilaquiles was actually nachos with eggs on top and half an avocado sliced on top.  IT wasn't that pleasant, although at first it seemed to taste okay.  The chips were soggy and were simply covered in salsa and cheese.  I couldn't see where the chilaquiles part came in at all, to be honest.  The after taste was strong.  The chicken was a breast beat out to what I believe was a chicken fried steak-like thing on top of waffles.  The problem with putting a UFO disc of boneless chicken breast on top of a soft waffle is the oil went in to the waffle a bit, but the heat between the two created condensation that made the waffle soggy.  The chicken was well seasoned, a bit too spicy for just fried chicken, but moist.  The portions, however, were enough to feed 6 people between the two dishes alone.  Still, it was okay.  I do have to emphasize that fried chicken and waffles should be the classic fried chicken pieces with a waffle, but that's just me.  The hash browns weren't pleasant at all to me.  We did order it to have a crispy outside, and I assumed it would be either home fries type of hasbrowns or the typical shredded potato one.  It was..well..like a baked potato was roughly scooped out then patted in to a pancake like hashbrown thing.  They didn't season it either.  I gave it to my husband in a take away box with the leftovers so as not to waste it.  The bacon was nice, though.  Overall, it was okay, and the restaurant is interesting, but I think that there are a few tweaks they need to make.  Then again, I'm one palette against a full restaurant, so maybe I need to try something different next time.  I do like them, and I hope that my next experience in six months will be a more tasty one.  Still, you should try this place for yourself.  In the end, I feel that a cute eatery cannot cover the the fact that it's oversized, just eh food.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried chicken breast &amp; waffle.
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilaquiles nachos
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8CF-eqAGE83QZ17Pb_6kWA.text: I have some odd, unexplained affinity for brunch. Something about eating eggs yet not having to wake so early for them gets me excited. As much as I love brunch, my brother outshines me in this respect tenfold. Every time I leave the house for it or come home from it, he seems to always criticize my choice in restaurant - usually exclaiming "What about Rise & Shine? They're so much better". Well David S., I finally tried them, and jesus! Why didn't I listen to you before?  A coworker and I decided to catch up over some brunch (she, too, shares my love for breakfast foods at normal people hours). After wavering in between this place and another establishment, we finally just took my brother's advice. The service was a bit slow at first, but was amazing once it picked up. Our waitress, Nicole (I believe that's her name) was so sweet and very attentive. Usually, I always gulp four glasses of water prior to the start of any meal. She was on top of her game - making conversation and filling our waters promptly.  To the food, we had both ordered the Baked Blueberry Croissant French Toast. When it came out, I think we were both about to die. This dish is not for the faint of heart or those struck with blueberry indifference. Literally, the dish was unrecognizable underneath the mound of blueberries. What croissant are you talking about? If that wasn't enough, there's a ramekin of the same blueberry sauce on the side! Jesus. One bite in, and I was in love. The blueberry sauce, candied walnuts, and croissant were euphoric. Not overtly sweet, just tart enough, with the perfect crunch and nuttiness of the walnuts. The portion is perfect for the price. I ended up taking half of it home in order to both save my waistline and taunt my brother by affecting his.  We had meandered a bit afterwards, inflicted with the pains of a food coma. Multiple people, other than our waitress, had stopped by for lively banter and to check up on the meal. Management was positively delightful - so genuinely sweet without any schmooze.   Weeks later, I still feel somewhat guilty. Indulgence at its best is definitely what you'll find here. Unfortunately for me, the only occasion I can bring myself to come back here for will be my birthday - my waistline will thank me.

esT8ENScy6PV8TNxB0E6Nw.text: Been here a few times before leaving Vegas. Very cool vibe and food has been good everytime. It is a local spot but still expect a wait if going on the weekend.

0fWlh3KZwhemyr_6ICding.text: The service is great. Seated fast, and very happy. The coffee is great with choices vanilla and half and half. That's what we came for, then it happened. The waitress said the potted bread is good and cinnamon toast crunch French toast. We had this for two, off the hook!! I wish there was a place like this where we lived. Brads recommendation: hide the waitress Serice bar out of site. Everything else great!

dHgg9Ywg79g6BFINnD7A1w.text: This is a great place to eat.  We ordered: the banana and frosted flake pancakes, the cinnamon crunch French toast, the steak omelet, and the ultimate steak and eggs..... All dishes were excellent.  Above all else, the food was top-notch.  We were seated quickly, and the waitress was friendly.  The food is a bit pricy, but it's all well worth it.  Highly recommends it!

zBOVqUWYgqkjEBsICh9D5A.text: We tried the iced coffees, bananas Frosted Flakes pancakes, Chillaquilles, the Go Go juice and turkey Kielbasa & eggs & everything was super delicious

-rmr0ilCfyDbAKhXzhmjZw.text: Came here this morning with my office , and let me just say from the service to the food it was great , Ryley was so nice ! We will definitely be coming back :) !!

r-AnmGbkoDxNOQ55nzJk5A.text: If you live in Southern Highlands, it's a great little diner to eat breakfast at. I always worked mornings, so I couldn't go as often as I liked. I just ate here this morning and it is still as great as ever! Plus, I think they extended the hours. They're open until 3pm now. The waitresses are cool. I ordered an egg-white omelet with tomatoes, mushrooms, spinach, and swiss cheese. It was PERFECT! It also came with hash browns and toast. I ordered it like that, but there's loads of other choices as well. The portion was just right. I adore the spinning flower umbrellas on the ceiling, too. If you sit at the barstools you can watch them make the food. It all looked so amazing. The place is really clean and there's lots of light. If you want to see some pictures or their menu check out their website and Facebook. Definitely go here!!!

2Nx7VuSne5chBEeDxI1GQQ.text: Delicious food and excellent service. Wish it was a bigger location, not much room for waiting.

kH6HQhjeGO8_Onu1kBQ0Pg.text: Great steak and eggs. Will go again plus all the waitresses are wearing pj's and are really pretty. Always makes it better to have breakfast with a view . Good food with decent prices makes it a very good place to go for a good breakfast.

wpqsAehZqqzZgQujwLDP4A.text: Had the ultimate steak breakfast.  Ribeye, eggs, and hashbrowns. It was very good. The steak wasnt as fatty as I usually like when I grill myself, but still very good. The hashbrowns and eggs were awesome. Fresh squeezed oj was great.

zULvUOTlO_TLoFDN6WRNiA.text: Lisa is one of the best servers I have ever had. Not only was she responsive to our needs but she has a little flare to her wording and her kindness! She should be praised for her above and beyond efforts. The pot of bread is a must!!

uKdxjwc8nbOMxEbf_aaHyQ.text: I've noticed a difference in the quality since the last time I came, unfortunately I forgot to take a picture before the review. Their portions are WAY too big for one. And secondly the eggs benedict I ordered were drenched in a pool of sauce and the hash browns next to them turned out soggy due to it. There wasn't as much spinach as I'm used to there being. The consistency in quality should be upheld, there shouldn't be fluctuations. Their juices and smoothies are always amazing though.

aAlbbYEygiWctQbpuwFzdQ.text: Perfect day. Perfect outside patio. Perfect omelet! This is a must try with amazing menu options. We will definitely come again. Today we had Julie W as our server and hands down this was the best service we have had in years!! She was very attentive, our coffee was refilled over and over, and she had a sense of humor! All around happy breakfast :-)

ojQb4ID5zxid_cOLCSC8mg.text: We ate at this location last summer, loved it. We've since only eaten at the Green Valley location, which is amazing. Coming back to this location yesterday, I was disappointed. My French Toast was crunchy on the edges, soggy elsewhere. My scrambled egg whites were not great, my bacon burnt, and my husband's standard scrambled eggs were stiff. We will definitely be patronizing only Green Valley R&S from now on.

SJqDRA8r117KBAO6p20LaQ.text: Fantastic breakfast.  Great service. Desiree was friendly and made sure that we tried the "cup of bread."  This will be our go to place on our way out of Vegas.

ud8h1b8sPvXGek0aXJN4MA.text: This place earned every bit of these 5 stars from the get go! This place is awesome, from the decor, to the pj's the wait staff wears, the cleanliness, the menu selection and of course the amazing food! The french toast was egg battered with the bacon cooked in, amazing! The two handed bagel breakfast sandwich was stuffed with egg, ham, bacon, sausage and cheese. The gentleman sitting at the table next to ours had steak and eggs. The steak was cooked perfectly and cut like butter, so tender. It's a bit out of the way, south of Vegas, but I could find a reason to come back.

WVPnzNRWzbUn69Yx85u0pQ.text: Wow, what a great breakfast. Wonderful staff, friendly and very attentive. Carrie was marvelous, she even gave me a chuckle when she dropped of the bill and I asked is that your number. Very very friendly staff. Food was delicious and delivered swiftly. OJ is fresh squeezed and so tasty, that after tasting mine my nephew ordered his own. Check it out

U5rEuhEICVMEPR-rrWoEzA.text: It's a shame I'm very fond of their food but they've messed up our order the last 2 times in a row. Today we ordered French fries and they never came out, when the waiter with dark short hair and beard brought the check I asked him if he charged me for the fries that NEVER came out and he said  "sure didn't" after inspecting the receipt ....  If this was a staff member who CARED for his place of employment or loyal clients he would have offered to make them really fast or done something to make up for his mistake.

Ksq49tYCmbmDgmwQWycc7g.text: This is one of my favorite breakfast spots! I come here often for morning get togethers with some friends. We also have a great time and the food is always on point.

0cupPvrk43UFWzs0T2nWEQ.text: To start off this spot has wonderful customer service!  A great atmosphere is always a priority when dining in if you ask me.  You must sit at a booth if oh do not enjoy the hardest chairs of earth.  There is more than an adequate amount of seats so your preference shouldn't be a problem.   I had breakfast 3 days in a row here and enjoyed it each time.   Day 1 eggs Benedict with ham, day 2 banana foster pancakes and day 3 was bacon, eggs and a waffle!   They provide Large portions of quality food for a reasonable price.   I just moved into the area and there are not many local choices nearby but thankfully rise and shine has the fire! Don't miss out on a good meal served by good people.   Thank you rise and shine for 3/3 positive experiences!!

NFjQ6_VrERdHLia2LibeeA.text: It was my first time here & I was pleased with the food, service and atmosphere. My kids loved their breakfast, my son told the waitress it was good like at home. The staff was really welcoming and friendly and checked on us regularly. The steak was excellent cooked perfect medium well. We are happy and full. Also, the decor was so cute and the waitresses wore pj's which I thought was cute to make it feel comfy like waking up to a good breakfast still in jammies. Glad we found this place we almost went to iHop, yelp helped us find this place rated 4 stars. I'm sure we will visit again when we come back to Vegas.

UZstyWlS8ohMROPotv-dcA.text: We  LOVE this place.  We go frequently.  The food is delicious and the servers and employees are always very nice.

cgQQziNP36mF7iFl17352A.text: Place is hip and good variety is great. I ordered the chicken egg white omelette with avocado and cups of bread (which was dry). Kim was our server and she was sweet and attentive. Over the food was good. I would come back and try other dishes so many to choose from. The food is a bit on the pricey side but worth it .

YNViV6_Qu3FfA1vfgKw2Lw.text: Great service food and experience! Wether you eat healthy or hi protein this breakfast place has it all. Delicious. Can't wait to come back for more

yNubGuyrlFDtT5wCDk9hBg.text: So my gf got mad at me because I refused to take her to an expensive steak house. This place is the very reason I hate paying for expensive steaks. Walked in and was quickly greeted and sat. Ordered two ultimate steaks with eggs. Steak medium and eggs over medium. Got eggs over well and charcoal steak. The steak was burnt and I mean burnt. Typical of these places they hire cooks off the street that have no real experience. It felt like eating dirt it was burnt and crunchy. Waitress and staff were outstanding but I didn't come in to hang out. I came in for a delicious steak and got charcoal

Say_tBKvdJtkIqnSILUNsg.text: What a great find!! Stopped here as we were heading home to Phoenix, what a DELICIOUS breakfast and very pleasant atmosphere, neighborhood place. DEFINITELY try the cup of bread- like a cinnamon roll but yummier  Our server was Maria, she was friendly and helpful, and if I lived here, we'd make this a regular breakfast choice- her plus delicious  Food = a great start to your day!

QzhggTen8bUHfrYCNJ9Ekg.text: Woke up this morning craving something sweet. Ran into Rise & Shine around 10 and was blown away from the service, along with their amazing food. French toast and coffee perfectly settled my cravings. My server, Amber, was bright and a great person. 10/10.

UOqadzcI_udYsCQMQD2tlg.text: One of my go to places for breakfast spots because we live right down the street for it. Always a wait when you come so you know it's going to be good. Takes about 5 mins to be seated if not less and they make sure to get you started right away. The staff is in pjs and it's really cute.  Started off with their coffee and some pot of bread which is what they are known for. So good. For my meal I had one of their bagel sandwiches and it had egg cheese and sausage, can't complain it was good! My sister had a parfait, once again yummy. My boyfriend had the steak huevos rancheros and it looked amazing!  They are really speedy with their service and it's also really good food. Every time I get something different and I have no problems. Greta restaurant great food.

sAz9Vch4eEdCMZfEF7IU_A.text: Really cute breakfast place! Brightens up the morning to see wait staff in PJs and the cute flower "fans" dangling from the ceiling and other whimsical decor. Service was friendly like a family diner. This is the place to go for a large breakfast. We tried the steak with poached eggs and bread in a cup. I ordered some extra sides (avocado, eggs, etc.) and there was definitely enough food for two people. The prices are on the higher side which is why it's 4-stars, but it's a nice place to have a family breakfast. They have outdoor seating for nice days or if you are bringing a furry companion.

W3wh2U1YVs9pot3ip3jvHQ.text: I've been a regular customer since they opened.  GREAT food and GREAT service.  Up until last week they had great coffee, but sadly changed supplier and brand of coffee. 3u82hYTGvxjona82bnC4Pw.text: I took my wife here after reading all the reviews on Yelp. This is officially our FAVORITE breakfast place EVER! -- FAIR WARNING: Once you eat here it's going to be hard to eat at places like Denny's and IHOP again, it's that good!  My wife had Chicken and Waffles with Pot of Bread (Cinnamon) and iced tea.  I had Steak and chilaquiles (just a fancy word for nachos) with eggs over easy + French Pressed coffee to drink -- I also ordered some extra gravy with the biscuit that came with my meal  Our whole meal was about $35... not too bad.  Everything tasted PERFECT -- The coffee had me on 10,000 hyper mode and my appetite kicked in... and the added surprise was that the "nachos" had this BBQ beans on it -- you let that egg run + avocado + bbq beans + sour cream and the blend is CRAZY GOOD  My wife said it was the best fried chicken she's ever had and the batter they used was to die for. The waitress was sweet enough to give my wife some FREE cinnamon cream cheese stuff (that NORMALLY goes on the red velvet pancakes) for her pot of bread because the waitress tried it herself before and was basically suggesting we try that. Love tips like this.

nj4Kt9byJHq7iVzQr42prg.text: This was a Fantastic place we found by Google-ing breakfast on maps.  Such a wonderful surprise.  Stop in before 3 pm.

I'm truly sad because this was one of my favorite breakfast spots.

gfuW22XSUyDqnpQxqBDv_A.text: I've been to this place when visiting Vegas 2 or 3 times since I initially tried it and I can say I'm happy I gave them another shot. The food and service are great but depending on what time of day (and day of the week) you go, there might be a bit of a wait because it seems to have become a pretty popular place to eat breakfast and brunch!  Once you order, the food comes out in a reasonable amount of time. I really love the eggs Benedict & their orange juice is delicious as well. My biggest complaint is that I don't live in Vegas so I can't try everything on the menu :)

qPKde_YC45pNAIYQObAUpA.text: Bomb bomb bomb! Uploaded pictures. My boss used to eat heere when they first opened and said it used to be better but idk. Pretty bomb. I've had the eggs Benedict before and today I have the bacon wrapped tenders with eggs. Twas uhmazing. The waitress today wasn't as nice as my last but everyone else was super friendly. Older people tend to be judge me and my friends but it's whatever. It's her tip. Other than that the resteraunt and food itself is clean and bomb.

lGreTYGbsMUr7twShnzrPA.text: I'm still annoyed about our wait. When you quote someone a wait time, your estimate should at the very least be within a ten minute window, not over three times as long as your quote.   They also ran out of potted bread that day, which I was excited to try after reading other Yelp reviews. Our server told us that it would be another half hour wait for that menu item. Obviously, since we waited over an hour doe our table, I passed.   That being said, the food and service here were both excellent. I had the chilaquiles, and my boyfriend opted for a standard breakfast dish with pancakes and bacon with eggs. Both dishes came out hot and delicious and in a prompt manner. While I'm glad we stayed to try this place out, I really do think the door staff could use some training on estimating wait times. Even after I complained to the hostesses that we had waited for over an hour, a manager never spoke to us to apologize. As I've worked in the industry for over fifteen years, I thought this was pretty unacceptable.

PyZJoJ9NbLRih8YO13iYRg.text: First and last visit nothing to come back for. The coffee is bitter the hasbrowns are soaked in grease 30 min wait with tables available for the entire hour I was there. I can get this poor quality anywhere.

x2OVSorXYFYCKaL-uKZFvQ.text: I have been here numerous times. Today I wanted a simple tomato or vegetable juice.   They don't have it!!! Sure they have a fancy juice bar to make gross concoctions loaded with sugary, sweet stuff but not just regular juices.  Oh and those juice bar drinks are expensive to top it off. One expects a certain minimum basics when a breakfast location...

IbiJUELc6AAh5YMx4Qh-nQ.text: So,  after having gone to Rise & Shine at least a dozen times and introducing many friends,  I will no longer be returning. I ate there a few days ago and saw that they had knocked out a wall and expanded. I thought, oh good for them, because they are always busy. Then I started looking through the menu and realized it had changed, but not for the better. The prices of everything had gone up and toast or a pot of bread that was included with dishes before,  was no longer. I ordered a chicken and waffle which I've had a couple times before. The other times, the chicken,  which is always huge,  sat atop thick waffle...not this time. The waffle was thin as a pancake and had not been poured with enough batter to be whole. Our server took our order and brought us the check, but nothing in between. The thing that got to me the most about the whole visit was the fact that this place has had loyal patrons in the community and then they jack up the prices & give you less, like they are on the strip serving tourists. Way to ruin a good thing.

mfBW0PbbnyXAqvFa_RGFQw.text: Love that they have French press coffee! I use this place for business meetings in the afternoon on weekdays and it's perfect! I love their decor too.

k3R3pD_eW2Fc6B4Vzy19Gw.text: My mother and I came visiting from Los Angeles and stayed in a hotel nearby, and found this place on yelp. Everyone else is so right! Their food is amazing! It was so great that we went two days in a row! The first day we got the fruit plate, coffee, 2 cup of breads, and the salmon omelette with egg whites. The food was great and the cup-of-breads are to die for! You have to get one! Our server was so accommodating and I will definitely be back the next time I'm in Vegas!

HZoVuv2SLbJQ8VbToX7LbA.text: I had the same experience as someone who posted here 7 days ago.  Asked for eggs a certain way and was told "no" especially since it was a Sunday.  Got me thinking is this not cooked to order restaurant?  We didn't wait to find out.

kQF4c-DVCviKfyUHUqyJgQ.text: I was on the border of 2 or 3 stars for this place. Reading the menu online I was looking forward to coming in.   To preface this review, the food was good. And you get a lot of it. Customer service was...meehhhhh.  THE REVIEW: I ordered the steak and eggs bagel. The steak was cooked great, the bacon was good, and the amount of food was insane. I ordered it with a side of fries. I was munching away, actually rather enjoying my bagel sandwich, when I was unpleasantly surprised by a sharp poke in my mouth. I had bitten into a toothpick that had been left in the steak. The toothpick had been used to hold the filet medallion inside the wrapped bacon. Now, I wasn't seriously injured, but it was an unpleasant sensation at the very least. I informed the waitress who apologized, and about 5 minutes later a man (whom I take it was a chef) came out and apologized. We get the bill of $34 for our breakfast, which surprised me. I have always been under the impression that when your food isn't cooked/presented appropriately (which I would consider foreign objects left in my food "not cooked/presented appropriately"), that you never charge the customer for that item. I was definitely disappointed with this, but neglected to argue or contest this. To me it should have been up to the management to make that decision on their own, and it will most definitely influence my decision in the future as to whether or not to patronize this establishment again.  Would I come here again? Probably not. Would I recommend this place to others? Possibly. Have not decided yet.

HEJREqyvWuW0_c-s234zMg.text: GO HERE! Definitely worth the drive a little out of town!! Great service, love the PJs! We had our 4 year old and the food was perfect for him. The coffee was really good! Then came the chicken fried steak and eggs...Goodness, just goodness!! It had depth, and I mean it lifted off the plate! The hash browns actually had flavor and the eggs were fresh! My hubby had really GOOD biscuits and gravy. GO HERE!! I'm considering driving back from CA 9hrs to come here again..haha...seriously

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak and eggs with depth!

ExZ8WetLQYV7gwc4zlItlw.text: Don't bother with Cracker Barrel, only 10 min south on Dean Martin turn right on Cactus and this place is on the left. Awesome food! Great friendly service. When you are tired of smoke filled casinos this is the place to go. Have the potted cinnamon role.

bJUSSsMdrZYYxHXnZve_lA.text: We drive down here from the strip just to eat breakfast here.  Pretty good ham and eggs with has Browns toast and coffee. Our bellies are full. Cool atmosphere.  We will be back on our next trip to Las Vegas for sure!!

cpdxUkrW4q5PT_yKH42heQ.text: omg..the best breakfast place in town for sure..i seriously recomend this place...i would give them an award if i could..amazing service too by jenn who was wearing leopard pjs..so cute.

CxdQVPUrDVviJvJJEMxfOQ.text: We live nearby so we thought we would give R&S  a try for breakfast @ 10:30 on a Sunday. After a 10 min wait we were seated. My bf commented that the large crowd of patrons and the tight seating arrangements didn't make for a very private or comfortable meal. Half of our tiny table was filled with various condiments. The waitstaff was professional, prompt, and pleasant. The amount of healthy options on the menu was limited. I would say the prices for most items were a bit high. Even though it is close to the house, I don't think I will be returning.

B9d2QIBTbgINJi6GLceVKA.text: Items selected: Pot of Bread - Cinnamon Chicken and Waffles Peanut Butter and Jelly French Toast Illy Coffee with refills Always on the lookout for a great local breakfast spot and already in Henderson for business reasons I decided to make my way over to "Rise & Shine, a Steak & Egg Place" largely based on the fact that anyone willing to go out on a limb and sport the website bestbreakfastvegas.com clearly warrants judgment; my verdict suggesting blatant False advertising. Featuring a kitschy design with floral umbrellas hanging from the ceiling and servers in their pajamas plus a menu of breakfast and lunch classics ranging from classic egg dishes to more novel options such as red velvet pancakes service was spot on despite the early morning rush and with my order placed within moments of seating coffee and water remained filled to the brim at all times. With good service and fun decor it was my hope that the food at Rise & Shine would indeed shine but perhaps because I didn't order "Steak & Eggs" the selections I tasted were average at best, the sort of place where big portions trump high quality ingredients - the chicken crispy but largely flavorless over a hotel lobby quality waffle and the pot of bread tasting mostly like yeast, something that Log Cabin 'syrup' and butter did not remedy. Better in quality but still marred by low quality ingredients the French Toast would fare the best of the morning's options but given the location and the cost I can name no less than a dozen restaurants more deserving of the 'best breakfast vegas' title.

ZgjAXaLFZdV32Uxp7c5fQg.text: Yelp never fails to disappoint! Yelped breakfast spots and this place magically appeared! We dropped in on our way out of Vegas. I asked our waitress what she recommened and she said the chicken and waffles...I took her advice and let me tell you...IT. WAS. WORTH. IT!! My friend got the steak and bagel eggs benedict which she loved as well, but we both agreed that the chicken and waffles was AMAZEBALLS! We also got the pot of bread...which was so cute and good! Oh and the service was great...waitress was so nice! Definitely will visit this place when I'm visiting Vegas again!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken &amp; waffles, steak and bagel eggs Benedict, &amp; pot of bread...yuuummm!!

nWwkU3sTmUrzGY0Uf2XMNw.text: Let me just say the food is amazing and portions are plentiful! My waitress today was the best i may have ever had. I like my coffee to stay hot and am normally let down with slow refills but I had to tell her no thank you a couple times which totally impressed me!   On the negative, I was seated at the bar and for the entire 45 minutes I had to look at two of the three chefs inappropriate and disgusting attire. One cook was young with a backwards skater hat on with pants halfway down his backside showing off his grey underwear while wearing a short tee shirt. The main chef was older in what looked like his 40's and was even worse. Biker bandana, biker chain to wallet, short shirt, and pants that were BELOW halfway down his backside with all to see his black boxers with gold designs on them??? Are we supposed to be impressed by his "ganstaness" or disgusted? Why do I pay good money to eat great food and have to look at two cooks butts the entire meal? Looks like there's no overseeing by management to prevent such a business mishaps. If you go to eat and want to enjoy your food without seeing someone's backside the entire meal, DON'T sit at the bar!

LGGBs6MRENBQmafy6Oosdg.text: Our server, Krystie, was super awesome and knowledgeable.  Great food, terrific service and attention to detail.  Definitely a top notch breakfast place. Exceeded my expectations.

qET5h9CUx4Y6fB1o4hWEQA.text: Place has really gone downhill... Using cheaper ingredients and still charging same expensive prices... Very disappointed. Food was terrible

2uEmL6kHxGlBs2uLxU3DrA.text: Being a breakfast fan, this is my favorite breakfast spot ever.  Pleasant staff, dressed in pj's.  A nice touch.  A good place to take anyone.  I've been probably a dozen times and have tried something different each time and have not been disappointed once.  They also serve illy coffee which is the best.    One very minor complaint.  Some of the booths are a little beat down and not the most comfortable.  Time for an upgrade.  The food and service make up for this though.  Not really a big deal

QCjwJSzHvVZfWug5IJmscQ.text: Cool breakfast spot in Southern Highlands! Everyone is nice and the PJ's are a great touch. Good food, tastes fresh, great for families and children. Request Amanda, she is friendly and polite! Great service! Definitely one of my favorite places to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious fruit parfait made with no yogurt to fit my Vegan lifestyle. So good!! Thanks R&amp;S!

_D1SQjPzFzTyIDOhFl0xig.text: Steak and eggs were amazing. So were the chicken and waffles my boyfriend had. The French Press was cool. Good food. Waited about an hour for just my bf and I, I believe it was a weekday morning. But it was so worth it! The waitresses are dressed in cute pajamas. You could obviously tell they are running around like crazy because of how busy and packed the restaurant gets. I know how it is because I'm a waitress too. They are fast though. The service was great. We could tell our waitress was busy but she took the time to ask us how we were doing and showed us how to work the French press without talking to us in a rushed tone. Look up, they have awesome twirling umbrellas as ceiling fans. Come early to avoid the long wait. I would recommend this place.
