O7FwEhlHHThrp0i01jYOMw.text: As soon as you walk in the staff greets you and is very friendly, I LOVE that the servers wear Pj's for their uniforms, it makes you feel comfortable and welcome! I ordered a Ham & Cheese omelet, very yummy and a very large portion!

slRbX-dxLTU8dHXAP6YQiA.text: Yum! I believe this place has been around for awhile and I've been meaning to try it. So glad I did. I LOVE breakfast but it's hard for me to enjoy at most places because I don't eat beef or pork. Despite the fact that they are a "steak n eggs" place, this place has more then a few options for people like me. Although not very healthy, I love their chicken and waffles.... The portion size is large but it is great to take to go for a later day snack. I am also a huge fan of the fact that they serve coffee in a French press which is my absolute FAV way to enjoy some joe. The only complaint I have is that they do seem to run out of things frequently. Especially the infamous pot of bread. Other then that, service is always fast and friendly. Food is good. Wait is never as outrageous as some places (but we don't go on Sat). Nice job Rise and Shine.

28270Qvm13Ua3ELP0gPa3A.text: A good thing, just got better! Rise & Shine has expanded in more ways than one. The original restaurant in Southern Highlands was recently remodeled and not only seats more folks, but it now features a specialty juice bar/latte station. No need to stop my Starbucks before entering here. Additionally, a second store is now open in Summerlin; although, I have yet to visit. What can I say, I like to stick close to home in the mornings.

RNrMXXonLfp2WE5nzWeZmQ.text: I love eating here but this time I ordered for take out. Food was ready in 15mins but everything was just so wrong. The burger I ordered was really plain, no mayo and came with onions which we did not want. The chilaquiles I ordered were okay just had to take the eggs off since they were extremely runny. Totally killed my appetite. The pot of bread was yummy as usual. Next time I'll eat there instead.

fyjBvMT4obCefEJvCIxsbw.text: Best breakfast spot in southern highlands. Fresh food, decent service depending on how busy it is but the fact that the food is amazing makes up for the mediocre service. My family and I always come here for breakfast. Its way better quality than dennys or ihop. Becareful going to late because it can get very busy. ujfh5lWgEwj8MX1ymbK9LQ.text: I would recommend this restaurant. The service was very good. Our waitress, Laura is an adorable brunette , very personable and very efficient. She had us in absolute stitches .Our food was very good, price was fair. The restaurant itself is cute, as far as atmosphere goes.  I'd come back if she was working.

aEQEjz6ew5-W0qWfU31X6w.text: We arrived at Rise and Shine around 10:00 on Sunday morning.  It was already full.  I'm glad we arrived when we did, because within 5 minutes (no exaggeration) there was a 25-30 minute wait.  And, people stayed.  So, given that the regulars were willing to wait a half hour, I figured we were going to enjoy a solid breakfast.  I had the chicken fried steak and eggs.  I chose the pot of bread, which was brought out early as an appetizer of sorts.  It was warm, and the butter served alongside was room temperature, so spreading was easy.  l liked the cinnamon flavor in the bread, but I think I would have preferred some toast or a biscuit with my meal rather than this bread prior.  The steak itself is a good size, and thick for a chicken fried steak.  This was an issue, as some of the areas were not as tender as I prefer.  I think the meat needed more tenderizing prior to preparation.  Also, it did not appear to be seasoned.  If the meat had seasoning prior to breading, even just some salt and pepper, it would really elevate this dish.  That being said, it was very good, particularly with the tasty sausage gravy.    The accompanying scrambled eggs were very fluffy.  They were fluffy to the point that they stand out among just about every other place I've ordered eggs in this town.  You get a substantial order of potatoes, which were above average.  I ordered them well done, and was glad I did.  My wife's order had barely any color on them, and I prefer them crunchy.  Servers wear pajamas and were very friendly, which was great.  My tea glass got close to empty once, but she was right there with a refill.  Excellent service overall.  Will we return?  It's not likely given the distance from our house.  But, if I was in the area again I absolutely would eat here and recommend you do the same.

dud4NwoQTXFd0MRBA9iR8A.text: Found this place on yelp. Wanted to get some breakfast on our way out of Vegas. Service was outstanding. The waitress was very sweet and always attentive.  Food was good. I think it's a bit better then other places you'll find in Vegas. Definitely get the steak and eggs if you are really hungry.  Pictures attached

q6TNG31LsyIJAM3qfBV-3w.text: First time here and was disappointed! One of my daughter lives near this shopping center and suggested this place. My other daughter and I we're on our way out and wanted something quick and togo. I ordered a burrito which they customized since there was only about 3 or4 items for there burrito selection. Also asked to cut burrito in half and they said they couldn't do it since it would fall apart. Not True, for what I had asked for I know for a fact  it would not! A $14.50 burrito, bacon, hash browns,eggs and cheese. Had maybe 2 small stripes of bacon, very very small amount of hash browns. Tasted more like an egg burrito. Maybe they don't specialize in burritos but quality should be in all there items. Again very disappointed

5AX3nrl89uQ15vS606T4RQ.text: I love this little hidden breakfast treasure. Clean and so tasty. All the food looks so pretty as it comes out and is huge portions while still being flavorful and fresh. They use to give everyone this amazing pot of bread with your meal and now it is extra so that makes me a little sad. The chicken fried steak is to die for, chicken and waffles is amazing too but it's that waffle that blows my tastebuds away. I'm not a waffle fan but this is the only waffle I've ever tasted that is moist, fluffy, and full of flavor. To top it off they make their own syrup with vanilla and cinnamon inside that make u keep it dripping for more. About $15 a person so not a cheap breakfast spot but you will have leftovers.

RnOdd-uMq036pthiQcl6QA.text: Ryley girl you are fantastic! She had a great personality and made us feel welcome from the moment we arrived.  The steak and eggs Benedict on an everything bagel was perfection. The BF got the ultimate breakfast and loved it as well. The chilaquiles were delicious. Bread in a pot gets an A+ from me. Oh and how could I forget the hash-browns seriously sooo good. I was sad I couldn't finish my meal.   The decor and staff adds to the charm of this neighborhood breakfast spot.

2NaYKQbKAQoinegcxf2CbQ.text: I have been meaning to eat here for months! With quite an appetite I had high hopes for the food here but my experience was off. The poached egg tasted really weird and lost all the egg taste and texture. The steak was unseasoned and the hash browns were meh. Even the plain bagel it came with was terrible. I've never found a bagel I didn't like until this place. The pancakes were ok. It was a little weird of how crumbly they were though.  Sometimes when you are hungry enough even average food tastes awesome but it didn't work here. Almost everything was terrible.

O03MvoFukx7NO1YklOONdw.text: After coming back a couple of times, we kept getting really disappointing service.   They also have too many bad table locations with zero ambiance. Especially if you come in after the morning rush since multiple tables stay dirty for long periods of time.   There are important factors other than food that make a cafe a good one, in my opinion.   We tried their Summerlin location but that one has even worse customer service. It must be a chain thing.   Save yourself some money and time.   There are way too many great breakfast places in this city to go to a mediocre one like this one.

yjyIySqUaBFIXTwy9laBYg.text: Great food! Super friendly staff! A great place to start your morning off right with the most important meal of the day.  I am looking forward to having breakfast here again soon!

V5yJYCH-M9kUFj8SACEMsA.text: Just finished eating here and it has never failed to put a smile on my face! Staff are very personable and relatable and continuously makes sure that your dining experience is awesome great start of my Easter morning!

51sztjhFaJnzkIpntIAiUA.text: Here visiting Vegas and steak and eggs sounded good so we tried this place out...SOOO glad we did!!! It's delicious, made from scratch goodness. It changed my life, it was that good!! Order the ultimate steak and eggs or the chicken and waffles, you won't be disappointed!!

TQ-5jIeMVTKjfS--wTygIQ.text: Food was very good but kind of pricy for a small strip mall restaurant. Portions were big, service was excellent and the place was very clean. I would highly recommend but warn about the $$$.

Ae2GOaSIumIqM1FPCEIeFQ.text: We love this place!! The service always quick and friendly and the juice bar is to die for! The open kitchen concept makes it fun to see how the kitchen runs and works so hard! The wait staff are dressed in PJs which is exactly how you wish you were really dressed before the coffee and first meal of the day, (or last;))They offer a variety of great food for both lunch and dinner. Breakfast meals set the tone for the day and we always leave here highly satisfied, thank you to all the staff!! We will continue to come back.

Cn-S4bzEjmnkUvp30vJeFQ.text: We haven't been in this area since my disaster of an experience a few doors down(Refer to my Xtreme Sushi review) but with all the high ratings, I knew we'd make it here one day.  Yes, it is clear across town, yes, we're up by Mt. Charleston, Yes, I am that person who'll drive AAAAAAALL the way to Hendertucky for the best Snow Ice in town, and Yes, there are too many whiner vaginers who make a big deal because of the distance travelling farther than outside of their hood....two answers for you-1) Stay home, or 2) Make like Rhianna and SHUT UP AND DRIVE!!!!  Breakfast/Brunch is my absolute favorite meal of the day, and we're always looking for another spot to add into our breakfast/brunch rotation. I like the quirky atmosphere here. Everyone is so welcoming as you walk in, spinning umbrellas up on the ceiling, waitresses in pajamas like they just rolled out of bed ready to serve you. Puts a smile on your face..:) One weird thing was the "Help us...Yelp us" on the back of the busboys' shirts. Don't know if that's against Yelp policy, but its not like they need to do that....They have a great fan base, and great food!  Menu selections here are plentiful, and our waitress Riley was AWESOME SAUCE! She was very informative, personable, and offered up suggestions, popular items, and even her personal favorites. when we narrowed it down, we split the Fried Chicken Breast and Waffles and The Ultimate Steak and Eggs Plate, with the potted bread(Took a page from Jamms?) as our bread choice, with some fresh squeezed OJ(they use Navel, not Valencia) Two HUGE chicken breasteses were fried to perfection-crisp, well seasoned exterior, and the inside stayed nice and juicy and went perfectly with the crisp, light waffle drizzled with the cinnamon infused syrup, which was unfortunately Log Cabin. The ribeye was a perfect medium rare as requested, and the hash browns were not your typical out of the box type and you can tell it was made in house. Nice and crisp on the outside, soft and creamy on the inside. As popular as they are, the potted bread didn't arrive until after we were done with breakfast. No one's fault though, as Riley even offered another bread choice, we chose to wait. Its kinda like a little Cinnabon in a flower pot that comes with a cream cheese glaze on the side and was a great ending to our meal.  Definitely can't wait to come back to attack their Sweet Cream Pancakes, Chilaquiles, and other popular items.   ALOHA!!!

etnjFHmz97U6Yirz7or7uQ.text: A few peers and I went here to get lunch in between a college test prep course. We had an hour, so ordered immediately when we got there. The menu looked good, but we ended up not even getting our food. We waited for 50 MINUTES, and finally had to leave so we weren't late to our class. The couple next to us waited 45 minutes for their food, and their order was wrong. We were extremely disappointed, especially in the service. The staff did not care to check on the progress of our order, when we asked continually. Will never go to this location again. Very disappointing.

YLtLqw285PAz9Not342BUw.text: Love love this place. The atmosphere, waiter and waitress in PJs! They are friendly.  Service is great. Food is amazing!! I highly recommend it!

eAvIPBI4-CF4y5MtIFkz_Q.text: This place is amazing. Very broad menu for any breakfast craving. Everything I've had on the 2 times I been there has been amazing. Customer service is amazing as well.Definitely will go there again whenever am in Vegas again.

5KXQMnHR4JIhLn3YOyGfcw.text: Uhm, what? There's, actually, a yummy place near my house?  The waffles are gigatic. Not scary Man vs. Food gigantic but, definately better tasting than Hash House a Go Go, iHop, Denny's, even Egg and I. Their potatoes hash is really good. Not mushy and spiced just right. The steak was made perfect. Moist but, over done like South Point's steak.  Super excited that they serve my favorite coffee ever-in-life: Illy. Yessss, ILLY IS ILL! I have yet to try their lunch which has rave reviews, too.  All in all thankful to eat something other than McDonald's egg mcmuffins in the morning =)

mm3N4xDESbfNRanyWujiBw.text: Great food and service. The coffee was excellent and offered frequently. The meals came quickly and were made to order. Very yummy! Will definitely be back!

vyWsHfh-jV4xLs_JCZK3kg.text: I visit rise and shine at least once a week. The food is amazing with large portions. 89ZHh3IEkzJuOj_LgrHzUg.text: Tried the steak and eggs with a glass of OJ. The OJ was freshly squeezed and amazing. The steak and eggs was also delicious. The cup-o-bread was sweet, warm and tasty.

OGuyoPiNUtCT1TKk-ns9Sg.text: I love this place everyone is friendly service was fast and wonderful. Food was delicious, they have a great variety of food as well! Love their fresh squeeze juices and smoothies !!

-c_lRj3yB1QOJE974mP77w.text: Horrible experience numerous problems with this place.  First the server didn't seem happy with wife ordering a waffle and us ordering water.  "Is that all" she said.  I wondered if it's one of those figure of speech things.  Later on i found out nope; she just a crappy waitress after all.  Second we waited 30 minutes for our food.  Third the people that sat after us got their orders in approx 10 minutes after sitting down.  Fourth, took 12 min to see a manager.  Fifth, my server said she was the manager and she was in the back handling some hostess issue that's why I didn't see her for approx 40 min.  6th my loco mono rice was dry and hard like it was sitting out all day; not only hard on the surface but throughout the rice.  7th told the server/manger about the crappy dry/hard rice and have her touch it and she says "I didn't cook it".  So she took it off my check.  I lost approx 1 hour of my time and came home to eat frozen pizza cause I'm still hungry.

a6HJJ0gWnrDljMwuOxilTQ.text: We found a new breakfast spot!!! Amazing food but there very busy ( I guess that's a good a thing) so be ready to wait!!

SQcu-ZW9uNMPjN06sbMYjQ.text: This place is a gem! Delicious food and great service. Love the decor inside. The service was perfect. Will definitely return here in the future. A+

D0lffPDRAZXg_AMr1jSLgQ.text: Had a great breakfast here over the Thanksgiving break.  Of course I ordered the country fried steak and eggs and I was not disappointed.  It is the best I've ever had!  The meat is really tender and moist and the batter is nice and crispy.  You can't get any better.  Next time I'm in Las Vegas, I will be coming here.

uViz6122OOu52jxwXMRx4A.text: Great local place for breakfast. I ordered the Country Fried Steak and Eggs and it was phenomenal. The rest of my family got chicken and waffles and the bananas foster waffles and they enjoyed them just as much as I did. Great service and great coffee as well. Excited to go back again real soon!

FuTxGzzAJMpTenB1X5wu8g.text: Staff is very attentive and friendly. Great breakfast and environment. Place was pretty cold since we were one of the few first ones in on an expected hot day in Vegas. I had one of my breakfast faves - chicken fried steak and eggs. The hash browns, gravy, steak and eggs came out perfect. I'm very satisfied with my experience bring it's my first time eating in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum

jRf2xF8a2FlPyA1cTG1t7Q.text: This was probably the best steak and eggs I've ever had, amazing service. I tried the freshly squeezed orange juice they have, and let me tell you it's taste like you're bitting into an orange. I don't know how else to explain it but it was the best!

XakbzF9oU_McXOK5PsZ2-A.text: My family and I stopped here on our way home to So CA and we had one of the best breakfast experiences at this wonderful restaurant. The food was delicious and our 11 year old son said his pancakes were the best he'd tasted. My husbands ham steak was fantastic and my avo Benedict was incredible. The atmosphere was so cute with their morning theme and the wait staff in PJ's. Our waitress Cary was so friendly and efficient which topped off this great dining experience! Will definitely be back and let our family and friends know not to miss!

CVY-tOLOvjNyL5BV-DZitg.text: Very disappointed. Came in to have breakfast before heading back to Cali. My husband and I ordered coffee. His coffee mug had lipstick stain. We didn't make a big deal about it, just asked for another coffee. After ordering our food we waited for 55 minutes and nothing. We asked one of the waitresses and said she would check. We waited 5 minutes for an answer and again nothing! At this point we've had enough and decided to leave. Not once did our coffees get refilled. This is THE WORST EXPERIENCE WE'VE HAD!

5248nRAyEl7RQ1zRL9cRXg.text: We moved to this area about 6 months ago. We have gone here twice but will not go back due to very poor service both times we went. We went around 9 am and it was not very busy. We were seated promptly but completely ignored by our server. Another server took our order and got us drinks. The last time we went, they were very busy. I ordered coffee and it came about 15 minutes later but not the way I ordered it, so it was sent back. My husband had to go to pick it up from the window. Very weird that you never see a manager and servers feel no sense of urgency.

vJCjPdQigY6J65e3Tkea2A.text: I used to love this place! But I got disappointed when I ate here last Sunday. The server was not as friendly as I remember. Seems like he didn't even want to talk to us. Then after a while, I saw him being so nice and talkative and helping the other table explaining almost everything on the menu. While he didn't even let us know that the full order is too big for 2 kids.   Then the food. I got my usual, chicken and waffle. But got disappointed on how small it was. I would've understand if their price went up. But when the food price went up, I'd expect that it'll still be as big (the quality is still good) the chicken was just half what it used to be. So that was disappointing. I was looking forward to leftovers, but no leftovers since it was small.  I don't think we'll be back for a while.

4w2BIqKE6Pd-Esivv7Ga_g.text: It's my dad's first time in Vegas after at least 14years. I wanted to take him to M resort studio buffet but found out they no longer have breakfast. Oh no!!!  I quickly yelp'd around the nearest breakfast places and found these guys. The pot of bread seemed like a unique idea and the photos looked great!   Arrived at around 830am. Quaint little place in a shopping plaza. Loved how the servers wear Jammies (must be the best work uniform ever).  Decor: simple. I honestly do not remember anything that stuck out besides the turning floral umbrellas on the ceiling and the "cow and egg" advertisement on the wall.   Orange juice: to my surprise, freshly squeezed.  Dads steak and eggs: steak was very tender and eggs cooked to a perfectly requested sunny side up.   The hash: very unique. They look like flat pasta noodles cut in smaller segments. It tasted very fresh with a perfect crunch.   My chicken fried steak: my steak was also very flavorful and tender. It was paired with a delicious gravy. I am not a big chicken fried steak fan but damn, this was good.   Husband's chicken and waffle: the portion size was good. Nicely breaded chicken breast with a waffle. Chicken was tender and juicy despite being fried.   Their pot of bread became 'tea cup bread' when we visited. It did not look too appealing since the shape was funky and some overfilled the cup. However, they were nice and warm out of the oven and very, very delicious. Dad and I are not fans of sweet bread but this was perfectly flavored with cinnamon and a bit of sweetness. Butter and tea cup bread for the win!  Pricing: a bit higher than your normal breakfast restaurant but hey, you're paying for fresh food. Totally worth it!  I am very glad our hotel decided to cancel their breakfast buffet because we got to experience something new and not your usual Vegas meal :)  I would definitely recommend and return at my next trip!!

Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and eggs

LcfMSE4uc2XZWCTDkTbt5Q.text: Awesome delicious food.  Vents make it a little cold.  The organic coffee was outstanding. Every plate of foods that would come out looked spectacular. Will definitely come back!  Have perfect waffles. My boyfriend ordered the chicken and waffles and it was delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles YUMM

9_xl7lhow2l96vCxs1tLsg.text: Super cute place! Servers in pajamas, large booths and umbrellas hanging from the ceiling. I also really like the tile on the walls.  I was there on a Monday morning around 11AM there was no wait. This was my first time here, but my friend had been there quite often because he lives right down the street.  He had the french toast with 3 eggs and bacon (apparently he's a growing boy - don't know how he ate it all, PLUS a slice of MY bacon!). I had just the standard breakfast with 2 eggs, hash browns and bacon. We both ordered the "pot of bread," and he ordered an extra for himself (I seriously don't know where he put all this food).  Everything was really good, although I am not a big fan of their style of hash browns. The service was fast and friendly and I will definitely be back because I really want to try one of their signature steak dishes.

-QQ19L1YERrRaP2Zxa7NdA.text: If you are in the Vegas area this is a must stop! To quote my husband, "This is the best breakfast I've ever had!". He had the chicken fried steak. My daughter had the buffalo chicken and she said it was very good. And that is coming from a very picky eater. The atmosphere was great also. Staff wear PJ's like they just got out of bed. I can't remember our servers name but her last name is Gene or Jean. She was great!

md_tdCx_JGpz-9CN_Ye9lw.text: The food was AMAZING & our waitress, Desire D. was even better!!! Very knowledgeable about the menu, super friendly, attentive & fun! She made our day! We will be back soon, thanks to her!

AmS14Szmk9LS12ey8zjZxQ.text: The service was good the food average but very expensive. Chicken fried steak (aka: country fried steak) $16.50 but no toast. Extra$$. Comparative meal at Egg and I a lot less and better food.

GFsx0I-t1J9QezwpmXyC1Q.text: Pretty darn good.  Wanted to find a place away from the strip.  Get the pot bread!

cRr_DCSydJE36-s3-cZAkQ.text: Have been coming here for years and was the worst experience.  The place was filthy.  The customer service was lacking and the food was plain.  What happened?  The hostess asked how was my breakfast and was told the truth but she just said sorry.  Rise and shine,  victims of your own success, will never go back. Bummer.

YgKxqUZD3WabtCoMK7tDMg.text: Since I visited the 9827 W Flamingo Road location, my review will be on there :)

YsuoGYnuNao5RExTE-_alQ.text: They are lucky to even recieve one star , but I wanted to make sure this posted. When a person orders a steak request medium and recieves something they can not put a knife through is absurd. I do not believe the cooks even know the difference in temperatures,or whether or not it is even cooked. Case in point order a medium receive a well done piece of rubber where a hacksaw could not cut through. or recieve on a second request fatty plate that has blood in it. DO yourself a favor not only avoid the non fully cook hasbrowns avoid recieving a belly ache , save your money at 12+ DOLLARS A PLATE AND GO SOMEWHERE ELSE ... THis place sucks and will never see my money again

eK4e8hvEXh9ugW0ij4i0uQ.text: We really enjoy going to the pajama breakfast place as my husband calls it. The waitresses wear flannel jammie's  and the service is friendly. So far We have liked everything we have tried from both the breakfast and lunch menu. Only downside is the pricing. If there were a few more lower cost options we would go more often.

IyJYoP3xxeYWPPW9n49b4Q.text: There food is good, service is excellent- price is average.  But there bread in a pot is to die for... I could go there and only eat that and be a happy camper!

tYt5DlRrwGsLnWxgj26Wig.text: First time at rise and shine, first review I've bothered to write for a restaurant.  Had the chicken fried steak and it was delicious.  Will be back again, I only fear writing this review will make it slightly more crowded

46cthm4awOxnvZFwO40BlQ.text: I don't EVER get out of my downtown and China town bubble, but I was diggin on this chick that lives right around this place and we went there for breakfast one day. The outside doesn't make it look very appealing, but once inside the wait staff and management were super friendly and attentive to all of our needs. I ordered the chicken fried steak ( which was an actual breaded steak! ) the scrambled eggs and the pot of bread which were absolutely amazing!  I loathe going to the suburbs even for a hookup, but I would go that far this food. ( that says quite a bit about the food if I wouldn't drive there for a hookup, but I would drive there for this food)  I hope they open one close to downtown, so I can leave The Egg and I and go to this place!!!

-mEIyHD9oTh9s6FGZBs23g.text: The service sucks here. The girl has no personality and she looks like she came to work in her pjs. The food was awful and it sucked. Definitely would not come back or recommend to anyone.

UJrWfb3Grmf7YpENfeh3Yg.text: Awful service, waited 35 minutes to be seated. I asked if we could sit outside and was told the wait would be just as long but a group of younger African american women came 20 minutes after us and were seated IMMEDIATELY.. Why? After we finally were seated it took our waitress 12 minutes to take our order and in the middle of taking our order she walked away!! WTH? She then came back to finish taking our order. The food took 29 minutes and was below average at best. The pancakes tasted like flour or bisquick mix. The eggs were okay, bacon was a bit crispy for my liking. The best part of this restaurant is the maple syrup. Management needs to hire a more friendly and efficient staff. I do not recommend this place at all.

yOguCamHriB7dFUaA3S3OQ.text: Very cool place. Staff is courteous and friendly. Portions are large and prices is an average of $11 a plate. Food is tasty and the decor is fun and quirky and a great place for family breakfast. A must visit when you're in Vegas.

gRJWsX_Ilufa9pnklvn0RA.text: maybe i was expecting too much with all the great reviews, but we could have passed on this place. came for sunday brunch. waited about 20 minutes before being seated at the booths. What bugged was that they were sooooo slow with cleaning the tables! the booth area that we sat at could have been readily available the moment we walked in if someone just had moved the dirty dishes! our waitress was nice but didn't pay attention to the fact that we had no silverware. the press coffee is strong but i guess i'm not a fan of illy's (not very aromatic). the steak definitely needed more flavoring (very bland), the hollindaise sauce runny and sour. hubby didn't think the chilaquiles was extrodinary either. overall, it's one of them "we came, we tried, we're.never coming back" places.

eTJ3VyR78YvOHeT2zvMM7w.text: The only reason why I gave this place a 3 star was because the customer service was really bad! The waitresses and hosts were like all in a bad mood  with each other!! On the other hand the food was delicious I had the chicken and waffle it was great! However will not go back to this place customer service is a big thing in places specially restaurants!!

LwKTp_NzmvNcHpAHL-nPOw.text: Came here for breakfast with G/F after I got off shift. Very festive inside, we were greeted at the front door by the hostess and was sat immediately.(Since we were the first customers of the day). Server was very friendly but kind of slow on the service side. I ordered the country fried steak and eggs and g/f got 8oz ribeye and eggs. The ribeye was very tasty along with their hashbrown, which are shoestring. The only gripe I have is that they do not put enough gravy on the plate, it comes in a separate portion cup (3oz i believe) I like my stuff smothered!!!!! Also its kind of on the expensive side.

Lwvks04n-c3WxVbdki5UxA.text: Excellent breakfast and service! Really liked the country fried steak and eggs, waffle and fried chicken great, steak omelet was great too, along with Pressed Coffee.  Only thing that disappointed me was the common jelly, homemade fruit or better end jam or jelly would have really been the icing on the cake to go with their homemade signature bread in a pot. Get over there now!! They close at 3:00!

fyjhoRCD2kG5cNFjY85VTg.text: Loved the concept from the reviews and it sure was busy on a Sunday morning. The menu is interesting and the pot of bread is a winner. Perhaps didn't order the right item and if I come back may try to be more original, but the omelet was nothing special and light on filling and any type of seasoning, but the hashbrowns were so peppery that almost rendered them inedible. There were peppers in the hashbrowns but the peppery flavor was a heavy pepper shaker. The too busy atmosphere almost made the pace seem frenetic so didn't enjoy the experience that I was expecting to.

L0LiV2SJAZK9n_I5HRyPfQ.text: I really wanted to like this place but after 3 times I'm done. There is no sense of urgency at all as far as being seated or getting your food. They would rather have you wait 15 min while they wipe down every dirty table instead of have a busser to clean up the mess. Because of the nonchalant service and the fact that they just don't seem to care my family won't ever be back

FgK9m521BAO7pMgTlgch-g.text: Food was awesome with a great presentation. Not to mention service was super friendly and the place is decorated cute!

Jf3eOxWbRHOoIKalOmthHg.text: Perfect breakfast... Perfect service, quaint, clean restaurant. I simply can't recommend this place enough.

F4DEZnBJ4A-Nt3Wkr798dA.text: Absolutely terrible! Takes forever just to get seated even when there are plenty of open tables. They have 1 moron waitress wearing dirty pajamas,no busser or hostess. Food is marginal at best. They mess up the order and don't even care. And theres also some huge fat slob (I think the owner) who just sits there an eats and doesn't help seat people or do anything about the fact that te place is totally understaffed. Looking at the owner alone is enough to make someone lose their appetite. I'll never go back to this place!

WCFtlHWHGSWCT0e8E2H9rg.text: Nice staff. very vibrant decor to the place. My steak was cooked a good mid rare, hash brown were mighty tasty, biscuit was delectable . Good quality in steak, but I wished with was more seasoned.

_RmfxfN2V-awZGVOQGYr8Q.text: The boyfriend finally agreed to go out for breakfast and this made me beyond happy. The place: Rise and Shine in Southern Highlands. Very quaint, family-run breakfast/lunch spot.  We arrived just after 11 and had a 20 min wait. Thank goodness for the gorgeous Fall weather.  Our name was finally called and a 10-13 year old brought us to our table. Normally, the idea of children working in a restaurant annoys me. Restaurants is a serious business and throwing your underaged kids in the mix is more distracting than it is helpful. But at R&S, this little one was very mature and informative.  Pleasant surprise.  The wait staff are garbed in PJ sets to match the name of the restaurant. Clever. But the food...not overly complicated and that's how I like my favorite meal of the day.  -Corned beef hash with eggs: yum! Not my typical choice but happy I did this time. -Peanut Butter and Blueberry jam French toast: this was a buffer dish in case the hash didn't work out but then I just ended up way stuffed. -Spiced Rib eye steak and eggs: this was the bf's meal. Served with the egg atop nachos instead of the meat was odd and looked very heavy to me. He said it wasn't bad. The streak was seasoned well as I had to try at least one piece.  There are no TVs for distraction so it's a great place for families with kids. Can't wait to go back to try their pot of cinnamon bread as they ran out this time.  Food was good but service will make me a repeat guest.

LTzHKTtKah76SlnBkLy6Ng.text: Rise & Grind is a really cute place to grab breakfast with family/friends, or you can choose to go alone and sit at the bar. They serve my favorite coffee (illy) and offer these cute little plant pots of cinnamon bread. (FYI; you need to arrive early to receive a pot of bread. They only make 100 a day) The prices are a little high for breakfast but you do receive a good portion of food. There's a variety of items on the menu to choose from. I will definitely visit again to enjoy my illy coffee and try something new.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baby pot of bread! So cute!

VpMi35ryojLMmNu87uFAcA.text: Great place to eat.  Bring family here all the time. Affordable breakfast!! Can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Love the potted bread! outstanding service!! If you ever have Lisa as your waitress , she's absolutely amazing!!

KFTFWNg0yxF8jOkZjiqUDw.text: I would give zero stars if I could! Horrible service! Food came out in 5 minutes or less???! Eggs Benedict was raw and smothered in hollandaise (soogy and uneatable) My Granddaughter's eggs and pancakes which where served on top of each other?! had a long black hair under her food...GROSSSS!!! Will never go back

yoIDR0xDt2ldfJ21GgIyRQ.text: Great breakfast place.  The staff serves you in their pajamas.   Feels like home!  Food is great.... have never been disappointed!

wKJiRI3GC_7yQ6Ds_Khzdw.text: Over priced place. Food is mediocre. Servers wear pjs which Is cute I guess. Some waitresses really look like they just rolled out of bed though.

E74ZbeTesL5wUY_zzYYfYQ.text: We just love this place. For us it's a neighborhood gem-a short walk from home. The consistently friendly and good service, the great food and colorful relaxed decor make this well worth a drive to get here. I've enjoyed every breakfast I've had. But only go for the chicken and waffles if you're seriously hungry. Kids and Senior options too -which is nice.

opgDVhYfAFJpFzNZB9tYyA.text: Normally I would give this place a 4 Star review, but on Sunday May, 3 2015 that all changed.  Granted this place is packed on the weekends and to keep pace with the knashing carnivors waiting anxiously to get in and get there feed on, the staff in nasty pajamas has to be on point with the kitchen.  This seems obvious right?  Well on Sunday there was a line out the door, normal, and the experience started like this:  The hostess, a girl I had not seen before and unfortunately did not get her name, asked us how many and told us that there would be a 15-20 min wait.  So I looked to the Bar which no one was at and asked if we could sit there.  First she eye rolled me and then said I don't know.  I asked if she could check and again the same exasperated eye roll that she might have fallen backwards from, "Ill check," she said.  I waited 5 min while she talked to severs, played with her pen and gave the general I could give a rats hind end about you as a customer look and finally I asked if she even asked any one (of which she didn't because I was watching like a hawk with a caged animal in my stomache ready to leap from its depths and attack on site).  Also, I wasnt the only annoyed one as all the people were talking about how rude that hostess was.  She is definately not the face any owner would want at the FOH.  Lazy, non-caring, and rude.  While sitting waiting for Griselda the Mean to get back to me, I looked around and there were 6-8 four tops sitting with dirty dishes on them which would have acomodated most of the people outside waiting.  Those table stayed dirty for exactly 15 min before they started to be cleared.  This whole team led by there Manager Jessica, who didn't lift a finger to help any one and simply walked around with a face that could sink a1000 ships and then complained about the customers attitudes only a few feet from me.  Maybe its just me but the Manager should be the buisiest person in the restaurant, cleaning making sure that customers are taken care of, smiling, greeting, not hiding in corners and avoiding the crazy crowd that had acumulated outside the door.  Jessica only became interested in us when we asked for a comment card.  Then she couldn't stop walking behind me and my girlfriend looming over to get a peek at what was being written.  So unprofessional.  She was training...if you want to call it that, a server by the name of Cali for management, who was AWESOME.  She was sooooo weeded and still she took the time to come by and make sure that we were ok at least 3 times.  Great job on the floor Cali, hopefully you will be replacing Jessica so very soon!!  Food...well it was satisfactory this time.  My steak came out mooing at me, way rare (I ordered medium), and the hashbrowns were raw and I think if I equated it to a measuring cup I got a bout 1/3 of a cup of hashbrowns and the eggs over easy were dripping with oil, saturating everything on the plate.  The open air kitchen was getting slammed, plates were being thrown on the floor by the line cooks, (Seriously?) the cooks were openly swearing at the servers and calling them horrible names behind the line only 2 feet from me and I was able to hear everything.  Sloppy plating and the list goes on.  My girlfriend said here omlet was good but the pot of bread she ordered was raw about an inch down in the cup.  Sorry Rise and Shine, normally you all are so on point and friendly and look so comfy in your designer flannel pajamas.  Please understand people normally this place is the bomb, but under the horrible leadership that day it all came crashing down.

Jsl1FRwyB8AAeiu4wMR6fQ.text: The breakfast was pretty good and the service was good but the bad part was you can see the cooks and one of the cooks went from playing on his phone at the cash register to going to prepare someone's food and touching a waffle with his bare hands without washing them. That was very unappealing. Later he went back to playing on his phone again I never saw him once wash his hands after he handled people's food.. Won't be coming back to this place just because of that..

CFSoYrEbShYypAuj2wCw0Q.text: went back a few times.   Food is still delicious and the chicken and waffles are always a winner. I also enjoyed the bagel egg sandwiches, and the burgers.  It is cool seeing the waiters wearing PJs.

y1cYFAynTbzB5kjGQo-jUg.text: Food was so good! One of the best breakfast meals ... and the service was amazing ! Will definitely come by next time in Vegas

rFpZ9Nnvk0aOphYLNXX2GQ.text: A bit conflicted about this place...not far from my house...every time I go there is some thing just a tad off...perhaps it is I who is a tad off...lol...reasonable prices and food is decent...more three stars than four

TED9sttepinOh-dx5LBsvA.text: Came here before I went to Daylight :)   Ordered the bagel & egg sandwich, 3 Little pigs.  Bacon, Ham, and banger with American cheese on an Everything bagel.  Pretty appetizing!  I wish I had asked for a slightly undercooked egg to break the yolk and let it smother my bagel though!  The "fries" are like hash, so don't expect the type of fries you get with a burger :)

JAKMWrwjCwGPmr3XigZL5Q.text: Chicken Cobb Salad is the best I've ever had. Only breakfast before, but my Realtor and I had lunch there today. Get a to go box. Can't eat it all even if you try.

26wk7kv26lqtN6uuOV5C4w.text: I was really impressed with this place!  Walking in we were greeted immediately by very friendly employees. The decor is very cute and it kept my daughter entertained. Food was good and our server was great. We will definitely be back.

x-2iY9bm9lLn-BcYE0FZKg.text: Worth the 8 minute detour from the interstate of you are looking for a brunch time meal away from the hustle and bustle of the Strip.  There is something about places that beg me to leave a good review on Yelp!. Bus boys wear t-shirts that say "Help us...Yelp! us." A sign hangs in the window advertising that people like them on Yelp!. Then,  at the end of your meal,  a 20 question survey is handed to you with another Help Us,  Yelp! us advertisement.  I don't need your constant reminders to leave a good review, just quality service and great food. Also,  if you want me to leave a review,  provide me with free wifi since your network shows up as the strongest of the many networks in the area (3 of which are free).  That said,  we received quality service and great food.  My fiance and I shared their Country fried steak and eggs,  hashbrowns, biscuit,  and a side of corn beef hash. The steak was prepared in a great batter;  very crispy,  not hard,  thick,  but not overwhelming.  Gravy was served on the side and was very tasty.  Hash Browns are more like a mix between hash browns and home fries... home fried hash browns, maybe? The fluffy and crispy biscuit came out late,  but it was topped with sausage gravy at no charge... nice! Also,  the corned beef hash was a very good addition to this meal. We left very full and ready for a nap,  to bad we have a 4.5 hour drive ahead of us.   The food was matched with great service from the time we signed in to paying the bill.  Good job,  now lose the Help Us, Yelp! Us shirts, it's tacky and unnecessary given the quality food and service you have. You'd receive 5 stars if you didn't have the Yelp! requests everywhere.

HoQ_FA0i-_hWvt7bx6qq8g.text: Ate here this morning! I can't believe some of the negative reviews! The food was delish, the French press coffee was so good! I was super happy that my oatmeal came out with pecans & raisins & brown sugar! The bacon was delish..... Our server was a sweetheart & I loved that they wore jammies!

G8zWtFwNX7bj389SpDrcvg.text: New breakfast spots are cropping up everywhere and I'm loving it ! Apparently the word is out - around 10 AM on a Saturday we had a 20 minute wait for two.   The decor is absolutely adorable - hanging flowers are all over the place and the wait staff wears really cute pajamas - love it!   The food we tried was all very good. My husband had the blueberry french toast strudel . It was like a slice of a delicious casserole. If you're in the mood  for sweet but not disgustingly so, I recommend this! We also tried the chicken and waffles which was good, especially if you haven't had Roscoe's. It was much, much better than the one at HHAGG, and at this point the best I've had in Vegas. It was a big chicken breast instead of fried chicken which did make it much easier to eat. The waffle was pretty boring, but well executed. The chicken was a touch spicy, and the whole thing was served with cinnamon syrup. I would get it again, but I can't say it's crave-worthy.   Biggest bummer about this place was service was a disaster. Drinks were late and forgotten, the pot of bread supposed to be served prior to the meal was brought after, etc, etc. They all seemed very rushed and stressed out. Given how brand new this place is, they get a pass, but I would hope the service improves in the future!   It's no Babycakes, but it does hold its' own. In a sea of breakfast spots at every corner, this place deserves a spot in anyone's short list .

XVAeI_8okvP8QKGbA5rSyQ.text: Awesome breakfast place.... nice decor and Lavazza coffee! The breading on chicken fried steak was perfectly seasoned and it was nice to automatically have gravy on the side to prevent the steak from getting mushy. Salivating just thinking of the food again!

eb03R_LCSI8ero-SaM3xKw.text: Went here on a Saturday around 930 ish had like a 10 mins wait for a table...had good service ...the food was good but a pricey ..57 bucks for a 3 person breakfast

SBj2_GAZIaUCDoZI5xeDhg.text: Came in on a Sunday, there was a lot of people waiting but the great news is they seat you quickly. We had a party of 3, and got seated with in 10 mins. Our server was extremely nice, tentative, and made sure we were satisfied. The food came out quickly, and it was delicious. Ask for the hash browns to be crispy and they'll make sure they are. I got the steak omelet and pot of bread. Quality of steak was good, cappuccino with hazelnut Nutella did not even taste like coffee tasted like a yummy hot chocolate, and pot of bread was crisp on the top and soft in the inside. Overall good way to start a Sunday morning.

rRVpsUgyj_Y9edMUgyEdtA.text: For the price, the food was just okay. I could have gone somewhere with more selection and better quality food and spent less money. The service was just okay. Waitstaff was friendly, but not good about checking in. The decor was nice--the umbrellas hanging from the ceiling is a nice touch. The a/c was blasting and ice cold. While a/c is obviously appreciated, it's not fun to eat while I'm shivering. While there was nothing terrible about this restaurant, it's too pricy and too far out of our way for us to consider returning.

F-pjqvTxEpCkPupPSuZGYQ.text: Excellent food and huge servings...worth every penny. The waitresses wear their PJ's. Very original great neighborhood restaurant. Much bigger on the inside than it looks from outside. I would recommend the Eggs Benedict.

fMJn5BZLbtSDjnpPXQ6MRA.text: Today was a complete and utter disappointment when we went to eat around 1030am. We had the same sweet waitress and there were 3 of us. 40 minutes go by and our order is still not ready. We get up and go to our waitress who is by the kitchen and she tells us it has not been started yet and is extremely apologetic. Not her fault but the cook, who actually didn't give a damn, said he wasn't going to start it if we were leaving. What kind of customer service does this place have? How about trying to get the situation corrected? We got screwed. AND this place has usually very acceptable service when they are jam packed on the weekends. I hope the owners care enough to read this.

EczkyftnBf_dbnA29eQuig.text: A very cute brunch place! The waitresses wear pajamas and the restaurant is colorful with a friendly atmosphere. Our waitress was extremely friendly and knowledgeable. I had a bagel sandwich that had turkey and avocado with coffee. Service was fast and everything was very good

m6TCEYwgldZxChKwyo12PQ.text: Yummmm! Breakfast here was absolutely delightful. The restaurant is cute because they have sunflowers on the ceiling and the servers are dressed in pjs, which makes it the perfect lighthearted and pleasant place to eat breakfast.  The pancakes were great!  The bread in a cup was delicious!  The orange juice was so fresh!

6nhOcIX6kqwhtN5FdobGDQ.text: The food was great and service was the cherry on top. Christina made us feel like we were having breakfast in her home. She went above and beyond.

pmrd7-9qLa-OYtu5TMSkLw.text: Cutest little breakfast spot EVER!  Servers wear PJ's - all were friendly and welcoming.   Came in around 9:30 on a Saturday morning and had to wait about 15 minutes - Grab a Vegas & Seven magazine next to the hostess stand to pass the time. This place is worth the wait!  I opted for the Pot of Bread, the omelet and hashbrowns.    Pot of Bread - excellent, medium sized with the perfect amount of cinnamon twist.    Omelet - My go to is usually egg whites with spinach & onions - I saw kielbasa for an option and my polish heart just couldn't resist.  Perfectly cooked & great portion sizes.  Hashbrowns - now i am VERY particular when it comes to my hashbrowns - I despise breakfast potatoes & am a huge fan of crispy.  These hashbrowns were not your normal thick breakfast has browns, but instead thin and crispy.  Probably the best hashbrowns I have ever had.    All & all i will be adding this to my list of favorites.  Very nice to actually sit, eat and visit in a home-cooked setting.  Not in a casino - not in a bar, but in a great neighborhood.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cutest little pot of bread!

vdBJjNva7UMYruKImx6Kiw.text: I travel for work and have ate at a lot of places this one is definitely #1! Great food and fantastic service

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing breakfast!!! Rise and shine burrito

L24Hpk4CVh3ZRLh39aMtcA.text: Great place to eat..  Friendly staff, need a bigger place!!  It is so beautiful and calming in their.

10laPDGiVdhduu7Ihwfl_Q.text: This place was a pleasant surprise. We had breakfast on our way out of Vegas, away from the strip and its traffic. Awesome food quality, quick service, and all our dishes tasted exceptionally well. We ordered: Red velvet chocolate chip packages - super chocolatey and yummy  Chicken Avocado egg white omelette - Excellent  Fancy steak omelette - Amazing   All egg sides and kids' dishes were excellent as well. Even the Cappuccino was a high quality taste.   Definitely, this place is going to be a staple to our future Vegas trips.

nbhnpgQO2GOYNlc57qaoVw.text: This is my favorite breakfast place in Vegas so far. I have been going here for over two years. Previously was close to my place (it's just off cactus and Decatur/southern highlands parkway) but now I happily drive there.   The wait can be long sometimes and no reservations. So go early! It is a small place. But worth a wait (never too long anyways) if you are a late-comer.   The menu is great. Lots of options but especially great because all the food is amazing! My personal favorite is the New York steak spinach and Benedict bagel. I opt for the everything bagel. The hollandaise sauce with the balsamic flavor on top of perfectly poached eggs and fresh spinach and a steak is nothing to complain about. Their hash browns are delicious too. Shaved yet thick... And have a buttery crispness to them. Love!  They also make these little cinnamon breads in clay pots "pot o bread" that is wonderful. Now... This used to be more wonderful when they made homemade jam with chunks of strawberries... But it's still delicious with butter or the packaged jam. OR I have been known to get a small side of the cheesecake icing or something they have so it is cinnamon bun like :) (recommended a while back by a waitress there)  The next best thing here is their coffee. IF you're a coffee fan they have an option of French press or regular brew. I always go for the regular brew which is ILLY coffee. This is one of my fave roasts :) so I usually take a cup to go since it's hard to find in the city.   You can tell the staff enjoy working there. I always see the same servers. Great atmosphere and great food means happy customers and happy staff :)  The next best thing would be... That mostly anything that can be split in half you can order a half order. The price is somewhat changed (half or so) and is nice because the portions can be way too big! Or in case you're split between two dishes... It isn't written on the menu BUT they are so accommodating. You'll see!!  Try it! You won't be disappointed. And IF by chance you are --- let them know and in a jiffy they will correct it... That you'll forget anything wasn't perfect and still leave there smiling!!   My only downside would be the price.  Somehow I would like to see somewhat smaller portions and a slightly lower price. That is what makes me not go there as often. I feel breakfast should be max 10 per person. Not 15... But that would be my only complaint..  YUM! Salivating writing this... Can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon crunch French toast... Made as a platter (eggs and choice of meat added)
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New York steak spinach Benedict bagel --- my personal fave!

BNCVUCvcz6MSpdNGb8Aplw.text: Favorite breakfast stop. The wait can be annoying but it's popular so what can ya do. I order the Salmon Benedict it's my fave. Oh and I gotta have my orange juice maybe a coffee. The waiters wear pajamas there and I don't know why I don't either??

HwqmB9X8SYAoNzE_hsomSQ.text: 1st timer, busy breakfast place in southern highlands- everything was delicious. Full coffee and juice bar. Chilequiles and chicken and waffles were delicious.

8QRYO9be7gtydgknb8YQfg.text: This is a favorite breakfast place of mine. Service is is quick and friendly, despite always being busy. Coffee is great, fresh squeezed OJ is wonderful.  Get the pot of bread,  you won't be disappointed. I have tried the location on Flamingo a couple of times,  but it was slow and service sub-par and food was not great. This location is the location to go to if you want to enjoy some great food and fun atmosphere.

JJNbjMMVghDklU3r6kRawg.text: I always love trying new places for breakfast in Vegas before the ride back to Cali and I definitely made the right choice in stopping by here. I ordered the Rise & Shine Chilaquiles and by the pics on Yelp, it seriously did not look like it'd be such a large serving. Lol when we got there menu was quite a bit more $$$ , I asked server and she said , website hasn't been updated for 2 years , again are you kidding me ! Over priced and who doesn't serve toast with chicken fried steak and eggs ? We need more places in southern highlands to eat , this place is ok in a pinch !

ECQEbkQB3LkUzk7paaPBag.text: This place is pretty delicious... but expensive... I ordered many times from this place but I think I have to give this place a break for a long time because the last 3 orders I got to go and when I got home there is almost no food in the box. I paid 18$ for rib eye chilequiles and there was like 8 chips and like 3 bites of eggs. The rib eye was a great size but it should be the opposite in my opinion especially for 18$

W2aUPKoUpL3j7mlAeE1xiA.text: This place is pretty good. Fresh juice is very pricey, but still worth it. Eggs bacon pancakes and my favorite steak is great. Family dining so good

8nt0FkdKfV0Yq4BWWyXduA.text: Service is terrible and pretty expensive. The food isn't even that good. A smoothie is more expensive than something from the kids menu.

TNftUXmLblMh6DQZOPJcbA.text: When you put a cold dinner roll in the microwave do you know what happens? It becomes warm and hard as a rock. It's very obvious that the few orders of cup of bread we received were reheated in the microwave. They were super dry and after about a minute or two they were hard as rocks and completely inedible. Wouldn't be such a big deal but at $3 a pop I expect something edible. Very disappointing. Everything else was fine. It's just aggravating when restaurants make poor choices in hopes to save a few cents, cuz in the end they're losing a lot more by inspiring us to find a different breakfast spot.

c2opbaDc7GvsFio0vl4wOA.text: This was our first time here. The food and service and great. I had the streak with omelet was cooked to perfection. Coffee was great as well. We are from out of town but we will be back

R-uoXeh_1vDMC5CxlWIVGw.text: Their orange juice is freshly squeezed, thats one of the things I really liked about them. The restaurant has a cute theme, the pink flowers in the ceiling were rotating. The staff are all wearing jammies lol   The restaurant is clean except for a few tables that weren't cleaned, probably because they didnt have enough people for that big place.  I'm not one to complain- but the service sucked. Also, they had 3 wifi connections and they cant even share it. Lol food is ok, nothing really special about it. We had corned beef hash and biscuits and gravy. Maybe next time I'll try their steak and eggs.

ne9MCD9_8fg4j0Kbn4HHGQ.text: This was such a pleasant surprise. It was a Sunday and our group included seniors down to an 18 month old. We were greeted with smiles, seated immediately with coffee.  The breakfast menu was extensive. We placed different orders, we were all please with how delicious everything was. They handled the needs children well. My husband's waffles were the best he'd  ever eaten and he's tried a lot of them. My red velvet pancakes were excellent and a large portion.  We will return again when we visit vegas, this hidden gem located in a quiet neighborhood off the strip.

BbZ8WBI6mqHFcJ7-iD_Hyg.text: * The restaurant had a very friendly vibe and VERY aesthetically pleasing. It had flower umbrellas hanging from the ceiling. It's so cute. And the workers are dressed in their cute little pajamas.   * This is my first time at Rise & Shine, so I've only tried the Steak and eggs. Although, for the only thing I've tried, it's given me a great first impression. I accidentally said the wrong cooking temperature for the steak, so that's my fault. But the flavor was still great and savory. The hash browns were probably my favorite. It had so much flavor and little crunchy bits that I love so much.   * The price, I believe, was around $15. A little high on the price, but for steak, I guess it's acceptable.   * Would I go again? Yeah sure. I think I would want to try their other options next time, but it's a great breakfast place to go to.   * Rate: 8/10 * $$

Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Came with toast and my friend&#39;s came with a biscuit.

gCybtbRhsxwVz_PGmOTQvw.text: After a rather lackluster first visit to the other Rise & Shine location on Flamingo, it's with disappointment that I note that the original location also failed to rise to the occasion of a great breakfast.  All puns aside, I do really want to like this place. Service is spot on and incredibly friendly, but the food leaves much to be desired for me I'm afraid. I found the fried chicken flavorless and dry, the waffle was a soggy mess and the chilaquiles were as well. The only thing from my meal that I halfway enjoyed were the red velvet chocolate chip pancakes. They were good when paired with the flavorless and over-battered chicken to help make it more palatable.   Aside from the pancakes, the service was the only other saving grace about this place. I don't see myself making any extra effort to come back when there are much breakfast spots near me that have cheaper prices and better food.

IuFUO9D0Mz8LTa96nM3d0w.text: The negative aspects:  The food is bad. I ordered their ultimate steak and eggs. This place is named for their steak and eggs, so I was expecting to have a stellar breakfast before my drive back to LA. What I got were disgusting eggs, a very low quality cut of meat, and hash browns that looked and tasted like badly cooked shredded potatoes with a bunch of oil splattered on them. I brought it to the attention of the waitress, who in turn brought it up to the manager. The manager spoke with me, insisting that they only buy the best type of meat. I knew better, as I've had steak and eggs in many different places throughout LA and SD. The only thing that tasted right was the toast, but it's pretty hard to screw that one up.  The positive aspects:  The customer service was on point. I was seated immediately, and the staff was very nice. And by nice, I mean they greeted me very warmly, and even expressed sympathy that I was not happy with the meal. I've seriously never been greeted this warmly by any restaurant staff member, so props to them.  Seeing as this was a one time occurrence, I will consider coming back here and trying out other dishes. Stay tuned for updates.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GpUeRtw7Fm-YfBkvGxsjZA.text: Popular neighbor Resturant that is tucked into the corner of this everyday strip mall. The Steak n Eggs were far from everyday standards. The decor & the staff are all a little quirky, but in a good way. The steak & eggs were cooked perfectly. The steak had a correctly cooked  juicy medium inside, but the outside had a awesome texture, very similar to a nice high heat steak char. I believe they use a coffee ground rub on the steak. The eggs were scrambled & fluffy & the hash browns were plentiful & cooked properly. Bread in a cup choice was a nice added sweet enhancement to the breakfast. I would definitely visit again & try other delicious look items that were coming out of the kitchen.

EBD1duJxDDkVAyqXLKhmFg.text: The 1 star  for our waitress and our waitress ONLY. She was still training . So we had some compassion for her.  We have come here twice before but the service and food has always been mediocre. Its been about 8 months since our last visit so we decided to give it a go because of location convenience Came in this morning, ordered a kids breakfast and two adult breakfasts. My side dish of eggs and bacon, they eggs were WAY smaller than the kids eggs. Found that odd. They also forgot to put the cheese on them. Mentioned it to our server and she offered to have it fixed and I declined since we were on a time schedule because my husband was having breakfast with us on his work lunch break. I go to pick up a piece of my bacon and there is hair on it.... I also noticed the cook having a long beard and instead of them making him shave it due to health violations and cleanliness and professionalism, they made him wear a net over it ..... really?  Our waitress was very apologetic. They removed the $4.50 side plate. Hair in someone's food is disgusting and should absolutely never ever happen. The fact that the manager sent her back with a $5 coupon and our discount check, and he didn't even have not only the balls or the respect to come over and apologize to us shows their lack of care and customer service. But really, what would he say? There's no excuse for hair in someone's food because the bottom line is that is a result of the not so cleanliness of their kitchen. And as a server myself it's just unacceptable the lack of customer service as well. 1 stars for our server being sweet and professional, I feel bad that her manager had no balls and made her continuously apologize to us. We gave our coupon to the table over. I will also be notifying the health district . As well as never returning  Edit : the beard guard might be up to code with the health policy, but hair in my food is not .

vs12_DOblyfyB6KYSWjpKA.text: This breakfast place is so cute! The inside has a broken mosaic tile look and flower umbrellas flipped upside down as lights. Such a cozy and warm feeling for breakfast. And the servers wear PJs! :)  No, I didn't get steak & eggs. But I did get a breakfast platter with pot of bread. Pot of bread is like a dinner roll and a cinnamon roll mixed in one. It basically tasted like bread with some cinnamon... It wasn't AS exciting as I thought it was going to be, but the presentation still gets a 5 star rating from me. The hashbrowns were thick cut and so tasty! The bacon was done perfect and they use real eggs!   I was very impressed with this cute breakfast spot and will definitely be back!

UwDItCgU71R_xu6ememU5w.text: Ordered the Steak Egg White Omelet. Waited for 15 minutes till I was seated. Took a while for the order to be placed and for it to be served. The hash browns were cooked to perfection nice and crispy the way it should be cooked. The hash browns is really tasty. The steak was cooked to perfection and well seasoned. The omelet itself was cooked well and not over cooked. In the end the wait was worth it. I'd eat here again.

qV7thTT5P6GB3M9lArhD9Q.text: Breakfast with the husband.  Surprisingly it wasn't very busy at 10am on a Saturday morning. We were seated promptly and the server came over right away and took our drink order.  We took a little longer than usual to decide what we wanted, it all sounded delicious and from previous visits, all of the menu is.  Server was patient with us; coming back to check in on us a couple times.  This would have been a great time to upsell and offer suggestions.  From the time we placed our food order we sat for 25 minutes while we watched our food sit under the heat lamp.  If ever there was a need for a strong Expo - this would have been it.  There doesn't seem to be any management or leadership around today.    Food was good, although it was on the cold side and the Chicken Fried Steak was a little more on the spicy side than I would have preferred.

VCRZMExH69hqSD-qtKla_Q.text: Good food, nice place and excellent service. Kristen was awesome!!! She always anticipated anything that we might need and brought it to us with the cutest smile.

s3jjEjmHVsTDxRNuEnFLjw.text: Amazing food but pricey and servings are way too big. We went twice while in this area. We would definitely go back but maybe share a meal.

Du-l7dRwoTT31ewkjan3qg.text: Quirky and cool breakfast spot we found while on mini vacation. Our AirBnb host recommended. I thought the upside down flower umbrellas were a cute touch and the servers in Pjs was different. We all ordered steak and eggs with cup of bread. Cup of bread had a super cute presentation & was good. But if nuts were added it would have been even better. I asked for medium well steak & all of ours came out very charred...a little too much for me, but my friends liked it. I ordered side of fruit and was unimpressed with size, miniature portion, so I got unimpressive hashbrowns. We sat outside because weather was nice. Worth a try and prices are afforable.

E8JRCSz04mBqY3J5ySBoaA.text: A solid 5 stars!   How can people be so cheerful in the morning?  Amber was our stellar server!  She and the other staff wore cute pajamas and t-shirts with clever sayings!  They all greeted us warmly and checked up on us often!  The decor was so cute and fun! We enjoyed looking up at the floral parasols and tried  to figure out which ones were spinning and if there was some sort 2 pattern...  Food was great!  I cleared my plate of Salmon and Cream Cheese Omelette - so yummy!  And the Bread in the coffee cup was so fun and tasty, too!  We'll probably return if we are in Las Vegas again. It was such a pleasant experience with free parking, convenient location, and awesome food and service!

PrFx9rOSlsYuDsA6TWRbpw.text: The piggy, piggy omlet was delicious. Loved the honey butter with the everything biscuit.

7LM51GL78BMdCFV7BlGmnA.text: Customer service wasn't that great. The floater actually came by to give us our water but ended up spilling my cup all over me. He was apologetic, but could have done more by comping 10% off our bill or even giving us an extra side of bread. The bus boy seemed to think it was funny that a customer got drenched in water. Not really a good way to start my morning. The waiter was fine- she was hustling a lot of tables so I'm sure it was hard for her to attend to each table.  The food wasn't special either. My husband and I didn't like how greasy the food came out. We asked for crispy hash browns, not for it to be drenched in oil. The corned beef hash was okay, just would have liked for them to not skimp on the portions.  Not really sure why this place got so many hyped reviews. We are NOT coming back and I don't recommend either!!!

jvymyBM8OxCh1u0m-0cvkA.text: The staff was nice and friendly and very helpful when it came down to the menu. The orange juice was so fresh and delicious as well as the watermelon strawberry juice. The chicken and waffle was amazing with a side of gravy. I will definitely be coming back for more breakfast. This place is definitely on my top 10.

plekO4B5UsBKgO0sdKjgmg.text: Slow, slow, slow service.   We waited about 10-15 minutes for a table. We were seated at a table blowing ice cold air. Who puts on ac in January? We asked to move, another 10 minutes. We sat for another 10 minutes to give our order. And then waited over half an hour for our food. My daughters order was seriously over cooked, burnt, and inedible.  My omelet was underdone, as was my nephews eggs.  And seriously overpriced. We won't be going back.

jJG_Vcz5VHXurmeH8V2HzA.text: Best breakfast ever. Service, decor all A+ Highly recommend  Steak was killer (ultimate) $$

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7YoN7ktyV-fJnJcqdi9odg.text: We ate here driving through Vegas.  It was nice finding a place off the strip that had great breakfast! They were able to accommodate dietary restrictions well.  Also the umbrella flower decor was beautiful!  Food highlights: freshly squeezed juice, philly cheese steak omelette, kids meal options.  One complaint was that they burned our hash browns a bit but otherwise great meal. Nice stop on a long drive.

hns6kB6DmLx0MLG5v4fGXQ.text: Stupendous!!!  Great referral from friends knowing my quest to find the best corn beef hash. I was a little skeptical but was nicely surprised.  It was a great experience.   Such a fun place away from the crowded strip. The restaurant was clean and playfully decorated. At first glance the menu is a little overwhelming but with excellent instruction from a pajama wearing waitress I was able to find what I wanted. This place has a little bit of everything including it's very own juice bar.   The homemade corn beef hash was fresh and very tasty. It was served with cubed hash and three well prepared over easy eggs. In lieu of my normal side of toast I opted for a cinnamon roll called "Cup 'o Bread". Very creative presentation. It was served in a cuye coffee cup and packed full of flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. CBH
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Cup &#39;o Bread&#34;

tHcv8Yvv9RsDB_bFzN3MqA.text: an excellent brunch experience! the name steak and eggs place is the tip of the iceberg! with top shelf cuts available with your eggs!  we shared two succulent  dishes. the fried and  battered buffalo chicken breast breakfast is a brilliant switch on the typical country fried chicken and gravy! a medium buffalo sauce with hashbrown eggs and toast was tasty.  our second dish was the Mexican twist on a rib eye steak breakfast! eggs placed on savoury bed of beans, cheese and chilaquiles! a rib eye! but wait there's more, salsa, sour cream and avocados!  the place was busy yet we were seated in served in less than an hour! well worth the short wait. the staff has optional uniforms pajamas or company gear. creating a fun ambient.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. cool decor set&#39;s the ambient! first time here! excited for the experience.

AdQVkpkJwuRvd4S4MzEp-g.text: Decided to give Rise and Shine a try for brunch.  It was pretty good. The family was. Very satisfied with their meal. I ordered the green chili & pork burrito. It ended up having a lot a egg It which I didn't particularly enjoy. Service was very friendly and nice. Overall, I'd come back and give them another try.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Menu
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The chicken
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rise &amp; shine

GkKeKWJvUupHLKeI8-_IFQ.text: I am confused on how this restaurant gets such good ratings. This is the 2nd time I've eaten here & I'm even less impressed than the first time I ate here.   The waitress brought cold coffee over & we thought maybe she didn't serve it right away because she was busy. We stopped another server or busboy that was walking around looking like he was lost. He apologized & got us 2 fresh cups. They were even worse. We told our waitress and her response was "but I can see them steaming..." I told her to stick her finger in it & she looked at me like I was trying to set her up for injury ..to prove my point I stuck MY finger in the cup. She then did the same ... "oh your right". She brought 2 more cups from a different pot. They were better but not by much.   We didn't see her again until our food came. I ordered a bagel with cream cheese & Bangor sausage on the side. The sausage is the only reason for the 1 star. Great flavor.  How you can screw up a bagel is beyond me. Regardless, the waitress saw that I took one bite from it & didn't ask if there was a problem.   I won't waste my time or money to come here again. Instead, I will drive another 9 miles and go to Mimi's.

wUEvwHY98YqY2ID8L8vLKA.text: Came here on my trip to Vegas and the food was good but I over heard a manger or a higher up employee speak very poorly to another employee over minor things . Super unprofessional

YzkrTF6kIxeMTC56Hl-oKA.text: Great place to have family breakfast. We first came to another breakfast joint at this local shopping center, but was immediately driven out by the strong smell (some kind of fried food). This place is spacious, has good vibe, very good food and decent service. Will come back again.

khKg3TaoZqosG25QH4g3wQ.text: This place is awesome. The servers and staff are super friendly and accommodating. The food is delicious. The cinnamon bread in a cup is to die for, I really can't describe how good it is. It melts in your mouth , I could have that for breakfast everyday if I could. Plus the servers dress in their pjs which I think is so cool  Anyways definitely going back to Vegas just for rise and shine.

L90snnJ6m2wYBhjBDfFZwQ.text: I have not dined here for a couple of years..& remembered how good the food & service was.. Recently moved to this end of town was excited to try this place again.. It was a Monday 2 weeks ago..it was not real busy.. No one at the door to greet us.. The server was nice.. It took forever to get our food.. I was watching the cooks placing food in the window & no one was picking up any of the food...it was just sitting there.. finally when we served our food it was all cold.. I did not want to complain.. I was not willing to wait another 30 minutes for my breakfast.. The server never came back except to drop off the check or offer any refills on coffee.. What happened to this place .. what happens when it is really busy.. Very disappointed..& very pricey for a terrible breakfast

UXW5v46oy9dFvdowqxQFdQ.text: Found this gem today.  We were hungry but also in a hurry as we had somewhere to be in 30 minutes.  Our waiter was outstanding and the food was perfect.  There was 4 of us so we all got different things.  My daughter got steak and eggs derrin the kids menu (it was fantastic). We had a variety oh lunch items and breakfast. The build your own burger was off the charts.  So glad we stopped into here.  Plus we were out in under 30 minutes.  Thank you.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s always busy in here.  That&#39;s a sign that this place is AMAZING. A great breakfast spot for sure.

pkIGp5GcjuPb5nV6nX9T_Q.text: Every Vegas trip, this is a must-have place to go for breakfast grub! It's less crowded than the one on Flamingo, and you get a table much faster. I don't think we've ever waited more than 5 minutes, if at all. Food is just as good as the other location. My go-to is always steak and eggs. It's usually always delicious, except this last time the meat was quite fatty, and the last few times there's a lot of char from the grill left all over the steaks. Really gives it a burnt look and feels a bit gritty... not my favorite things in life, but tolerable. Fresh squeezed OJ is great. I didn't realize what "bread in a cup" was until my son ordered it... it's a cinnamon roll, but in a cup... and delicious! Portions are great, I always end up with leftovers. Staff is great and ambiance is adorable.

ukQTVRm-b5uqpZfEMdcofw.text: This place is great. Very cute decor, love the moving umbrellas spinning from the ceiling and love that the waiters wear pajamas. I had the ultimate with the ribeye and wow. For the price you pay, what a deal! You get a big juicy steak, eggs, the best hash browns Iv ever had and choice of toast, pot of bread or biscuit all for $16.99. I chose the pot of bread which was adorable and tasty. All around great place that I cannot wait to visit again.

Ou9ONRoeADZ89gE1V4iE-w.text: I am so glad that this place is in my neighborhood because there aren't too many good places to eat breakfast lunch or dinner but this one serves a pretty good breakfast and lunch! You have to try one of their fruit parfaits because they are the best! If you're into waffles and pancakes and things like that for breakfast those are pretty excellent as well and then there's eggs more ways than you can think of. The decor is so cute with the parasols hanging from the ceiling and I love the theme where all the servers wear pajamas! The only downfall, and not for them, is that it can get very crowded and the service can take quite a while as in quite a while! So if you plan to visit here I suggest that you make time. Overall though, it's an excellent restaurant with an expansive menu. It's only a four star restaurant in my opinion because of the slow service on any given day.

trXYs5UrA0J6kPcd-BSMuQ.text: Literally every time I come here they don't cook the food all the way this place is flat out disgusting they can't even manage to make French toast and when I complained about the food I still had to pay for it and they didn't offer to remake the food the girls here are LAZY

JSwFIIPdEaeZXDYbvAaIvg.text: First time trying this place out since moving to vegas, and did not disappoint.  Came in for breakfast and ordered the pork chiliqules (not sure spelt that right, after the recommendation of our server (Frankie).  When I tell you this dish was fire! Def come in and give it a shot and ask for Frankie you won't be disappointed

I'll NEVER go here again ID RATHER HUG A CACTUS  And speaking of Hugs that's what all these employees need is a HUG; they rude as FUCK   White White White --- no flavor.  mayonnaise - vanilla bean!!
