Ikd6lgeATWLUqyj0fVV1Qw.text: The fancy steakhouse omelette was really good. Great presentation, tender steak seasoned just right with a side of beamaise sauce. I asked for the hash browns crispy and the steak medium rare and that's exactly what I got. Great coffee(Lavazza) too. Not too expensive, considering the quality and freshness of the food. Iy4lzDJuwEmiqfYB0e2TRg.text: Definitely a fan! Wasn't busy at all on a hot Friday morning in June. We were seated right away. The decor is very cute, with the colorful flower umbrellas, and it must be nice to work in your PJs! Our waiter suggested the green smoothie, which was indeed just a teeny bit sweet from the honeydew melon. The cup of bread was amazing! Like a cinnamon roll with the cream cheese frosting on the side for dipping. We ended up ordering two of them! I got the avocado eggs Benedict with hash browns. The balsamic vinegar drizzled on top was a little different, but it worked! We would definitely return next time we're in Vegas!

j5iA1nhVp7TEiFo_PpRe3Q.text: Awesome service, awesome food, awesome environment. Definitely reccomend this place. Pancakes are huge and super good. Ribeye and eyes was perfect.

t8zs2tnccRSlukMS67Tcdw.text: Awesome steak and eggs. I had the ultimate ribeye steak. .. eggs and the cup o bread. It was delicious!!! The rib eye was very flavorful and charred to perfection.. I got medium rare. Eggs was good.. over easy .. poke the yolk and got all the goodness on the steak. Now the cup o bread was something else.. very soft and have a perfect sweetness to it. If you like cinnamon roll.. you will love it:) highly recommended this place.. just roll out of bed with your pj and go. All the staff  wears pj also:) you will not be the odd ball.

imnE9_4-uTo-M6PYY-N4Jw.text: What a gem! My wife and I love this place so much we visited this place two mornings in a row. We love the ambiance with the country music and employees wearing pajamas so you feel right at home when you are waking up on a lazy Saturday morning.   My wife ordered the chiliqueles two day in a row and I ordered the corn beef hash and the loco moco. If I could I would eat the loco moco right now it was that good! This will be our new local spot as we are building right around the corner.

8StHC5aYUqYG-Ql3qgTZ7w.text: Been coming here for a long time when we're in town. Nothing to say but good things. Service is good and food is good - most importantly, for a breakfast place - their coffee is great!

M62OOBq9OKRXstzJTlKBEw.text: Rise & Shine is very cute! The wait staff looks like they just rolled out of bed (they serve in pajama attire) and it adds to the overall charm and theme of this place. Interior decor is very cute as well.  Service was exceptional from the hostess to our server - no complaints here!   Why 3 stars?   Corn beef hash was a very small serving size and I've had better. The breakfast burrito was huge but tasted okay. One thing to note is that the retried beans were EXTRA salty. Maybe it was just a bad batch but it was horribly salty and the part of it that touched the burrito made my burrito super salty. I'm usually a fan of breakfast burritos so I was disappointed here.   We got banana pancakes as well - this was delicious! The pancakes were the highlight of the meal, but otherwise the food was okay.   Prices were a little on the high side in my opinion, especially for mediocre food (with the exception of banana pancakes).  My overall experience was good, but the food - I'm not sure if I'd come back because I didn't have anything that stood out.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

f76RMPPycMWF0IiKB2pihg.text: Great food, can't  express enough the service  Everything was great hard to find these days Kim and Gelato were so nice and helpful things you don't find in service ..,,, The steak is to die for in both meals 2 days straight had the wonderful steak in it !!! I will be here more than I should.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0U_nNwP2jawSgRY4gAlhtA.text: It is truly an early bird who catches a worm as the saying goes. My guess is that they've consumed some of the amazing eats from this gem of a restaurant while on the prowl.  On a recent visit with my Dad we ended up here back to back days during the trip and our only complaint was that the food was so scrumptious here that it pained us to leave the remains of the unconsumed on the plate. You certainly can share without embarrassment here as the portions (on most items) are enough to feed an army!  Before I get into the main attraction I do want to point out from top to bottom the staff here. Once again they are beyond inviting and the genuine care they portray to each table of patrons is a staple that they are well worth the 5 star rating from not just myself, but the other masses as well who choose to dine within those walls. I really feel so at home there and that is a special gift!  For day #1 I had my heart set on trying something different so I went for the red velvet chocolate chip pancakes. Those are a MUST if you have a craving for a "short" stack, but there is nothing short about that stack by any means. I was served 4 huge battered circular halos and with literal chunks of chocolate chips how can you go wrong? They were quite fluffy overall and the after taste of chocolate in each bite partnered with the cream cheese syrup it comes partnered with left me feeling like I was sharing a sunrise with Willy Wonka in the chocolate factory!  For day #2 I scaled it back a bit and devoured the pot of bread and the three egg breakfast with bacon on the side. It was simplistic in nature with just eggs, hash browns, and bacon however even in a simple form the food is still on point. The bacon (being the high point) was crispy and had a slight smoky tint to it that elevated it to a whole other level. I actually had a full on body shake because it was so amazing!  With top notch consistent hospitality, this is by far my #1 breakfast destination when I am in the area and it's been fun to watch the growing cult following they are getting as time goes on. To keep it simple, people know what's up!

Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Three egg breakfast with bacon

fBE-ASUaJzZmHoEHN6PjvQ.text: On our way to Utah we found this place on yelp.   Def a go to spot when in the area.  I had the bananas foster with ice cream and waffle.  Omg!!!  It was so good!!  When in town def going back!

oxRD8aqdhRhnisojo9D1bg.text: Yum! This little place was awesome! We're we're around the corner looking at granite when hunger struck. So I get on Yelp to find this little gem. We were seated right away. Hubby ordered the homemade corn beef hash and I had the turkey, ham and bacon Dijon panini. We were both really happy with our choices. Our waitress was great too. I think that her name was Amber. They all wear pajamas. Cute!

i8m-ucTCYDYOV7ork0w4iw.text: My mom and I decided to eat here on our last day in Vegas and it was worth the little wait, and then some. The ribeye was delicious, the fresh squeezed juice was perfect and their cafe mocha might very well be the best mocha I've ever had, anywhere. I'll definitely put this place on the list next time I visit!

3qSzfVFPaih0ucsF4UqCnA.text: I absolutely love everything about this place!! Worth every penny!! Amber was such an awesome server!! Please come in and see her when this place opens!! Get the French press!! Do yourself a favor if you're in Las Vegas Start your day here!!!

k02EQnqsvRDxVeuL_3Up1A.text: Food is good, ambience is good, service is good, the only real complaint is the cost of breakfast. Breakfast for my wife, 2 year old daughter, and I came out above 50 dollars with a nominal tip. I had the biscuits and gravy which was ok. The hash browns in this place really shines though. They have all the right seasonings and just the right texture which is hard to find in a place.

IWa-LWSxWoZZqY59gqSBbA.text: Conveniently located for us. We love the ambience. My kids enjoy it here too. They think it's kind of cool how the waiters are in PJ's. Their fresh squeezed orange juice is a must here! As well as the bread in a pot. All the entrees we all order, we all enjoy and continue to re-order whenever we come back.   Sunday's have loooong waits. Don't go hungry.

63oDbD98Xcl9s5S5AaeMag.text: What a great spot! I had the three little pigs on an everything bagel. It was huge! Ha browns were crispy. Vannesa our waitress was so friendly and extra sweet! My wife ordered french toast (crispy cinnamon) yummy :p All the food on everyone else's table looked great too. If I lived in Vegas we would come back here more!!! Until next time ;)

IW_caJNjyMJbOsnRWXbQGQ.text: Ate here for the first time today. Friendly staff. Servers all wear pajamas, which I thought was an amazing touch. Was told I had to try the "Cup of bread" and our server was nice enough to surprise us with a complimentary dose of the sweet cinnamon favorite. It was pretty darn good. I love bagel sandwiches and my husband can never turn down chilliquiles, so when our waitress recommended the two, we instantly knew what to order.  He had the Steak and Chilliquiles and his steak was cooked as asked. I had the AvoVeggie Bagel Sandwich with fries. The shoe string fries were well seasoned and delicious! My only complaint was that the big selling point for me was fresh mashed avocado on my bagel... and instead it was not fresh, but more like whipped and browning... the flavor was a bit old and masked the flavor of the entire sandwich. I did try a bite of my husband's Chilliquiles and that ranchero flavor was grand! We shared a French Press Coffee that averaged a little over 3 cups of coffee. The decor of the restaurant was very bright and fun. I think we will try this place again, but will stay away from the avocado.

Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9WndJxOE9IA-XmmDFKUdFQ.text: Great place to have brunch with family and friends. They have a great staff and the food is always delicious. My son loves to look at the hanging flower umbrellas while he eats.

Df83X90E17773lh47wYBfw.text: This was a very surprising l good breakfast spot.  The Crunchy Cinmamon French Toast and the Crispy fried Chicken breast were succulent.  The place is full of good energy.  My wife is still licking her lips.  Will definitely visit again!

gTPQxqgepa4TckNwTowa6Q.text: Rise and shine chilaquiles are the shit, better than my abuelitas. Amber is the best server here, tip her the big bucks!

y5AVmFkwo4HwohM_tVzNWA.text: Tempted by positive reviews we stopped in for breakfast on an early Sunday morning. The Hostess seated us and then we didn't really see anybody for about 15 minutes. The manager came by to ask how we were doing noted that we had not gotten our drinks or been attended to and she immediately sent someone over and profusely apologized. Not that big of a deal but kind of a bummer. We all ordered steak and eggs and the bread pudding deal in the cup. Not a terrible steak. Certainly not Steakhouse quality or even quality of like the Outback but better than what you get on the Midnight Special in a cafe in the casino. The potatoes were killer!! Not a bad meal for the price but not great I mean all in the place is alright. We might go back again but it's definitely not a place I'm going to tell anybody they must stop at.

cl_nuZAP6xuLHvxUvVdqOQ.text: I am on a Vegas foodie adventure, and this spot hit a line drive right over the fence for a breakfast home run.  Professional juice bar, open kitchen, LavAzza French press coffee, waitresses wearing pajamas, just a fun place.  First up were the amazing homemade popovers with a maple infused cream delicious dipping sauce.  Main course was the well seasoned and properly charcoal grilled rib eye steak with 2 eggs over and nice crunchy hash browns.  Clearly a 4 star plus breakfast winner, will return for fried chicken and waffles tomorrow.

2b10OcnNGIqqFDoJDMWB1A.text: I love this local gem for brunch!!  I've never seen a restaurant pump out truly authentic southern classics like sausage gravy and biscuits while also delivering as close to a homemade chilaquiles as I've ever eaten!!  Everything on the menu is fantastic and the service (delivered in quirky striped pajamas) is friendly and efficient.  Gelato has taken care of me almost every time I have been here.  She knows the menu, makes awesome recommendations, and it quickly becoming one of my favorite parts of coming here. If you're looking for the best brunch in Southern Highlands, you'll find it at Rise & Shine!!

fgcaseZoN7IT9cTmA409Cg.text: I see why this place comes up as one of the best BREAKFAST in Las Vegas. I will definitely return here next time in Vegas!!  On a scale of 1 to 10 I give it an 11!!!

0rOddWm865MvWAj9v742-Q.text: Huuuge selection! I've been here a few times and I've always had a great experience. Ashley took great care of us, she was super sweet and down to earth. I love that they all wear PJs! How cute is that?  I got the salmon and bacon bagel ~~yummy  and my bf got an omelette and hashbrown~~yummy.. you really can't go wrong with anything on their menu here.

DnVy_RbrqkKsLbI1B2YdfQ.text: Great food!  Great Service by Desiree!  Our new favorite place!  Pancakes were delicious.  Ribeye Chilaquiles were awesome. Chorizo burrito was amazing. Good vibes, music, & decor.   Seriously our new favorite place . Can't wait to come back & try the chicken & waffles.

IpOI9xTS7M1Qm5EGE8Kh7w.text: food was good, honest about menu choices, after they placed down our food ,service was inattentive.

UE_gWtKM83XTnp7dwQpLBw.text: Update:  I have been back to Rise and Shine for breakfast many times since my earlier review. I say, without hesitation, that the people, service and food has been outstanding.

DUnl0rCJLmzCiisKBFadCA.text: Food was great had the steak, eggs, hash brown, and cup of bread (cinnamon roll in a cup), with a glass of the green juice. I enjoyed my food, however my server was slow and kept forgetting stuff like how I wanted my steak and my cinnamon roll which is included in the meal. The place was not even packed.. My friend ordered the chicken and waffles which he felt wasn't that great.

QUPx3TdtqDkxCgbLJ5AKSg.text: Every time my parents are in town we have to come here multiple times. My dad says he doesn't know why we would risk anywhere else when we still haven't had everything on the menu at rise and shine...   I'm not really a huge fan of breakfast restaurants in general and even I like this place. The chicken and waffles, bagel sandwiches, and anything with steak are always reliable. Also, try the pot of bread, it's yummy and adorable!

tvnpMtIPNy_RG0N7GOc2oQ.text: Rise & Shine is a perfect breakfast spot if you want to try something outside of the high priced tourist areas of Vegas. Located in the corner of an unassuming strip mall is this high quality breakfast spot.   While the steak and eggs is the go-to (and they sure looked delicious), we went with a normal pancakes, eggs and bacon breakfast combo. It was so large that we ended up sharing it for the two. Awesome bacon and fantastic pancakes.  For the amount of food and the price, you really can't beat it.   Nice and quick service as well.

bi541IfaGB5RDUkUXRfJQA.text: We ordered breakfast for pickup on a Saturday morning. We used the menu available online, called in our order, and were told to pick it up in 20 minutes. When we arrived, the hostess told us a total of over $40! We ordered a bagel sandwich, French toast, and 2 orange juices!!! We were shocked at the price because the menu we ordered from had completely different prices. It stated $2.85 for an orange juice, and we were told they raised the prices and it was now $5 for a small orange juice, the size of a kids cup!! They did NOT update their menu or prices online, did not give us a total over the phone, and really expected us to pay $10 for a few sips of orange juice? The food was decent, but the hashbrowns were mushy and flavorless, instead of crispy and salty. The bagel sandwich was okay, but nothing worth $15!! We will never be back here again. The prices are insane and the food is not worth it.

Kxm6ucA4uOQ4XLDm3L7vTA.text: Came here to have breakfast and relax, definitely miss living right down the road from this place but I don't live too far. Hoped there was wifi but there wasn't, but it didn't kill me. Anyways, ordered a cup of coffee, normally I love coffee in the morning but this cup was kind of old, the coffee tasted like it was sitting for awhile but I downed it anyway due to there only being one server. It wasn't too busy, but it was enough to keep one person running around. I ordered the country fried steak and it was good definitely had a zip to it, the eggs weren't over easy but fried...the hashbrowns weren't bad, and of course I'm digging the pot of bread! I hate complaining because I've worked in the food and beverage industry for a long time, so I eat what I eat unless it was raw or cold then I wouldn't. But this was mediocre. It definitely has changed since the first time I was here, so it's kind of disappointing.  They should have put at least one more person on the floor so that someone can always make sure that coffee cups were filled and water cups were filled.   4 stars were given because besides the food and the service its a beautiful restaurant and it has potential and I hope it's worked on and not forgotten when the new restaurant is built.

AchXKS0GD1agF4T8io7AjQ.text: Visiting Las Vegas this weekend on our way out of town we stumbled across this gem. The Waitress was lovely and the food delicious with quick service. The only thing that would make the place my go to spot when in town would be some gluten free options! Hope to see that in the future!

TAybKQ6DwyGAPu1qaeNXPg.text: Tasty breakfast, fast service, friendly staff, reasonable price! I'll definitely bring my family in for breakfast  or brunch  when they come to visit me

q0_CLP5qNHJYWgd4jh_CWg.text: I've been here before when the place was smaller and it was amazing! The service was good and the food was fast and hot.  Today I went and it being a holiday, I expected a wait even with the bigger place,  which was fine.  Once we were seated,  it took our server more than 15 minutes to take our order.  We waited an additional 30 minutes after ordering for us to receive half our food,  calling it was warm would be a stretch.  We watched our server serve multiple other tables in other sections before serving us.  We finally got our toast and it was so cold the butter wouldn't even melt.  This place is a great place if you want to waste an hour and a half of your life waiting for deplorable servers to serve you cold food. Have fun!

hCBynvDYKI7z-vYKqEjjJw.text: We have been to rise n shine four times.  At first, we were excited to have a neighborhood place near our house.  Our first experience was good - food was delish and the server was attentive.    The second time, we waited in line for 20 mins, then waited another 20 mins for someone to help us, then waited another 20 mins for coffee before we walked out.    Third time, we managed to get sat, again the server was inattentive (waited a long time to get drinks) and got our very slowly made order wrong (my husband always orders eggs over hard, with emphasis and they came back runny).    Today, we decided to give it another shot, and were seated next to a woman who was talking on her speakerphone.  It made an already loud cafe unbearable.  Management should have asked the woman to step outside for her call.  We walked out and the hostess was unapologetic and a little snippy.  We will not be going back for another try.

aLjVOjTJvgk82k6C06kb1Q.text: AMAZING! they have great food & customer service, I had red velvet pancakes with eggs and sausage on the side, it was my first time trying red velvet pancakes, I was a bit skeptical but they were amazing very warm and they were just soooo fluffy and delicious! A little pricy but honestly well worth it. I would eat there again and again and again

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Velvet Pancakes with eggs/sausage on the side AMAZING !!

Z2YSHVRvcRnJG4Yn3G0ofg.text: I've been coming here since they opened and I must say today SUCKED!!! The only positive thing is that the food came out fast. The servers look and talk unprofessional and extremely unkept. I didn't get offered anything as my side besides hash browns no fruit or anything. Didn't get checked on the entire time I was eating. I'm just mad cause they jacked up their prices so much I expect better service not worse service.

7YA79BWVYhnoJ750ZYUVmg.text: Great breakfast spot. Wonderful options for the kids and adults.  Love their omelettes and Nutella coffee drinks.

cGKj6gB5wrLNig9E609oCA.text: Okay so I'm reviewing 1 star because of the awful service I always receive. It never fails. I've been here over 10 times and I can't ever seem to get good service. I am a server myself so I know the drill. The hostess gave better service and I have tipped her before tipping the server. I live down the street so it is convenient and the food is so amazing! The pot of bread is to die for! But it takes the server about 5-10 minutes to even greet me. Then I don't see them again till I get my check. This place has so much potential but it is sad that I am starting to do take out because the service sucks ;(

35568mVhXdm80Rt36BFPfw.text: This is our go to breakfast spot! We absolutely love Rise and Shine! The eggs benedict is ourstanding!

dipu_KYUGtqmLAPkpXrcuw.text: It's too bad I can't leave negative stars. 3 of us saw the great yelp reviews and decided to come. It's not an understatement to say EVERYTHING went wrong: it took a while just to get ice water (no lemon as requested), when the coffee finally came there was grandma pink lipstick predominantly displayed which was replaced with no apology, I ordered the daily special to which the server had no clue what I was talking about and went to check the board himself while telling us the board was new and no one tells him about anything there, I ordered the lox bagel--a few mins later the server came back to ask what bagel I would like--about 10 min after that the server comes back to tell me that the special isn't available until tomorrow. He says the other 2 meals will up out shortly and will bring a menu back to me so I can order something else. We decided to just leave without the food... This doesn't include the server calling me "sir", telling us about how cranky he is in the morning and sharing about how he wrote 'iced' for our waters and couldn't remember if it was tea or water. Fail!

S_c4Je4bex01Ir7eCUwnZA.text: Awesome place!! Great food and great staff!! The place was very busy but staff still maintained a great attitude!! Will go again and again!! Coffee was great too!!

IXDIsVTt7vHq1ZNo2fV7tQ.text: So I used to absolutely love this place but the last two times we have went, to include this past Saturday morning, the wait for the food was over a half hour. I mentioned it to the young lady who I paid the check with but she didn't really have a good reason as to why we had to wait so long. The waitress didn't even say sorry for the wait. The service is going down hill.

wvvWJJnxwireTwVlE1ArRQ.text: Great food. Definitely a good "local" spot that's away from the strip. Most importantly, great friendly service. Definitely worth checking out.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome food
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brunch!

TVGCZAlQu1YIPDmG2FxZAw.text: I dined here for the first time last Sunday.  It was absolutely delicious.  They have a huge assortment of food and a fun ambiance.  They are very busy in the weekends but seem to get people through fairly quickly.  I enjoyed the green juice to start and then ordered the classic steak and 2 egg breakfast.  The steak was cooked perfectly.  My friend ordered the biscuits and gravy and he loved it too.  Go give it a try!

-3P8brQEeej92752Vf6C-Q.text: Went here for breakfast and everything about this place was unique and charming! Staff dresses in pajamas and are super friendly and enthusiastic!   The ambience and decor is so cute and colorful.   The food was wonderful - their signature pot of bread and ultimate steak and eggs were delicious! I also loved the hazelnut Nutella coffee - I personally liked the latte better than the cappuccino but that's because it was sweeter. The cappuccino was stronger and more coffee flavored.   Definitely a gem in vegas and will be going back!

8r8BikGr2RPTJmbAvL3DpQ.text: Best breakfast diner in town HANDS DOWN.  Your best breakfast options are not located in the heart of Las Vegas (the strip, spring valley, etc). Rise & Shine is located on the far Southside off the 15 freeway of Silverado Ranch Blvd.  At this joint, they offer some serious quality breakfast in exceptional presentation. I have already visited this place twice in less than a week. All for good reason.  On my first visit, I tried the Ultimate steak & eggs breakfast which consisted of a massive and juicy 8oz rib eye steak. Along with my meat was hash browns and 3 egg whites. It's about $14+ but you get what you pay for. This is one massive meal and a quality that you can't find at South Point or wherever the hell you go for your midnight steak & eggs.  On my second visit, I tried the Ham & Eggs Benedict on a English bagel. Though I'm not much of a Ham & Eggs Benedict type of person, it was tasty as well! Served with your standard hash browns.  Already came here twice and looking forward to a 3rd time to see how the corned beef hash is. Apparently, it's made fresh from scratch so can't wait to give that a try.  Service was great as well! Servers were all attentive and courteous. They even wear pajamas to resemble an early-day atmosphere.

DrXlEKxZ4u_7WwoqtYtEbg.text: Just sat down and ordered. I always start a review with 5 stars and work down from there.   This place has an awesome menu - I had a hard time deciding, so I went for eggs eggs Benedict because it's my fave. Doug and the baby had pancakes and Doug had bacon on the side. He also ordered watermelon strawberry juice, which he didn't like. I took a sip and can see why - it's an all natural juice with no added sugar. Not really a kids beverage; I, on the other hand, loved it.  They brought out warm syrup!!! That wowed me. But the pancakes didn't need it. They were fluffy and light and had their own sweetness to them that made them delicious plain. The eggs Benedict had an unexpected but interesting balsamic reduction drizzled on top that made me an instant fan. I didn't get to try Doug's bacon because he devoured all 5 pieces before I got a chance but it looked great. Sightly thick and cooked perfectly.   The decor was cute, umbrellas for lights and fans and the servers wore pjs:) LOVED IT!!  If I lived in Vegas, this would be my go to breakfast place!

Imwe1bSyPUjjfQlBhMba1A.text: Excellent.  Visiting from ca and found this place on Yelp.  Excellent food, service and friendly atmosphere. Will definitely come back next time we visit Las Vegas.

UyAsv0Yyd9Wkjb6H9ijrsA.text: Very tasty--we have now made a point of stopping here twice on our way out of Las Vegas. Their bacon, eggs, and waffles are delicious.

WkIKcFID7lsF8rp0PGaAcg.text: Great place. One of my favorite breakfast places in Vegas! Extremely reasonable, great food, and great service

O_Qb_yeEKjA5Gi9OFlniDg.text: Completely off the beaten Vegas path, but well worth the visit!!! Loved it!!!! Do try the pot bread;)!!!!!

gMEQ6_RypUfTOKYXj1d0Cg.text: Great service! Super-cute place and great food! My daughter loved the red velvet pancakes! The cream cheese syrup is incredible!

FEj-W2yTvHjBy1e488V-CA.text: If your on this side of town. This place has amazing eggs Benedict. The place is clean and the service is amazing! And I hear the waffles are to die for!

AihGwAMjh4kMgdrZDK2RIw.text: This place was so good we came back a second time while on our trip to Vegas. Highly recommend the French Press coffee! Also you have to get a pot of bread, delish! The atmosphere is cute and comfy. Friendly staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and Waffel

eOCZXUWsMdnsvO-WBg1Fcw.text: This was my first time to Rise & Shine even though I live right across the street from this restaurant.  I was able to get right in and sat at the bar. I was greeted and waited on immediately.  The reason I haven't went before is that their prices are extremely high. That is my only complaint and still is. I almost got up and left but decided to try something. I saw they had an over 55 menu but was very limited. I ordered the very small steak with one egg and hash browns . They brought it on this little dish all clumped together.  The food was very good.  Price $8.60 with tax. I left hungry.  They could have put it on a bigger plate and gave more hash browns in my opinion only.   A waitress asked me my opinion about the meal and I was very honest with her.   She understood my concerns being a Senior Citizen.  Price is the only reason I cannot go back.  I understand they have to charge more for bring in Southern Highlands. They could try to offer some better  deals for Seniors and increase the portions a little bit. You should never leave a restaurant hungry.   If you can afford the prices then Bon Apetite

XeosO6p2vOv0AgwPxsBNOw.text: This place is amazing. Great atmosphere, great service, and most of all great food. You must try the French press coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DrDTQGFUhH4MhZo2bsprNw.text: OMGosh- This place is heavenly! The best omelette and hash browns that I have ever had. My omelette was cooked perfectly ( not too firm and over cooked like their Flamingo location). And the Pot of Bread was a fun way to serve a cinnamon roll. Service was attentive with a smile! If you have a hankering for some good grub then this is the place to be.

sqUYCeTT0-FeG8n6hpZgpQ.text: We just moved into the area & this has now become our regular breakfast spot. Their french press coffee & pot of bread is a must to start out your day. Their omelette is my usual go to because their ingredients are so fresh. You really can tell the difference. Texas toast French toast is excellent & their original pancakes are my step daughters favorite. They serve them with warm maple syrup with a cinnamon stick steeping in it. There is a large outdoor patio & inside seating. The prices are a little high for breakfast but the quality of the food is worth it. Oh yea you can go in your pjs bc the servers are in theirs too.

hYf11AzsV2oI1rS5Dd3rbw.text: This is absolutely the best breakfast place I've visited since moving to Las Vegas. If you enjoy a good breakfast, it's worth dropping in. If you're not in the southern Highlands area, it's worth the drive.  Ambience: this is a smaller restaurant, which gives a great feel for breakfast. The wait staff is in pajamas, which is a nice touch. If you make a trip alone, I recommend sitting at the bar and watching the cooks work. These guys are on top of their game   Food: the portions are big! You definitely get your money's worth. As far as taste, the food is flawless. The pancakes are perfectly fluffy. I had one of the bagel sandwiches and I was thoroughly impressed.  Staff: everyone from the hostess to the manager is very friendly. The waitresses are very attentive and are always around, but not in an annoying bothersome way.   Overall, a great little restaurant. I will be back many times for sure.

2kpWcJ_a7vdKrl2RbIYiTQ.text: Very expensive and will not diverge from the menu at all. My sister doesn't eat meat and just wanted an egg and cheese sandwich on a bagel, they only make one with ham, sausage and bacon and wouldn't leave out the meats for her. Bizarre...

uJNk_Gi5IOpPO7-5IjWrGQ.text: LOVE THIS PLACE!! It's officially our new favorite breakfast spot !!! All the cute girls that work there run around in pj's !! Not to mention the ribeye steak and eggs were amazing !!

KiRz9toMTh3dlFMfVhaBLg.text: My boyfriend and I went yesterday morning for breakfast on our anniversary. The food was amazing although I did have to wait on my cream cheese syrup for about ten minutes after I received my pancakes so they were a bit cold when I finally got to eat them. The only real complaint I have is that our server a guy wasn't very friendly but the lady with glasses was amazing and picked up his slack

MDAoBenRMLxRaqbdWVrVvA.text: I agree with a few of the other posts, it is off putting walking into a restaurant, and no one says hi, or comes up to you for a while. It was good to expect that before I went, because I probably would have cursed and stormed out had I not been expecting it. The first time I went, I got the chilaquiles (not sure if that is spelled right), and I won't be ordering those ever again. They were way to salty for me, but my husband liked his chicken fried steak, and eggs benedict the last couple of times we've went. We'd come back, but it's not my number one breakfast spot in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilaquiles.

Eow_sSCxWSRRFSlaiGWkdw.text: Went there this morning for the first time... What a cute restaurant all decorated up with flower umbrellas and the servers are wearing pajamas as their uniforms for the "Good Morning" feel! We had an amazing experience! Gilbert took care of us and gave us great menu recommendations. When the food came out, we were very impressed with the presentation as well as quality and taste! Overall great food, great staff, and great atmosphere! We will be back :)

cADVWXFbybxBxTF3zSCkGw.text: I order the biscuits and gravy to go.  I love 3 minutes away from this terrible establishment and by the time I got home I tried to cut into the biscuits and they were harder than a rock.  I even tried a steak knife to no avail.  I proceeded to call them back and the lady asked me if I want them remade.  I said absolutely not but u can refund my money since I couldn't eat what I just ordered.  Then I was told that they can't and won't do that.   By far the worst breakfast I ever had.  Was not even edible and the fact that I couldn't even get my money back is complete BS.  I will never patronize this place again and I'll make sure non of my friends do either.  Terrible food and service.  You've been warned.....

pcDcil2_rXunU3idoY0Taw.text: I pride myself on how great my own steaks are. It's hard for me to find anywhere that is equivalent to mine. This is the best steak I've had at a reasonable price.

vV_MpMsSA2ylcMAnlLQY1Q.text: Amazing food. Steak & Chilliques is the best! Very good coffee. Friendly relaxed atmosphere.

GDpsT0ndNiwXprNLlGCw9g.text: Went here yesterday for breakfast after looking on Yelp for a breakfast place away from the strip.  What a pleasant surprise!! Great variety on the menu.  I had an omelet but the Red Velvet pancakes looked interesting.  But I did try the pot of bread.  Imagine a cinnamon roll baked in a small flower pot.  It was delicious and very unique. Service was great.  Got seated immediately and servers were quick to refill coffee and water.  It was excellent.   Best part, the servers were wearing pajamas!!!

L9XAIi_JYnEnxv9cLXp-LQ.text: Loved my breakfast! Prepared just how I like it, good service & clean premises. I could do without the waitresses in their jammies, but that doesn't downgrade my rating. Thanks!

FA_cvaAH_DGEwqd6-cx3yA.text: I just wish to post an update regarding my latest review which unfortunately discussed some potential health issues and shortcomings of service.  I can't update without giving a star rating.  So for now, I'll revert to my 4 star rating.  I received a personal message from the new general manager, Davilan, who was very apologetic for the shortcoming of the restaurant.  He has assured me that that level of service throughout our visit was not acceptable and not at the level expected of staff  and has been addressed accordingly.  My wife and I only expect to be treated as all the other guests, nothing more, nothing less.    In all fairness, and based upon the very timely response from Davilan after the review posted, my wife and I will return in the near future.  I'll keep you posted.

V7oNMLc6roCP438na2ZGsQ.text: Very poor service, this place used to be good.  I'm not impressed with the service or food.  I walked out this weekend after waiting over 25 min for table.

-RmwZd0oPLS3qLReTFfHuA.text: What a concept! Steak and Eggs used to be a once in awhile treat because of the price (usually) and the calories (who cares now...!)! But, at Rise and Shine, it is BEYOND delicious, portions are just right, and the price is right! The servers are dressed in Jammies, they have Illy coffee (French Press too if you like and I highly recommend it!) fun cinnamon bread in flower pots as a choice of bread (NOT to be confused with a cinnamon roll - it is not sticky sweet like that. More like Cinnamon toast - you can put butter and jam on it). They have Chilaquilles, which my hubby who loves SW cuisine/flare, was just in love with . The perfect hint of heat, great flavor on his steak - "Baby, most places just don't season their steaks anymore... this is perfect!" was the comment that I got, and let me tell you, my hubby is Picky with a capital "P"!  definitely recommend going early. We went at 8am after dropping a friend off at the airport and by 845am there was a wait already (on Father's Day). Love it Love it Love it and will definately be back!

Kfte4YSioi6cmHxN-qYk0g.text: Love this place.  Try the red velvet pancakes-they are awesome.  Great omelets too. Service is prompt and courteous

qnQ888FJfuarZZDWnSRccg.text: My panini was good... it was nothing special but my boyfriend loved the steak and eggs.  He ordered his steak medium-rare and it came out moo'ing but we were too hungry to send it back, the wait was atrocious.  They say that they are a "Steak and Egg" place so if you want variety, you're SOL.  On a good note, I loved the atmosphere, the staff wore pajamas and the decorations were so creative with the umbrellas and all.

wZyAvQGhc1ujBxXu7bY18g.text: Love this place! Great food! They are opening a new location off 215 and flamingo closer to my house. Yaaaay!

ajCUYt_TY4FSy9l8u0efyQ.text: The staff here was friendly but the food was sub par. There were a lot of weird twist to the breakfast plates that weren't explained on the menu when you order. Pancakes were probably the highlight on this menu after trying the spot out 4 different times.

jVN3jbaHhKCyp1VYz662Pg.text: Loved this place!  Food was great and the service was top notch!  My favorite breakfast place in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilaquiles
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short stack w/bananas on the side.

n3nMKXqDTwGVWxqiJzO-rA.text: Food and coffee were sooooo good!  I had the eggs Benedict but wanna come back and try their namesake steak & eggs!  I totally need to bring Rick here!

Tdbmt1kBj2E2OrskwLLL5A.text: Great food. Not a fast-paced dining experience, so plan on a hour. Highly recommend the French press coffee!

1Dyq5jiAbE0OmNwmUCRpww.text: Thanks Yelpers!  All of your mouthwatering pics drove me into this place!  I felt like I needed a breakfast "do over" after eating at Republic Kitchen and Bar for Sunday brunch.  On Monday before taking my mother-in-law to the airport, we stopped in at Rise & Shine and I couldn't resist the baked blueberry French toast casserole.   The hubs and his mom had what appeared to be the regular eggs and bacon breakfast with hash browns but the taters were so tasty and seasoned and the bacon so crisp and smoky!   I stole a piece to go with my blueberry yumminess!  I loved that the blueberry compote wasn't super sweet.  Our server was though and  we can't wait to go back and try some of the other menu offerings.

_cE0ILN19yqk4X1OSfwkzg.text: After my last review where I gave them 3 stars based on my experience NOT FOOD which was so yummy, I felt compelled to update my review on this place. A manager from the restaurant contacted me via email and they were truly concerned and apologetic about the service I received. That to me says a lot about the integrity of a business. They truly care not only about delivering a superb product, but making sure that every customers experience is equally as superb! They definitely deserve 5 stars!! The food is excellent and there customer service is top notch and genuine. Anyone who has not eaten there definitely should, they are awesome and deserve your business and it is the best breakfast place in Las Vegas!!

LfExb4w-QEsobZvYn8vflQ.text: A great place to eat breakfast, and an even better place for great service. The food is phenomenal. It does not matter what you get to eat, it is all delicious. The service is even better. Everyone is friendly, and they are always willing to go the extra mile to make the customer happy!

_PrExhkUhtzJ1bhALYBgVA.text: I really wanted to like this place after all of these great reviews and the look of the menu but Rise and Shine fell short of my expectations. I have to say that the atmosphere was nice and we were seated very quickly. The waitress took our drink orders immediately and the service started off great. I was vey excited that they served Illy coffee being a huge coffee fanatic but they ruined a terrific bean and rather expensive one by burning it. This is by far the worst cup of Illy i've ever had.  The menu look fantastic and my wife ordered the croissant French toast with blue berries and I had the chicken fried steak. The French toast was nothing like advertised and actually should of been called bread pudding since the consistency was equivalent. The mound of fresh blueberries on top was a nice touch. The wife was not to thrilled about the dish probably because mentally she was prepared for something else, I thought it was just okay. My country fried steak was disappointing , extremely chewy with bits of tendons everywhere, the gravy was good and the hash browns was the best part of the dish. Dont be fooled about the picture of the pot of bread, although it appears fancy, it had no taste and was cold. I will give this place another shot someday but not anytime soon.

chWSttpH4oOKgkKztpVnAw.text: Delish!  Loved the crunchy cinnamon French toast.  The bacon was great also.  Portions are HUGE.  Will definitely go again.

QBkhYQPPZKWyxER6jhdcVQ.text: Great little breakfast place in the southern highlands area.  Had steak and eggs was cooked perfect  all the food at the table was awesome.

DbhYcC3660PWS42J7wZQTQ.text: First time visit this restaurant since it was close to our home, they tottally IGNORED US!, they have like 10 people who they're supposed to be working on tables (server/bussers), restaurant wasn't busy at all, they'are just standing, chatting, walking on circles, we read the entire food menu, wait for 25min without someone even asked us what do we like to drink, saw a busser just walking and playing with a rubber band, person making pastries without a hair net and looking more like a hair stylist, hostess uniform looks like she's been wearing it for a whole week without washing it. This place seriously needs a new managment, looks like everyone is in a playground and don't care at all.

LQ5OOeo6gevkbghtZiciEg.text: This was a great discovery. I thought the food was creative and full of flavor, and the service was decent as well. The only complaint was that the dollar pancakes we're not actually silver dollar Pancakes, there were a lot bigger than what my child was expecting. We had their signature steak and eggs which was a really healthy portion of beef, I was a bit surprised in a pleasant way I guess. The lokomoko was a great take on the Hawaiian dish, and their bread in a cup was especially interesting. I would definitely come again.

PKMiL-DGW11iG39ul1_55A.text: I've eaten here for years and always had good service but today I received the best service I've ever had. Gabe was outstanding, he deserves to be working in fine dining. He was extremely attentive and knowledgeable. Not only was he great with our table he was just as amazing with the tables around us! Thank you Gabe for the great service

7Z2PHd5ruXcALHu9BSHDbQ.text: Excellent food Cute atmosphere Wait staff wore pjs :-) Laura was our waitress  Super fast

FpLS6a-4MA5H7uHdqel8kA.text: Great food. I ordered the chicken egg white omelette and had it delivered through uber eats.They included a cinnamon roll with a sweet sauce which was really good.

Pi65_9-GrIracWGRUXouGA.text: Went here this morning $60 For crap!  4.50 for a cup of KIDS orange juice RIDICULOUS.  I got the avo steak egg whites omelet it was bland and the avocado was three slices the steak was cheap steak. The hash browns were bland as well.  For the price I will not be returning I rather eat at Denny's.

yxMwr8ihcvoxRg8l0R7Sig.text: Simply the best breakfast in the city. Steak chilaquiles are the best I have had in any city. When you go, ask for Desere her happy smile and thorough service will brighten your morning. I can't wait to go back.

0BFRIHZcwjK2bw4ussMcsQ.text: Delicious! First of all ...We went here on Mother's Day and there was only a 10 min wait at the location in Southern Highlands. I was amazed to see there were tables to sit and wait (a rare thing here) , the staff were so polite and inviting , the service was excellent and the food OMG ... came out hot and so delicious! I will definitely come back ... and we live all the way out in Centennial Hills !

Od4cG9btyGEJmiMkNjwnBQ.text: We came out on Saturday morning for breakfast.   This was my first time eating here, although I had popped in once about 5 years ago and had a bite of a friend's steak:  it was delicious.  They were busy, but not packed, and we were seated right away. Our server was very sweet, and very patient, as it took us a while to decide on what we wanted to try.    I had the New York Steak, Spinach, and Benedict Bagel which came with potted bread, and my fella had the Spice rubbed rib eye steak chilaquiles, also with potted bread. We both had a tea and a coffee as well.   So.  Potted bread.  This was like a sweet, warm cinnamon bun in a little mug served with butter.  You really don't *need* the butter, its that good on its own, but the butter was tasty too.  I'd go back and order just this...a few of them.  They were awesome.   When our breakfasts arrived, I was thrilled with mine.  It looked amazing, and tasted even better!  The steak was cooked to perfection: mid-rare, and seasoned beautifully.  The poached eggs had a lovely runny yolk, and the hollandaise was not too rich.  The spinach gave it a nice touch, and while I didn't really eat all of the bagel, it was delicious, and perfect for sopping up the yolk and juices from the steak.   My fella's Spice rubbed rib eye steak chilaquiles LOOKED amazing.  I, unfortunately, was unable to try any, due to an avocado allergy.  We had asked for them to make it without avocado, but it came out with it on top.  My fella doesn't like avocado, but isn't allergic, so he just scraped it off, and our server apologized about it.  I was bummed that I didn't get to try it, but maybe next time. He really enjoyed it a lot, and the steak was great.  (that was on the side, no avocado!)  Really, the only reasons for the missing star is the avocado, and the fact that for a plain cup of coffee, and a plain bag of Earl Grey tea, it is $2.85 a piece.  That's a little steep for just brewed coffee and a tea bag, if you ask me, especially when we were never offered refills.  Honestly though, its not a huge deal, or a deal breaker, because the food was so delicious, and there was SO much of it!    I have every intention to come back to Rise and Shine for breakfast again.  They have a good sized menu that I look forward to testing out!

Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New York Steak, Spinach, and Benedict Bagel
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potted Bread:  YUM

03OxjyuLf45sA_sD4BObJA.text: When we're in Las Vegas, Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place is my favorite spot to have breakfast!!  It is located quite a distance from the Strip, but it is so worth the drive!!  The staff is wonderful, efficient, helpful, and friendly with everyone dressed in their pajamas.  The interior looks lovely, and what really stands out is all the colorful umbrellas hanging from the ceiling.  The food that I have tried here has been absolutely positively delicious!!  By no means, am I an expert on all their many menu options here.  There are only two meals that I have ever tried here, and I cannot get myself to try some other items.  Crispy Fried Chicken Breast Atop a Waffle is amazing!  The Belgian waffle with the warm cinnamon maple syrup is really good.  The chicken breast that sits on top of that waffle is even better cause it is so tender, moist, and full of flavor!!  Wow!!  Red Velvet Chocolate Chip Pancakes are the BOMB!!!  If you are a sweet tooth like myself, then order this decadent treat!!  It will be like a party in your mouth!!  The combination of the white and milk chocolate chips with the warm cream cheese syrup on top of those fluffy Red Velvet pancakes is like a very very sweet taste of heaven!!!  I can never finish this meal in one sitting because it is so overwhelmingly rich and SWEET!!  Fortunately, the leftovers are almost as good the next day!!  Seriously, get ready for an awesome sugar overload!!  Maybe one day, I will venture to try something else on their menu.  I hear their Steak & eggs are pretty darn incredible as well.  For now, I look forward to my next trip to Sin City so I can get my fill of Rise & Shine's yummy goodness!!

Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My favorite Red Velvet Pancakes ever!!!
Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Velvet Chocolate Chip Pancakes are INCREDIBLE!!

_93IaFXwKImuJCRItNLm6A.text: I have one word, CHRISTINE!   We are tourists and she went way and far beyond the call of duty. She gave us so much attention for eight people at one table.   She did not do it for personal gain but  because she genuinely cared about us and catered to our every need. My husband and I highly recommend her for promotion in your organization.   I am a human resources professional of over 40 years and to me she is the epitome   of customer service

qifD8REEclUJc7Ldiaavrw.text: This breakfast restaurant has been in the southern highlands plaza for awhile and I've never had a bad experience here other than maybe a 10min wait at most because it can get busy. The fresh squeezed orange juice and freshly baked pot of bread with powdered sugar are amazing. I've ordered many items in the past among those the corned beef hash, ribeye steak and eggs, salmon lox bagel, steak and spinach eggs benedict, chicken fried steak and all are good.

z7lFgrKICYL2nMj0c3a8ng.text: I was surprised that there wasn't a waiting list to get in today... They usually do... Guess it was my my lucky day because my brother and I got seated right away.  Our server was Chris and she was really awesome and attentive.... We got our freshly squeezed orange juice, hot chocolate and water within minutes... The menu is huge! So many great breakfast choices to choose from. I felt like I wanted to order a few dishes just for myself but I opted for the bone in ham steak with hash browns, scrambled eggs and a pot of bread (which is my favorite)! My brother got fried chicken and waffles...  Every thing was delicious! I couldn't eat the rest of my ham so I took it home.  Customer Service at Rise n Shine was AWESOME!!! Thank you to our server Chris who was very sweet! I always enjoy coming to this place!

Esf88fGZu7yGnVS7oE5f_Q.text: We went in the other day and Food was amazing. The hostess Crystal was so delightful and amazing. She made us feel very welcomed and at home. She always had a smile on her face and was very open to answer any questions we had.

TCEzFKX1oqQKZjnrA7bFUw.text: Wish I could give 5 stars because the food is just so delicious! Everything I have tried has been amazing but the prices are a bit ridiculous, sadly mostly everything is overpriced and the portions are just ok.

Oi08B0QsZmTAvMvynpqAVA.text: I came here many times before and i was always impressed with the service of the staff and the quality of the food. I've tried all the locations but my recent experience at Southern Highlands, was just mind blowing!! I was there with my family our server was Amber she was amazing. Her hospitality was just wonderful. Now what really made our experience wonderful was the Hostess CRYSTAL!!! I can say because of her, this will be our location from now on. While waiting for our table, Crystal went the extra mile and made sure we were ok. Crystal constantly kept checking on us to see if we needed anything.  I worked in F&B industry for a long time and never seen someone so happy at her job and so genuine. Crystal definitely made our day, she definitely brightened our stay. She has such powerful smile who seems to love what she does. We will continue coming back definitely and we hope to see Crystal and her wonderful smile!! Every time we come in.

mbNw1nLZWNgykFo70Q7KIg.text: My family & i went for the first time sunday morning and all i gotta say is that im coming back, great food, fast, and not to mention our hostess crystal was amazing very friendly, she made me and my family feel like home.

IAETVOGyKwH54U59hIYmlA.text: This location is the  best of all the staff is so sweet crystal in the front was the so nice. i need to go back for the bread in the cup!!!!!! sooooo good

0quzp4iP9GT-Tz3fWB9eqQ.text: A pretty good breakfast spot. But be warned, this is the ONLY location worth going to. Their Flamingo location really turned me off of this place because my first and only experience was literally the WORST breakfast service in Vegas.   However, the Southern Highlands location is great! The service is fast and the staff is really kind. The food is really good, too. I'm not a lover of sweets but their cinnamon French toast is to die for. Their eggs Benedict and omelettes also hit the spot in the morning.

XFRDFkruOb7uL2N-cFWuhA.text: I Was Tipped Off About This Amazing Breakfast Spot By A Friend Of Mine. I Looked It Up On Yelp And Found All Of The Good Reviews. Me And My Wife Went And It Was AMAZEBALLZ. Our Server Cary Was Very Helpful And An Amazing Waitress. I love when you go to a new spot and they know how to help you choose the right meal. My wife got the county fried steak and I got the rib-eye. Everything was killer and I would tell anyone in the area this is a must eatery.

ZhvQKcYJpp09oOWXgokR0w.text: Amazing service, tried the avocado Benedict and it was one of the best breakfasts I may have ever had! Definitely recommend if you want to be away from the hustle and bustle of the strip and relax.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

U1mJOl_AXmzQAQQ9WjxCvg.text: Yelp has not disappointed this Vegas Trip weekend. Heading home from the strip we came upon this place about a mile off the freeway. Usually, I detour when it points me longer than a mile or so, but learning from last time I'm glad we stayed and headed for this place. Had I not I would have ended up at a run down shack in Barstow.   The place looked lively as we came in. After all how many places do you know where you can come to work in your pj's. We all loved this! Made us get even more into the Christmas spirit. We were seated promptly. Not that I'm a coffee connoisseur or anything, but they serve Lavazza! Smooth good ol Italian coffee. Last place I had Lavazza was in San Francisco.   Getting into the menu they had a good variety. I had the steak omelette, and the rest had the chicken and waffles and 3 egg omelette. Overall our breakfast arrived timely, was cooked to order, and I can say their hash browns are outstanding. Only complaint was the chicken had a little too much pepper which ended up brushing off on the waffle. Other than that everything else was good.   In the end it was a great breakfast spot on our way back to CA. I would highly recommend.

kaHrvIX_F-hZ4ZwbIf-PaQ.text: They know what they're doing and they're doing it right! Amazing steak! I had the chilaquiles and ribeye. Both amazing. The chilaquiles aren't authentic Mexican but they are still good! The parfait is also amazing. I will come every time I visit Las Vegas!   My husband also had the cinnamon raisin French toast with bacon. He struggled finishing it but had to because it was so delicious. Also, don't forget to get some French pressed coffee. Will be purchasing a French press after this.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazingness!

vWq3SNH17jCZuZRrsOBUXQ.text: Beautiful decor. Friendly and efficient staff wearing pjs. Great food, fresh juices, and espresso!  This is as if someone took my wish list and created a business! Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vK9EbFvKjxnUWdQfLPO9nw.text: The food was good, (i had the egg white and chicken omelette. So fresh and delicious!) and the only reason this place didn't get one star.  The wait was "15 min" when we got there and we weren't seated for 30 min. The hostess was rude, but the waitress was lovely.  Unfortunately the food came out veryyy slowly and the place was not "packed full" to support how slow the food came out.  To top off the "ambiance," the restroom was a mess (there was no hand towels or toilet paper.. But that's not the end of the world).  Lastly, there was a lot of tension between all of the employees (especially the hostess and the wait staff). It was very unprofessional, and if I was the owner I would be embarrassed that the negativity is so strong that it bleeds to the customers' experience.  I may order take out from this place some day because again, the food was great, but I do not want to be around the employees.

Kiz9uBmCskFG4BT6nRaErQ.text: Love the friendly service and the relax feel of the restaurant. Food is great, my husband and I got back all the time!

0uiLH7Qp0SRfhXeVGD7AsQ.text: Pot o  bread and servers in pj's. Good for breakfast or lunch. Always have the fresh squeezed juice and french press coffee.  Food is always good. Gets very busy on weekends but they have a nice spot to hang outside.

pSl1uNzxGpPKfFj6Lseh0A.text: Love this breakfast place!  It's cool that the waiter's and waitresses wear pjs to work!  I always get the eggs benedict..it has balsamic vinegar on it which is a really yummy twist to the traditional!  Hubby always gets the chicken and waffles which are great too! Service is always great!  Rise and Shine is our favorite place for breakfast when eating out!

0Bpa4eVYWlBxtyzkIu8GzA.text: Sometimes you just really want a huge breakfast after a weekend in Vegas served on a plate bigger than your face. Hubby had the chicken and waffles it was some of the best chic and waffs I've ever tasted with warm homemade syrup. I had country fried steak and eggs. Usually it's like a pounded out piece of mystery meat but here it was literally a steak. Maybe we just fill up fast but neither of came close to finishing our food. Waitress was nice. It's cute having everyone in pajamas. And someone tell me, do all the flowers on the ceiling spin or just some? I couldn't tell and I forgot to ask haha. Driving me crazy.

XTqXh0CDUa8NLw-kJad6tg.text: FRESH SQUEEZED orange juice, great selection of food, get the "cup of bread" for your side. If you hate Ihop and Denny's you'll LOVE IT HERE!

03Hdo8omw_RYqGtpGlgvOA.text: This place is pretty good breakfast/brunch place in the southern highlands area. I had the chicken and waffles, I'm not a chicken and waffles expert but it was pretty darn good. I liked how it their chicken was boneless which made eating it clean and easy.

From the moment we walked in the door there were two very nice ladies who greeted us and didn't waste any time to seat us!! My breakfast was everything I hoped for. Your classic American egg cheese ham bacon and sausage bagel with a side of hash browns! My boyfriend went big and got the country fried steak and I had to steal a bite! This place seriously so good. And our server was amazing! I wish I remembered her name. She made a joke that I couldn't take my leftovers home and that I was held hostage till I finished everything on my plate. dpi0Hhh8W2Ed2FmnVCSAkQ.text: I'm not really sure how this place has ANY bad reviews. We've been here several times as we live in the southern highlands area. We LOVE rise & shine! The service and food  have never been anything but amazing! We refer all our friends and family here and have also got nothing but raving reviews from them. Keep doing what you're doing and we'll be forever customers!

xhmN_BX-bYuJEt1xZz3s-g.text: Nasty cook. I have eaten here before and have always liked the food. Today I decided to bring m daughter for brunch.  The issues started with the waitress scratching her head and then making our toast. Then as I was about to put food in my mouth I cought the cook wipping his nose with the back of his hand and instead of washing his hands, he continued making the food. I was unable to eat and my stomach turned sour. Spoke to the manager and she then decided to tell me they have had this issue with the cook before, that really makes me wonder as to why continue to have this person around.

W38y8cp--1xybugr2u8vZg.text: LOVE this place. The service is excellent and so is the food. The portions are pretty filling. The staff is dressed in PJs which I think is too cute!! I have tried a few different things and there is nothing that I did not like.

leXaMTC5BPY0riuJelMElQ.text: GREAT breakfast,  and the pressed coffee is wonderful.    We come from southern California,  and always have breakfast at Rise and Shine.  Best in Vegas

T1GbdYMFTi0eW3sKknIBjg.text: Our family is always on the hunt for great restaurants. Breakfast, lunch, and dinner places. Loved the atmosphere. When we arrived the place was packed had to wait for 20 minutes to get a table.There was three in our party and we ordered three different things so we could all sample different dishes.  The chicken fried steak is gigantic, enough to share. The breading was awesome. Order extra gravy.  The steak and eggs were delicious not too big or too small. The steak was very flavorful!  The corned beef hash was good. Had better.The corned beef was diced into big pieces prefer it the traditional way.   Wanted to try so many other dishes that sounded great. Will definetly be back!

H10hp-vTvgguufIletiSNQ.text: My husband choose this place for breakfast and I am a very happy girl, service was excellent and the food is good!! Will definitely be coming back!

XgmP6SKa5EPrkgquoFrBew.text: These guys are truly deserving of 5 stars. I order from Postmates from them. When I do, I order a ton of food. They have never messed up on anything or forgotten anything. The food is cooked to perfection and tasty.

YXnhmTeyaO_mC81v3SSJ-A.text: The food is good. Variety is sparse. Wish they had cottage cheese or apples or bananas as an alternative to potatoes. Not a lot of booths but so there is often a wait for seating. Tried it for lunch too as it is close to home tomato soup is very acidic and not very good, tastes like tomato paste.  Grilled Cheese was ok.

cHtVJqRtVzbKYHgjn-nGYw.text: They really need to step their game up in the server department. The girl who was eventually my server was kind and had great energy do not get me wrong. Others seemed less thrilled to be there, mentioning to the host that there are other open sections in front of guests creates tension, and when waiting for a long time to be greeted, this really doesn't help. I am thankful the busser grabbed our orange juices, but it was disheartening to see so many walk by and see us still sitting without drinks without checking up on us. I eventually grabbed the busser and asked for drinks. I know we can get tunnel vision in this industry, especially toward the end of the day, but servers are what make or break repeat customers. I really hope that next time this will not be a problem. It really should not take ten minutes to be greeted.

7cTy_7ZGDggqlYZf84TZIA.text: I gave this place 3 stars because of the host. The food is excellent and the waitress is great, but the host was very rude. There's no word to explain how rude this lady was. It made the whole experience of eating here a very bad one. It's too bad because I did like to come here to eat but I won't be back

5rkCzE2jeGTcgAksLoz2AQ.text: Over priced for mediocre  food. Almost everything on the menu starts at $12.99 per dish. Plain old breakfast with waffles/pancakes/eggs shouldn't  cost $12.99 an order. The waffles came out soggy and cold. Service was really really slow.

G1cT-oN8vdUzzoBoEa_deA.text: Excellent service. Food is great. I had the ham and eggs Benedict. Hash browns are very good too.

QDkzYA2dvxcZlyCck6lPAw.text: I gave them a 2 stars only because they do not have any kind of vegan option they do not carry any other milk but cows milk.  On the positive side the service is great and it feels like a neighborhood dinner

1NvWj2LWPCNWktwozO549Q.text: Ahhhhh!!! This place is soooo amazing! I wish I lived in Vegas! The concept of the whole place is so neat! I had the chicken waffle and omg it was sooooo good! The red valvet pancakes were amazing as well. I love how the servers were in their pajamas and sleeping slippers. This place is a must if you're in town. It's going to be my stop whenever I'm in the neighborhood! Yummy yummy!

iax7rEBqARlMTsiU_ja7tg.text: We love this cute restaurant for breakfast!! The food is so good and the service is great too. Kris was our server this morning and she was awesome!!

Uj4qb5XzrBK5AP677NFe3A.text: I was right!!   I had the chicken and waffle and it was delicious!   Savory chicken, with light breading.  I'm not a fan of thick breading or greasy chicken and theirs had neither of those qualities!  The potted bread was scrumptious.  Sorry I didn't take pics, but I was so hungry, I ate it all!!

BKto_Vc7nhJxdVHaGpGFnw.text: First time visiting this place for breakfast. We live down the street and did not want to drive to the other side of town to enjoy breakfast. So we came here. We were not disappointed! The food was delicious and the staff was very nice. Laura was the sweetest woman! Since it was our first visit, she treated us to two pots of bread which was sweet and savory! The wait staff wear pajamas and the atmosphere is extremely cozy! We will be going there again because the food was amazing!!!

dQLrLTI0lAo_FSSSZKUd_g.text: It was my birthday and my boyfriend offered to take me to breakfast. We yelped breakfast places and saw that Rise and Shine had gotten some harsh reviews about service, but the bf had been there before and said he didn't remember poor service being an issue.   We decided to chance it. When we arrived, the hostess (the girl with nose ring) didn't welcome or acknowledge us. We waited and she finally just asked "how many?" and then didn't say anything like 'alright just have a seat' or 'it'll be just a minute please' which was awkward.   Great, I thought. My boyfriend even commented about how awkward it was.  But I have to say that was the last of the disappointment because we were seated in about 5 minutes and our server (girl with glasses) was amazing!   She was upbeat and kind and always there to keep our waters and coffees full (they serve Illy coffee which is THE BEST). And she was very attentive without smothering us.   I got the cinnamon toast crunch french toast. It was actually a little burned. But it was still yummy. I ordered it as a platter so it came with sausage and eggs.   Boyfriend ordered corned beef hash and liked it. It came with a pot of bread which really is like a little roll. It's cute but my guy was like "uhh do I just pull this out and eat it?" It's nothing too special. It has a cinnamon swirl in the middle which he shared with this birthday girl ;)   We saw the owner, who has been mentioned in previous reviews, running around the restaurant seemingly doing stuff, at least very active, wearing slacks and a dress shirt.   In summary: If the french toast wasn't a little burned it would've been AMAAAZING. Although it was still enjoyable.   Maybe the owner should have a talk w the hostess about how she's the first impression anyone who comes in gets of the establishment.   Order their coffee because Illy is the best!!  Overall, my boyfriend and I felt that it was evident that they read the yelp reviews and make adjustments accordingly. We thought this was great.

z7yVNKWAv4OmaJ4Yydl51w.text: Perfect hangover breakfast, like a warm hug.

ZVqafY31c0nelBz3ZNIBXw.text: Food was pretty good.  Nothing great.  Server ruined the dining experience.   I was trying to explain the menu to my elderly father and the server insists on speaking over us to get the order in at her convenience.    Also, she had the nerve to sit where we (my father, sister and I) were seated to take the order of the table next to us.   This happened 7-27-2014.   She (server) was obnoxious in behaving that way.   Aside from that, she refilled our drinks quickly.

GB3twlQT91FFwISA70WVPA.text: First time here.  Certainly won't be my last! Had the Steak and Chilaquiles which was amazing! The Pot of Bread was really yummy too! Other things I had a taste of were the Red Velvet Chocolate Chip Pancakes and the Cinnamon Raisin French Toast which I highly recommend since my kids pretty much cleaned their plates.  Overall, food was great, service was great, a definite new favorite place for breakfast!
